name: Abandonment
description:
An [Agent|Agent] leaves behind a [Theme|Theme] effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.

<ex>[Carolyn|Agent] [abandoned|Target] [her car|Theme] and jumped on a red double decker bus.</ex>

<ex>Perhaps [he|Agent] [left|Target] [the key|Theme] in the ignition</ex>

<ex>[Abandonment|Target] [of a child|Theme] is considered to be a serious crime in many jurisdictions.</ex>

There are also metaphorically used examples:

<ex>[She|Agent] [left|Target] [her old ways|Theme] [behind|Place] .</ex>

name: Abounding_with
description:
A #Location is filled or covered with the #Theme.  The #Location is realized as the External Argument, and the #Theme either as PP complement headed by <ment>with</ment>, <ment>in</ment> or <ment>of</ment>.

NB:  This frame does not include uses of adjectives like <ment>paved</ment> when they merely specify the Type of some location, as in ""paved and unpaved roads"".

<ex>[The waters of the bay|Location] [teemed|Target] [with fish|Theme].</ex>
<ex>[The waters of the bay|Location] <m>were</m> [teeming|Target] [with fish|Theme].</ex>
<ex>[The road|Location] <m>was</m> [completely|Degree] [covered|Target] [in mud|Theme].</ex>

name: Absorb_heat
description:
An #Entity (generally food) is exposed to a #Heat_source whose #Temperature may also be specified.  Generally, the #Entity undergoes some sort of change as a result of this process.

<ex>[Bacon|ent] was [frying|Target] [in the pan|Container], and a great heap of eggs already lay steaming on a plate.</ex>
<ex>If [it|ent] [cooks|Target] [at 400|tem] [for an hour|dur], it 'll be nothing but a pile of ash!</ex>

name: Abundance
description:
The #Quantity of a #Collection occurring in a #Place has a particular #Measure. The #Measure of the #Collection is referred to only in terms of how the #Measure diverges from a norm for #Collections of the specified type. #Degree may further refine the relation of the #Measure to the norm.

<ex>[Beauty|Collection] <m>is</m> [abundant|Target] [in a land flowing with snowmelt|pla].</ex>

<ex>Detritus of life [abounds|Target] [in the atmosphere|pla]. </ex>

<ex>There was a recent discovery that [exotic microbes|Collection] [teem|Target] [in the rocks hundreds of metres beneath the floor of the Pacific Ocean|pla].</ex>

name: Abusing
description: In this frame an #Abuser repeatedly treats the #Victim in a cruel and violent way, including physically harming or forcing the #Victim to engage in sexual activity against their will. The #Victim usually lacks the power to resist or fight back. A #Type of abuse may be indicated. There may also be a #Degree. <ex> [Her father|Abuser] [verbally|Type] [abused|Target] [her mother|Victim]. </ex>

name: Access_scenario
description: A Theme is or is not capable of entering or accessing a Useful_location because of/despite a Barrier.

name: Accident
description: During her stay at a #Place, the #Tourist can get involved in an #Accident.

name: Accommodation
description: It describes commercial establishments that offer accommodation services to tourists. Usually the establishments are classified  according to their type and/or their quality.

name: Accompaniment
description:
A #Co-participant fills the same role as the #Participant in an event or relation.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The mayor|Partic] was killed [along|Target] [with|Target] [three bodyguards and his driver|Co-Th].</ex>

<ex>The doctor told me to take [my regular pill|Partic] [in|Target] [combination|Target] [with the new drug|Co-Th] and I will be cured of my symptoms.</ex>

name: Accomplishment
description:
After a period in which the #Agent has been working on a #Goal, the #Agent manages to attain it.  The #Goal may be a desired state, or be conceptualized as an event.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Jeremey|Agent] [obediently|Manner] [accomplished|Target] [this task|Goal].</ex>

<ex>In response, the Prime Minister has simply cited [his|Agent] [free-market|Domain] [[accomplishments|Goal]|Target]. </ex>

name: Accoutrements
description: A #Wearer wears accessories, which are made of  some #Material and may have a #Style.  Most of the accessories are non-essential (clothing) items. <ex>[She|Wearer] wore [a black|Descriptor] [velvet|Material] [hat|Target] [on her head|Body_location].</ex>

name: Accuracy
description:
An #Agent is involved in an activity whose degree of success is dependent on a parameter of the action matching a particular set of values of a continuous variable or variables (e.g. quantity, location, time).

The #Agent, or metonymically the #Instrument or #Means action, is described in terms of the actual or expected #Deviation between the location, time, or quantity in the activity and the location, time, or quantity which is necessary for the intended event.

<ex>[The Longview Rangefinder|Instrument] is [accurate|Target] [to within one foot per hundred yards|Deviation] .</ex>
<ex>[His estimate|Means] was [off|Target] [by an order of magnitude|Deviation] .</ex>

<ex>[The fork truck operator|Agent] must be [fairly|Degree] [accurate|Target] [in his aim|Means].</ex>

<ex>The [precision|Target] [of the daily measurements|Means] is dependent on a number of factors.</ex>

name: Achieving_first
description:
A #Cognizer introduces a #New_idea into society.

<ex>It is difficult to imagine how different our lives would be without [Edison's|Cognizer] [invention|Target] [of the light bulb.|New_idea]</ex>

name: Active_substance
description:
A #Substance causes an #Effect.  The #Substance is produced by a process understood as directed towards the #Effect.  The #Name for the material that makes up the substance may also be given.

<ex>A rationale for using [denatured gp160|sub] as a [therapeutic|eff] [agent|Target] in HIV-infected people is to boost the immune response .</ex>

<ex>[The quinolones|sub] now seem to <m>be</m> the [antimicrobial|eff] [agents|Target] of choice for acute bacterial prostatitis.</ex>

<ex>[Hormonally|eff] [active|Target] [chemicals|sub] have the potential to cause significant environmental injury.</ex>

<ex>Only after the potion has been drunk does the [active|Target] [ingredient|sub] form. [DNI|eff]</ex>

<ex>The [sarin|nam] [[agent|sub]|Target] might have been a leftover shell from a chemical-arms dump. </ex>

name: Activity
description:
This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the #Agent enters an ongoing state of the #Activity, remains in this state for some #Duration of #Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.   The #Agent's #Activity should be intentional.

This frame is intended mostly for the inheritance of common FEs, and to provide the frame structure for the beginning, ongoing, finish, or stop stage of an #Activity, each of which constitutes a subframe of this frame. This frame should be compared to the Process frame.

name: Activity_abandoned_state
description: An #Agent is in an unfinished part of an activity.

name: Activity_done_state
description:
An #Agent has completed an #Activity.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Finally [I|Agent] am [done|Target] [cleaning the apartment|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[Construction on the new Safeway|Activity] <m>was</m> [done|Target] [by October|Time].</ex>

name: Activity_finish
description:
An #Agent finishes an #Activity, which can no longer logically continue. This frame is a subframe of #Activity.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Jason|Agent] [completed|Target] [grading the papers|Activity] [late Sunday night|Time].</ex>

<ex>Upon [completion|Target] [of the final exam|Activity], [Ava|Agent] tossed out her notes. </ex>

name: Activity_ongoing
description:
An #Agent is performing the portion of an #Activity in which there is dynamic stability.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, [Manny|Agent] [continued|Target] [eating his lunch|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[Keep|Target] [living the dream|Activity]!</ex>

name: Activity_pause
description:
An #Agent pauses in the course of an #Activity.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The government|Agent] [froze|Target] [settlement construction|Activity] [in 1992|Time] [to facilitate peace talks|Purpose].</ex>

<ex>The lifting of the [nuclear|Activity] [freeze|Target] was deemed necessary to generate needed electricity.</ex>

name: Activity_paused_state
description: An #Agent remains in a particular stage of an #Activity, without progressing in the activity.

name: Activity_prepare
description:
An #Agent prepares for an #Activity.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The troops|Agent] were [preparing|Target] [themselves|Agent] [for the mission|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[The boats|Agent] are [getting|Target] [ready|Target] [to leave the pier|Activity].</ex>

name: Activity_ready_state
description:
The #Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the #Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the #Activity have been satisfied.  In many cases, the #Protagonist is an intentional agent, but there are other uses in which the agent is deprofiled, and the #Protagonist is an entity which is essential to the #Activity.
Alternatively, the #Activity may be indicated by a #Salient_entity which stands in for the #Activity.  This #Salient_entity may also be an intentional agent, but need not be.

<ex>[She|pro] <m>'s</m> not [ready|Target] ! [DNI|act].</ex>
<ex>[He|pro] <m>'s</m> [ready|Target] [to talk|act] , I think .</ex>
<ex><m>Is</m> [the UK government|pro] [ready|Target] [to do a u-turn on passport-ID cards|act] ?</ex>
<ex>Check and see if [Sal|pro] <m>is</m> [ready|Target] [for the bathtub|sal] .</ex>
<ex>[The world|pro] <m>is</m> finally [prepared|Target] [for him|sal] !</ex>

name: Activity_resume
description:
An #Agent resumes participation in an #Activity. Progress on the #Activity is retained from before the interruption.

<ex>[Normal Service|act] Will Be [Resumed|Target] [Shortly|Time]. [CNI|age]</ex>

[The Kinshasa government|age] has [resumed|Target] [supporting Rwandan rebels|act].

name: Activity_start
description:
An #Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing #Activity in which he will be continuously involved.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[At the same time|Time], [city-states|Agent] [began|Target] [to grow in influence|Activity] [on the southern Greek mainland|Place].</ex>

<ex>Naturally, [I|Agent] [started|Target] [crying|Activity] [to get out of work|Purpose].</ex>

name: Activity_stop
description:
An #Agent ceases an #Activity without completing it.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[After the lawsuit|Time], [the company|Agent] [stopped|Target] [producing the once very profitable toy|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[The rugby club|Agent] [terminated|Target] [negotiations with Argyll|Activity] [in September 1988|Time].</ex>

name: Actually_occurring_entity
description:
Against the background of a contextually salient non-real world, for instance a hypothetical, imagined, simulated, expected, projected, or dream world, an #Instance of a #Type encountered in a relation or event in the real world is presented as being different from the instance found in the non-real world. Of course, the real-world #Instance of the expected #Type may also be presented as not occurring, as in the last example below.


<ex>[Actual|Target] [results|Type] may vary.</ex>
<ex>[ACTUAL results|ins] may vary.</ex>

<ex>Also present is the [actual|Target] [policeman|Type], now 20 years older and helping to cast and prepare the young actor who'll be portraying him onscreen.</ex>
<ex>Also present is [the ACTUAL policeman|ins], now 20 years older and helping to cast and prepare the young actor who'll be portraying him onscreen.</ex>

<ex>Of course, an [actual|Target] [car|Type] with all these capabilities simply did not exist.</ex>
<ex>Of course, [an ACTUAL car|ins] with all these capabilities simply did not exist.</ex>

name: Addiction
description:
This frame concerns an #Addict's physiological or psychological compulsive dependence on an #Addictant, the substance or behavior to which the #Addict is addicted.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Although she was never a big fan of drugs, [she|Addict] <m>became</m> [hooked|Target] [on that designer drug|Addictant] instantly.</ex>

<ex>[He|Addict] <m>is</m> a [cocaine|Addictant] [addict|Target].</ex>

<ex>There are some [cocaine|Addictant] [[addicts|Addict]|Target] living in the house across the street.</ex>

name: Adding_up
description:
A #Cognizer computes a #Result on the basis of input #Numbers by addition.


<ex> [Add|Target] [up|Target] [your savings|Numbers].</ex>
<ex> This is a cumulative figure obtained by [adding|Target] [up|Target] [the cost of treating a given volume of specific diseases|Numbers]. </ex>
<ex>When [he|Cognizer] later took the trouble to [add|Target] [up|Target] [the bill|Numbers] he discovered that the actual cost was Fr 1,481 , around 140 pounds : an overcharge of 40 pounds</ex>
<ex>[Chaperones|Cognizer]  [tallied|Target] [the number of tickets sold at the school dance|Numbers] [at more than 1000|Result].</ex>

name: Addressing_initial
description:
A Speaker starts a communicative interaction by referring to the #Addressees. The choice of the form of #Address characterizes their social relation. Addressing at the text opening serves to establish contact and thus contributes to structuring the interaction.
This frame is limited by the position of its instantiations in the text: unlike the frame Address_focus_addressee [so far defined only for German: Anrede_Fokus_Adressat], it occurs exclusively at the beginning of an interaction.
The frame #Appellations describes the use of names and titles for addressing people.

name: Adducing
description:
A #Speaker mentions a #Specified_entity filling a #Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the #Speaker.

<ex>He cites [the chief original observations|Specified_entity] [adduced|Target] [by Darwin|Speaker] [as evidence for his theory|Role].</ex>

<ex>[Mexico|Speaker] [cited|Target] [the drought|Specified_entity], now in its eighth year, [to avoid releasing Texas' full share of 110 billion gallons per year from the reservoirs|Purpose]. [DNI|Role]</ex>

<ex>[An objector|Speaker] will [immediately|Time] [point|Target] [to the lack of stability of this  simple, some will say simple-minded, hierarchy|Specified_entity]. [DNI|Role]</ex>

<ex>She expected a restaurant as their meeting place, but instead [the lady|Speaker] [named|Target] [the hotel where she was staying|Specified_entity].[DNI|Role]</ex>

<ex>Where is the second-order neural pattern located? [Damasio|Speaker] already [pointed|Target] [to the cingulate cortex|Specified_entity] [in his 1994 book|Medium].</ex>

name: Adjacency
description:
A #Figure is located adjacent to a #Ground. This is equivalent to the #Figure and #Ground either constituting or being associated with a zone, with each zone in contact with the zone of the other.

<ex>[The two houses|Figures] were [adjacent|Target] , so she bought them together .</ex>
<ex>[The bedroom|Figure] [adjoining|Target] [hers|Ground] was much smaller .</ex>
<ex>[The park|Figure] [borders|Target] [a very upscale neighborhood|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>While you solder , make sure the [neighboring|Target] [pins|Figure] don't get overheated . [DNI|Ground] </ex>

This frame is intended to cover productive metaphor cases such as those found in ""adjacent web pages""--referring to pages that metaphorically ""share a border"" by virtue of sharing a hyperlink, as well as many additional cases of entities which are cognitively associated in other ways.  There are a number of less productive metaphors that are also intended to be included in this frame, e.g. ""behavior bordering on lunacy"", ""cleanliness is next to godliness"", despite the fact that conventionally we do not find ""adjacent to lunacy"", etc.  Though these expressions sound creative, they are immediately understandable and contextually unobjectionable.

name: Adjusting
description:
An #Agent changes a #Part of a complex entity with regard to some #Feature in order to achieve some #Imposed_purpose affected by the #Feature.  The complex entity is often a device or mechanism, but may also be an abstract entity such as the economy.  Also, the full entity may be used in place of the #Part.

<ex>[I|Agent] need to [adjust|Target] [the thermostat|Part] [to around 80 degrees|Final_value] [when she visits|Time].</ex>
<ex>It didn't work the first time , so [she|Agent] had to [tweak|Target] [the oven|Part] [a little|Degree] .</ex>
<ex>Greenspan expressed confidence that the [current|Time] [calibration|Target] [of interest rates|Feature] was not an overcompensation .</ex>

name: Adopt_selection
description:
An #Agent has an #Attribute which can take different #Values, and the #Agent selects and then begins to use some #Value for that #Attribute.  The #Attribute includes both physical (shape, color) and abstract (belief, practice) types.  For some LUs in this frame, it is common for only the #Value to be expressed, with the #Attribute implicit. (Often this implicit attribute can be given second-layer expression on the #Value. Note that such second-layer annotation should be assumed in the first two examples below.)

<ex>[They|age] scoff at their opponents and [assume|Target] [an air of superior knowledge|val]</ex>
<ex>There are times when [teachers|age] should [adopt|Target] [a neutral stance|val] in discussion of morally controversial issues.</ex>
<ex>A person does not have to make the statement ""[I|age] [adopt|Target] [this|val] [as my position|att]"" to do so.</ex>

name: Aesthetics
description:
An #Entity is judged to be sensually pleasing or intellectually interesting to a (generally implicit) #Viewpoint.


<ex>We saw this [beautiful|Target] [boat|Ent] with the red sails several times</ex>
<ex>We camped here on the beach and had an [absolutely|Deg] [lovely|Target] [early morning walk through farm fields|Entity]</ex>

name: Affirm_or_deny
description:
A #Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a #Message to some #Addressee. Instead of (or in addition to) a #Speaker, a #Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a #Topic may be stated instead of a #Message.

<ex>[She|Speaker] [affirmed|Target] [her loyalty to the cause|Message].</ex>

<ex>[He|Speaker] [denied|Target] [that he had ever believed in the existence of God|Message].</ex>

<ex>[BBC News|Med] [confirmed|Target] [the story about the refugees|Top].</ex>

name: Age
description:
An #Entity has existed for a length of time, the #Age. The #Age can be characterized as a value of the age #Attribute, or a #Degree modifier may express the deviation of the #Age from the norm. The #Expressor exhibits qualities of the age of the #Entity.

<ex>[This building|Entity] <m>is</m> [twenty thousand years|Age] [old|Target].</ex>

<ex>[My grandpa|Entity] <m>is</m> [really|Degree] [old|Target]</ex>

<ex>[Junior|Entity] <m>is</m> [only five weeks|Age] [old|Target].</ex>

<ex>A cunning [oldish|Target] [voice|Expressor] called out from the crowd.</ex>

<ex>[His|Entity] [[age|Target]|Attribute] was [23|Age] [at the time|Time].</ex>

<ex> [People|Entity] <m>of</m>  [[age|Target]|Attribute] [55|Age] or older should consult their physician. </ex>

<ex>I have a [13-year|Age]-[old|Target] [cousin|Entity]</ex>

<ex>[My grandma|Entity] <m>is</m> [old|Target]</ex>

There are additional patterns that the LUs in this frame occur in which are not licensed by a particular lexical head but by a construction.  Additionally, there are patterns that evoke this frame without any overt lexical head that are part of this frame.


<ex>She is 45 years of [age|Target].</ex>
<ex>Billy  is 13.</ex>

name: Age_descriptor
description: Age_descriptor

name: Aggregate
description:
This frame contains nouns denoting #Aggregates of #Individuals.  The #Aggregates may be described by an #Aggregate_property.

<ex>An [[army|Agg]|Target] [of postal workers|Individuals] descended on my office.</ex>

name: Aging
description:
An #Entity is undergoing a change in age typically associated with some deterioration or change in state.

<ex>[This bark|Entity] [ages|Target] and turns black.</ex>

<ex>The U.S. is to upgrade [aging|Target] [missile defense systems|Entity] with advanced tech.</ex>

name: Agree_or_refuse_to_act
description:
A #Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a #Proposed_action, proposed by an #Interlocutor.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[They|Speaker] [agreed|Target] [to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper|pro].</ex>

<ex>[The man's|Speaker] [refusal|Target] [to accept blood|pro] severely hampered his treatment after the car accident.</ex>

name: Agriculture
description:
In this frame an #Agriculturist cultivates #Food.  The location or #Ground where the #Food is cultivated by the #Agriculturist is often expressed.

<ex></ex>
<ex>[Peasants|Agriculturist] were encouraged to [cultivate|Target] [basic food crops such as beans and corn|Food]</ex>.

<ex>[Shrimp|Food] [farming|Target] seems to be a recipe for disaster</ex>

<ex>[Some fields|Ground] were probably [cultivated|Target] [only in the dry season|Time] [CNI|Agriculturist]</ex>

name: Aiming
description:
An #Agent adjusts an #Instrument to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access #Target_location.  Usually, there is a #Targeted entity at the #Target_location which is mentioned in its place.

<ex>If [you|Agent] [aim|Target] [your weapons|Instrument] [somewhere else|Target_location] , I 'll be more likely to talk .</ex>
<ex>[The sortie|Means] [targeted|Target] primarily [resupply points|Targeted] , but these included several civilian areas . [INI|Instrument]</ex>
<ex>[A good marksman|Agent] still should take [aim|Target] [for a moment|Duration] [before each shot|Time] . [INI|Instrument] [INI|Target_location]</ex>

name: Alignment_image_schema
description: An #Alignment_match region has the same orientation as the relatively linear #Ground.  The #Alignment_mismatch region is oriented perpendicularly to the #Ground.

name: Alliance
description:
After having worked separately for some time, two or more organizational or individual #Members are now organized in an #Alliance so that they may better pursue some common #Purposes.  The formerly separate #Members may be presented separately as #Member_1 and #Member_2.

<ex>[They|Members] formed a [loose|Descriptor] [[coalition|Target]|Alliance].</ex>

name: Alternatives
description:
There exist a number of different possible #Situations that may happen in the future.  (In some cases, the #Situation is concurrent or past, and only the knowledge of which has happened is in the future.)  In most cases, there is an #Agent involved who has to consider which of the possible #Situations will or should occur.  A #Salient_entity which is deeply involved in the #Situation may also be mentioned.

<ex>[You|Agent] <ment>have</ment> [but two|Number_of_possibilities] [[choices|Situation]|Target] [for your daughter|Salient_entity] .</ex>

While all the members of this frame denote possible situations, in principle, this frame could be split into a number of subtypes on the following basis:
<ex></ex>1. Future.n, and most uses of alternative.n and possibility.n all evoke nothing more than a simple possible situation (not necessarily an #Situation) with no #Agent; the remaining frames would inherit from this.
<ex></ex>2. Use.n evokes different possible things that can be done with a #Salient_entity (i.e., #Purposes) and thus uses the Using frame; in this frame, the target denotes the #Purpose that can be achieved.
<ex></ex>3. way.n evokes different events that can lead to an Outcome (not necessarily a #Purpose); this frame should use the Means frame.  In this frame, the target denotes the possible Means actions.
<ex></ex>4. option.n, choice.n, and many instances of alternative.n and possibility.n, evoke possible #Situations that an implicit or explicit #Agent can bring about at will.  A #Purpose that would be served by bringing these #Situations about may be mentioned. A #Salient_entity related to the #Purpose may occur in place of the #Purpose.

name: Alternativity
description: In this frame, there is a #Profiled_alternative that the speaker wishes to primarily focus on and which is mutually exclusive with a #Contrasting_alternative.  It is not possible for both to be true in the same context with the same participants, although the described situation may be true of the same entities at different times, or true of different entities at the same time.  Frames inheriting from this one, e.g. Negation, may indicate which of the alternatives is imagined to be the case, but in other frames related to this one, e.g. Conditional_scenario and Alternatives, both alternatives are presented as possible, and which one is true remains an open question.

name: Amalgamation
description:
These words refer to #Parts merging to form a #Whole.  (The #Parts may also be encoded as #Part_1 and #Part_2.)  There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the #Parts are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the #Whole.

<ex>[The two droplets|Parts] [merge|Target], and then travel down the windowpane even faster.</ex>

name: Amassing
description:
A #Recipient (who may or may not be agentive) ends up in possession of a #Mass_theme (which may be conceptualized as a single mass entity, or may be a group of individual entities).  Some lexical units (e.g. [stockpile|Target]) specifically indicate an intentional #Recipient.

This frame differs from Gathering_up in that this frame refers specifically to the acquisition and (according to expectation) long-term possession of entities, rather than (as in the Gathering_up frame) simply talking about causing a group of entities to be located in the same place.  In sum, Gathering_up concerns (co-)locations, but Amassing concerns possession.

<ex>[Bogs|Recipient] [accumulate|Target] [carbon|Mass_theme] [for thousands of years|Duration].</ex>

name: Ambient_temperature
description:
The #Temperature in a certain environment, determined by #Time and #Place, is specified.

<ex>It's [too|deg] [hot|Target] [to do anything|deg] [today|tim].</ex>

<ex>[Nome|pl] <m>is</m> [pretty|deg] [cold|Target] [this time of  year|tim]</ex>

<ex>[Last Tuesday|tim] <m>was</m> a [real|deg] [scorcher|Target].</ex>

<ex>[Tomorrow|tim] is gonna <m>be</m>  [chilly|Target].</ex>
<ex>I ca n't go out into the [cold|Target] . [DNI|Place] [DNI|Time]</ex>

name: Ammunition
description:
A piece of #Ammunition is a disposable artifact to be fired as a projectile in a weapon with the purpose of causing harm or damage.

<ex>The octagenarian inventor's vest repels [armor-piercing|Use] [[bullets|amm]|Target]. </ex>

<ex>It is armed with a automatic loaded 105 mm gun firing [anti-tank|Use] [[rounds|amm]|Target]</ex>

<ex>[Depleted uranium|Material] [[munitions|amm]|Target] are primarily used by the US and the UK.</ex>

name: Amounting_to
description:
The absolute #Value of a quantifiable #Attribute  of an item is determined by adding up the values for the #Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item. The item is not expressed as a separate constituent but it is presupposed by the concept of #Attribute.  Alternatively, the #Numbers form an implicit set whose sum is the #Value associated with the set.   In some cases what is reported is just the cardinality of the individuals that make up the item so that in effect the #Value is a count. In other cases the identity of the #Attribute can only be inferred from the #Value.

There is no cognizer on the scene in this frame. Instead, the frame focuses on the relationship between the #Attribute or #Numbers and the #Value, which is stable and unchanging regardless of who performs  the calculation.

<ex>Defence is provided in West Germany by [armed forces whose number|Attribute] [totals|Target] [close to half a million men and women|Value] </ex> .
<ex> [Revenues|Attribute] [totalled|Target] [568.86m pounds|Value] </ex>
<ex>The WHO estimated that the cumulative [total|Target] [of AIDS cases|Attribute] was [more than 1,500,000|Value]. </ex>

name: Animals
description:
The LUs in this frame refer to biological entities other than human beings and plants, which are labeled by the FE #Animal.

<ex></ex>

<ex>My husband and I adopted a [really sweet|Char] [dog|Animal] last year.</ex>

<ex>The [cows|Animal] [that live on the farm down the road|Descriptor] are always mooing loudly.</ex>

name: Annoyance
description:
An #Experiencer, #Expressor, or #State has a feeling of annoyance as evoked by a #Stimulus or concerning a #Topic.

<ex>[Peck|Experiencer] was [annoyed|Target] [at the interruption|Stimulus].</ex>

<ex>Maggie noted [his|Experiencer] [rather|Degree] [irritated|Target] [expression|Expressor].</ex>

name: Appeal
description: In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the #Convict or his or her #Representative applies to a higher #Court to reverse the #Decision of the lower court on certain #Grounds. <ex> [The defense|Representative] plans to [appeal|Target] [the court's decision|Decision] [on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b|Grounds] . </ex> <ex> [John Michaels|Convict] will [appeal|Target] [his conviction|Decision] .</ex>

name: Appellations
description:
This frame is only for words that are used as the #Titles of individuals. The #Title is applied to a #Name (surname or full name) and often designates their rank within a man-made institution (e.g. chief, king, bishop, brother) or general social status (mr., miss), or may indicate a kinship relationship (cousin, aunt). Pairings of Title and Name can be used as vocatives (see Attention_getting), while the Titles may not always be vocative on their own.

<ex>He saluted [[General|Target]|Title] [Fightmeister|Name] walking into the room.</ex>
<ex>Everyone stood as [[Captain|Target]|Title] [Jack Aubrey|Name] delivered a toast.</ex>
<ex>[Supreme Court|Context] [Chief|Type] [[Justice|Title]|Target] [John Roberts|Name] is sticking to his guns .</ex>
<ex>[[Captain|Title]|Target] [Mike Eruzione|Name] [of the USA Miracle on Ice hockey team in 1980|Con] turns 58 today.</ex>

Most LUs of this frame are related to LUs of the Leadership or Kinship frames, but some (e.g. Lady, Mr., Brother) occur only here.  These LUs differ from normal examples of LUs in Leadership or Kinship in that the LUs are used simply as vocatives or as modifiers of names, to indicate how the individual fits into the general or specific social context.

name: Appliances
description: A device or machine, mainly electrical, developed to perform a specific task. Several properties of the #Appliance can be specified, such as its #Creator, #Time_of_creation, #Name, #Type, #Origin, #Constituent_parts, #Description, #Material of which it is composed, #Quantity and the #Place where it is.

name: Apply_heat
description:
A #Cook applies heat to #Food, where the #Temperature_setting of the heat and #Duration of application may be specified.  A #Heating_instrument, generally indicated by a locative phrase, may also be expressed. Some cooking methods involve the use of a #Medium (e.g. milk or water) by which heat is transferred to the #Food.  A less semantically prominent #Food or #Cook is marked #Co-participant.

<ex>[Sally|Cook] [fried|Target] [an egg|Food] [in butter|Medium].</ex>
<ex>[Sally|Cook] [fried|Target] [an egg|Food] [in a teflon pan|Heating_instrument].</ex>
<ex>[Ellen|Cook] [fried|Target] [the eggs|Food] [with chopped tomatoes and garlic|Co-participant].</ex>

This frame differs from Cooking_creation in focusing on the process of handling the ingredients, rather than the edible entity that results from the process.

name: Appointing
description:
A #Selector, often an individual in a leadership role, appoints an #Appointee to assume a #Role in an organization (which can be expressed as the #Body).

<ex>[Press secretaries|Selector] [accredit|Target] [journalists|Appointee] [to the sessions|Body].</ex>

Words of this frame are often used to describe Change_of_leadership situations, since Change_of_leadership is perhaps the most frequent kind of Appointing.

name: Architectural_part
description:
An entity is integrated into a building as a #Part of a (possibly unexpressed) #Whole which may refer to the whole building or merely to a sub-part of the building.

<ex>We need [new|Dsc] [[counters|Target]|Part] for the kitchen</ex>

<ex>The storm ripped off the [bathroom's|Whole] [[roof|Target]|Part]</ex>

name: Arithmetic
description: This frame describes a certain type of mathematical scenario in which two numbers, labeled #Term1 and #Term2, interact via some mathematical operation.

name: Arithmetic_commutative
description: This frame describes types of arithmetic operations and statements which have the commutative property, i.e. the operation is bi-directional, e.g. addition and multiplication. The terms involved are either individually labeled #Term1 and #Term2 or grouped together as a single noun phrase labeled #Terms.

name: Arithmetic_non-commutative
description: This frame describes types of arithmetic operations and statements which are not commutative, i.e. the operation is uni-directional, e.g. subtraction and division. Because of the non-commutative nature, terms must be separated from each other in the form of #Term_1 and #Term_2 instead of a combined Terms FE.

name: Armor
description:
An #Asset, the safety of which is desirable, is protected from damage by a covering, the #Armor. The #Armor covers part or all of the #Asset and is designed to absorb force from an oncoming #Danger.

<ex>They were wearing nothing but primitive [wooden|mat] [[armor|Armor]|Target].</ex>

<ex>An extra level of safety is provided by [the soldiers'|Asset] [ballistic|Danger] [[armor|Armor]|Target].</ex>

name: Arraignment
description:
At a court hearing, a #Defendant is informed of the #Charges against him or her, (usually) enters a plea, and a decision is made by a #Judge as to the amount of bail, if any.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Mortimer and Isabella|Defendant] were hurried off and [arraigned|Target] [before parliament|Judge] [in November|Time].</ex>

<ex>If the court rejects the appeal, [the 19 young men|Defendant]  <m>face</m>[arraignment|Target] [on murder charges|Charges] [before the tribunal|Judge] [in the southern city of Port Harcourt|Place].</ex>

name: Arranging
description:
An #Agent puts a complex #Theme into a particular #Configuration, which can be a proper order, a correct or suitable sequence, or a spatial position.

<ex>[He|Agent] [arranged|Target] [the elements|Theme] [in the pattern that we now call the periodic table|Configuration].</ex>

<ex>Try to [order|Target] [them|Theme] [by importance|Configuration]. [CNI|Agent] </ex>

name: Arrest
description: #Authorities charge a #Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the #Charges), and take him/her into custody.<ex>[The police|Authorities] [arrested|Target] [Harry|Suspect] [on charges of manslaughter|Chrg].</ex>

name: Arriving
description:
An object #Theme moves in the direction of a #Goal. The #Goal may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its is always implied by the verb itself.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Some students|Theme] [arrived|Target] [at the school|Goal] [on Sunday|Time].</ex>

<ex>It was [his|Theme] [arrival|Target] [at Nijmegen|Goal] [in 837|Time] that made the Vikings withdraw.</ex>

name: Arson
description:
A #Perpetrator intentionally sets fire to his own or someone else's property, often in order to collect an insurance payment on this property.

<ex>[Two men|Perpetrator] were charged with [[arson|Target]|Offense].</ex>

name: Artifact
description:
An #Artifact is deliberately made or modified by an intelligent entity to be put to a certain kind of #Use.  Various properties of the #Artifact may be specified, such as its #Creator, #Time_of_creation, #Name, #Type, and the #Material of which it is composed.  The #Artifact may or may not be a physical entity.

<ex>There are reports that Kim Il Sung asked China to share its [nuclear|Type] [weapons|Use] [[technology|Target]|Artifact].</ex>

name: Artifact_subpart
description:
A #Component has a distinct #Function in the operation of a complex #Artifact, which is not regarded as complete unless it is assembled from a number of different #Components. Each #Component may also be described by their #Creator, #Time_of_creation, or #Material.

<ex>Most of the cost comes from the price of [engine|Artifact] [[parts|Target]|Component].</ex>
<ex>We'll need to find a [metal|Material] [[part|Target]|Component][from 1982|Time_of_creation].</ex>

name: Artificiality
description:
An #Entity is evaluated for whether or not it belongs to a particular #Reference_category in a context where its category membership is doubtful. The criterion or criteria that are relevant to evaluating #Reference_category membership depend on the individual lexical units and/or on the context. Typically, either the material composition of the #Entity, its method of creation, or the identity (and proper authority) of its creators are critical for proper category membership. Note that #Entity also covers behaviors.

<ex>It can be hard to get your money back after discovering you've bought a [bogus|Target]
[autograph|Reference_category] for hundreds or thousands of dollars! </ex>

<ex>It can be hard to get your money back after discovering
you've bought [a BOGUS autograph|Entity] for hundreds or thousands of dollars! </ex>


<ex>A [bogus|Target] [policeman|Reference_category] pulling over motorists was arrested after stopping a car carrying
four real officers.</ex>

<ex>[A BOGUS policeman pulling over motorists|Entity] was arrested after stopping a car carrying four real officers.</ex>


<ex>You people are pretty thick if you think you have evidence to prove that [the moon landing|ent] <m>was</m> [fake|Target].</ex>
<ex>You people are pretty thick if you think you have evidence to prove that the [moon landing|Reference_category] <m>was</m> [fake|Target].</ex>

name: Artistic_style
description:
This frame contains LUs that express the #Form which a piece of #Artwork represents. The #Form may also represent the entire body  of an #Artist's work. The #Form may be further characterized by the #Time of some #Artwork's creation or other #Descriptors.

<ex>[Her|Artist] [[style|Target]|Form] [of painting|Artwork] is an excellent blend of traditional and modern.</ex>
<ex>The [whimsical|Descriptor] [[style|Target]|Form] [of this piece|Artwork] is very effective.</ex>

name: Assemble
description:
In this frame a group of #Individuals intentionally come together to form a #Group.  Alternatively, a grammatically more prominent #Party_1 assembles with a #Party_2, expressed as an oblique phrase.  If this asymmetric construal is chosen, #Purpose only relates to #Party_1.
<ex>[We|Individuals] [assembled|Target] [in the courtyard|Place] [to talk about our future plans|Purpose].</ex>
<ex>[Our study group|Group] is [convening|Target] [outside|Place] [today|Time].</ex>
<ex>[The Dodgers|Party_1] [meet|Target] [the San Francisco Giants|Party_2] [tomorrow|Time] [at Dodger Stadium|Place].</ex>

name: Assessing
description:
An #Assessor examines a #Phenomenon to figure out its #Value according to some #Feature of the #Phenomenon.  This #Value is a factor in determining the acceptability of the #Phenomenon.  In some cases, a #Method (implicitly involving an #Assessor) is used to determine the #Phenomenon's #Value.

<ex>[Each company|Phenomenon] is then [evaluated|Target] [for their earning potential|Feature]. [CNI|Assessor] </ex>
<ex>[From the evidence of the pilot studies|Evidence] [the risk of damage to the test subjects|Phenomenon] was [rated|Target] [too high to continue|Value]. [CNI|Assessor]</ex>
<ex>[He|Assessor] [weighed|Target] [his options|Phenomenon] [carefully|Manner].</ex>

name: Assigned_location
description:
An Individual is assigned a #Station to remain at, usually in order to accomplish a task. The #Station may have an intended use based on its features (e.g., a vendor's booth), or it may be temporarily assigned a use.

<ex>The guards who remained at their [stations|Target] had no idea what was going on two floors below.</ex>

<ex>Return to your [post|Target]!</ex>

name: Assistance
description:
A #Helper benefits a #Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a #Goal that the #Benefited_party has.  A #Focal_entity that is involved in reaching the #Goal may stand in for it.

This Frame has unique Frame-to-Frame Relations: it inherits from and uses the Intentionally_act frame. This is atypical of FrameNet's frame relations.

<ex>Will [you|Helper] [help|Target] [the Government|Benefited_party] [find your brother|Goal]?</ex>
<ex>Maybe [Stephen|Helper] should [assist|Target] [him|Benefited_party] [with the last manuscript|Focal_entity].</ex>
<ex>[They|Helper] [helped|Target] [me|Benefited_party] [psychologically|dom] [to overcome the physical loss I had suffered|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[You|Helper] have [helped|Target] [him|Benefited_party] [tremendously|deg] [by showing him  how to stand up for himself and by being his friend|Means].</ex>
<ex>[By bringing assistance to his troops wherever they were in trouble|Means] [he|Helper] [aided|Target] [them|Benefited_party] [greatly|deg].</ex>

name: Assistive_Technology
description: Resources that provide greater accessibility and autonomy to an #Individual with a #Disability. These can be products, equipments, devices, resources, methodologies, strategies, practices and services that help overcome barriers.

name: Asymmetric_reciprocality
description: Perspective on Reciprocality in which #Protagonist_1 acts on or is related to  #Protagonist_2.  The relation or event is construed as asymmetrical, inasmuch as #Protagonist_1 is presented as more agentive, if agency is involved (such as in conversation, participating), and #Protagonist_2 is presented as more passive.  In cases of comparison or other relations (e.g. resembling, being near), #Protagonist_2 is construed as suitable as a reference for #Protagonist_1, often because #Protagonist_2 is more temporally stable and/or is more salient and widely known.

name: Athletes
description: This frame contains individuals who practice a kind of #Sport professionally.

name: Athletes_by_position
description: This frame contains the athletes described based on the #Position they occupy in a sports competition.

name: Athletes_by_sport
description: This frame contains all types of #Athletes that incorporate the name of the #Sport in a competition.

name: Atonement
description:
An #Agent has committed a #Wrong in the past and is making #Amends for it. The #Degree to which the #Amends are adequate may also be expressed.

<ex>[He|Agent] [atoned|Target] [for his sin|Wrong] [with good works|Amends].</ex>

name: Attaching
description:
The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in
which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to
something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be
connected to each other.  In the first, the frame includes an
#Agent who attaches an #Item to a #Goal by
manipulating a #Connector, creating an asymmetric relationship
between the #Item and the #Goal.  In the second, the
#Agent attaches two #Items to each other, where each
serves as a #Goal for the other, creating a symmetric
relationship between the two #Items. In both cases, the
#Connector remains to bind the two entities (either
#Item and #Goal, or two #Items), without
creating a new entity.

<ex>[The robber|Agent] [tied|Target] [Harry|Item] [to the chair|Goal].</ex>

<ex>Make sure [you|Agent] [bind|Target] [his wrists|Items] [as tightly as possible|Manner].</ex>

name: Attack
description:
An #Assailant physically attacks a #Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the #Victim physical damage.   A #Weapon used by the #Assailant may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual #Place, #Time, #Purpose, #Explanation, etc.  Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the #Assailant or the #Victim, and in such cases the #Place FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.

<ex>[As soon as he stepped out of the bar|Time] [he|Victim] was [set|Target] [upon|Victim] [by four men in ski-masks|Assailant].</ex>
<ex>Is [he|Asl] [invading|Target] [Iraq|Victim] [just to cover other shortcomings|Purp]?</ex>
<ex>[Then|Time] [Jon-O's forces|Assailant] [ambushed|Target] [them|Victim] [on the left flank|Place] [from a line of low hills|Source].</ex>

name: Attempt
description:
An #Agent attempts to achieve a #Goal. The #Outcome may also be mentioned explicitly.

<ex>[John|Agent] [attempted|Target] [to climb Mt. Everest|Goal].</ex>

<ex>It was another [failed|Outcome] [attempt|Target] [to climb Mt. Everest|Goal].</ex>

name: Attempting_and_resolving_scenario
description: An #Agent has a particular #Goal in mind, and then uses some #Means that they believe will bring about the #Goal.  The #Agent succeeds or fails inasmuch as the result of the #Means action matches the #Goal.

name: Attempt_action_scenario
description: This frame represents the core action of an Attempt, where an #Agent has a #Goal and performs some #Means action that they believe will achieve the #Goal.  See its two perspectivized frames for further information.

name: Attempt_distant_interaction_scenario
description: An #Agent attempts to interact with a relatively distant or indirectly accessible #Target using some #Instrument (which may be a body part, e.g. <ment>hand</ment>).  The #Agent's ability to manipulate the #Instrument and put it in the #Target location is in question.  The most common types of distant interaction involve an #Agent attempting to move the #Instrument ballistically so that it contacts the #Target (e.g. Shooting_scenario), or an #Agent attempting to direct an #Instrument that enables perception at a #Target_location to be examined.

name: Attempt_means
description:
An #Agent attempts to achieve a #Goal using some #Means.

<ex>[John|Agent] [tried|Target] [using a crowbar|Means] [to open the door|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[They|Agent] [tried|Target] [opening the window|Means] [in order to rob the store|Goal].</ex>

Very frequently, an entity involved in a #Means action stands in for the #Means, and similarly a #Goal may be metonymically expressed with an entity related to a #Goal situation:

<ex>[John|Agent] [tried|Target] [a crowbar|Means] [on the door|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[They|Agent] [tried|Target] [the window|Means] [in order to rob the store|Goal].</ex>

Unlike the Attempt frame, the #Means is focused upon, and the #Goal is often implicit.  This frame answers the question of how something is to be attempted, rather than what is being attempted.  The frames can be most reliably distinguished by paraphrasing a sentence with ""give X a try"", since ""give try"" belongs only in this frame.

name: Attempt_obtain_food_scenario
description: A #Seeker is trying to obtain #Food and is seeking it within the context of a #Ground.

name: Attempt_obtain_mineral_scenario
description: An #Agent attempts to obtain a non-renewable resource, often solid minerals or metals, but also oil, water, and other valuable substances.

name: Attempt_suasion
description:
The  #Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the #Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the #Content. There is no implication that the #Addressee forms an intention to act, let alone acts.


<ex>[Mr Smithers|Speaker] always [encourages|Target] [the employees|Add] [to stay late and work harder|Content].</ex>

<ex>[Dennis Rodman|Speaker] [advises|Target] [moderation in all things|Content]. [INI|Add]</ex>

The #Content most prototypically refers to an action that the #Addressee will carry out themselves, but may (in the case of valences with a non-finite #Content clause) merely refer to a situation that they have indirect influence over, as in the following

<ex>When I talked to her, [I|Speaker] [suggested|Target] [that he be removed from office|Content] . [DNI|Addressee] </ex>

name: Attending
description:
An #Agent goes to an #Event and is present in a relatively non-participatory way.

<ex>[The Angolan guerrillas|Agent] will [attend|Target] [a September meeting|Event] [in Zaire|Place].</ex>

<ex>[We|Agent] just [go|Target] [to the movies|Event] [when it rains|Time].</ex>

<ex>[His|Agent] [attendance|Target] [at the funeral|Event] did not go unnoticed.</ex>

name: Attention
description:
This frame concerns a #Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a #Figure within a #Ground.  It is often unknown to the #Perceiver whether or not the #Figure exists within the #Ground. Alternatively, the #Expressor may be expressed as showing signs of the #Perceiver's state of attentiveness.

<ex>Legislator tells [consumers|Perceiver] to <ment>be</ment> [alert|Target] [to dioxin levels|Figure].</ex>

<ex>They demand an [attentive|Target] [gaze|Expressor], a careful accounting of parts.</ex>

name: Attention_getting
description:
This frame covers terms used to get someone's attention, including #Interjections (e.g. <ment>hey</ment>, <ment>yo</ment>) and certain terms of address (#Address_term), the latter of which may serve the function of attention getting.

<ex>[[Hey|Target]|Interj].</ex>
<ex>[Hey|Interj], [boy|Add_t].</ex>
<ex>[Hey|Interj], [boy|Add_t], come over here now!</ex>

name: Attitude_description
description:
The lexical units in this frame are descriptions of a #Cognizer's #Attitude about or outlook on a #State_of_affairs.

<ex></ex>
<ex>[Carl|Cog] is becoming [more|Deg] [pessimistic|Target] [about the negotiations|State] every day.</ex>

<ex>The benefits of cluelessness come from living in a society where [people|Cog] <m>take</m> an [optimistic|Target] [view|Att] [of life|State].</ex>
<ex></ex>
The #State_of_affairs can be expressed without a #Cognizer in many cases, as shown in the following:
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The situation|State] is [fairly|Deg] [grim|Target] at the moment.</ex>
<ex></ex>

name: Tourist_potential
description: A given #Place houses an #Attraction. Usually, the #Attraction is either a natural or artificial feature with historical or cultural value, which attracts people to the #Place so as to explore its potential.

name: Attraction_tourism
description: The search for entertainment is, basically, what motivates the #Tourist to visit a #Place. S/he wishes to see and/or enjoy the benefits that a #Place or an #Attraction can offer. The kinds of attractions might be described separately to emphasize their specialties. Though they are described in separate events, all kinds of attractions may be regarded from three different perspectives: that of the Tourist, that of the Attraction itself and that of the Touristic Potential of a Place.

name: Attributed_information
description:
A #Proposition is attributed to a #Speaker or a #Text.

<ex>[According|Target] [to|Target] [the Press Trust of India|spe] [in an article published on its Web site Thursday|tex], [the woman has been identified as 31-year-old Aafia Siddiqui, who was being sought by U.S. officials last week along with two other men, including one whose last known address was in Miramar, Fla|pro].</ex>

<ex> In addition, [according|Target] [to|Target] [Section I3.5b|tex], [the spacing of stud shear connectors along the length of a supporting beam shall not exceed 36?|pro]. </ex>

<ex>[According|Target] [to|Target] [the Pope|spe], [Muslims believe in the same God|pro] and according to Jesus, Muslims are the greatest in Heaven.</ex>

name: Attributes
description: An #Entity has a particular #Attribute with some #Value. This frame is primarily for inheritance.

name: Authority
description:
An [Agent|Agent] has the means to affect a #Theme along the lines of a certain #Domain. There is an imbalance of influence or power within a certain #Domain that favors the #Agent (often due to some #Source) over the #Theme.

<ex>[His|Agent] [authority|Target] [over his subjects|Theme] was given to him [by God|Source].</ex>
<ex>[Congress|Agent] has the [power|Target] to enact [laws|Domain].</ex>
<ex>Only [the King|Agent] has the [authority|Target] to declare [war|Domain].</ex>

name: Avoiding
description:
An #Agent avoids an #Undesirable_situation under certain #Circumstances. That situation may be an activity (e.g. going to school), or an entity (perhaps) metonymic for such an activity or situation (e.g. the curb).  In this frame, the situation is undesirable from the #Agent's point of view (e.g. <ment>evade</ment>), and contrasts with scenes in which the situation is specifically undesirable to someone else (e.g. <ment>forbear</ment>) or from the point of view of an external morality (e.g. <ment>abstain</ment>).

<ex>[Mike|Agent] [avoided|Target] [his supervisor|Undesirable_situation] [at all costs|Circumstances].</ex>

name: Awareness
description:
A #Cognizer has a piece of #Content in their model of the world.  The #Content is not necessarily present due to immediate perception, but usually, rather, due to deduction from perceivables.  In some cases, the deduction of the #Content is implicitly based on confidence in sources of information (<ment>believe</ment>), in some cases based on logic (<ment>think</ment>), and in other cases the source of the deduction is deprofiled (<ment>know</ment>).

<ex>[Your boss|Cognizer] is [aware|Target] [of your commitment|Content].</ex>
<ex></ex>
Note that this frame is undergoing some degree of reconsideration.  Many of the targets will be moved to the Opinion frame.  That frame indicates that the #Cognizer considers something as true, but the Opinion (compare to #Content) is not presupposed to be true; rather it is something that is considered a potential point of difference, as in the following:

<ex>I [think|Target] that you are awesome.</ex>

In the uses that will remain in the Awareness frame, however, the #Content is presupposed.

<ex></ex>
This frame is also distinct from the Certainty frame, in that it does not profile the relationship of the #Cognizer to the #Content, but rather presupposes it.  In Certainty, the Degree of confidence or certainty is expressible as a separate frame element, as in the following:

<ex>She <m>absolutely</m> [knew|Target] that he would be there .</ex>

name: Awareness_change_scenario
description: An #Experiencer becomes aware of some #Phenomenon (a situation, fact, or idea) that they formerly did not have in their mind.

name: Awareness_situation
description: A Cognizer has a piece of Content in their model of the world due to deduction, inference, or similar means of arriving at information from perceivables.

name: Awareness_status
description:
Some #Content is part of the mental model of a #Cognizer. The #Cognizer arrives at the mental model not by direct perception but by reasoning from perceived phenomena. Alternatively, the #Role of a particular object is known to be applicable to that object.

<ex>[That fact|con] is [known|Target] [to many|cog].</ex>

<ex>The [presumed|Target] [killer|rol] was last seen driving south on the interstate.</ex>

name: Bail_decision
description:
This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  #Judge decides whether the #Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway|Accused], was <m>granted</m> [$100,000|Status] [bail|Target] until June 18.</ex>

<ex>[He|Accused] was <m>granted</m> [conditional|Status] [bail|Target] [by Teesside Magistrates|Judge].</ex>

name: Basis_for_attribute
description:
A piece of information about a #Landmark is presented as more accessible and useful for determining or communicating a similar type of information about the #Trajector.  In this construal of a situation, there is a (more) profiled element, the #Trajector, and an un- or less profiled element, the #Landmark.  In combination with a schematically-defined #Profiled_region (with a pre-defined relationship to the #Landmark), the #Landmark serves as the basis for understanding the status or location of the #Trajector.

<ex>[The cat|Trajector] [in|Target] [the shed|Landmark] purred violently .</ex>
<ex>[The shed|Trajector] [around|Target] [the cat|Landmark] shook .</ex>
<ex>We 'll have to [leave|Trajector] [before|Target] [noon|Landmark] .</ex>
<ex>In the 1990s , though , [the rate at which DNA could be read|Trajector] revved [into|Target] [high gear|Landmark] .</ex>

name: Bearing_arms
description:
A #Protagonist has (or does not have) a #Weapon.  The #Degree to which the #Protagonist is armed may also be described.  The #Protagonist is normally a human but may be a device that has subsidiary weapons.
<ex>Apparently, [the suspect|Protagonist] <m>is</m> [armed|Target] [with a shotgun|Weapon].</ex>
<ex>After she pulled the .45 from her sock drawer, [she|Protagonist] <m>felt</m> [well enough|Degree] [armed|Target] [to face anyone coming in|Degree].</ex>
<ex>[The Tomahawk missile|Protagonist] [packs|Target] a lot of heat .</ex>

<ex>[An individual with a right-to-carry license|Protagonist] may continue to [carry|Target] in a ""school zone"" in compliance with existing state and local laws. [INI|Weapon]</ex>

name: Beat_opponent
description:
A #Winner has victory over an #Loser.

<ex>[He|Winner] [always|Frequency] [beats|Target] [me|Loser] [at chess|Competition].</ex>

name: Becoming
description:
An #Entity ends up with some #Final_quality--a new fact about the #Entity. Alternatively, based on a cluster of changes of characteristics, the #Entitynewly meets the conditions for being a member of a #Final_category.

<ex>[The weather|Entity] [turned|Target] [cold|Final_quality] .</ex>
<ex>[You|Entity] can [become|Target] [a firefighter|Final_category] [today|Time] !</ex>

This frame should be compared with the Transition_to_state frame, which is more general in allowing arbitrary descriptions of a final situation:

<ex>We [ended up|Target] telling him to leave .</ex>

There is no way to effectively paraphrase such a sentence in the Becoming frame.

name: Becoming_attached
description:
An #Item comes to be attached to a #Goal, with a #Connector forming a bond between the #Handle of the #Item and the #Goal (or some part of it). Alternatively, multiple #Items may form a bond between each other.

<ex>According to plan, [the front part of the hull|Item] [quietly|Manner] [attached|Target] [to the docking gear|Goal].</ex>

<ex>[The cells|Items] [bind|Target] [together|Result].</ex>

name: Becoming_aware
description:
Words in this frame have to do with a #Cognizer adding some #Phenomenon to their model of the world. They are similar to Coming-to-believe words, except the latter generally involve reasoning from Evidence.
<ex></ex>
The words in this frame take direct objects that denote entities in the world, and indicate awareness of those entities, without necessarily giving any information about the content of the #Cognizer's belief or knowledge. These words also resemble perception words, since creatures often become aware of things by perceiving them.

<ex>[Later that night|T], [they|Cog] [found|Target] [the barely-alive victim|Phen] [inside the Red Hall estate flat|Ground].</ex>

<ex>[Almost immediately|T], [the police|Cog] [discovered|Target] [the wrought-iron crypt gate|Phen] [swinging open|State].</ex>

<ex>[In the bag on the table|Ground][I|Cog] could [vaguely|Deg][discern|Target] [two bottles of wine and several cartons of cakes and other goodies|Phen].</ex>

<ex>[People passing through|Cog] [recognize|Target] [it|Phen] [from afar|Ground], [by the clouds of coal dust darkening the air|Evid].</ex>


General Grammatical Observations: Passive forms of the verbs in this frame can occur with extraposed clauses expressing #Phenomenon:
<ex>That year it was [discovered|Target] [that consumers preferred the older model|Phen].</ex>
<ex>It is not always [recognized|Target] [how much work goes into a dinner party|Phen].</ex>

name: Becoming_a_member
description:
A #New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed #Group.
<ex>[Seven new members and the three countries|New_member] [joined|Target] [the alliance|Group] [five years ago|Time].</ex>
<ex>[Most new students|New_member] [enroll|Target] [in a university|Group] [without declaring a major|Manner].</ex>
<ex>It represents [every man and woman who|New_member] has [enlisted|Target] [in the armed forces|Group] [to protect our families and serve the community|Purpose].</ex>

name: Becoming_detached
description:
The Becoming_detached frame covers two situations: a scene in which one thing comes to be physically detached from something else; or a scene in which two things come to be disconnected from each other. In the first, the frame includes an #Item that detaches from a #Source, creating an asymmetric relationship between the Item and the #Source. In the second, the #Items detach from each other, where each serves as a #Source relative to the other, creating a symmetric relationship between the two #Items. The #Items that were formerly attached re-appear as the two separate or potentially separate entities that they were throughout.

<ex>[The ship|Item] <m>became</m> [decoupled|Target] [from the dock|Source].</ex>

name: Becoming_dry
description:
An #Entity loses moisture with the outcome of being in a dry state.

<ex>[The slab|Entity] [dries|Target] [very quickly|Manner].</ex>

name: frm_becoming_nonfunctional
description: frm_becoming_nonfunctional

name: Becoming_separated
description:
A #Whole separates into #Parts, or one part of a whole, called #Part_1, becomes separate from the remaining portion, #Part_2.

<ex>[This small channel|Whole] meanders through marsh and wetland, [splitting|Target] [into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair|Parts].</ex>

<ex>Just crack one open and if [the yoke|Part_1] [quickly|Manner] [separates|Target] [from the whites|Part_2], they are probably bad.</ex>

name: Becoming_silent
description:
In this frame a #Speaker ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular #Topic. An #Expressor may also be indicated.
<ex></ex>
The words of this frame are very frequently used imperatively, to the extent that certain words and phrases (<ment>not another word, silence, shhh</ment>) can only be used this way.

<ex>Finally, [Jan|Speaker] [shut|Target] [up|Target] [about his car accident|Topic].</ex>
<ex>[The children's laughter|Expressor] [quieted|Target] [down|Target].</ex>
<ex>Somehow, [he|Speaker] managed to [hold|Target] [his|Speaker] [tongue|Target].</ex>

name: Becoming_visible
description:
An #Entity that is previously not visible to a #Perceiver becomes visible.

<ex>[The armada|Entity] [appeared|Target] [on the horizon|Place] [at sunset|Time].</ex>

<ex>The captain ordered his men to dig at the X and [the corner of a chest|Entity] [appeared|Target].</ex>

name: Bedding
description: Bedding

name: Behind_the_scenes
description:
#Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar #Production.  #Artists never appear on stage or in front of a camera.  Some (e.g., a director) may interact with the actors (on-screen participants) of the #Production.  Often times a particular #Production is made for distribution by a #Distributor, by a particular #Studio, or in a specific #Medium.  The #Artists may be categorized into #Type or work in specific #Medium.
<ex>[Steven Spielberg|Artist] [directed|Target] [several films|Production] [for Universal Pictures|Studio].</ex>
<ex>[Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment|Studio] [produced|Target] [Jurassic Park|Production] [for MCA|Distributor].</ex>
<ex>Surprisingly, this [film|Medium] [[producer|Target]|Artist] was willing to work for a cable company.</ex>
<ex>[Independent|Type] [[producers|Target]|Artist] often win big at smaller film festivals.</ex>

name: Being_active
description:
An #Agent is described as pursuing an #Activity, expending some effort. The #Agent may be active in a particular #Role. Alternatively, the #Activity itself may be described as having an #Agent who is expending effort.  In some cases, the Activity may involve a #Salient_entity which may stand in for it.

<ex>[Sky, a Korean War veteran,|Agent] <m>was</m> [active|Target] [in his opposition to Vietnam|Activity] and continues to protest current combat in Iraq.</ex>

<ex>[She|Agent] <m>is</m> [active|Target] [in the community|Place] [by establishing parent groups, life skills program, sharing circles and various Aboriginal cultural activities for young women.|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[John Colville|Agent] <m>was</m> quite [active|Target] [as a land speculator|Role] [in both Virginia and Maryland|Place].</ex>

name: Being_attached
description:
An #Item is attached by a #Handle, via a #Connector, to a #Goal, or #Items are attached to each other.  There may be a #Dependent_state, which depends crucially on #Item(s) being attached.

<ex>[My thumb|Item] <m>was</m> [stuck|Target] [to the tube of glue|Goal].</ex>

<ex>[The prisoner's legs|Items] were [shackled|Target].</ex>

name: Being_at_risk
description:
An #Asset is in a state where it is exposed to or otherwise liable to be affected by a #Harmful_event, which may be metonymically evoked by reference to a #Dangerous_entity. Words expressing relative safety (i.e., lack of risk) are also in this frame.

<ex>If you are a farmer, [you|Asset] <m>are</m> <m>at</m> [risk|Target] [for hearing loss caused by noise exposure in your work|Harmful_event].</ex>

<ex>[No child|Asset] <m>is</m> [secure|Target] [from the temptation to do what ""my friends"" are doing|Harmful_event].</ex>

<ex>Our nation is making a disastrous mistake thinking that [we|Asset] can <m>have</m> [security|Target] [from
people|Dangerous_entity]: There is only security with people. </ex>

<ex>[You|Asset] don't <m>have</m> [security|Target] [against impersonation|Harmful_event] unless you have security against eavesdropping.</ex>

name: Being_awake
description:
A #Protagonist is awake at some #Time and #Place.  This entails the #Protagonist having a higher general level of awareness of the surroundings than when asleep.

<ex>[He|Protagonist]'s [awake|Target]!</ex>

name: Being_born
description:
This frame concerns the inception of the life of a #Child, generally human, at a particular #Time and #Place.  The #Relatives may also be mentioned.

<ex>[Little Jessie|Child] [came into the world|Target] [at 8 last night|Time].</ex>

name: Being_contained_within
description: In this situation, a #Trajector is contained inside a #Landmark.  This frame serves only to relate the Containing frame (with LUs such as contain.v) with the Interior_profile_relation frame (with LUs such as inside.prep).

name: Being_detached
description:
An #Item is detached from a #Source, or #Items are detached from each other.

<ex>When [the snow plow|itm] is [disconnected|Target] [from the vehicle|src], extend the lift cylinder to the end of its stroke and coat the chrome rod with a light grease.</ex>

<ex>[The gold leaves that|itm] are [unattached|Target] [to the engraved surfaces|src] fall off.</ex>
<ex>By 5:00 to 5:30 (depending on the time of year) [the boat|itm] is [unmoored|Target] and loaded.</ex>

name: Being_dry
description:
An #Item is in a state of dryness.
<ex>[The shingles |Item] are [dry|Target].</ex>
<ex>[The apple|Item] is [completely|Degree] [dehydrated|Target].</ex>
<ex><fex name = ""Item"" >The mop is [dry|Target].</ex>

name: Being_employed
description:
An #Employee has a #Position doing work in a particular #Field, or doing work on a particular #Task, for which an #Employer gives #Compensation to the #Employee.

<ex> [Undocumented foreigners|Employee] are [working|Target] [as  building contractors|Position] [for Laing Builders|Employer].</ex>

name: Being_free
description: Being_free

name: Being_incarcerated
description:
A #Prisoner is punished for committing a #Crime by being confined to a #Prison for a specified period of time.

<ex>[Phil|Prisoner]'s [serving time|Target] [at Pelican Bay|Prison].</ex>

name: Being_included
description: A #Part is profiled as being a subset or constituent subpart of a #Whole. This is in contrast to Inclusion frame, wherein the same relation is seen from the point of view of the #Whole.

name: Being_in_captivity
description:
A #Theme is held in captivity by an #Agent or #Cause.

<ex>[Twenty soldiers|Theme] were <m>in</m> [captivity|Target] for over a month before they were released</ex>

<ex>I never release [my|Agent] [[prisoners|Theme]|Target].</ex>

<ex>She couldn't believe [she|Theme] was [prisoner|Target] [in her own home|Holding_location].</ex>

name: Being_in_category
description:
An #Item belongs to a #Category, as (often implicitly) conceived of by a #Cognizer.

<ex>[To me|Cognizer] [this|Item] [counts|Target] [as historical fiction|Category] [because it is based on real events|Criteria].</ex>

name: Being_in_control
description:
A #Controlling_entity has control of a #Dependent_entity, #Dependent_situation, or #Dependent_variable.

<ex>[She|Controlling_entity] was <m>in</m> [control|Target] [of the empire|Dependent_entity] [within two days|Time].</ex>

This frame is distinct from Control in that the #Controlling_entity is not fully asserted to be currently controlling the #Dependent_entity, #Dependent_situation, or #Dependent_variable, but rather is attentive to it and capable of making the situation correspond to the desired state at any time.

name: Being_in_effect
description: A particular #Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the #Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect. The #Binding_principle can be expressed as being in effect for a particular #Duration, or at a particular #Time or #Place, or under certain #Circumstances. [This law|bin_pri] will only become in [effect|Target] [during the last three weeks of the year|dur]. [The statutory wetlands definition|bin_pri] is [effective|Target] [immediately|tim]. [This contract|Binding_principle] is [binding|Target] [on all parties|obl]. Although the in effect is properly in this frame, (put) into effect is analyzed in the Execute_plan frame. This is in part because to put an (evacuation) plan into effect is to actually execute the plan (to evacuate), while to put a plan in effect is to determine that in the future the plan may have to executed, i.e., to make the plan binding. Similar observations can be made for come into effect.

name: Being_in_operation
description:
A #Device or machine is in (or out of) service. Note that being broken or functional is a separate issue from being turned on or off. This latter notion is what the present frame is concerned with.
The #Time when and the #Place where the #Device is in use may be specified, as may be the Purpose a backgrounded human User had in turning the Device on or off. [The TV|Device] is [on|Target] [The lights|Device] were [off|Target] [when I came by|Time].

name: Being_located
description:
A #Theme is in a stable position with respect to a #Location.

<ex>[Our offices|Theme] are [located|Target] [about two miles south of I-85|Location] .</ex>

name: Being_named
description:
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.

<ex>[Her|Entity] [name|Target] <m>was</m> [Lola|Name].</ex>

name: Being_necessary
description:
A #Dependent state-of-affairs has a #Requirement as a prerequisite for obtaining or occurring.

<ex>[The atomic bombings|req] <m>were</m> probably not [necessary|Target] [to win WWII without a mainland invasion of Japan|dep].</ex>

<ex>We will take the [required|Target] [measures|req], regardless of the yelping of the left. [DNI|dep]</ex>

<ex> [Two tokens|reqe] <m>are</m> [necessary|Target] [for county to county trips|Dependent].</ex>

name: Being_obligated
description:
Under some #Condition, usually left implicit, a #Responsible_party is required to perform some #Duty.  If they do not perform the #Duty, there may be some undesirable #Consequence, which may or may not be stated overtly.

<ex><ment>It</ment> <gov>is</gov> [my|Responsible_party] [duty|Target] [to fight any attack on the Brotherhood|Duty] .</ex>
<ex>[This country|Resp] has the [responsibility|Target] [to support its citizens' right to express themselves|Duty].</ex>
<ex>[I|Resp] am [obligated|Target] [to pay|Duty] [or they'll double the fine|Con].</ex>

NB:  Contrast this frame with Likelihood and Preconditions frames, which involve many of the same lemmas.

Many LUs which might be expected to be found here (should, must, have to) are actually in the Required_event frame. Our analysis is that these LUs do not evoke an obligation directly, although they are frequently used in contexts that are consistent with an understanding of obligation and are pragmatically strengthened to (defeasibly) imply an obligation.

name: Being_obligatory
description:
Under some #Condition, usually left implicit, a #Duty needs to be fulfilled by a
#Responsible_party. If the #Duty is not performed, there may be some undesirable #Consequence for the #Responsible_party, which may or may not be stated overtly.
Compare this frame to the Being_obligated frame.



<ex>It would [behoove|Target] [us|res] [to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples|dut]</ex>

<ex>Fressed too much at the [obligatory|Target] [BBQ|dut]. [INI|res]</ex>

<ex>When I was in HS, [marching band|dut] <m>was</m> [mandatory|Target] in order to participate in any of the other ensembles [INI|res]</ex>

<ex>Should [insurance|dut] <m>be</m> [compulsory|Target]?</ex>

name: Being_operational
description:
An #Object with an understood function is or is not in a state ready to perform that function.

<ex>[The remote|Object] is [almost|Degree] [broken|Target].</ex>

<ex>Hand me that [broken|Target] [watch|Object] so I can throw it away.</ex>

name: Being_pregnant
description: This frame describes the experience of expecting and bearing a child, from the perspective of the parent(s).

name: Being_questionable
description:
In this frame, an #Entity or #Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.  The general implication is that the #Entity or #Behavior provides evidence for some (as yet unproven) socially undesirable conclusion about a (usually implicit) #Social_actor.  (Such conclusions often include the idea that some individual is lying, or that a crime was committed.)
<ex>We found some [suspicious|Target] [checks|Entity] lying on his desk.</ex>
<ex>It <m>was</m> rather [suspicious|Target] [of you|soc] [to leave the party just before the police arrived|Behavior].</ex>

name: Being_relevant
description:
A #Phenomenon is related to some cognitive action, the #Endeavor, of a #Cognizer. In many LUs, the #Cognizer is null-instantiated and implied as being the speaker or another participant of the #Endeavor.

<ex>[This book|Phenomenon] is [very|Degree] [relevant|Target] [to my essay|Endeavor].</ex>
<ex>This book is very [relevant|Target] to [my|Cognizer] essay.</ex>

name: Being_rotted
description: An organic item, the #Patient, has undergone the natural process of rotting  and decaying with a possible expression of the #Degree to which the rotting has occurred. <ex>[The coconut milk|Patient] became [rancid|Target].</ex>

name: Being_up_to_it
description:
An #Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an #Activity that is judged to be difficult for it to participate in, either due to inherent properties of the #Entity or temporary #Circumstances. A #Degree modifier may indicate by how much the #Entity exceeds or falls short of the minimum requirements.

<ex>[Little Tommy|Entity] was not [up|Target] [to|Target] [getting out of bed|Activity] [because he was quite sick|Explanation].</ex>

name: Being_wet
description:
An #Item is in a state of wetness with the possibility of the wetting #Liquid being mentioned, along with the #Degree of wetness.
<ex> [The mop|Item] <m>is</m> [drenched|Target] [with water|Liquid] [from last night's rain|Explanation].</ex>

name: Besieging
description:
An #Assailant, a group of armed forces, surrounds the #Victim, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the #Victim off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful. A successful siege is often followed by the #Assailant taking control of (the land held by) the #Victim.

<ex>[Towards the end of the summer|tim], [a great English host|ass] [besieged|Target] [the Danish fort of Tempsford|vic] and took it, killing the last Danish king of East Anglia.</ex>

name: Beyond_compare
description:
Compared to its #Competitors, a #Standard is at the high end of a scale with respect to some #Variable. The #Competitors are frequently not realized syntactically.
<ex>The taxpayer is supporting [a system|Standard] [unmatched|Target] [in wastefulness |Variable].</ex>
<ex>The drawing room was a place of [unmatched|Target] [squalor|Variable].</ex>
<ex> She was envious of her mother's [matchless|Target] [beauty|Variable].</ex>

<ex></ex>When there is no overt #Variable it must be understood from the context. <ex>[He|Standard] was [unmatched|Target]  [ by any other  politician of his time|Competitors].</ex>

<ex></ex>When the target occurs as the modifier of a predicate nominal, it  is tagged as #Standard, rather than #Variable.
 <ex>They were [matchless|Target] [needlers of each other|Standard].</ex>

name: Be_in_agreement_on_action
description:
Two (or more) people (the #Parties, also encodable as #Party_1 and
#Party_2) have an agreement. Both sides are construed as having
a commitment to an #Obligation--the relationship is understood to be symmetrical or
reciprocal. Instead of a specific mention of the #Obligation, a #Topic expression may be used to indicate the domain covered.

<ex>[The US and Russia|Parties] have an [agreement|Target] [to share early warning data on missile launches|Obligation].</ex>

name: Be_in_agreement_on_assessment
description:
The #Cognizers have a similarity (or dissimilarity) in their #Opinion. The #Cognizers may be expressed separately, with #Cognizer_2 being the basis for establishing the #Opinion of #Cognizer_1.  Rather than a specific #Opinion, a phenomenon about which a similar or differing #Opinion is held, the #Topic, may be specified. A specific #Opinion may also go unmentioned when the #Opinions of the #Cognizers are understood as answers to a #Question.

<ex>[Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond|Cognizers] [agree|Target] [in their impressions|Question].</ex>

<ex> [This copyeditor and I|Cognizers] [mostly|Degree] [see|Target] [eye|Target] [to|Target] [eye|Target] [on things|Topic].</ex>

<ex>[I|Cognizer_1] [agree|Target] [with you|cog2] [that everything should be monitored to keep the person from wasting time and protecting the interests of the company|Opinion].</ex>

name: Be_on_alert
description:
A #Protagonist has become aware of a possible #Danger (a dangerous event or a #Dangerous_entity that might participate in an event harmful to the #Protagonist) and is ready to engage in an #Activity in response to that #Danger.

<ex>[All tropps|Protagonist] are on [high|Degree] [alert|Target] [for possible intruders|Dangerous_entity] [following an attack on a nearby compound|Time].</ex>

<ex>[we|Protagonist]'re on [alert|Target] [to stop anyone trying to sneak in|Activity].</ex>

<ex>[we|Protagonist]'re on [guard|Target] [for possible sabotage|Danger].</ex>

name: Be_subset_of
description:
A #Part is considered to be a member of the set described by the #Total. The relationship between #Part and #Total subset-superset rather than part-whole (as it is in the frames Part_whole and Including).

<ex>[Dr. Nelson|Part] [numbers|Target] [among the world?s foremost geotechnical engineering experts|Total].</ex>
