An #Agent acts so as to be the strongest force, or most important causal factor in some #Situation, to the exclusion of other competing actors.

<ex>[York|Agent] [dominated|Target] [the game|Situation] [as they held the ball on offense almost the entire 70 minutes|Manner].</ex>
<ex>Is there a future for Unix in [a market|Situation] [increasingly|Degree] [dominated|Target] [by Microsoft|Agent]?</ex>
<ex>[Walz|Agent] [dominated|Target] [the debate|Situation] [so completely it was almost embarrassing|Degree].</ex>

name: Domination
description:
An #Agent has a influential, controlling position in a #Situation, and is the primary causal factor in the development of the #Situation, leaving other #Competitors unable to take controlling positions.

Two perspectives are taken on this frame, one where the #Agent is viewed as controlling primarily the #Situation, and another where the #Agent is viewed as primarily influencing the other #Competitors in the #Situation.

name: Dough_rising
description:
The LUs of this frame describe a lump of #Dough expanding as gas develops inside it.  This is part of a process where, in order to produce a lighter, more easily chewed bread, #Dough is leavened with yeast, baking soda or in another fashion to add gas to it before baking.

<ex>I've got no frozen boxed meals, and no other real options to make something to keep me going while [my pizza dough|dou] [rises|Target].</ex>

name: Downing
description:
An #Agent disables a flying or floating #Patient, causing it to be unable to support itself in its current medium.

<ex>It's rumored that [she|Agent] [downed|Target] [a helicopter|Patient] [with a precisely fired arrow|ins].</ex>

name: Dressing
description:
A #Wearer puts on an item of #Clothing, which then occupies the #Body_location.

<ex>[You|wea] didn't have to [dress|Target] [like a pirate|man] [to impress me|pur]. [INI|bod]</ex>
<ex>He [put|Target] [on|Target] [his thickest pair of gloves|Clothing] and then went back out to see if he could move them now. [INI|bod]</ex>
<ex>Jack [put|Target] [on|Target] [his watch|Clothing] - [on his right wrist|bod], and checked the time.</ex>

name: Drop_in_on
description:
A #Visitor arrives at the #Host_location as a guest of the #Host, for the purpose of achieving a #Purpose. The #Purpose is often social in nature, i.e., the visit itself constitutes a goal.

<ex>[I|Visitor]'m gonna [drop|Target] [in|Target] [on Kieth|Host] [for a while|Time].</ex>

name: Dunking
description:
An #Agent temporarily places a #Theme into a #Substance, often with the intention to remove it later. The #Substance may be metonymically represented by its container. The #Theme may be partially or completely submerged.

<ex>[She|Agent] [dunked|Target] [her sandwich|Theme] [into some tomato soup|Substance].</ex>

name: Duplication
description:
This frame involves a #Creator making a duplicate, the #Copy, of some #Original entity.  A #Source, the location of the #Original, and #Goal, the location of the #Copy, may be expressed.

<ex>[The teacher|Creator] [copied|Target] [the problem|Original] [onto the blackboard|Goal].</ex>

<ex> [His handouts|Copy] were [poorly|Manner] [photocopied|Target] [ by his assistant|Creator][from my originals |Original].</ex>

name: Duration_description
description:
An event or state (here termed an #Eventuality) or time-#Period is described in terms of the #Degree to which its duration diverges from a standard.  As is usual for gradable attributes, the standard of comparison is normally based on the expected duration for the type of #Eventuality or #Period.  (In conjunction with the comparative construction, the standard may also be based upon an explicit value.)
<ex></ex>
<ex>After a [lengthy|Target] [discussion with the Foreign Minister, Mr. Qian Qichen|Eventuality], they met the Prime Minister.</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>The [lengthy|Target] [period which most party leaders have already spent in Parliament before gaining office|Period] certainly gives them time to acquire suitable skills.</ex>

name: Duration_relation
description:
A #Period or #Eventuality is related to its #Duration.  Alternatively, an #Entity may stand in metonymically for an #Eventuality that it is involved in.

<ex>[You|Entity] wouldn't [last|Target] [five minutes|Duration]!</ex>

name: Duration_scenario
description: An Event or #Period has a particular #Duration.  The #Duration may be characterized in several different ways: as a #Durational direct measure, a #Degree of deviation from an expected #Duration, or as a #Count of #Units of standard, known duration.

name: Dying
description:
A #Protagonist is near or approaching death.

<ex>But a [dying|Target] [patient|Protagonist] is still a living patient.</ex>

name: Dynamic_situation_scenario
description: This frame denotes simple #Events in which an #Entity is in a dynamic situation, usually punctually or continually changing to conform to the situation encoded in the Event_endstate.  This frame also covers situations in which there is no significant difference between the pre- and post-states, but the dynamic situation that occurs between them is notably temporally bounded.

name: Dynamism
description:
A physical #Exerter, #Action, or #Force exerts energy at a level specified by the target. This frame covers both individual-level/static uses (""an INTENSE person"") as well as stage-level/dynamic uses (""an INTENSE look""), although the individual-level meaning seems more basic.

<ex>Although an [energetic|Target] and able [warrior|Exer], Charlemagne tended to direct battles rather than fight in person.</ex>
<ex>[She dumped a mug on the bedside table|Act] with [such|Deg] [vigor|Target] that steaming coffee spashed out.</ex>
<ex>Swing the racket with [dynamic|Target] [force|For].</ex>

<ex>[I|Exer] felt [particularly|Deg] [sluggish|Target] [at work|Pla] [that day|Tim].</ex>
#Exerter, #Action, and #Force belong to a Core set.
<ex></ex>
This frame also covers several productive metaphor cases. In the first one, movement or change caused by a social entity is conveyed as energy exerted by a physical entity. 'Social' here encompasses entities that are economic, political, technological, historical, cultural, and intimate:
<ex>[The private sector|Exer] is [so much more|Deg] [dynamic|Target].</ex>
<ex>Singh had been under [intense|Target] [political pressure|Exer].</ex>
<ex>[Economies|Exer] are [still|Tim] [sluggish|Target].</ex>
Relatedly, the influential effect of an psychological entity is described in terms of energy exertion by a physical entity. 'Psychological' includes the intellectual, emotional, and creative:
<ex>[Sinead's|Exer] [emotional|Dom] [intensity|Target] permeates every nuance of every lyric.</ex>
<ex>He finds [the Poet Laureate's theory about Shakespeare|Exer] to be [more|Deg] [energetic|Target] [than persuasive|Deg].</ex>
Both metaphors appear to involve a third metaphor, which is the anthropomorphization of processes (see examples directly above) or inhuman entities (e.g. in nature):
<ex>The [lazy|Target] [creak|Act] of sails</ex>
<ex>The [energetic|Target] [waves|Exer]</ex>
<ex>A broad, [lethargic|Target] [river|Exer]</ex>

Further, there is a metonymy wherein energy exerted by people carrying out an activity characterizes instead a central object or other component of the activity:
<ex>Lucker plays [lazy|Target] [games|Act].</ex>
<ex>She thought the [lazy|Target] [days|Exer] in France would never end.</ex>

<ex></ex>
Compare to: Level_of_force_exertion.

name: Earnings_and_losses
description:
An #Earner receives #Earnings by providing #Goods to a #Buyer; providing the #Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.  This frame emphasizes the effect on the #Earner and often generalizes across an indefinite number of transactions with various parties.  Some of the LUs (e.g. <ment>earn.v</ment>) primarily refer to the to the #Earnings without reference to cost, others to the amount the #Earnings differ from the cost, emphasizing either a net loss (e.g. <ment>loss.n</ment>) or net gain (e.g. <ment>net.n</ment>).

<ex>This reflects the 15 % jump in [[earnings|Earnings]|Target] over 1994 .</ex>
<ex>[We|Earner] [made|Target] [nearly two million|Earnings] [on resales alone|Goods] [last year|Time] .</ex>
<ex>After a [$ 1.5 million|Earnings] [loss|Target] , the company is in no state to continue .</ex>

name: frm_eating_event
description: frm_eating_event

name: Eating_habits
description: Eating_habits

name: Eclipse
description:
An #Obstruction blocks an #Eclipsed entity partially or completely from perception. The positions of the #Obstruction and the #Eclipsed entity are often reported relative to a #Vantage_point.

<ex>[A small green bulb|Eclipsed] [concealed|Target] [behind the panel|Obstruction] flashed on momentarily .</ex>

For LUs of this frame marked with the semantic type Visual_modality, visual perception is the base meaning, although some of these words are used metaphorically to cover other perceptual modalities, as in the following:

<ex>The note left on her dresser was a [veiled|Target] [threat|Eclipsed] . [CNI|Obstruction]</ex>

Such cases should be marked with the sentence tag ""Metaphor"".

name: Economy
description:
A #Political_region, often a nation,  has an economic system, the#Economy, defined by the level of production and consumption of goods and services.  The #Market_type or #Domain may be specified.

<ex>The [Canadian|pol] [[economy|Economy]|Target] will continue to expand in 2005.</ex>
<ex>Medical industry is a new force in the [industrial|dom] [[economy|Economy]|Target] [of Lin'an|pol].</ex>

name: Education_teaching
description:
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.  A #Student comes to learn either about a #Subject; a #Skill; a #Precept; or a #Fact as a result of instruction by a #Teacher.

Some of the nouns (schoolmaster, -mistress) in this frame refer to administrative positions and do not take relevant frame elements; these will be moved.

<ex>[Dad|tea] [taught|Target] [me|] [that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens|fac]. </ex>

<ex>[What|fac] [Our Cat|tea]  [taught|Target] [Me|stu] [ About Marketing|sub]!</ex>

<ex>For two years [she|tea] [taught|Target] [me|stu] [French|sub]</ex>

<ex>[Mom and Dad|tea] [taught|Target] [me|stu] [not to bullshit|pre], because it always
came back to bite me in the ass, without fail. </ex>

<ex>[A young swiss girl up in a swiss chalet|tea] [taught|Target] [me|stu] [how to yodel|ski].</ex>

<ex>Young Murdock later met [a blind martial arts master known as Stick, who|tea] taught him how to use his augmented senses and [trained|Target] [him|stu] [as a fighter|rol].</ex>

<ex> Maria, [a woman|stu] [studying|Target] [to be a nun|rol] is sent from her convent to be the governess of the seven children of a widowed naval captain </ex>

Frame-Element relations:

Several Frame element relations hold in this frame. There is a core-set {#Material, #Teacher} (possibly also including #Institution); these FE's can fill the subject slot of the teach-type verbs.
There is another core-set  {#Precept, #Subject, #Skill, #Fact, #Role} to do with what is learnt. In addition, the FE #Qualification may occur with #Subject and #Role
<ex>My sister is [studying|Target] [for a maths degree |Qualification]  [ to be a teacher |Role]</ex>
<ex>She's [studying|Target] [maths|Subject] [to be a teacher |Role].</ex>

Phrases expressing #Qualification also very often include information about the #Subject (see below), which is to be annotated on the second layer.

<ex>Bill is [studying|Target] [for a BS in physics/a maths degree|Qualification].</ex>
<ex>Bill is [studying|Target] for a BS in [physics|Subject]/a [maths|Subject] degree.</ex>

name: Electricity
description:
Lexical units in this frame refer to #Electricity, in particular as a form of energy harnessed for particular uses (such as powering machines).  The #Source of the #Electricity may also be expressed, or incorporated in the meaning of the LUs.

<ex>A compound to generate [wind|sou] [[electricity|Target]|ele] was built on the other side of those mountains.</ex>

<ex>China's [[hydroelectric|Target]|ele] dam is being built primarily for flood control and energy production.</ex>

name: Elimination_tournament
description: This scene refers to the phase of the World Cup #Tournament, in which #Team_1, #Team_2, or #Teams dipute only one match in each stage of the phase. The winner goes to the #Next_phase and the loser is eliminated.

name: Elusive_goal
description:
An #Experiencer does not achieve a #Desired_goal. Typically, the #Experiencer is the object of the verb.  Metaphorically, a pursued entity is not captured.

<ex>[Success|Des] [eludes|Target] [me|Exp].</ex>
<ex>[His point|Des] [escaped|Target] [ the entire audience|Exp].</ex>
<ex>[A simple truth|Des] has [evaded|Target] [so many of us|Exp].</ex>
<ex></ex>
This frame is a metaphorical extension of the Evading frame.  The Evading frame concerns literal motion of two self-directed entities, one of which moves in such a way as to successfully prevent the other from capturing it.  In the case of the Elusive_goal frame, however, there is no literal motion, but rather a #Desired_goal that is not ""captured"" by the #Experiencer that would like the #Desired_goal to be true or known.

name: Emanating
description:
In this frame an #Emission emanates from a #Source along a #Path or to a #Goal.
<ex>[The light|Emission] [emanates|Target] [from the tower|Source].</ex>
<ex> [The uranium particles|Emission] [radiate|Target] [from the nuclear plant|Source] . </ex>

name: Emergency
description:
This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone should or must act to prevent a #Undesirable_event from occurring. Often, an Entity affected by the #Undesirable_event is more salient than the event itself and is mentioned in its place.

<ex>The Texas Rangers are trained to respond to [highway|Place]  [emergencies|Target]</ex>
<ex>Jo had a [peanut butter chocolate candy|Entity] [emergency|Target].</ex>

name: Emergency_fire
description: A fire which burns and requires an emergency-type response.

name: Emitting
description:
In this frame a #Source_emitter discharges its #Emission along a #Path or to a #Goal.
<ex> (1) [The factory|Source_emitter] [exudes|Target] [toxic fumes|Emission] [from three large chimneys|Sub-source].</ex>
The #Sub-source is only present when the actual #Source_emitter is also given or is present in a possessive.
<ex> (2) [Light|Emission] is [emitted|Target] [ from the tower|Source_emitter] . </ex>
<ex> (3) [Noxious odors|Emission] are [emitted|Target] [from his feet|Sub-source] . </ex>
In (3) we would tag 'his' as #Source_emitter on a second layer because the inalienable possession on the #Sub-source indicates the #Source_emitter

name: Emotions
description: An #Experiencer has a particular emotional #State, which may be described in terms of a specific #Stimulus that provokes it, or a #Topic which categorizes the kind of #Stimulus.  Rather than expressing the #Experiencer directly, it may (metonymically) have in its place a particular #Event (with participants who are #Experiencers of the emotion) or an #Expressor (a body-part of gesture which would give an indication of the #Experiencer's state to an external observer).

name: Emotions_by_possibility
description: An #Experiencer, #Expressor, #Event, or #State can be described as characterized by a particular emotion as evoked by a possibility in their future (#Stimulus) or concerning a given #Topic.

name: Emotions_by_stimulus
description:
An #Experiencer, #Expressor, #Event, or #State has an emotion as brought on by an #Stimulus or #Topic.

<ex>The [joyful|Target] [reunion|Event] took place on Sunday.</ex>

<ex>The Polish-born Pope was driven past [jubilant|Target] [crowds|Experiencer].</ex>

<ex>[I|Experiencer] am [glad|Target] [about the sheep|Topic] .</ex>

name: Emotions_of_mental_activity
description:
An #Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a #Stimulus.

<ex>[The children|Experiencer] [enjoyed|Target] [noise games and sing-songs|Stimulus].</ex>

<ex>The [pleasures|Target] [of eating|Stimulus] are fleeting.</ex>


<ex>[Diners|Experiencer] [delight|Target] [in counter culture cuisine|Stimulus].</ex>

name: Emotions_success_or_failure
description:
A #Topic or #Stimulus fails or succeeds at causing an emotion in an #Experiencer, which is conveyed by an #Expressor or manifested in a #State or description of an #Event.

<ex>[They|Experiencer] were [dissatisfied|Target] [with the arrangements|Stimulus].</ex>

name: Emotion_directed
description:
The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an #Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a #Stimulus or about a #Topic.  There can also be a #Circumstances under which the response occurs or a #Reason that the #Stimulus evokes the particular response in the #Experiencer.

<ex>[Mr. Whiskers|Experiencer] is [upset|Target] [that there are no more cat treats|Stimulus].</ex>
<ex>The [furious|Target] [parent|Experiencer] stormed into the office.</ex>
<ex>[Franz|Experiencer] gets [infuriated|Target] [at the thought of his ex-wife remarried|Circumstances].</ex>
<ex> She flashed a [jubilant|Target] [smile|Expressor].</ex>

name: Emotion_heat
description:
This frame contains verbs that describe emotional experiences and participate in the locative alternation, as in the following examples:
<ex></ex>
<ex> [I|Expe] was [boiling|Target] [with anger|Emo].</ex>
<ex>[Anger|Emo] was [boiling|Target] [inside me|sea].</ex>

 While these words might seem to be like support verbs for emotion nouns such as anger, the same verbs can be used in the absence of such nouns, as in:
<ex></ex>
<ex>[His remarks|Cause] <m>made</m> [me|Expe] [boil|Target] [inside|sea].</ex>

name: Emphasizing
description:
An #Agent who is engaged in an #Undertaking accords a #Degree of importance to a #Consideration that influences the success of an #Undertaking. As a consequence, the #Agent acts in a way that reflects that judgment of importance.


<ex>[Our company|Agent] [emphasizes|Target] [marketing tried and true products and services|Consideration].[INI|Competing_consideration]</ex>

<ex>In fact, [most search engines|Agent] [place|Target] [little|Degree] [weight|Target] [on words placed in meta tags|Consideration] [when creating their relevancy rankings|Undertaking].[INI|Competing_consideration]</ex>

<ex>The [emphasis|Target] <m>is</m> [on the fundamental principles from which the automotive technologies of the future will develop|Consideration], [rather than on present-day processes|Competing_consideration].</ex>

<ex>[Our|Agent] [emphasis|Target] [on quality|Consideration] does not stop with our products. [INI|Competing_consideration]</ex>

<ex>[When shooting in my studio|Undertaking], [I|Agent] [emphasize|Target] [a relaxed atmosphere|Consideration].[INI|Competing_consideration]</ex>

name: Employee_scenario
description: The sequence of events in which the #Employee hires on with an #Employer, holds a #Position, and finally leaves the #Position.

name: Employer_scenario
description: The sequence of events in which the #Employer hires an #Employee, employs them in a #Position for some #Duration, and finally lets them go from the #Position.

name: Employing
description:
An #Employer employs an #Employee whose #Position entails that the #Employee perform certain #Tasks in exchange for #Compensation.

<ex>[I|Emper] [employed|Target] [him|Empee] [as Chief Gardener|Posit] [for ten years|Dur].</ex>

name: Employment_continue
description: This is a non-perspectivized frame representing the middle stage of the Employment_scenario, in which there is a stable employment relationship between the #Employee and the #Employer.

name: Employment_end
description: This is a non-perspectivized frame representing the final stage of the Employment_scenario, in which the relationship between the #Employer and the #Employee comes to an end.  There are two different ways in which the relation ends, represented in the Firing frame (in which the #Employer is agentive) and the Quitting frame (in which the #Employee is agentive).

name: Employment_scenario
description: An #Employee and #Employer enter into an employment relation, wherein the #Employee remains employed for some #Duration of time, and finally the relationship ends either by the #Employee leaving the job or the #Employer letting go (or firing) the #Employee.  To each of these events there are concomitants, such as agreeing to/signing a contract for entering employment, compensation and performance of a service for the employment period itself, and severance for the dissolution of the relationship.  There are several other events involved, including preparatory actions on the part of the #Employer (posting the #Position), the prospective #Employee's part (looking for a job), or both (job interviews).  In addition, there is the possibility of change in the relationship of #Employer and #Employee during the employment period, such as a change in #Position (e.g. promotion, demotion) and a change in #Compensation (e.g. raise, paycut).

name: Employment_start
description: This is a non-perspectivized frame representing the initial stage of the Employment_scenario:  the formation of the employment relationship between the #Employer and the #Employee.

name: Emptying
description:
These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated  #Source because it is the source of motion of the #Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike #Source in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as <ment>empty</ment>, may also occur with #Path or #Goal expressions, e.g.

<ex>[The players|Agent] [emptied|Target] [the bucket|Source] [over his head|Path]. </ex>

name: Encoding
description: A person (#Speaker) expresses a #Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular #Manner. The content may be emotional, as in <ex>[Humans|Speaker] [express|Target] [ feelings|Message] [through words|Medium]</ex> intellectual, as in <ex>[Formulate|Target] [the idea|Message] [carefully|Manner]</ex>  or linguistic, as in <ex>[Phrase|Target] [your question|Message] [as a comment|Medium].</ex>

name: Encounter
description:
This frame describes #Individuals who unintentionally come together to form a #Group.  Alternatively, a grammatically more prominent #Party_1 meets by chance a #Party_2, expressed as an oblique phrase.

<ex></ex>
<ex>[I|Party_1] [encountered|Target] [Jim|Party_2] [on my way to class|Means].</ex>

name: Endangering
description:
An #Agent or #Cause is responsible for placing a #Valued_entity at risk. #Endangering_act, Place, Time, Reason, and Circumstance may also be specified.

<ex>[His actions|Cause] have [imperiled|Target] [his immortal soul|Valued]!</ex>

<ex>I admit that [I|Agent] [endangered|Target] [you all|Valued_entity] [by attracting the killer's notice|Endangering_act].</ex>

name: Endeavor_failure
description:
Some individual or group ceases to be able to sustain an #Endeavor (a long-term activity involving economic interaction with the public, often a business venture).

Unlike Business_closure and Locale_closure, the #Endeavor need not refer to an organization or business tied to a specific location or locations.

<ex>[Exxon|end] [went under|Target].</ex>

name: Enforcing
description:
An #Agent acts to ensure that a #Rule (often a constraint on behavior) is being followed. The #Agent's action is according to a general plan for #Rules (such that implicit in the #Rule is the affordance to certain entities to ensure that the #Rule is followed). The #Rule may be specified for the #Duration for which it is in effect.

<ex>Why don't [we|Agent] [enforce|Target] [the 20000 gun laws currently on the books across the nation|Rule]?</ex>
<ex>[Computer systems|Medium] can [ruthlessly|Manner] [enforce|Target] [rules and standards|Rule] [indefinitely|Duration].</ex>
<ex>Can [a landlord|Agent] <target>enforce</target> [rules|Rule] [upon tenants|Focal_participant]?</ex>

name: Entering_of_plea
description:
The #Accused enters a #Plea in answer to the #Charges.  In most jurisdictions, the possible pleas are innocent, guilty, or nolo contendere.  Accused persons may stand mute, in which case, the court usually enters a plea on their behalf.

<ex></ex>
<ex>He made it clear that [he|Accused] would [plead|Target] [guilty|Plea] [to indecent assault|Charges].</ex>

<ex>An [innocent|Plea] [plea|Target] was <m>entered</m> on her behalf [by a judge|Judge] [at an earlier hearing|Time].</ex>
Compare to: Citing.

name: Entertainment
description: This scene depicts commercial establishments that offer entertainment to tourists. The establishments are usually classified according to the type of entertainment they offer.

name: Enter_awareness
description:
The #Content (an external or cognitive event or situation) comes into the awareness of an #Experiencer, resulting in a noticeable change in the #Experiencer's conception of the #Content or entities and facts associated with it.

<ex>[Her walk|Content] [struck|Target] [me|Experiencer] [as odd|Content].</ex>

name: Supernatural_entity
description: Supernatural_entity

name: Entity
description:
This frame is for words that denote highly schematic entities.

<ex>We found an unusual [wooden|Type] [[object|Target]|Entity] in the desert.</ex>

name: Entity_relation
description: Entity_relation

name: Entourage
description:
A group of #Individuals form a group, the #Entourage, which remains co-located with the Attended_person. The #Entourage may have a specific Purpose for following the Attended_person, such as to protect or serve him or her, or the Purpose may be vague (e.g., to be near a person of power).

<ex>Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by [his|att] [[entourage|ent]|Target] [of junior doctors and medical students|Ind].</ex>

<ex>The CEO arrived with a [comparatively small|ent_p] [[escort|ent]|Target] [of 30 individuals|Ind].</ex>

name: Enumerating
description:
A speaker presents a sequence of information units that can be subsumed under a common integrator. The information units are marked as #List_elements and together make up an enumeration. Optionally, the common integrator or umbrella term used to refer to all #List_elements together is realised as the #List_total, preceding (and thus introducing) or following (and thus summing up) the enumeration.
By pointing out the relation between segments of the text or discourse, the speaker provides the reader orientation within the text structure. It also contributes to disclosing the train of thought and text planning strategies employed as well as to establishing coherence.
Activation of this pragmatic frame entails co-evocation of the frame Communicative_Context, which provides the contextual/ situational factors relevant for the interaction in the form of frame elements (e.g. speaker, addressee).

name: Erasing
description:
An #Agent or #Cause removes a piece of #Information from a #Document such that it cannot be retrieved.

<ex>[I|Agent] [deleted|Target] [the last line|Information] [from my essay|Document].</ex>

name: Escaping
description:
A Self-moving #Escapee departs from an #Undesirable_location.

<ex>[Benjamin|Escapee] [escaped|Target] [from Germany|Undesirable_location].</ex>

name: Estimated_value
description:
A #Cognizer has carried out an approximate calculation or considered some #Evidence and produced an approximation of the #Value of a feature of an #Item. There are two alternative construals in which the relationship between the feature and the #Value is conceived. Either a holistic #Estimation by the #Cognizer is presented, or the #Question that is addressed by the #Cognizer's estimating is given.


<ex>You can list a [[ballpark figure|Value]|Target] [for shipping and handling|Item].</ex>

<ex>Moreover, [their|Cognizer] [[estimate|Value]|Target] [of 0.27 °C mean surface warming per century due to land-use changes|est] is at least twice as high as previous estimates based on urbanization alone.</ex>

<ex>Our decision to trust people depends on [our|Cognizer] [[estimate|Value]|Target] [of how trustworthy they are|que].</ex>

<ex>To help you anticipate the cost of your move, movers will give you an [[estimate|Value]|Target]
[of the price|que].</ex>

name: Estimating
description:
A #Cognizer carries out an approximate calculation or considers some #Evidence so as to arrive at an approximate #Value for some #Feature of an #Item.

There are two alternative construals. In one, the #Feature is presented as a #Question about the #Item and the #Value is conceived as an answer to the #Question.

In the second construal,  a fully propositional #Estimation by the #Cognizer is presented which expresses the result of the #Cognizer's approximation.

<ex>[Until 1971|Time], [dolphin mortality|Question] could be [estimated|Target] [only from analyses of vessels ' logbooks|Evidence] -- and the figures are probably underestimates. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

<ex>[The UK government|Cognizer] [estimates|Target] [that there is sufficient gas in the UK sector to meet UK demand for some 17 to 35 years|Estimation] .</ex>

<ex>[The astronomers|Cognizer] [estimated|Target] [how much energy was needed to create the cavities by calculating the density, temperature and pressure of the hot gas|Question].</ex>

<ex>[The banner|Item] is [estimated|Target] [in value|Feature] [at $500|Value]. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

<ex>[When Congress passed the Medicare bill in late 2003|Time], [the Congressional Budget Office|Cognizer] [estimated|Target] [its cost|que] [at $395 billion over 10 years|Value].</ex>

<ex>[We|Cognizer] estimated [how much we had|que] [at around 12 thousand|Value].</ex>

name: Evading
description:
An #Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid #Capture  or contact with a #Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power. This frame characterizes a  more specific event  than Avoiding in that both the #Evader and the #Pursuer are moving entities.  In addition, this frame differs from Escaping by requiring a #Pursuer and being neutral about the prior captivity of the #Evader.

<ex>[I|Evader] [gave|Target] [my handler|Pursuer] [the|Target] [slip|Target].</ex>

<ex>[He|Evader] [evaded|Target] [capture|Capture] [for several hours|Time].</ex>

name: Evaluative_comparison
description:
This frame is about the static comparison of an #Profiled_item to a #Standard_item, often  with respect to some #Attribute. In this frame, there is an inherent asymmetry between #Profiled_item and #Standard_item in that the two cannot be expressed jointly as a subject. #Degree expressions are also found that indicate how close the items are to each other on the scale evoked by the #Attribute. Furthermore, the particular value of the standard or item on a certain scale may be given by the #Standard_attribute of the #Profiled_attribute respectively.

<ex> The Sun is putting on [a show that|Profiled_item] [rivals|Target] [the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers|Standard_item].</ex>
<ex>[Mexico's Copper Canyon|Profiled_item] [rivals|Target] [the Grand Canyon|Standard_item] [in sheer beauty and drama|Attribute].  </ex>
<ex> [Peyton Manning's passing yards|Standard_attribute] are [equaled|Target] [among NFL quarterbacks|Comparison_set] [by only a select few|Profiled_item]. </ex>
<ex> [Few pianists|Profiled_item] have ever [equaled|Target] [the lightness and vivacity of his rhythm|Standard_attribute] . </ex> <ex> [The current price|Profiled_attribute] [matches|Target] [the price last year|Standard_attribute] . </ex>

name: Event
description:
An #Event takes place at a #Place and #Time.

<ex>[Big earthquakes|Event] only [happen|Target] [along plate boundaries|Place]. [INI|Time] </ex>

<ex>[The party|Event] will [take place|Target] [on Sunday|Time] [in the all-you-can-eat buffet|Place].</ex>

name: Eventive_affecting
description:
An #Entity undergoes some change (the #Event) that is (or is construed as) punctual.  (This frame exists mainly to allow common FEs to be inherited.)

<ex>[This|Event] [happens|Target] [to me|Entity] [all the time|Frequency].</ex>

<ex>[The area|Entity] was [struck|Target] [by tragedy|Event] [in 1996|Time], [when an assassin killed 35 people in Port Arthur.|Time]</ex>

name: Eventive_cognizer_affecting
description:
An #Event causes the #Cognizer to accept some #Content.  Although the #Cognizer forms an intention, it is not entailed that he/she acts.

<ex>[The divorce|Event] [convinced|Target] [him|Cognizer] [to get help|Content].</ex>

<ex>[The price of a factory reconditioned tool|Event] [decided|Target] [it|Content] [for me|Cognizer].</ex>

name: Event_endstate
description: The endstate of a simple event X-schema.

name: Event_initial_state
description: The initial state of a simple event X-schema.

name: Event_instance
description:
This frame describes a particular instance of an event.

<ex>These next two days will be the [last|Instance_Prop] [two|Iteration_Count] [[times|Target]|Instance] [that I'm here|Event].</ex>

name: Event_tourism
description: This frame refers to events which promote the transit of people from different locations. Even when tourist activities are not the main purpose of their trips, visitors usually look for tourist attractions in the locations where events take place.

name: Evidence
description:
The #Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the #Proposition, where the #Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.  Some of the words in this frame (e.g. argue) are communication words used in a non-communicative, epistemic sense.

<ex>[The latest poll results|Support] [show|Target] [that support of the president is at an all-time low.|Proposition]</ex>

name: Evoking
description:
Some #Stimulus causes a #Cognizer to think of a prior #Phenomenon due to its perceived similarity.

<ex>I burned down the malt shop where we used to go just because [it|Stim] [reminds|Target] me [of you|Phen]</ex>

name: Examination
description:
This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's #Knowledge or skill in a particular area.  An #Examiner conducts an #Examination to an #Examinee to determine the #Examinee's #Knowledge and/or determine their #Qualification for some privilege; this proceeds either by the #Examinee demonstrating a skill or by writing responses to questions.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[At the end of the trial period|Time] [all three groups|Examinee] <m>took</m> [an English for Commerce|Knowledge] [[examination|Examination]|Target] [to assess progress|Purpose].</ex>

<ex>[Many constables|Examinee] had <m>passed</m> [the Sergeant's|Qualification] [[exam|Examination]|Target].</ex>

<ex>The only point of [Mr. Baker's|Examiner] [[tests|Examination]|Target] that I can devine is that they will serve to check up on the teachers.</ex>

name: Exchange
description:
Two parties, the #Exchangers, each give and receive from the other #Themes. The parties are also construable separately as #Exchanger_1 and #Exchanger_2,  in which case the #Themes may be construed separately, too, as #Theme_1 and #Theme_2.


<ex>[They|ex1] [swapped|Target] [the island|thm1] [with the Neapolitan government of the day|ex2] [for the much smaller Capri|thm2].</ex>
<ex>Then [the teams|exs] [swapped|Target] [their draftees|thms].</ex>
<ex>We [exchanged|Target] [addresses|thms] and he told us that next year when we are in Aruba we will visit with his family there. </ex>


<ex></ex>

Notice that this frame is to be differentiated from the Replacing frame, where there is no notion of trade between two parties and the focus is only on the relationship between two items that successively fulfill a function or participate in a relation.

name: Exchange_currency
description:
A #Money_owner exchanges #Sum_1 in the  #Source_currency for #Sum_2 in the #Target_currency at some #Exchange_service.

<ex>[After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon|Time], [we|Money_owner] each [exchanged|Target] [$50|sm1] [for Uzbek currency|Target_currency] [with a shifty loiterer|exs] [in the lobby|Place] [at the rate|exr] .</ex>

<ex>[We|mon] [recently|tim] [exchanged|Target] [$100|sm1] [for £64.00 UK pounds|sm2].</ex>

<ex>If [he|mon] [exchanged|Target] [the money|sm1] [into Deutsch-marks|tar], his 18 marks in Germany can just barely obtain four Big Macs.</ex>

<ex>He said the most crucial evidence was that of [former police reservist, Simo Petersen-Jessen,
now in Australia, who|mon] had [converted|Target] [the money|sm1] [into rands|tar].</ex>

name: Exclude_member
description:
A former #Member of a #Group ceases to be a member as a result of the action of an #Authority within the #Group.  (In directly democratic #Groups, the #Authority may consist of the #Group itself as a voting whole.)

<ex>[The priest|Authority] [excommunicated|Target] [Henry|Member] [from the church|Group].</ex>

name: Excreting
description:
An #Excreter excretes #Excreta.

<ex>[Principal Skinner|Excreter] [burped|Target] [on me|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[Lenny and Karl|Excreter] [pee|Target] [three times a day|Frequency].</ex>

name: Execute_plan
description: An #Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out). In some cases, the #Agent is a focal participant in the #Plan, although a separate #Focal_participant may also be mentioned. The #Plan may be specified for the #Duration for which it is in effect. Health authorities say [they|Agent] have put [measures|Plan] into [effect|Target] [in all ports of entry and in centers of provinces|Place]. [Channing House|Agent] has recently [implemented|Target] [a new dining program for residents on pureed diets|Plan]. Note: the phrase (put) in effect is in the Being_in_effect frame.

name: Execution
description:
An #Executioner punishes an individual (#Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the #Reason).

<ex>[The hooded man|Executioner] [hanged|Target] [the thief|Executed].</ex>

name: Exemplar
description:
This frame concerns a specific subset of #Instances of a #Type which are evaluated in terms of their similarity to a conceptual prototype of the #Type. The judgment of exemplariness may be made along a certain #Domain.
<ex>She is a [model|Target] [student|Type].</ex>
<ex>He's the [image|Target] [of a good father|Type].</ex>

name: Exemplariness
description:
An #Entity, with regard to a particular #Domain, is representative of a conceptual prototype of the #Comparison_set of which it is a member.

<ex>[Virginia Woolf|Entity] is a [prototypical|Target] [Modernist author|Comparison_set].</ex>

name: Exercising
description:
An #Agent actively maintains or improves their level of phyiscal fitness. The action may target a specific #Body_part, or happen through a particular #Means.

<ex>[Football players|Agent] [exercise|Target] [every day|Frequency].</ex>
<ex>Don't [work out|Target] [your legs|Body_part] [after a long run|Time]. [CNI|Agent]</ex>

name: Existence
description:
An Entity is declared to exist, generally irrespective of its position or even the possibility of its position being specified. #Time, #Duration, #Inherent_purpose, and #State may also be mentioned.

This frame is to be contrasted with Presence, which describes the existence of an Entity in a particular (and salient) spacio-temporal context, and which also entails the presence of an observer who can detect the existence of the Entity in that context.

<ex>[Finally|Time], [Poland|Ent] ceased to [exist|Target] [as a state|State] [for hundreds of years|Duration].</ex>
<ex>[Such laws|Ent] [exist|Target] [to prevent exactly this kind of fraud|Use].</ex>
<ex>[There|Target] [IS|Target] [a Santa Claus|Ent]!</ex>

name: Expansion
description:
An #Item changes its physical size.  The #Size_change of an #Item may be explicitly indicated or characterized in terms of #Initial_size and/or #Result_size.  In the default case, expansion is along all dimensions, but sometimes the #Dimension of expansion is incorporated or made explicit.
<ex></ex>
This frame does not specify whether the #Item gains mass or substance along with the change in size, and thus includes words that specify an increase in substance (grow.v) along with those that deny an increase in substance (stretch.v) and those that are unspecified (expand.v).

<ex>[The pile of leaves|Item] had [shrunk|Target] [by about half|Size_change] [after the first haul|Time].</ex>

<ex>[The jeans|Item] [stretched|Target] [a little|Size_change].</ex>

name: Expectation
description:
Words in this frame have to do with a #Cognizer believing that some #Phenomenon will take place in the future.  Some words in the frame (e.g. <ment>foresee.v</ment>) indicate that the #Phenomenon is asserted also to be true, while others do not.

<ex>[Michael|Cog] [expected|Target] [Abby|Phen] [to demand examples|Phen].</ex>
<ex>[From the look on her face|Evidence] [Michael|Cog] [expected|Target] [that she would say she got the job|Phen].</ex>

name: Expected_location_of_person
description:
A #Person usually resides or works in a #Location.




<ex><m>Is</m> [Mr. Adams|Person] [in|Target] [today|tim]? [DNI|Location]</ex>

name: Expend_resource
description:
An #Agent uses a #Resource which is consumed and unavailable for future use.

<ex>[We|Agent] [exhausted|Target] [our supply of oil|Resource] [long ago|Time].</ex>

name: Expensiveness
description:
A #Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an #Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an #Intended_event.  This event is often more specifically described as gaining possession of some #Goods or receiving a Service.  In the majority of cases, the #Payer is described generically (INI), and the situation depicted answers the question of how much of an #Asset would have to be given up to receive the #Goods or bring about the #Intended_event.

<ex>It 'll [cost|Target] [Sandra's parents|Payer] [fifty grand a year|Asset] [for her to attend that school|Intended_event]. </ex>
<ex>[That book|Intended_event] would [cost|Target] [you|Payer] [more than twenty dollars|Asset] [to bind|Intended_event] [in a local book bindery|].</ex>
<ex>[Stamps|Goods] used to [cost|Target] [only five cents|Asset].  [INI|Payer]</ex>
<ex>The [cost|Target] [of a trip to a resort or spa|Intended_event] varies by region, dependent primarily on weather, not local economic conditions. [INI|Payer]</ex>
<ex>Well, [it|Intended_event] 'll [cost|Target] [you|Payer].</ex>
<ex>[For you|Payer], [thirty bucks|Asset] <m>is</m> [practically|Degree] [free|Target].  [DNI|Intended_event]</ex>

name: Experiencer_focused_emotion
description:
The words in this frame describe an #Experiencer's emotions with respect to some #Content. Although the #Content may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.

<ex> [My|Experiencer] [enjoyment|Target] [of the movie|Content] was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me. </ex>
<ex> [Smithers|Experiencer] <m>takes</m> [great|Degree] [pleasure|Target] [in collecting matchboxes|Content].</ex>
<ex> [Sergio|Experiencer] <m>derives</m> [great|Degree] [pleasure|Target]
[from  smoking|Content].</ex>
<ex> Smoking <ment>gives</ment> [me|Experiencer] [extreme|Degree] [pleasure|Target].</ex>

An #Explanation for the emotion may also be expressed, often giving information about the #Content of the emotion. In such a case, #Content is annotated on a second layer:

<ex>[She|Experiencer] [detested|Target] [him|Topic] [for eating cheese|Explanation] .</ex>
<ex>She [detested|Target] him [for eating cheese|Content] .</ex>

With certain verbs, the #Circumstances can be expressed in a finite clausal or wh- complement which may optionally be preceded by a Null NP Object:

<ex>[I|Experiencer] [hate|Target] it [when you do that|Circumstances].</ex>

Note: This is not how it is currently tagged.

name: Experience_bodily_harm
description:
An #Experiencer is involved in a bodily injury to a #Body_part.  (In some cases, no #Body_part need be indicated.)  Often an #Injuring_entity on which the #Experiencer injures themselves is mentioned.
<ex>I think that [I|Exp] [hurt|Target] [myself|Exp] [pretty bad|Sev] [back there|Place].</ex>
<ex>[He|Exp] [smacked|Target] [his head|Body_part] [on the mantel|Inj_ent] [getting up from poking at the fire|con].</ex>

name: Experimentation
description:
An #Experimenter conducts an #Experiment based on a #Hypothesis.  This #Experiment contains a #Control_group or #Control_group_member which is compared with a #Treatment_group or #Treated_individual in order to determine the #Result.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Johann's|Experimenter] [[experiment|Experiment]|Target] [proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease|Result].</ex>

<ex>Jacob placed the [[control group|Control_group]|Target] under a strong light for 20 hours each day.</ex>

<ex>[Rolf|Experimenter] [tested|Target] [his hypothesis|Hyp] [in Vienna|Place] [in 1973|Time].</ex>

name: Expertise
description:
This frame concerns people's knowledge or skill in certain domains.  It does not concern acquaintance or familiarity with people.
With adjectives as targets in this frame, we annotate on two FE layers.
<ex>FE Layer-1: He is an [experienced|Target] [programmer|Prot].</ex>
<ex>FE Layer-2: He is an [experienced|Target] [programmer|Skill].</ex>

name: Explaining_the_facts
description:
A #Question about the reason or cause of a known #State_of_affairs is presented as being answered by the existence of a particular #Fact.  The exact chain of reasoning, including the answer itself, of which the #Fact is a part is not specified.

Contrast this frame with the Evidence frame which casts a Support (a fact) as providing Evidence for, or conclusively proving, the Proposition (another proposed fact). Thus, there is no open question in the Evidence frame.


<ex>[Ruby's orange vest marked with the words ""service dog""|fac] [accounts|Target] [for why the 3-year-old goes along|que].</ex>

<ex>[The nation's history|fac] [explains|Target] [why the current conflict succumbs to, and yet simultaneously transcends, the stereotype|que].</ex>


<ex>Then [that I exist|sta] is [explained|Target] [by A and B having come together|fac].</ex>


<ex> [Lack of potential for improvement in the immediate future|fac] [accounts|Target] [for the low number of returnees into South Ossetia, even for the Ossetian ethnic group|sta].</ex>

<ex>[That|fac] [explains|Target] [it|sta].</ex>

<ex>[Somehow|mea]  [this|fac] [explains|Target] [why Apple is always  the last man to get the technology|que].</ex>

name: Explosion
description:
Due to chemical, nuclear, or other reactions, an #Explosive explodes, potentially causing damage to the surrounding area. The #Explosive is often, but need not be, a weapon.

<ex>[The bomb|wea] [exploded|Target] in the middle of the plaza.</ex>

<ex>Nearby, [a mine|wea] [detonated|Target], causing minor damage to the tank.</ex>

<ex>The [car bomb|wea] [explosion|Target] left a massive crater.</ex>

name: Exporting
description:
An #Exporter moves #Goods across a border from an #Exporting_area to an #Importing_area.

<ex>[Several companies|Exporter] actually make most of their income by [exporting|Target] [goods|Goods] [out of the country|Exporting_area].</ex>
<ex>[Exportation|Target] [into nations of ""special interest""|Importing_area] is essentially prohibited.</ex>

name: Expressing_publicly
description:
A #Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express #Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time. The #Content may not have been previously communicated due to inability or social stricture.  In cases where the individuals addressed are a smaller group than the public at large, a separate #Addressee may be expressed.

<ex>[Those grievances|con] can be [aired|Target] [during Board meetings|Time]. [CNI|com]</ex>

<ex>[Saddam|com] [voiced|Target] [his joy|Content] [when he was told Spain's new government had left the US-led military coalition in Iraq|Time].</ex>

name: Extradition
description:
A #Suspect in a #Current_jurisdiction is forced by #Authorities (of the #Current_jurisdiction) to go to the #Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the #Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the #Crime_jurisdiction.  The purpose or reason for the extradition may also be expressed.

<ex>[The fraud|Suspect] was [extradited|Target] [from Venezuela|Current_jurisdiction] [to the US|Crime_jurisdiction].</ex>

name: Extreme_point
description:
An #Entity that has characteristics which change over time is at a point or in a phase of its development in which, compared to other actual or expected stages of development, it possesses extremely high or low powers or intensity.  The high or low level of development correlates with the occurrence of a #Marker, a product produced by the #Entity or an event in which it participates, which is indicative of the #Entity's abilities or intensity.

<ex>[The Tang Dynasty|Marker] <m>was</m> the [high point|Target] [of the Silk Road's importance|Entity].</ex>

<ex>[Meeting Fiona Bennett|Marker] <m>was</m> the [LOW POINT|Target] [of my summer|Entity].</ex>

<ex>It must be remembered that this man was born at the [[zenith|Target]|Marker] [of the Victorian age|Entity] and witnessed the glory of Britain at her greatest.</ex>

<ex>But Lubitsch was at the [[high point|Target]|Marker] [of his genius|Entity], and he has made a masterpiece not to be missed.</ex>

name: Extreme_value
description:
An #Entity possesses a #Value for a certain #Attribute which is extreme when compared to the values either of other entities or to values of the same #Entity at other points of time.

<ex>[Airfares|Entity] <m>hit</m> a [10-year|Period] [[low|Target]|Value] today. [DNI|Attribute]</ex>

<ex>[Today's|Period] [temperature|Attribute] [high|Target] <m>was</m> [71F|Value], and the low was 50F. [INI|Entity]</ex>

<ex>[The index|Entity] hit a [post crash|Period] [high|Target] [of 2,423.9|Value]. [DNI|Attribute]</ex>

<ex>By 1972, [the campus|Entity] had <m>reached</m> a historic [enrollment|Attribute] [high|Target] [of 6,300|Value].</ex>

<ex>So, right after the company's IPO, you happily bought at the [high|Target] [of
$14 per share|Value], because you believed they were the first player into this market? [DNI|Attribute] [INI|Entity]</ex>

<ex>We are currently expecting a [price|Attribute] [[low|Target]|Value] associated with the 9-Month (40-Week) Cycle. [INI|Entity]</ex>

<ex>The [Swiss|Entity] [low|Target] [of 5.8 percent in 1999|Value]  was followed by a high of 12.6 percent in 2001. [DNI|Attribute]</ex>

name: Facial_expression
description:
The words in this frame refer to facial #Expressions and the #Possessors of those #Expressions.

<ex>[His|Possessor] [lackluster|Manner] [[smile|Target]|Expression] [revealed his disappointment|Conveyed_emotion].</ex>

name: Fairness_evaluation
description:
In this frame an #Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the #Action affects the #Affected_party.  An #Actor may also be identified, who performs the #Action and may be characterized as fair, unfair, etc. based on how these actions affect the #Affected_party.  #Grounds may also be identified.

<ex>[Smithers|Actor] was being [very|Degree] [fair|Target] [about the distribution of supplies|Grounds].</ex>
<ex>[Smithers|Actor] was being [very|Degree] [fair|Target] [about distributing the supplies|Action].</ex>
<ex>[The decision|Action] was [fair|Target] [to all involved|Affected_party].</ex> <ex> It was not [fair|Target] [for the warning to remain in place|Action].</ex>
<ex>[The company|Actor] was [unfair|Target] [to its loyal employees|Affected_party].</ex>
<ex>Smith received a [fair|Target] [trial|Action].</ex> <ex> [The student loan system|Action] is [socially|Parameter] [unjust|Target].</ex>

name: Fall_asleep
description:
A #Sleeper goes from wakefulness to an altered state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment.  The LUs of this frame are differentiated by how quickly and deeply the state is entered and what causes the change (especially whether it comes about naturally as a result of sleepiness or is brought about by injury).

<ex>[I|Sleeper] [dozed|Target] [off|Target] [at about 1am|Time].</ex>

name: Fall_for
description:
A #Victim comes to have incorrect beliefs as a result of exposure to a #Deception. The #Deception is necessarily orchestrated by one or more agents, though these are not expressible by the LUs in this frame.

<ex>[The public|vic] was too clever to [fall for|Target] [the type of propaganda prevalent in London at the time|dec].</ex>

name: Fame
description:
An #Entity is well-known among a wide range of people (in general or in a particular domain) for a particular #Reason, which may be a behavior, characteristic, or some other associated item. In the case of events, fame entails a large number of people being aware of the event's occurence; in the case of concrete entities, including humans, fame entails awareness of existence. In both cases, often fame is accompanied by awareness of the #Entity's significance in historical, cultural, or social contexts.

<ex>[Shakespeare|Entity] <m>was</m> [famous|Target] [during his life|Time] [because he performed in front of Queen Elizabeth I more than anyone else|Explanation].</ex>

name: Familiarity
description:
An #Entity is presented as having been seen or experienced by a (typically generic and backgrounded) #Cognizer on a certain number of occasions, causing the #Entity to have a certain degree of recognizability for the #Cognizer.

<ex>[Susanna Fulton's work|Entity] <m>is</m> [new|Target] [to me|Cognizer].</ex>

<ex>[Two of these frames|Entity] <m>were</m> [new|Target] [to me|cog] [as a beginning professor|Role].</ex>

<ex>[This|ent] <m>was</m> [as|deg] [new|Target] [to him|cog] [as the rest of the outcity|deg].</ex>

<ex>[JSON|ent] <m>is</m> [fairly|deg] [new|Target] [to me|cog] [as a data format|Role].</ex>

<ex>Moreover, [this way of describing and categorizing architecture|Entity] <m>is</m> [familiar|Target] [to most people|Cognizer].</ex>

<ex>[Coronaviruses|Entity] <m>are</m> not [unfamiliar|Target] [to the epidemiological world|Cognizer].</ex>

<ex>Abbey Stadium will bring us into contact with one [familiar|Target] [face|Entity] at least.</ex>

name: Fastener
description:
The #Fastener is an artifact created to close a #Container (e.g. coat, jar). Sometimes, the #Container_portal rather than the #Container is expressed.

<ex>The [door|cop] [[seal|Target]|Fastener] prevented air from getting in and the kids' screams from getting out.</ex>

<ex>She has an [antique|Time_of_creation] [ivory|Material] [[button|Target]|Fastener] at the front and another vintage button on her apron.</ex>

<ex>NIST designed a [high pressure|Type] [[seal|Target]|Fastener] [for the extension sleeve|Use] using a series of metal washers to load the window under pressure.</ex>

name: Fear
description:
An #Experiencer, #Expressor, or #State can be described as characterized as having an emotion of fear concerning a particular #Topic or as evoked by a #Stimulus.

<ex>[I|Experiencer] was [scared|Target] [by a bump in the night|Stimulus].</ex>

name: Feeding
description: Feeding

name: Feeling
description:
In this frame an #Experiencer experiences an #Emotion or is in an #Emotional_state. There can also be an #Evaluation of the internal experiential state.
<ex>[John|Experiencer] [feels|Target] [anger towards his mother|Emotion].</ex>
<ex>[Martha|Experiencer] [feels|Target] [angry|Emotional_state].</ex>
<ex>[Dr. Hibbert|Experiencer] [feels|Target] [good|Evaluation].</ex>
Inalienably possessed aspects of the #Experiencer frequently stand in for the #Experiencer.
<ex>[Her heart|Experiencer] [felt|Target] [angry|Emotional_state].</ex>

name: Feigning
description:
An #Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular #State_of_affairs holds.

<ex>[Jordan|Agent] [feigned|Target] [a love of jazz music|Original] [to get her phone number|Purpose] .</ex>

name: Fields
description:
An individual or group (#Practitioner) or a part of their work life (#Work) is defined professionally by the #Activity that they typically engage in. Alternatively, the #Activity may be indicated by a #Salient_entity conventionally associated with it.

<ex> [Chris|pra] was <m>in</m> the [construction|act]  [industry|Target] for 20 years before coming to GSCM.</ex>

<ex>[My career|wor] <m>was</m> [in|Target] [oil and gas|sal].</ex>

name: Fighting_activity
description:
A generally large group of people, the #Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted #Fight amongst themselves.  There are no distinct sides, and generally no particular goal (compare Hostile_encounter).  The #Fight may be described as having a #Manner or #Degree of violence.  #Time and #Place may also be expressed.

<ex>[The gladiators|Combatants] entered the [[fray|Target]|Fight].</ex>

name: Filling
description:
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the #Theme. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated #Goal because it is the goal of motion of the #Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike goals in other frames.
 <ex>[Lionel Hutz|Agent] [coated|Target] [the wall|Goal] [with paint|Theme]. </ex>

name: Finals
description: The #Competition comes to an end, with a #Winner beating one or more #Losers in the finals.

name: Fining
description:
The #Payer is (legally) forced to pay a #Fine by an official #Speaker as a punishment for some action (the #Reason).  The #Speaker represents an entity which receives the payment.
<ex>[They|Payer] were [fined|Target] [approximately $3.1 billion dollars|Fine] [for their knowing, malicious injury to consumers|Reason].</ex>
Compare to: Citing.

name: Finish_competition
description:
A #Competition comes to an end, with a #Competitor tying, winning, or losing against an #Opponent (or opponents) according to their #Score.  (In the symmetrical situation of a tie, the #Competitor and #Opponent may be jointly mentioned as #Competitors.)  According to the #Score that the #Competitor and #Opponent have achieved, they may receive a #Rank or a #Prize.  The #Margin may also be mentioned.

<ex>Unbelievable--[he|Competitor] [lost|Target] [the gold medal|Prize] [by just .02 points|Margin]!</ex>
<ex>Looks like it will came to a [draw|Target] [between Woods and Stephenson|Competitors].</ex>

name: Finish_game
description:
A #Player finishes a #Game, possibly with an outcome of winning or losing. A #Game is an activity that is considered recreational, and is valued for associated pleasure, as well as social interaction, material reward, or status. Not all games can be won or lost. Those that are specifically competitions are defined in the inheriting frame Finish_competition. In some LUs, the #Game is DNI.

<ex> [John|Player] [won|Target] [the lottery|Game]! </ex>
<ex> [John|Player] [lost|Target]. </ex>

name: Firefighting
description: This frame characterizes the situation in which a #Firefighter acts to prevent a #Fire from occurring, accelerating, or affecting important things such as people, buildings, possessions, and valued natural areas. This frame is primarily present as the target domain of a metaphor that maps the entire domain of Hostile_encounter to the domain of firefighting.

name: Fire_break
description:
This frame pertains to #Fire_breaks, entities intended to prevent a fire from traveling in a direction. They are constructed by removing combustible/flammable material from the predicted path of the flames.

<ex>The firefighters created several [fire breaks|Target] at the outskirts of the wildlife sanctuary to prevent fires from reaching the precious ""inner sanctum"". </ex>

name: Fire_burning
description:
A #Fire burns #Fuel, resulting in damage and possibly complete destruction of the #Fuel.

<ex>[A fire that started on Saturday afternoon, the High Glade Fire - located on the Mendocino National Forest's Upper Lake Ranger District|Fire] - continued to [burn|Target] [actively|Manner] [on Sunday|Time].</ex>

<ex>Since the [fire|Target] is [near a road|Place] and also [on part of the Appalachian Trail|Place], the Forest Service said a main concern is the safety of the public.</ex>

name: Fire_emergency_scenario
description: This frame characterizes any scenario in which the presence of a fire necessitates an emergency response in order to mitigate damage directly caused by the fire.

name: Fire_end_scenario
description: This scenario begins with a #Fire burning, transitions as the #Fire goes out, and ends with the #Fire dissipated.

name: Fire_going_out
description:
A #Fire goes out.

<ex>[The fire|Fire] is expected to [burn out|Target] [within a week|Time].</ex>

name: Fire_stopping_scenario
description: The Fire_stopping_scenario begins with a #Fire in process, transitions with the action of an #Agent to end the #Fire, and ends with the #Fire having stopped burning.

name: Firing
description:
An #Employer ends an employment relationship with an #Employee.  There is often a behavior of the #Employee that motivates the firing (a #Reason) or some more general #Explanation given for the action.

<ex>[He|Employer] [fired|Target] [me|Employee] [as annotator|Position] [for being too slow|Reason].</ex>

name: Firing_point
description:
A location from which a #Detonator activates a distantly-located explosive device.

<ex>Locating the [[firing point|fir]|Target] of remote control IEDs is no easy task.</ex>

<ex>The first task is to determine where he located [his|det] [[firing point|fir]|Target].</ex>

name: First_experience
description:
An implicit experiencer has an #Experience for the first time. Some LU's may specifically imply an agentive activity.


<ex>[In Italy|cxt] [the term was|exp] [first|Target] [used by the Venetians in 1546|exp]</ex>

<ex>[This time|cxt], [the comet was|exp] [first|Target] [seen on the night of 19th October, 1805 by European observers Jean Louis Pons, Johann Sigismund Huth, and Alexis Bouvard|exp]</ex>

name: First_rank
description:
An #Item is located at the top end of a scale of importance or social rank (or some other #Attribute) in comparison to other members of a #Contrast_set (usually, implicit) that is otherwise similar in kind to the #Item. Oftentimes, the limits of the #Contrast_set are determined by an expression of the #Limits_of_consideration.

<ex>The [main|Target] [problem|Item] is that the administration has not yet clarified ""Regime change."" [INI|Contrast_set]</ex>
<ex>Oh, he had a great many concerns -- [chief|Target] [among them|Contrast_set] [his own boredom|Item].</ex>
<ex>Their [primary|Target] [objective|Item] [in Bosnia|Limits_of_consideration] was bringing about a lasting peace. [INI|Contrast_set]</ex>

name: Fleeing
description:
A #Self_mover responds to a (real or imagined) danger by moving away from it.

<ex>[She|Self_mover] had [fled|Target] [from DCS facilities|Source] several times before..</ex>
<ex>[Pakistanis in US|Self_mover] trying to [flee|Target] [to Canada|Goal] hit roadblocks.</ex>
<ex>[Anderson's division|Self_mover] suddenly [bolted|Target] [north|Direction] [from Devil's Den|Source], flanked out III Corps almost entirely, and shattered the entire Corps.</ex>
<ex>[We|Self_mover] [fled|Target] [for several miles|Distance] before reaching our safe-house.</ex>

name: Fluidic_motion
description: In this frame a #Fluid moves from a #Source to a #Goal along a #Path or within an #Area.  <ex> [The blood|Fluid] [spurted|Target] [from the wound|Source]. </ex><ex>[The water|Fluid] [gushed|Target] [into the house|Goal] . </ex>

name: Food
description:
This frame contains words referring to items of food.

<ex>Specialties include deep fried shredded beef , duck , prawn dishes and [hand-made|Descriptor] [noodles|Target].</ex>

name: Food_gathering
description:
A [Gatherer|Gatherer] removes [Crop|Crop] ripe and ready to an accepted degree. The [Crop|Crop] comes from a  [Source|Source] where it has been grown and matured.

<ex>[They|Gatherer] [harvest|Target] [their pumpkins|Crop] [in the Autumn|Time]. [INI|Source] </ex>

<ex>[We|Gatherer] [bring in|Target] [the tobacco|Crop] [from the fields|Source] [during the summer|Time].</ex>

<ex>The stage at which [the peppercorns|Crop] are [harvested|Target] [from the vine|Source] decides their colour . [CNI|Gatherer]</ex>

name: Food_service
description: The different types of services offered to the #Eater during their stay in a #Establishment. The services may be of a specific #Type and be performed at a specific #Location.

name: Foreign_or_domestic_country
description:
A #Current_country is identified as matching or not matching the instance of the #Discourse_salient_country.

<ex>[[Foreign|cur]|Target] sales account for only 20% of IBM's income .</ex>

name: Forging
description:
An #Agent produces a #Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of)  a #Standard. An instance of the  #Standard may actually exist that served as an original that is copied by the Agent, or the #Standard exists only as an idea.

<ex>So who was it that [faked|Target] the photo ""showing"" Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?</ex>

name: Forgiveness
description:
A #Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an #Evaluee who has committed an #Offense.
<ex>[God|Judge] [forgives|Target] [repentant sinners|Evaluee].</ex>
<ex>Won't [you|Judge] [forgive|Target] [me|Evaluee] [for keeping it a secret|Offense]?</ex>

name: Forgoing
description:
A#Forgoer decides not to partake in something ordinary that is otherwise #Desirable.

<ex>[Chuck|For] often [skips|Target] [lunch|Des].</ex>

name: Forming_relationships
description:
#Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as #Partners) to change their social relationship.

<ex>[I|Partner_1] [befriended|Target] [the little pony|Partner_2] by giving him a piece of apple.</ex>

name: Fragmentation_scenario
description:
A #Whole fragments or breaks into #Parts, or alternatively a part, #Part_1, breaks off from the rest of the item, called #Part_2.

<ex>[Last year|Time], [it|Part_1] [broke|Target] [off from the Ross Ice Shelf|Part_2] and began drifting out to sea. </ex>

<ex>[The calved ice|Whole] [broke|Target] [into three large icebergs, named A22, A23 and A24|Parts].</ex>

name: Freeing_from_confinement
description:
An #Agent causes a #Theme which was held captive to be free from a #Location_of_confinement, against the wishes of the captors.

<ex>[Two men disguised as guards|Agent] [sprung|Target] [a convicted killer|Theme] [from prison|Loc] [last night|Time].</ex>

name: Frequency
description:
This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event. Many of the adjectives and adverbs in this frame are based on nouns in the Calendric_unit frame.


<ex>China will have to face a [high|Degree] [frequency|Target] [of sand storms|Event] in the years to come.</ex>

name: Friction
description:
A #Theme moves on or against the surface of a #Static_object. (Alternatively, #Themes  moves against each other simultaneously). The #Theme exerts pressure on the surface and experiences resistance to its movement.


<ex>[Smithers' boots|Theme] [scraped|Target] [on the floor|Static_object].</ex>

name: Friendly_or_hostile
description:
Two parties or individuals are on the same side or on different sides of a (typically military) conflict. The two sides may be expressed jointly as the #Sides, or separately as #Side_1 and #Side_2.

<ex>We received a tip from a [friendly|Target] [local|Side_1] about a possible attack. [DNI|Side_2]</ex>

<ex>Infiltration from [hostile|Target] [forces|Side_1] is a constant threat. [DNI|Side_2]</ex>

In many cases only #Side_1 is mentioned, leaving #Side_2 as the perspective from whom the description is being given (typically the speaker/writer).

name: Front_for
description:
An individual or organization, the #Front, serves as a cover for an #Illicit_activity or an #Illicit_organization.

<ex>[The laundromat|Front] is a [front|Target] [for the Yakuza|Illicit_organization].</ex>

name: Frugality
description:
The words of this frame describe how a #Resource_controller spends money or other #Resources for a particular purpose . They can be applied to the #Resource_controller or to their #Behavior in particular instances.  These words indicate a judgment of how conservatively the #Resource_controller guards their #Resource.

<ex>[Margeret|Resource_controller] has always <m>been</m> [penny-wise|Target].</ex>
<ex>[Bill|Resource_controller] [squanders|Target] [his money|Resource].</ex>
<ex>[To spend the surplus now|Behavior] would <m>be</m> needlessly [profligate|Target] .</ex>

name: Fugitive
description:
A #Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of #Authorities in relation to a #Crime which the #Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.

<ex>[He|fug] <m>is</m> in fact a [fugitive|Target] [of the law|aut] and you must inform the police if you see him.</ex>

<ex>[Only two years earlier|Time] [she|fug] had <m>been</m> [on the lam|Target] [from charges of embezzlement|Crime].</ex>

name: Fullness
description:
A #Container  is in a state of fullness/emptiness with respect to some #Contents.  Note the connection between words in this frame and those in the Containers, Emptying, and Filling frames.
<ex>John carried [a bucket|Container] [full|Target] [of water|Contents].</ex>

name: Function
description:
An #Entity is designed for or exists to perform an #Activity or fulfill a #Role.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[This platform|Entity] will [function|Target] [as a great stage for tomorrow's play|Role].</ex>
<ex>[The ropes|Entity] [serve|Target] [to tie things together|Activity].</ex>

name: Funding
description:
A #Supplier gives funds to a #Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (#Imposed_purpose) of the #Recipient.

<ex>[The University|Sup] [funded|Target] [Paige|Rec] [so that she could complete her doctorate|Imp].</ex>
<ex></ex>

Often, the #Imposed_purpose appears as a direct object of the target verb instead of the #Recipient. With these, the #Imposed_purpose can either be metonymically linked to some #Recipient, in which case the #Recipient FE is marked as DNI:
<ex>[Investors|Sup] [financed|Target] [the software start-up|Imp].[DNI|Rec]</ex>


or it can explicitly encompass the #Recipient, in which case the #Recipient part is annotated on a second FE layer:
<ex>[Lobbyists|Sup] [backed|Target] [the senator's campaign for president|Imp].</ex>
. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . [the senator's|Rec]

name: Furniture
description: A #Piece_of_furniture is a physical entity, being a type of furniture created for a specific #Use like the decoration of a room. Several properties of the #Piece_of_furniture can be specified, such as its #Creator, #Time_of_creation, #Name, #Type, #Origin, #Constituent_parts, #Description, #Material of which it is composed, #Quantity and the #Place where it is.

name: Sports_event
description: Each of the competitions among athletes or teams.

name: Gathering_up
description:
This frame describes an #Agent's gathering of #Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  #Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.
<ex>[The police|Agent] [gathered|Target] [the suspects|Individuals] [into a line-up|Aggregate].</ex>
Compare this frame with Congregating, and contrast it with Amalgamating.

name: Gesture
description:
The words in this frame have to do with non-verbal communication. Topic is not normally expressed with these words. This seems to be related to the absence of a verbal code in cases of gestural communication. Topic can be viewed as a partial characterization of a #Message, but such partial characterization is either difficult or irrelevant in the absence of a verbal code.

<ex>[I|Communicator] [gestured|Target] [with my hand|Body_part] [for him to come over|Message].</ex>

name: Getting
description:
A #Recipient starts off without the #Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.  Although the #Source from which the #Theme came is logically necessary, the #Recipient and its changing relationship to the #Theme is profiled.

<ex>[I|Recipient] [got|Target] [two whistles|Theme] [from John|Source].</ex>

name: Getting_scenario
description: In this scenario, the #Recipient begins without the #Theme, then acquires the #Theme from a #Source.

name: Getting_triggered
description:
A #System interacts with the environment (which may include a volitional agent) and goes into operation in accordance with its intended purpose.

<ex>[The alarm|System] [went off|Target] [as she walked through the entrance|tim].</ex>

<ex>[The bomb|System] must have [triggered|Target] accidentally.</ex>

name: Getting_underway
description:
A #Self_mover begins the motion away from a relatively deprofiled #Source location. The focus is on the motion rather than on the location that is being departed. The label #Self_mover here also includes vehicles that are steered by an intentional agent.


<ex>[After a lunch of sandwiches on paper plates|Time], [we|sel] [get|Target] [under|Target] [way|Target].</ex>


<ex>When [I|Self_mover] [got|Target] [going|Target] [for the day|dur] I had horrible pain down my buttocks and leg.</ex>

<ex>[We|Self_mover] [got|Target] [going|Target] [via Tikul|Path] and after a light lunch finally found the pottery place recommended in the guide,</ex>

<ex>I'll make this brief, as [I|Self_mover] need to [head|Target] [out|Target] [for the bookstore|Goal] [in a bit|Time].</ex>

<ex>[The band ""Killers""|Self_mover] is [heading|Target] [out|Target] [on 25-date tour through Europe and Japan|Journey] [this week|Time].</ex>

name: Getting_up
description:
A #Protagonist leaves the place where they have slept, their #Bed, to begin or resume domestic, professional, or other activities. Getting up is distinct from Waking up, which is concerned only with the transition from the sleeping state to a wakeful state.

<ex>[I|pro] [rose|Target] [from bed|bed], threw on a pair of camouflage shorts and drove my little Toyota Corolla to a construction clearing a few miles away.</ex>
<ex>One recent Monday, for example, [Joe|pro] [rose|Target] [from bed|bed] [extra early|tim] [to catch an administrator at 8:30 am|pur].</ex>

<ex>[In the summer|cir] [I|pro] [get|Target] [up|Target] [early|tim] and get some miles in on my bike before the kids and Ange wake up. [INI|bed]</ex>

<ex>He slept or threw up the whole day. [He|pro] [got|Target] [up|Target] [for 2 hours|dur] [in the evening|tim].  [INI|bed]</ex>

<ex>[When it snowed|cir] [Smithers|pro] [got|Target] [up|Target] [before everyone else|tim] [at two o'clock|tim] and swept the walkways. [INI|bed]</ex>

name: Getting_vehicle_underway
description:
A #Driver prepares a #Vehicle for travel by placing it in the normal location for the operation of the vehicle or by detaching it from a place where it was held.

<ex>Throughout Irish history, [countless generations of exiles|Driver] have [cast|Target] [off|Target] [from the shores of Ireland|Source].</ex>
<ex>""Good,"" said Matt as [he|Driver] [pulled|Target] [the car|Vehicle] [out of the parking space|Source].</ex>
<ex>The next day, after [weighing|Target] [anchor|Target], [we|Driver] cleared Longboat Pass Bridge, and exited the ICW into the open waters of the Gulf of Mexico.</ex>

name: Get_a_job
description:
A new #Employee obtains a #Position with an #Employer, with which there are certain #Tasks associated; in exchange for the performance of these #Tasks, the #Employee receives #Compensation from the #Employer.

<ex>[I|Employee] [signed|Target] [on|Target] [with YouTube|Employer] [to make them a new GUI|Task].</ex>

name: Get_document
description: The #Tourist obtains the #Documents needed for her trip.

name: Give_impression
description:
In this class of perception words, a #Phenomenon, typically expressed as External Argument, and its perceptual characteristics are given some description.  This may be a #Characterization describing purely perceptual properties, an #Appraisal (i.e. positive or negative judgment) or an #Inference about some non-perceptual property based on the #Perceiver_passive's perception.
<ex></ex>
<ex>There's a hamburger bar open, and [it|Phenomenon] [smells|Target] [real good|Appraisal].</ex>

<ex>[What we drank then|Phenomenon] [tasted|Target] [like sulphur and ox blood|Characterization].</ex>

name: Giving
description: A #Donor transfers a #Theme from a #Donor to a #Recipient.  This frame includes only actions that are initiated by the #Donor (the one that starts out owning the #Theme).  Sentences (even metaphorical ones) must meet the following entailments: the  #Donor first has possession of the #Theme.  Following the transfer the #Donor no longer has the #Theme and the #Recipient does. <ex>[Barney|Donor] [gave|Target] [the beer|Theme] [to Moe|Recipient].</ex> <ex>[$300|Theme] was [endowed|Target] [to the university|Recipient] [to build a new performing arts building|Purpose].</ex>

name: Giving_birth
description:
A #Mother and #Father produce a #Child or an #Egg.
<ex>[Betty|Mother] [bore|Target] [Gerry|Father] [three intelligent daughters|Child].</ex>

name: Giving_in
description:
A #Capitulator who has been opposing a #Force, which is typically exerted by a #Compeller, ceases opposing that #Force. As a result, the #Force runs its course and an #Issue is resolved against the interests of the #Capitulator.


<ex>Accordingly, there is no basis to conclude that [Tazewell|Capitulator] [acquiesced|Target] [in the rule against claim-splitting|Force].</ex>
<ex>Accordingly, there is no basis to conclude that Tazewell [acquiesced|Target] in the rule against [claim-splitting|Issue].</ex>


<ex>My uncle continued trying to placate Nuayman until [the latter|Capitulator] [relented|Target]. [DNI|Issue] [DNI|Force]</ex>


<ex> [Genesis|Capitulator] [acquiesced|Target] [to doing a short Q and A session|Resultant_action]. [DNI|Force]</ex>

<ex>[The government|Capitulator] would not [yield|Target] [to pressure|Force] , the spokeswoman promised . [DNI|Issue]</ex>

name: Giving_scenario
description: The sequence of events in which the #Donor begins in possession of the #Theme, then gives it to the #Recipient, relinquishing possession.

name: Gizmo
description:
This frame contains general words denoting equipment where the #Use or purpose is not specified by the lexeme but (typically) by a separate expression. The words are described with respect to the #Use for which the item is used or its typical #User.

<ex>[coffee|Use] [machine|Target]</ex>
<ex>[dentist's|User] [equipment|Target]</ex>

name: Goal
description:
A #Landmark (in combination with the image schema evoked by particular targets) serves to pick out the final location of a #Trajector in a construed or actual motion event.

<ex>[Flights|Trajector] [into|Target] [Denver|Landmark] are not permitted [at this time|Time].</ex>

name: Going_back_on_a_commitment
description:
A #Protagonist has made a #Commitment but does not honor it, thereby doing harm to an #Affected_party.


<ex>[My buddy Tom's girlfriend|Protagonist] [backed out|Target] [of going to the show with me|Commitment].</ex>
