<ex>However, [the employer|pro] [then|Time] [backed out|Target] [of that statement|Commitment] and did not pay the STD!</ex>

<ex> [The government|Protagonist] had [reneged|Target] [on promises to give them land|Commitment].</ex>

<ex>When [she and her family|pro] [went back|Target] [on their police statement|com] [in the Vadodara court|pla] [in May 2003|Time], it stirred a huge controversy.</ex>

name: Government_institution
description: The #Institution is an organization which is part of a government, the #Purpose of which is to provide a service or fulfill a role designated by the government. The #Purpose may, but need not, entail direct interaction of the citizenry.

name: Go_dancing
description: While visiting tourist places, the #Tourist may go dancing, usually in traditional #Establishments at the place visited.

name: Go_into_shape
description:
A #Theme, which may or may not have a default shape or configuration, goes into a particular shape without being made to do so by an agent. Depending on the type of shape, there may be a Locus about which the #Theme changes shape.

<ex>[It|Theme] [curled|Target] up [into a cylinder|Resultant_configuration] [after laying in the sun|Circumstances].</ex>

name: Go_places
description: During her stay, the #Tourist usually gets around her main destination.

name: Go_shopping
description: While visiting touristic attractions or places, the #Tourist may go shopping. The #Establishments visited for this purpose can be both traditional stores and markets.

name: Gradable_artistic_quality
description:
This frame contains LUs that ascribe an artistic quality to a work. This frame does not contain ""period"" words such as ""romantic"" or ""classical"".

<ex>With its lack of decor, [the church|Entity] seems [quite|Degree] [austere|Target].</ex>

name: Gradable_attributes
description: An #Entity has an implicit #Value for an #Attribute. #Degree expresses either explicit comparison or the deviation of the #Value when compared with other entities of similar kind. The #Value may hold only relative to a particular #Time or in particular #Circumstances.

name: Gradable_proximity
description:
A #Figure is (stably) located with respect to a #Ground in terms of how the distance between them compares to some general or contextually relevant scale.  The Degree of divergence from the expected distance may also be expressed.  In addition to the asymmetrical consideration of #Figure and #Ground, these may be construed collectively as #Figures, in which case each entity is assessed for how expected its distance is from others in the group of #Figures.
<ex></ex>
Productive metaphors include cases where the degree of closeness or intimacy between people/entities is conceptualized as gradable proximity (""their [close|Target] / [distant|Target] relationship...""). The directness of familial relations is also construed this way (""a [close|Target] / [distant|Target] cousin""). Other metaphors involve possibility - usually of more extreme events - as proximity (""it was [near|Target] collapse / extinction / disaster"") and of category fit as proximity (""that was [far|Target] from perfection / the truth / a miracle"").

name: Graph_shape
description:
This frame descibes a #Shape that #Data makes on a #Graph.

<ex>The [trace|Target] [of the first trial|Data] [on the graph on the right|Graph] shows a sharp increase after stage 1.</ex>

name: Grasp
description:
A #Cognizer possesses knowledge about the workings, significance, or meaning of an idea or object, which we call #Phenomenon, and is able to make predictions about the behavior or  occurrence of the #Phenomenon. The #Phenomenon may be incorporated into the wider knowledge structure via categorization, which can be indicated by the mention of a #Category. The #Cognizer may possess knowledge only in part and this may be expressed in a #Completeness expression. The #Cognizer may also be realized as a cognitive-emotional #Faculty that is conceived of as having understanding. Note that the knowledge may have been acquired either from instruction or from the #Cognizer's own experimentation, observation, or mental operations.

Words in this frame are frequently used metonymically to denote the transition into the state described above.

<ex>I figured this out last week and now [I|Cog] [really|Completeness] [understand|Target] [it|Phen].</ex>

<ex>[My father|Cognizer] failed to [comprehend|Target] [that his explanations were based as much upon faith as mine|Phenomenon]</ex>

<ex>[The draughtsman|Cognizer] must [fully|Completeness] [comprehend|Target] [what he is drawing|Phenomenon]</ex>

<ex>Nobody seems to have explained this to her, but [finally|Time] [she|Cognizer] [understands|Target] [DNI|Phenomenon]</ex>

<ex>I realized [I|Cognizer] had not [properly|Manner] [understood|Target] [my own needs|Phen]</ex>

<ex>[The mind|Faculty] is often unable to [comprehend|Target] [the significance of what it perceives|Phenomenon].</ex>

<ex>[Our sensations|Phenomenon] are in some sense to be [understood|Target] [in terms of a set of stimulation levels (spiking frequencies) in the appropriate sensory pathways|Reference_point]. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

name: Greeting
description: This frame includes words, expressions and/or gestures that may compose a complete interaction or the beginning of a more extensive interaction.

name: Grinding
description: In this frame a #Grinder or #Grinding_cause causes a #Patient to be broken into smaller pieces.  A #Result or #Goal can be present.<ex>[Bill|Grinder] [ground|Target] [the coffee beans|Patient] [into a fine powder|Result].</ex>

name: Grooming
description:
In this frame, an #Agent engages in personal body care by grooming either a #Patient or a #Body_part.  An #Instrument can be used in this process as well as a #Medium.

<ex>[She|Agt] [washed|Target] [the baby|Patient].</ex>

name: Ground_up
description: In this frame a #Patient is in a state of having been broken into smaller pieces.  <ex> We enjoy eating [ground|Target] [beef|Patient] . </ex>

name: Preliminary_stage
description: This frame is related to the first phase of the competition in which athletes or teams of a given sport are divided into groups and compete among each other. A given number of participants move on to the next phase in the official event.

name: Growing_food
description:
A #Grower endeavors to tend to and influence the environment of #Food so as to foster its growth.

<ex>[I|Grower] [grow|Target] [my own vegetables|Food].</ex>

name: Guest_and_host
description:
Two individuals, the #Guest and the #Host are in a temporary social relationship within which the #Host provides use of a location or resources for the #Guest at a location highly associated with the #Host (in many cases, where the #Host lives or works). The #Guest is not expected to reciprocate the hospitality of the #Host while the relationship holds, though may be expected to act as #Host at a later time.

<ex>[Commander Silvers|gue] <m>was</m> [the President's|hos] [guest|Target] [last week|Time] [at the White House|hos_loc].</ex>

<ex>[Steve Stephens|Host] will <m>be</m> [your|Guest] [host|Target] [for the weekend|Duration].</ex>

name: Guilt_or_innocence
description:
An #Accused individual is deemed by a Judge to be involved (or not) in a #Misdeed.  The Judge is either not mentioned, or is introduced by some other frame in the discourse.


<ex>[I|acc] <m>am</m> [innocent|Target] [of this crime|mis] and so is James Griffiths . </ex>
<ex>It is possible that [the Frauleins Krabbe , Breuer and Moller|acc] are [guilty|Target] [of serious wrongdoing|mis].</ex>

<ex></ex>
Note that this frame is not  limited to technical, legal uses. The use of guilty in this frame is also to be distinguished from that in the Contrition frame by not referring to an emotional state. Innocent has several other meanings that are distinct from the one it has in this frame. It can mean 'ignorant of'; 'innocuous'; 'pure and unsullied by experience'.

name: Gusto
description: A #Person has a particular mental state and the ability to engage in an activity with enthusiasm, energy, and positivity.

name: Hair_configuration
description:
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.  Note that Attachment and Body Part will generally be incorporated in the lexical meanings.  Subregions (e.g. roots, ends) are often not specified, and sometimes incorporated (e.g. in 'bangs')

<ex>On either side her head gleamed [coiled|Configuration] [[braids|Target]|Configuration] [of dark-gold hair|Hair] , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .</ex>

name: Halt
description:
This frame consists of LUs which denote a #Theme ceasing motion.


<ex>[Peter|Theme] [stopped|Target] [immediately|Time] and span to see Aeryn frozen where she stood.</ex>

<ex>[He|Theme] [stopped|Target] [at the door|Place], not wanting to see what he knew must be on the other side</ex>

<ex>As Lynn walked through the bedroom on her way to the shower [she|Theme] [stopped|Target] [to look at her sleeping husband|Purpose]</ex>

name: Have_associated
description:
A #Topical_entity has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an #Entity.

<ex>[By the 1920s|Time] [a characteristic book|Topical_entity] [had|Target] [black and white photographic illustrations only|Entity] .</ex>

<ex>[Their schools|Topical_entity] [had|Target] [an improved and more balanced curriculum|Ent] .</ex>

<ex>[With dual citizenship|Circumstances] , [Stephen|Topical_entity] [now|Time] [had|Target] [two presidents he hated|Entity] .</ex>

name: Have_as_requirement
description:
The obtaining of a #Requirement state of affairs or the presence of a #Required_entity is profiled as a prerequisite for the obtaining or occurring of a #Dependent state-of-affairs.

<ex>[This game|Dependent] [demands|Target] [great skill|Requirement].</ex>

<ex>[The war on terror|Dependent] [requires|Target] [little sacrifice for most Americans|Requirement].</ex>

<ex>[Glass  art|Dependent] [demands|Target] [great patience|Requirement] [from the student|Required_individual].</ex>

name: Have_as_translation_equivalent
description:
A  #Source_symbol in a #Source_representation system is presented to be matched by a #Target_symbol in a #Target_representation in the ability to express a particular #Content.

<ex>[A palintonon or palintone|Source_symbol] [translates|Target] [as ""V-spring""|Target_symbol] and euthytonon or euthytone
translates as ""straight-spring"" [from Greek|Source_representation].</ex>

<ex>It can be confusing if [one word|Source_symbol] [translates|Target] [into several|Target_symbol] [in Spanish|Target_representation], [which don't have the same gender|Target_symbol].</ex>

<ex>Therefore, [this word|Source_symbol] [translates|Target] [as ""a male""|Target_symbol].</ex>

<ex>[Perak|Source_symbol] [translates|Target] [as ""silver""|Target_symbol] [in the Malay language|Source_representation].</ex>


Sentences such as the following are actually to be handled in the Be_translation_equivalent frame, which has the reverse point of view from the current frame.
<ex>We have just seen how each Bible program makes it easy to get a definition of [the Greek or Hebrew word|Source_symbol] [which|Source_symbol] [a given English word|Target_symbol] [translates|Target]. </ex>
The difference is essentially between whether both speaker and addressee in the context where the word is used are starting with the #Target_symbol in mind.  When they are, the symbols are being compared for how they correspond and Be_translation_equivalent can be used.  Otherwise, generally where the information conveyed by the predication is what the #Target_symbol is, Have_as_translation_equivalent is used.

name: Have_visitor_over
description:
A #Host, at a location strongly associated with him/herself (such as a place of employment or residence), temporarily hosts a #Visitor so that the #Visitor can achieve a goal. The purpose of the visit is often social in nature.

<ex>[We|Host] [had|Target] [him|Visitor] [over|Target] [for tea|Purpose].</ex>

name: Having_commercial_agreement
description: #Party_1 and #Party_2 (collectively refered to as #Parties) make a commercial agreement, an #Obligation, which both #Parties are expected to keep or fulfill.

name: Having_or_lacking_access
description:
A #Theme has access to a #Useful_location or is blocked from it by a #Barrier.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Making [services|loc] [accessible|Target] [to those with special needs|Ent] is expensive.</ex>
<ex>[I|Theme] don't have [access|Target] [to the safe|loc].</ex>
<ex>[The regime|Barrier] has now restricted [access|Target] [to the internet|loc]. </ex>

name: Health_response
description:
A #Protagonist is sensitive to a #Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the #Protagonist.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary|Protagonist] <m>are</m> [allergic|Target] [to cats|Trigger].</ex>

<ex>On top of this, [he|Protagonist] <m>has</m> [allergies|Target] [to oats and dust|Trigger] and is a finicky feeder.</ex>

name: Hearsay
description:
The #Hearer receives a #Message or communication on a particular #Topic. Words in this frame denote events of verbal communication, but express the #Hearer rather than the #Speaker as an External Argument.

<ex>[Teenage fans|Hearer] first [heard|Target] [about the tragedy|Topic] [on a popular radio show|Medium].</ex>
<ex>[Teenage fans|Hearer] first [heard|Target] [the tragic news|Message] [on a popular radio show|Medium]</ex>

name: Heat_potential
description:
An #Insulator is judged for its potential to increase the body temperature of an #Experiencer. The #Activity that the #Experiencer engages in to experience the heat and the #Circumstances in which the #Insulator is judged may also be provided.

<ex>That looks like a [really|Degree] [warm|Target] [bed|Insulator].</ex>
<ex>[This blanket|Insulator] is too [toasty|Target] [for me|Experiencer].</ex>

name: Hedging
description:
When words of this frame are used as hedge markers, they signal that the speaker of the sentence wishes to be careful about asserting some #Hedged_content.  Use of a hedge marker may mean that the speaker is uncertain of how factual of the #Hedged_content is, or uncertain of whether they're expressing the idea behind #Hedged_content well, or it may mean that the #Hedged_content is socially undesirable or awkward in the conversational context.

<ex>The president is [a bit|Target] [of an idiot|Hedged_content] when it comes to foreign policy .</ex>
<ex>I 'm sorry , but he is [on the|Target] [heavy|Hedged_content] [side|Target] , you understand .</ex>
<ex>I thought, [like|Target], [maybe you would know|Hedged_content] .</ex>
<ex>My father was [something|Target] [of a dilettante|Hedged_content] .</ex>
<ex>[He|Hedged_content] [rather|Target] [doubts you'll be able to convince your mom|Hedged_content]. </ex>
<ex></ex>
Because these words serve to indicate hesitancy, often for purposes of increased politeness, speakers may use several encodings of hedging simultaneously to iconically indicate the degree of politeness or hesitancy that they wish to express:

<ex>Your story, is, [like|Target], [kind of|Target] a bit [on the|Target] short [side|Target] .</ex>
<ex></ex>
There is also an ironic or sarcastic use of LUs in this frame, as in the following:

<ex>When a standard vaccuum can't even pick up the clods, you know [you've|Hedged_content] [kinda|Target] [got a problem|Hedged_content].</ex>
<ex></ex>
Words expressing small quantities or degrees (e.g., ""a tad"", ""a little"", etc.) can be used in a very similar function to words of this frame.  However, these words do not simply signify hesitation, but merely frequently imply it when used to modify a predication.  Such words can only be used on their on or with a noun to signify a small quantity or number (""a little whiskey"", see Proportional_quantity), or with an adjective to indicate that the quality described by the adjective is close to average (""a mite stupid"", ""somewhat confused"" see Degree).  Words of those frames may be nested within noun phrases or in other positions where content is not asserted but rather presupposed.  Words that belong to the Hedging frame, by contrast, either take a noun complement and indicate hesitancy or imprecision concerning the category (""something of a klutz""), or modify an entire proposition to indicate imprecision of the proposition (""I, like, waved it around"").  In both cases, the #Hedged_content must occur in the at-issue focus of a proposition, the part of a statement that the speaker is, so to speak, on record as asserting.

name: Heralding
description:
A #Communicator announces (linguistically or non-linguistically) the  imminent arrival of an #Individual or the occurrence of an #Event.  Generally, the #Communicator is attempting to inform the public.


<ex>[The unveiling of Alinghi's keel|evt] was [heralded|Target] [by alp horns|com]</ex>

<ex>[A brass band|com] [heralded|Target] [his arrival|evt] and he was flanked by secret service agents</ex>

<ex>[The telegram|med] [heralded|Target] [him|Ind], but with boundless miles for hiding he had stolen in under the cover of night</ex>

name: Hiding_objects
description:
An #Agent causes a #Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a #Hiding_place or putting in place an #Obstruction that screens the object.

<ex>Therefore, as I passed the school, [I|Agent] [hid|Target] [the gun and holster|Hidden_object] [in the mailbox|Hiding_place]</ex>

<ex>[Gruenwald|Agent] [hid|Target] [the money|Hidden_object] [at a local garbage dump|Place] then retrieved it the following morning.</ex>

<ex>In later books [Harry|Agent] often tries to [hide|Target] [his scar|Hidden_object] [with his hair|Obstruction]. </ex>

name: Hindering
description:
In this frame a #Hindrance makes it more difficult for a #Protagonist to complete their intended #Action or a #Hindrance directly affects an #Action where the #Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor.  Crucially, these lexical units do not entail that the #Protagonist was unable to complete the #Action or that the #Action did not occur. The #Hindrance may indicate a lack of enablement or an obstacle on the natural progression of the #Protagonist or #Action

<ex> [Malcolm|Protagonist] was [hindered|Target] [by his drinking problem|Hindrance] . </ex>
<ex> [A lack of money|Hindrance] [hampered|Target] [our plans|Action] . </ex>
<ex> [Many candidates' progress|Action] is [severely|Degree] [impeded|Target] [because they have to resit for the exam|Hindrance]. </ex>
<ex> [The new dam|Hindrance] [impeded|Target] [the flow of water|Action] . </ex>

name: Hire_provide_touristic_services
description: General frame in which the #Tourist hires a #Service from the #Operator.

name: Hiring
description:
An #Employer hires an #Employee, promising the #Employee a certain #Compensation in exchange for the performance of a job.  The job may be described either in terms of a #Task or a #Position.  In some cases, the #Employee FE will also indicate the #Position (see fourth example below).

<ex>[John|Empee] was [hired|Target] [to clean up the file system|Task].</ex>
<ex>[IBM|Emper] [hired|Target] [Gates|Empee] [as chief janitor|Posit].</ex>
<ex>[I|Empee] was [retained|Target] [at $500 an hour|Compense].</ex>
<ex>[The A's|Emper] [signed|Target] [a new third baseman|Empee] [for $30M|Compense].</ex>
The same sentence (above) should also have the FE #Position on the second layer:
<ex>The A's [signed|Target] [a new third baseman|Posit] for $30M.</ex>

name: Historic_event
description:
In the course of history, an #Event or #Entity is taken to have importance or significance.

<ex>Throughout the campaign [activists|Entity] have [made|Target] [financial|dom] [history|Target] [as one by one major corporations have yielded to protester power|Time]</ex>

<ex>[The conference|Event] <m>was</m> [historic|Target] [for Atlanta's growth as a city|Entity].</ex>

<ex>Many of the [historic|Target] [sites|Ent] offer additional outdoor recreation activities.</ex>

<ex>The James River is arguably the most [historic|Target] [river|Ent] in the country and one of the most important rivers in the Southeast.</ex>

<ex>Take in the [[history|Ent]|Target], the sawdust-covered floors, and the legendary backroom where the ale flowed during Prohibition.</ex>

name: History
description:
A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given #Topic.

<ex>And that is where the [history|Target] [of art|Topic] begins.</ex>

name: History_scenario
description: This frame describes how #Events are related to each other and #Place and #Time.

name: Hit_or_miss
description:
An #Agent succeeds or fails to interact perceptually or physically with the #Target or #Target_location.  The #Instrument which is used to interact with the #Target may stand in metonymically for the #Agent.

<ex>At first [he|Agent] shot [very|Degree] [wide|Target] [of his target|Target] .</ex>
<ex>Because I programmed the scope wrong , [I|Agent] kept [missing|Target] [Jupiter|Target] .</ex>
<ex>[She|Agent] scored two [hits|Target] [on the deer 's left side|Target_location] .</ex>

name: Hit_target
description:
An #Agent causes the ballistic motion of a projectile and its subsequent impact on a #Target.

<ex>It looks like [he|Agent] [hit|Target] [the bull's-eye|Target] [with his first arrow|ins]!</ex>

<ex>If [he|Agent] [shot|Target] [her|Target], he is fully culpable whether he meant to or not.</ex>

name: Holding_off_on
description:
An #Agent decides temporarily not to perform a #Desirable_action or not to interact with a #Salient_entity.

<ex>[I|Agent] have actually [held off|Target] [on buying some movies by WB|Desirable_action] [because of those damned cases|Explanation].</ex>

<ex>[We|Agent] [held off|Target] [on reporting this|Desirable_action] [because, by all accounts, the young Oscar-nominee has NOT been offered the role|Explanation].</ex>

<ex>This meant [waiting|Target] [with dinner|Desirable_action] until late. [CNI|Agent]</ex>

<ex>[I|Agent] [waited|Target] [with going to him|Desirable_action] and in retrospect think that that was a mistake.</ex>

name: Hospitality
description:
A #Host is judged regarding their attitude as a potential host in a guest-host relationship. The #Host exhibits a #Behavior that is judged as demonstrating a particular degree hospitality towards a #Guest. Alternatively, the #Host may reveal an #Expressor that indicates a particular sort of attitude.

<ex>I found [the board|Host] to be [very|Degree] [hospitable|Target] [to Russian graduates|Guest].</ex>

name: Hostile_encounter
description:
This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (#Side_1 and #Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as #Sides) over a disputed #Issue and/or in order to reach a specific  #Purpose.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[He|Side_1] still wants to [fight|Target] [Mike Tyson|Side_2] [in about 8 months|Time].</ex>

<ex>[Dennis Andries's|Side_1] [European cruiserweight title|Purpose] [clash|Target] [against Akim Tafer of France|Side_2] [in Beausoleil|Place] [last February|Time] has been voted as the EBU's fight of the year.</ex>

name: Hosting_event
description: A #Host organizes an #Event.

name: Hunting
description:
A [Hunter|Hunter] tries to gain [Food|Food] by way of outsmarting or tracking a living. The [Hunter|Hunter] hopes the attempt will result in the catching and killing of the living entity that is intended for human consumption. The act of seeking [Food|Food] inherently involves the assistance of some tool, which can be an extension of the [Hunter|Hunter]'s body or an artifact fashioned or exploited for the use of food seeking, catching, and/or killing.

<ex>[In the Congo|Place], [he|Hunter] hunted [big game|Food] [for the first time|Particular_iteration].</ex>

<ex>[People|Hunter] [still|Time] [fish|Target] [bass|Food] [in the lake|Ground].</ex>

<ex>[Folks from Northern California|Hunter] [hunt|Target] [brilliantly|Manner]. [INI|Food] </ex>

name: Hunting_scenario
description: A #Hunter endeavors to- and either fails or succeeds at finding and obtaining [Food|Food]. This scenario occurs within the context of some #Ground within which the preparation, hunt, and success or failure of it plays out.

name: Hunting_success_or_failure
description:
A [Hunter|Hunter] succeeds or fails at capturing his sought-out or tracked [Food|Food].

<ex>[We|Hunter] [bagged|Target] [six roosters|Food].</ex>

<ex>[Bottom trawlers|Hunter] [catch|Target] [fish that live on or near the seafloor|Food].</ex>

name: Hypertext_access
description: Hypertext_access

name: Identicality
description:
A #Current_instance of a certain #Type is under discussion. This instance  is evaluated as being the same instance or a different instance from a #Previous_instance encountered in a #Previous_context.

<ex>Kim has a [different|Target] [hair color|tp] every week</ex>
<ex>Kim has [a different hair color|ci] every week</ex>

<ex>Is this the [same|Target] [sofa|tp] [as the one that used to be in the lobby|pi]?</ex>
<ex>Is this [the same sofa as the one that used to be in the lobby|ci]?</ex>


<ex>Dracula and your neighbor are [different|Target] [people|Type]</ex>
<ex>Dracula and your neighbor are [different|Target] [people|soi]</ex>

name: Identity
description:
An #Instance of some type is conceived of as having an #Identity, defined as the unique feature that distinguishes each #Instance from all other instances of its type.  #Identity persists across time and remains constant for an #Instance despite arbitrary changes in other attributes of the #Instance.  Establishing #Identity answers the question ""which"".

<ex>I still have questions about [her|Instance] [[identity|Identity]|Target] .</ex>
<ex>[[Which|Target]|Identity] [dinner|Instance] did you choose ?</ex>

#Identity is not the same as appearance or name (if the #Instance even has such), although these attributes of the #Instance may be useful in establishing #Identity.  #Identity can be established knowing the totality of the history of an #Instance; however, this is impractical and usually proxies like name and appearance are used.  For the #Identity of humans, history sufficient to establish #Identity can usually be satisfactorily established by documents associated with the person, often with information like appearance and name, though use of such documents contributes to the problem of multiple identities, only one of which is considered legitimate or ""true"" in a given context.  Just as we would consider <ment>gun</ment> in ""fake gun"" to contain a reference to the normal concept of Weapon, we consider <ment>identity</ment> in ""multiple identities"" to belong to this frame, even if only one of the identities is legitimate.  Multiple identities can also exist when each is primarily associated with a fragment or aspect of the history and attributes of an entity, and the ""true"" identity might be very much debatable; in most such cases, there are different names associated with the different identities, as in the case of stage names or Ellis-Island names, but sometimes, the different ""identities"" go under the same name (e.g., some members of secret societies). While these may be considered different identities, they refer to the same person.
<ex></ex>
This frame is intended to cover cases where an entity is mentioned, but the category it fits is what is actually meant:

<ex>We need to determine the [[identity|Identity]|Target] [of the metal used in the picture frame|Instance] .</ex>

In this case, it is not individual identity of the physical hunk of metal that is intended to be in question, but rather the category that the hunk of metal fits into; i.e., the specific element or elemental composition of the metal is what is in question.  Such sentences should be understood as determining which #Instance of the supercategory is intended.

<ex></ex>
This frame is not intended to cover related, and often more common, uses of the word ""identity"" such as ""sexual identity"", ""national identity"", or ""brand identity"", which do not refer to a unique identity of an #Instance, or even the identity of a supercategory of the #Instance, but rather refer to the specific properties of an #Instance that are considered very important for how the #Instance operates in aggregate.  Thus, uses like ""losing your identity"" are not intended to be covered by this frame.

name: Identity_scenario
description:
An #Instance of some #Type is conceived of as having a distinct #Identity.  Its #Identity persists across time and remains constant for an #Instance despite arbitrary changes in other attributes of the #Instance.  Establishing #Identity answers the question ""which"", and is often answered by saying that an #Instance is the same or different from a previously mentioned instance (see Identicality), or by deictic reference (""that one""), etc.

#Identity is not the same as appearance or name (if the #Instance even has such), although these attributes of the #Instance may be useful in establishing #Identity.  #Identity can be established knowing the totality of the history of an #Instance; however, this is impractical and usually proxies like name and appearance are used.  For the #Identity of humans, history sufficient to establish #Identity can usually be satisfactorily established by documents associated with the person, often with information like appearance and name, though use of such documents leads to the problem of multiple identities, only one of which is considered legitimate or ""true"" in a given context.

name: Idiosyncrasy
description:
A certain #Idiosyncrasy belongs to an #Entity distinguishing it from other entities.


<ex>If you have 32 [totally|Deg] [idiosyncratic|Target] [meanings for a term|Id] in a class, everyone will be very confused when they talk! [DNI|Entity]</ex>

<ex>[The art of change-ringing|Idiosyncrasy] <m>is</m> [peculiar|Target] [to the English|Entity]</ex>

This frame differs from Typicality in that it focuses on a distinguishing #Idiosyncrasy that an #Entity has rather than the mere fact that an #Entity is unusual.

name: Image_schema
description: A #Profiled_region is picked out relative to a #Ground.

name: Imitating
description:
An #Agent displays a #Characteristic of a #Standard in his or her own way of behaving.


<ex>I guessed [he|agt] was trying to [imitate|Target] [the movements of a skier|Characteristic]</ex>

<ex>[In a tv commercial last year|Containing_event], [she|Agent] [aped|Target] [male slobbiness|Characteristic] [in a singlet and
Y-front-style underpants, kicking back on the couch, watching sport|Depictive].</ex>

<ex>'You are all the same ,' [he|agt] said, [imitating|Target] [not her voice but its angry cadence|Characteristic].</ex>

<ex>Antony, after he had seen this man, [imitated|Target] [him|Standard] [in piety|Characteristic].</ex>

name: Immobilization
description:
The #Agent immobilizes a #Patient optionally,  to an #Anchor.

<ex>[The junior officer|Agent] [handcuffed|Target] [his commanding officer|Patient] [to his desk|Anchor].</ex>

name: Impact
description:
While in motion, an #Impactor makes sudden, forcible contact with the #Impactee, or two #Impactors both move, mutually making forcible contact.
<ex>[The massive metal foot|Impactor] [hit|Target] [the ground|Impactee] [with a huge thud|Result].</ex>

name: Importance
description:
A #Factor affects the outcome of an #Undertaking, which  can be a goal-oriented activity or the maintenance of a desirable state, the work in a #Field, or something portrayed as affecting an #Interested_party. An #Explanation may be given for the importance of the #Factor. The #Degree of importance may also be specified.

<ex>Temperature is the [most|Degree] [critical|Target] [factor|Factor] [in successful storage|Undertaking].</ex>
<ex> [Timing|Factor] will be [critical|Target].</ex>
<ex>[Heathcliff|Factor] <m>is</m> [more|Degree] [important|Target] [to me|Interested_party] [than myself|Degree] . </ex>
<ex> [1992|Factor] <m>was</m> <m>of</m> [great|Degree] [importance|Target] [to the business community|Interested_party]. </ex>

name: Importing
description:
An #Importer receives #Goods from an #Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the #Importing_area.  The #Path along which the #Goods pass may also be indicated.

<ex>[The U.S.|Importer] [imported|Target] [some wheat|Goods] [in the period|Time], although it exported about ten times as much.</ex>
<ex>[We|Importer] [import|Target] [most of the Tahitian seashells|Goods] [through Japan|Path].</ex>
<ex>[Importation|Target] [of wildlife|Goods] has gotten more difficult. [INI|Importer] [INI|Importing_area] [INI|Exporting_area]</ex>

name: Import_export_scenario
description:
An #Agent moves #Goods (or some other useful item) from an #Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the #Importing_area.  The #Path along which the #Goods pass may also be indicated. Depending on the lexical unit, the #Agent 's point of view may be centered on the #Exporting_area at the beginning of the process (e.g. <ment>export</ment>) or on the #Importing_area and the end of the process (e.g. <ment>import</ment>) or on the #Path (e.g. <ment>transship</ment>). In some sentences, a constituent which encodes the #Agent FE also encodes information about the #Exporting_area, #Path, or #Importing_area.

<ex>Cooperating was an old term used by the Customs service to describe the illegal traffic of contraband[|Goods]sold and [transhipped|Target] [from larger vessels|Exporting_area] [into small local boats|Importing_area].</ex>

name: Imposing_obligation
description:
A #Duty is imposed on a #Responsible_party according to a #Principle which regulates how the #Responsible_party should respond to a #Situation.  The #Situation may be expressed metonymically by reference to an #Obligator, whose action invokes the #Principle.  It is only rarely the case that the #Principle and the #Situation/#Obligator are both expressed overtly.

<ex>They escaped total Soviet invasion and occupation only by entering into [a separate agreement|Principle] [that|Principle] [obligated|Target] [them|Responsible_party] [to military action against the retreating German armies|Duty].</ex>

<ex>[The lease agreements|pri] [bound|Target] [them|Responsible_party] [to make rent payments to Homeowners Rescue|Duty].</ex>

<ex>It was also discovered that with out her knowledge, [he|Obligator] had [committed|Target] [her|Responsible_party] [to a new TV series|Duty] and he had already taken an advance on the money.</ex>


<ex>[The Generality's invitation to give a conference on the theme|sit] [obligated|Target] [me|Responsible_party] [to study Gaudí's work even more|Duty].</ex>

name: Impression
description:
This frame describes the #Impression which a #Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an #Audience. The #Audience is often left unstated when it represents anyone who is aware of the subject. The #Impression may be describe with a #Descriptor; the effectiveness of the #Impression may be provided by #Degree. The #Context indicates the domain in which the #Impression is understood.

<ex>[He|Figure] <gov>had</gov> an extremely [fragile|Descriptor] [self|Audience] - [[image|Impression]|Target]</ex>

<ex>[My|Audience] [impression|Impression] [of the show|Figure] was just the opposite</ex>

name: Imprisonment
description:
The #Authorities put a #Prisoner in #Prison as punishment for an #Offense.

<ex>[US Drug Researcher|pri] [Imprisoned|Target] [for FDA Fraud|off].</ex>
<ex>Men will be more likely to be [put|Target] [away|Target] [for murder rather than manslaughter|con] [for killing their wives|off].</ex>
<ex>However, any treatments may be years in the future and in the meantime, [criminals|pri] will continue to be [imprisoned|Target] [for public safety|pur].</ex>

<ex>[The government|aut] wrongfully [imprisoned|Target] [them|pri] [in ?detention centers?|jai] (a nice term
for concentration camps), tortured them mentally and physically</ex>

name: Improvement_or_decline
description:
An #Entity improves from a less desirable #Prior_state to a more desirable #Post_state.  (Note that members of this frame marked with the semantic type ""Negative"" indicate deterioration.)  In most cases the #Prior_state and the #Post_state are implicit, since the most important fact is simply that the #Post_state is better than the #Prior_state.

<ex>[My typing speed|Entity] is [improving|Target] .</ex>
<ex>[They|Entity] have [improved|Target] [in their typing|Domain] [a lot|Degree] .</ex>
<ex>If you think [your whole life|Entity] is [deteriorating|Target] , get out your relationship !</ex>

name: Improvised_explosive_device
description:
An improvised explosive device is a #Bomb or similar device used in non-conventional warfare. It consists of explosive material connected to a detonator, possibly including other materials meant to damage nearby people and property.

<ex>An [[IED|Bomb]|Target] struck the lead truck.</ex>

<ex>It was determined that the device was an [explosive charge|Type] [IED|Bomb]; no additional shrapnel was located.</ex>

<ex>Robots designed to deactivate [[roadside bombs|Bomb]|Target] are currently being deployed in the region.</ex>

name: Inclination
description:
Due to internal forces/properties, an #Entity is inclined towards a particular #Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state. The underlying force is seen as being beyond the #Entity's control. The #Degree to which the #Entity is inclined towards the #Behavior may also be specified as well as the #Basis for the inclination.


<ex>[My grandmother|Entity] <m>has</m> [criminal|Behavior] [tendencies|Target]. </ex>
<ex> ""[Smithers|Entity] has always <m>had</m> a deplorable [tendency|Target] [to exhibitionism|Behavior]. </ex>
<ex>[Chuck|Entity] <m>was</m> not [very|Degree] [inclined|Target] [to believe me|Behavior]. </ex>
<ex> [Smithers|Entity] <m>has</m> a [genetic|Basis] [predisposition|Target] [for neural tube defects|Behavior]. </ex>

name: Inclusion
description:
A #Total has a #Part, either  as a member of an aggregate or as  a constituent part of a simple entity.

<ex>[His collection|Total] [included|Target] [two El Grecos|Part].</ex>

name: Inclusion_scenario
description: A #Part is either a subset of a collection of items that make up a #Whole, or is a subpart of a singular Whole. This frame covers both super/sub-set relations and part-whole relations.

name: Increment
description:
A member or members of a #Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.

<ex>My husband left me for [another|Target] [woman|Class] -- and now wants to get back together again!</ex>

<ex>My husband left me for [[another|Target]|Added_set][ woman|Added_set] -- and now wants to get back together again!</ex>

name: Indicating
description:
A #Communicator or #Medium assigns linguistic meaning to an #Unresolved_referent thereby identifying the specific actor or entity which fulfills the answer to this question.

<ex>Can [you|Communicator] [name|Target] [all the U.S. Presidents|Unresolved_referent]?</ex>

<ex>[No doctor|Communicator] can [name|Target] [the disease that's killing him|Unresolved_referent].</ex>

<ex>[Every year|Frequency], [InfoWorld|Medium] [names|Target] [100 companies that have made the best use of technology|Unresolved_referent].</ex>

name: Indigenous_origin
description:
An #Entity began its existence in the context of a location of #Origin, which is a discourse-salient place, or culture.

<ex>Obviously there are [species|Entity] [that|Entity] are [native|Target] [to China|Origin] or used in Chinese Medicine that aren't used in Western or Cherokee Medicine and vice versa. </ex>

<ex>The [indigenous|Target] [people|Entity], women and the elderly are the most affected. [DNI|Origin]</ex>

<ex>The Athenians believed that [they|Entity] <m>were</m> '[autochthonous|Target]' [in Attica|Origin]. </ex>

name: Indirect_fouls
description: It designates an infraction in which a #Infractor violates a sport rule that does not involve excessive force against the opponent at a given #Time of the game and #Place of the sports venue.

name: Individual_history
description:
This scenario describes a series of #Events, associated with a single #Participant, i.e., the history of the #Participant. The #Events do not necessarily form a coherent whole (e.g., are not necessarily causally related), but merely occupy a period of time. In many cases the history is limited to what are considered the important or significant events. Words in this frame can also denote the time period over which the sequence of #Events took place.

Note: uses of words in this frame to describe a record of the series of events are not in this frame (e.g., <ment>we compiled a history of Rome</ment>).

<ex>We've been worried about [our recent hire's|Participant] [[history|Events]|Target] [of deceiving employers|Domain].</ex>

<ex>The following sections document the entire [25-year|tim] [[history|Events]|Target] [of the company|Participant].</ex>

<ex>Our areas of strength are [British, American and European|Participant] [[History|Events]|Target] [from 1492|Start_time] [to 2000|End_time].</ex>

name: Individual_moves
description: This frame describes the moves performed by an #Athlete in regards to the move itself or the technique used.

name: Ineffability
description:
A #Stimulus inspires a feeling of awe and interest in a (generally implicit or generic) #Experiencer due to desirable qualities which are difficult to explain.  Alternatively, the #Attribute of the #Stimulus may be described instead.

<ex><m>There is</m> a certain [je-ne-sais-quoi|Target] [about that city|Stimulus] .</ex>

name: Infecting
description:
The action of spreading some #Infection to an #Infected_entity, intentionally or otherwise. Pathology indicates that the #Infection_cause can be airborne, carried on the skin/hair, or transmitted via various other forms of contact.

<ex>[Her daughter|Infection_cause] [infected|Target] [her|Infected_entity] [with chicken pox|Infection] .</ex>

name: Influencing_potential
description:
A #Force has the potential to influence an #Entity or #State_of_affairs within a certain #Domain due to some #Source.

<ex>[Economic [power|Target]|Force] gives [China|Entity] [enormous political pull.|Domain]</ex>

name: Information
description:
A #Cognizer knows or comes to know some piece of #Information about a #Topic.  In this frame, many LUs encode a specific #Means_of_gathering and/or #Source, but these may also be expressed separately.

<ex>Also, the big problem is that [our|cog] [[intel|Target]|inf] [about WMD's|top] has many times been wrong.</ex>


<ex> [Anyone|Cognizer] <m>got</m> the [[straight dope|Target]|inf] [on this|Topic]? </ex>

<ex><m>Get</m> the [inside|Source] [[scoop|Target]|inf] [on sprint football player Austin Wilson|Topic]. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

<ex>I know him pretty well and [I|Cognizer] <m>have</m> a lot of [[dirt|Target]|inf] [on him|Topic] so I can always hold him over a barrel.</ex>

<ex>[What|inf]<m>'s</m> the [info|Target] [about the new scanner chip|Topic]? [INI|Cognizer]</ex>

name: Information_display
description:
A man-made artifact, digital or physical, which is used to display information presented via the object.

<ex>[4chan|Name] is an [[image|Target]|Type] [board|Target] [for discussing gaming and internet culture|Use].</ex>

name: Infractions
description: A team or one of its players, the #Infractor, violates a rule of the game, causing the referee to concede a compensation to the #Opponent.

name: Infrastructure
description:
A group of entities exist (as an infrastructure) such that a particular type of #Activity is either enabled or facilitated.  The entities may or may not have been organized specifically for the #Activity.  The infrastructure is constituted by #Resources that can be made use of by #Users, and the infrastructure may be specified for its #Place or #Possessor.

<ex>While the [US|Possessor] [transportation|Activity] [[infrastructure|Infrastructure]|Target] continues to crumble, competitors in Brazil and Argentina are investing millions to improve their transportation</ex>

<ex>The exacerbated sprawl like growth in the last decades has been a direct result of decisions taken in the creation, boost, and development of [highway|Resource] [[infrastructure|Infrastructure]|Target].</ex>

<ex>Mexico's Ministry of Tourism expects to see more than $1.78 billion invested to further develop [the country's|Possessor] [tourism|Activity] [[infrastructure|Infrastructure]|Target].</ex>

name: Ingestion
description:
An #Ingestor consumes food or drink (#Ingestibles), which entails putting the #Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.  This may include the use of an #Instrument.  Sentences that describe the provision of food to others are NOT included in this frame.

<ex>[The wolves|Ingestor] [devoured|Target] [the carcass|Ingestibles] [completely|Degree].</ex>

name: Ingest_substance
description:
In this frame an #Ingestor takes a #Substance into his or her body. The #Delivery_device can appear as a direct object.

<ex>[You|Ingestor] should refrain from [taking|Target] [vodka|Substance] [up the nose|Entry_path].</ex>

<ex>[Smoking|Target] [a cigarette|Delivery_device] only takes a couple of minutes . [CNI|Ingestor] </ex>

name: Ingredients
description:
A #Material is used to make a #Product.

<ex>These [cooking|use] [[ingredients|mat]|Target] are readily available.</ex>

<ex>An [aberrant|des] [hemoglobin|pro] [[precursor|mat]|Target] has been discovered to be implicated.</ex>

name: Inherent_purpose
description:
The universe is considered through a teleological perspective and natural phenomena are seen to exist for the purpose of fulfilling some ultimate aim.  A natural phenomenon is an #Apparatus and an ultimate aim is a #Goal.

<ex>The [PURPOSE|Target] [of the sun|Apparatus] <m>is</m> [to provide energy|Goal]</ex>

<ex>Everybody knows that the [FUNCTION|Target] [of the heart|Apparatus] <m>is</m> [to pump blood|Goal].</ex>

name: Inhibit_motion_scenario
description: This scenario concerns an #Agent inhibiting the motion of a #Theme against the desire, plan, or tendency to be free. After a period of time, the #Agent may choose to release the #Theme, or the #Theme may escape or be broken free by an intervening cause.

name: Inhibit_movement
description:
An #Agent restricts the movement of a #Theme to within the vicinity of the #Holding_location, despite the #Theme's desire, plan, or tendency towards motion; the #Agent may also use an #Instrument. Alternatively, there may be a non-sentient #Cause instead of an #Agent restricting the #Theme.

For many of these targets, the means is incorporated.  For some LUs, the #Theme is required to be a sentient entity.  Several of these LUs may be used to describe punishment situations when the #Theme is a sentient entity.

<ex>[They|Agent] [held|Target] [the package|Theme] [for two months|Duration] [in the border-patrol locker room|Holding_location] .</ex>

name: Inspecting
description:
An #Inspector directs his/her perceptual attention to a #Ground to ascertain whether the #Ground is intact or  whether an #Unwanted_entity is present. Alternatively, the desired outcome of the inspection may be presented as a #Purpose.

<ex>[The police|insp] removed Flonnory and Barbour from the automobile and [frisked|Target] [them|gro] [for weapons|unw].</ex>
<ex>[Double-check|Target] the form [to make sure all of the information has been entered correctly|pur].</ex>

name: Installing
description:
An #Agent  places a #Component in a #Fixed_location so that the #Component is attached and interconnected and thereby functional.


<ex>Displays were given an overhaul in the 1950s, with [canopies|Component] [installed|Target] [above the Christmas counters|fix] [to allow calendar and gift bows to be displayed|pur]. [CNI|Agent]</ex>

<ex>[At the street|loc] [an 8'' culvert|Component] will be [installed|Target] [under the driveway|fix]. [CNI|Agent]</ex>

<ex>[In the space where the piano was, right next to the washing machine,|fix] [my grandmother|Agent] [installed|Target] [her first dryer|Component].</ex>

<ex>[My handyman|Agent] [installed|Target] [it|Component]  [yesterday|Time] and then I sort of forgot about it. </ex>

<ex>Now Marvin Odum, InterGen's Chief Executive Officer, has committed to moving up
[installation|Target] [of the pollution control technology|Component] on its two other turbines.</ex>

name: Instance
description:
This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote #Instances of #Types of entities or events.

<ex>The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and [[instances|Instance]|Target] [of management decisions being taken without team consultation|Type] had also increased .</ex>

name: Institutionalization
description:
A #Patient is committed to the care of a medical #Facility by a proper #Authority. Regardless of whether the #Patient agrees or does not agree with their placement in the #Facility, the #Authority judges that it is in the best interest of the #Patient or his environment that the #Patient receive treatment in the #Facility.


<ex>[Ten years after Abraham Lincoln's assassination|Time], [a Chicago court|aut] declared his 56-year-old widow Mary insane and [committed|Target] [her|pat] [to a mental institution|fac].</ex>

<ex>[A pregnant woman|pat] was [hospitalized|Target]  [with gunshots to her
shoulder and abdomen|dep]. [CNI|aut] [INI|fac]</ex>

<ex>Arberg issued a two-sentence statement saying [Rehnquist|pat] was
[hospitalized|Target] [for a fever|aff] and undergoing tests. [CNI|aut] [INI|fac]</ex>

<ex>The [hospitalization|Target] [of the Saudi king|pat] upset the skittish oil markets. [INI|aut] [INI|fac]</ex>

name: Institutions
description:
This frame concerns permanent organizations (the #Institutions) with a public character, meaning that they are intended to affect the lives of the public at large in a particular #Domain.  In some cases, most or all members of the public have a direct relationship with the #Institution, but in many cases, the effect on the populace is indirect.

<ex>[This|Institution] is an [academic|dom] [institution|Target] [comprised largely of entrepreneurs|Members].</ex>

name: Musical_instruments
description: frm_instrumentos_musicais

name: Intentionally_act
description:
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings. It exists mostly for FE inheritance.

<ex>[I|Agent] [carried|Target] [out|Target] [the deed|Act] [easily|Manner] .</ex>

name: Intentionally_affect
description:
An #Agent causes a #Patient to be affected, sometimes by a particular #Means or by use of an #Instrument.

<ex>[A professional dishwasher|Agent] doesn't [do|Target] [dishes|Pat] [with a rag|Ins] [anymore|Time]!</ex>

name: Intentionally_create
description:
The #Creator creates a new entity, the #Created_entity, possibly out of #Components.

<ex>[The Libyans|Creator] were [generating|Target] [arms|Created_entity] [for export|Purpose].</ex>

name: Intentional_deception
description:
A #Deceiver performs some action so that the #Victim ends up with an incorrect understanding about some #Topic.  The #Means may be via communication, perceptual obscuration, or merely performing an action that the #Victim will draw incorrect conclusions from.

<ex>[The government|Deceiver] [deceived|Target] [the public|Victim] [last year|Time] [about the existence of evidence in several corruption trials|Topic].</ex>

<ex>I can't believe [they|Deceiver] [fooled|Target] [me|Victim] [with that old trick|Means].</ex>

name: Intentional_traversing
description:
A #Self_mover intentionally moves in a #Directionon a #Path relative to landmark that is neither the #Source nor the #Goal of the overall motion. The shape or configuration of the #Path may be expressed with a #Path_shape


<ex>[Ambrose Powell|Self_mover] [forded|Target] [over|Path] [on one horse|Means_of_motion], and we drove the others after him.</ex>

<ex>[We|Self_mover] repassed the first day's battlefield and [ascended|Target] [the road to the city|Path].</ex>

<ex>[Jeff Manor and I|Self_mover] [climbed|Target] [the North Face of Mt Shuksan|Path], [with cold, clear weather and solid ice|cir].</ex>

name: Interactive_moves
description: This frame describes the moves performed by an #Athlete_1 in their interaction with an #Athlete_2 or other #Athletes.

name: Intercepting
description:
A volitionally acting #Interceptor takes control, without being authorized to do so by the sender, of a #Theme that is underway from a sender to a recipient. The #Interceptor (or somebody on whose behalf they act) believes that the #Theme reaching its goal would be against their interest.

The #Theme may be a physical thing that is being conveyed, a self-moving entity, or information that is broadcast.

<ex>[Police|Interceptor] [intercepted|Target] [the call|Theme] and raided the address.</ex>

<ex>[The vessel|Theme] got [intercepted|Target] [in the Mediterranean|Place] [by the German navy|Interceptor] .</ex>


<ex>[A Royal Navy frigate|Interceptor] [intercepted|Target] [his yacht|Theme] [off Gibraltar|pla].</ex>

name: Interior_profile_relation
description:
A #Figure is located in the interior (the Profiled_region--see Locative_relation frame) of the #Ground. Some members of this frame indicate the plexity of the #Ground, as either single-entity gestalt (inside), two-entity or bi-partite gestalt (between.prep), and multiple-entity or multipart gestalt (among.prep, amid.prep), while others are maximally general (in.prep).
<ex></ex>

This frame makes use of the Bounded_region image schema, a way of partitioning a scene into an Interior, an Exterior, and a Boundary.  In some cases, the Boundary may be a physical entity that inhibits motion (""in a box""), while in other cases it may be based on a category boundary where properties change (""in the garden"").  The LUs that specifically pick out two-entity or multi-entity #Grounds imply the lack or irrelevancy of a physical barrier.

<ex>[The bookmark|Figure] [inside|Target] [her book|Ground] was torn and written on .</ex>
<ex>[My keys|Figure] <m>were</m> [in|Target] [the street|Ground] .</ex>
<ex><ment>Step</ment> [back|Temporal_profile] [outside|Target] . [CNI|Figure] [DNI|Ground] </ex>
<ex>[She|Figure] <ment>stood</ment> [in|Target] [a puddle|Ground] and splashed desultorily .</ex>
<ex>I <ment>felt</ment> around [inside|Target] [the oven hood|Ground] . [CNI|Figure]</ex>
<ex>They found the backpack and <ment>found</ment> [a computer|Figure] [inside|Target] . [DNI|Ground]</ex>
<ex>[Within|Target] [the base|Ground] , [nobody knew the attack was about to hit|Figure] .</ex>
<ex>[We talked|Figure] [outside|Target] [the office|Ground] .</ex>
<ex></ex>

This frame is intended to cover cases in which the #Ground is a critical locus for the event.  (When annotating the main verb in such a case, the locative phrase may be annotated on a second layer as Means, Instrument, or Cause.)
<ex>[The pole snapped off|Figure] [in|Target] [her hand|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>[She combed her hair|Figure] [between|Target] [her fingers|Ground] .</ex>
<ex></ex>

In some very specific situations, a prepositional phrase can be used with a copula to describe the whole #Profiled_region where a #Figure is or could be, as in the following:
<ex>[[Inside|Profiled_region]|Target] [my wallet|Ground] is where i put it .</ex>
<ex>[[Outside|Profiled_region]|Target] [your blind date's door|Ground] seems like the worst place in the world .</ex>
<ex></ex>

As in other locative frames, the LUs interact productively with other lexical and non-lexical frames. One of the more confusing cases is with verbs involving gaze, in the which the #Figure is specified by the governing verb to be the gaze of the viewer, and thus from the viewpoint of the locative LU is CNI. See the following:
<ex>They <m>looked</m> [among|Target] [the trees|Ground] for an hour . [CNI|Figure]</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex></ex>

This frame is used in several productive metaphor cases. One of the most frequent is the use of this frame to express an Entity (construed as a #Figure) as a member of a category or state (construed as a #Ground).
<ex><m>Is</m> [the economy|Figure] [in|Target] [recession|Ground] ?</ex>
<ex>There are good or bad weather days here , and [nothing|Figure] [in between|Target] . [DNI|Ground] </ex>
<ex></ex>

Another productive metaphor is referring to a mental entity or activity of a cognizer (construed as a #Figure) as being located inside the cognizer or the cognizer's mind (construed as a #Ground):
<ex>You close your ears to [the small voice|Figure] [within|Target] [DNI|Ground]</ex>
<ex>I felt [an unease|Figure] [inside|Target] [me|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>It was as though [a light had gone out|Figure] [somewhere|Region_quantification] [inside|Target] [of him|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>I had [inside|Target] [of me|Ground] [this feeling that something was going to happen|Figure] .</ex>
<ex></ex>

The frame can be used to talk about a member (construed as a #Figure) being part of a group (construed as a #Ground):
<ex>Then mingle [the most gruesomest , grisliest ghost stories|Figure] [in among|Target] [your jokes|Ground] .</ex>
<ex><m>There are</m> [so many children|Figure] [in|Target] [the family|Ground] .</ex>
<ex></ex>

Two uses of this frame are either productive or semi-productive, and we have annotated examples experimentally on the assumption that the metaphors may be productive:
In the first and most common, Interior_profile_relation lexical units are used to describe the timing of events relative to other events or periods, with per target differentiation or homogeneity of the #Ground events that serve as a reference, based on the literal use of a target:
<ex>[amid|Target] the confusion</ex>
<ex>[inside|Target] the competition period</ex>
<ex>[between|Target] lunch and dinner</ex>
However, some members of this frame require that a time be construed (e.g. with the word ""period"") while others can take events as #Grounds directly.
<ex></ex>

In the second, some idea (construed as the #Figure) is true in the context of a larger idea or text (construed as the #Ground):
<ex>[In|Target] [the paper|Ground] , [`` self-control '' is used to mean a sense of willpower|Figure] .</ex>
<ex>[Inside|Target] [the world he created|Ground] , [hobbits run wild|Figure] .</ex>
Again, the productivity of the this metaphor is uncertain because inside.prep, in among.prep, and some other members of this frame do not occur in this metaphor, or are strangely constrained and do not paraphrase similar examples with in.prep.
<ex></ex>
<ex></ex>

This frame should not be used for cases in which the #Ground element is a literal or metaphorical distance; see Within_distance.

name: Interrupt_process
description:
A #Cause (or associated #Actor) causes an ongoing #Process to temporarily stop.

<ex>[The error|Cause] [interrupted|Target] [the process|Process].</ex>

name: Intoxicants
description:
An #Intoxicant is ingested in order to achieve an altered state of consciousness. A #Type or #Descriptor may be indicated as well.
<ex> We <gov>smoked</gov> <x>some [high-grade|Descriptor] [[marijuana|Target]|Intoxicant]</x>.</ex>
<ex>They <gov>smoked</gov> <x>[freebase|Type] [[cocaine|Target]|Intoxicant]</x>.</ex>

name: Intoxication
description:
This frame concerns people being in an altered mental state that is induced by an #Intoxicant.
<ex>[Cory|Cognizer] <m>was</m> [drunk|Target].</ex>
<ex>[Nutty|Cognizer] stormed in [drunk|Target] [as a fiddler|Degree].</ex>

name: Invading
description:
The #Invader enters a [Land|Land] in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.

<ex>[In August 1990|Time] ,[Iraq|Invader] was [invading|Target] [Kuwait|Land] , which led to the Gulf war .</ex>

<ex>Some towns in Russia were ravaged by [barbarian|Invader] [invasions|Target] [in the thirteenth century|Time].</ex>

name: Invasion_scenario
description: An #Invader enters a land in an attempt to dominate the #Attacked and they either fail or succeed.

name: Irregular_combatants
description:
A #Combatant is declared or loyal to a Side in a military Conflict. The #Combatant is not part of any regular or (highly) organized fighting organization (such as an army), and is not necessarily a fighter by vocation.

<ex>A [20-year=old|Age] [Argentinian|Origin] [[guerilla|Target]|Combatant] was firing at our squad.</ex>

name: Isolated_places
description:
A #Place is located far off from centers of population, culture, and/or trade.

<ex>I'm from the [[middle|Target] |Place][[of|Target] |Place][[nowhere|Target]|Place], [California|Relative_location].</ex>

name: Judgment
description:
A #Cognizer makes a judgment about an #Evaluee. The judgment may be positive (e.g. <ment>respect</ment>) or negative (e.g. <ment>condemn</ment>), and this information is recorded in the semantic types Positive and Negative on the Lexical Units of this frame. There may be a specific #Reason for the #Cognizer's judgment, or there may be a capacity or #Role in which the #Evaluee is judged.
<ex></ex>
This frame is distinct from the Judgment_communication frame in that this frame does not involve the Cognizer communicating his or her judgment to an Addressee.
<ex>JUDGMENT:  She [admired|Target] Einstein for his character.</ex>
<ex>JUDGMENT_COMMUNICATION:  She [accused|Target] Einstein of collusion.</ex>
<ex></ex>
Currently, however, some lexical units and annotation for both remain in this frame.

name: Judgment_communication
description:
A #Communicator communicates a judgment of an #Evaluee to an #Addressee.  The judgment may be positive (e.g. <ment>praise</ment>) or negative (e.g. <ment>criticize</ment>), and this is indicated by the semantic types Positive and Negative attached to the lexical units.  This frame does not contain words where #Evaluee and the #Addressee are necessarily the same .
<ex>[I|Com] [commended|Target] [his handling of the crisis|Evaluee].</ex>
<ex>[Gaston|Com] [denounced|Target] [him|Evaluee] [to the committee|Addressee].</ex>
This is distinct from the Judgment frame in that it involves the communication of an evaluation, rather than merely forming and holding a particular evaluation.

name: Judgment_direct_address
description:
In this frame, a #Communicator judges the #Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the #Addressee. The judgment is given for a particular #Reason or about a particular #Topic.

<ex>[The principal|Communicator] [rebuked|Target] [the student|Addressee] [for cheating on the exam|Reason].</ex>

name: Judgment_of_intensity
description:
A speaker characterizes the intensity of an #Attribute of an #Entity by a #Degree.

<ex>[He|Entity] has a [severe|Target] [behavioral disorder|Attribute].</ex>

name: Judicial_body
description:
A  #Source_of_authority, typically a government, relies upon a set of institutions specialized for the administration of justice. These #Judicial_body s hear cases  that originate within their #Jurisdiction and relate  to the #Task given to them by the #Source_of_authority. Often, a #Judicial_body is part of a larger system  within which its #Rank can be specified. The #Judicial_body is typically located in a specific location, the #Seat.


<ex>The [federal|Source_of_authority] [[judiciary|Target]|Judicial_body]'s certification process is the foundation of the interpreter program. [INI|Task] [DNI|Jurisdiction]</ex>

<ex>The city files an appeal with [the state's|Source_of_authority] [Eastern District|Jurisdiction] [[Court|Target]|Judicial_body] [of Appeals|Task].</ex>

<ex>The case, tried in the [US|sou] [District|Jurisdiction] [[Court|Target]|Judicial_body] [in Boston|sea], involved technical and financial issues regarding the feasibility of the project. [INI|Task]</ex>

<ex>On Oct. 31, the [Alaska|Jurisdiction] [State|Source_of_authority] [Superior|Rank] [[Court|Target]|Judicial_body] granted Chugach Electric Association's Oct. 3 request to dissolve the stay. [INI|Task]</ex>

name: Jury_deliberation
description:
The #Jury discuss the #Case and its #Charges in order to evaluate the  #Possible_sentence of the accused.

<ex>[The jury|Jury] [deliberated|Target] [his guilt|Possible_sentence].</ex>

name: Justifying
description:
An #Agent uses some #Means to explain why their #Act or omission or a #State_of_affairs they are involved in was licit despite appearances, often mentioning mitigating circumstances.  Before this occurs, the #Agent has done or omitted to do an #Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a #State_of_affairs, which a #Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.

NOTE: There is a consistent metaphorical conception of justifying as defending.  Words in the defending frame can also be used in the justifying frame.

<ex>[Kim|Agent] failed to [fully|Degree] [justify|Target] [his decision|Act].</ex>

name: Just_found_out
description:
An #Experiencer, #Expressor, or #State can be described as having a surprised emotion as evoked by a #Stimulus or concerning a #Topic.

<ex>[I|Experiencer] was [more|Degree] [shocked|Target] [about the child|Topic] [than she was|Degree].</ex>

<ex>[Mrs Nowak|Experiencer] was [surprised|Target] [by the amount of money Mills left her|Stimulus].</ex>

<ex>I think the [shock|Target] [of that recognition|Stimulus] drove me a little crazy.</ex>

name: Key
description:
This frame is for objects, physical or otherwise, which are used to grant access to some location or function.

<ex>[Robert's|Creator] [master|Type] [keycard|Target] [opens any door in the building|Function].</ex>

<ex>Robert's master [keycard|Target] opens [any door in the building|Object].</ex>

name: Kidnapping
description:
The words in this frame describe situations in which a #Perpetrator carries off and holds the #Victim against his or her will by force.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Two men|Perpetrator] [kidnapped|Target] [a Millwall soccer club employee|Victim], police said last night.</ex>

<ex>Not even the [abduction|Target] [of his children|Victim] [by Captain Hook and his scurvy sidekick, Smee|Perp], can shake Peter's scepticism.</ex>

name: Killing
description:
A #Killer or #Cause causes the death of the #Victim.
<ex>[John|Killer] [drowned|Target] [Martha|Victim].</ex>

name: Kinship
description:
This frame contains words that denote Kinship relations. In annotating the directional uses of these words, we use the standard terms from anthropology, #Ego and #Alter.  <ex>[Matilde|Alter] is [Gilberto's|Ego] [cousin|Target] [once removed|Degree]</ex>
Compare to: Appellations.

name: Knot_creation
description: An #Agent creates a #Knot (possibly in a #Place and/or with an #Instrument).<ex>[Loretta|Agent] [ties|Target] [the most beautiful bowline I've ever seen|Knot].</ex><ex>If [you|Agent] can  [tie|Target]  [a half-hitch|Knot] [around the table leg|Place] [with only that much string|Instrument]...</ex>

name: Knot_creation_scenario
description: An #Agent manipulates a long thin object (the #Rope and creates a #Knot.

name: Labeling
description:
A #Speaker uses as a #Label to refer to an #Entity. The #Label is not a conventional name for the #Entity but a description categorizing the #Entity and thereby  expressing a judgment.

<ex>[Some|spe] [labeled|Target] [him|ent] [a womanizer|lab].</ex>

<ex>During her lifetime, [her enemies|Speaker] [branded|Target] [her|Entity] [as a prostitute|Label]. </ex>

name: Labor_product
description:
An #Agent or a #Cause mentally or physically expends energy rendering an #Input, whether implicit or explicit, into a #Output.

<ex>[Erosion|Output] <m>is</m> the [work|Target] [of wind and water|Cause] [on rock|Input].</ex>

NB:  The #Input in the case of artistic #Output, or an "" artistic work"" as more commonly referred to, is usually INI, because the material at hand being rendered is usually an idea or artistic material that is taken as common foreground knowledge by the semantics of the #Agent's professional role.

<ex>One of [Chinua Achebe's|Agent] greatest [works|Target] <m>was</m> [Things Fall Apart|Output]. [INI|Input]</ex>

name: Launch_process
description:
An #Agent acts to begin the life of a [Process|Process].

<ex>[After discovering her knack for organization|Time], [she decided to try to |Agent] [launch|Target] [a career in human resources|Process].</ex>

<ex>[The City of Bratislava|Agent] has [launched|Target] [a pilot project of providing internet access in the city centre|Process].</ex>

name: Law
description:
A #Law regulates activities or states of affairs within a #Jurisdiction, dictating what #Required states should be the case and what #Forbidden states should not.  Often it also indicates negative consequences for individuals that violate it, and these negative consequences are generally enforced by some official authority.  They may or may not be created by some official legislative body.

<ex>The new [act|Target] [banning smoking in public|Forbidden] will pass soon.</ex>

name: Law_enforcement_agency
description:
A law enforcement #Agency is tasked by a government with guaranteeing compliance with the laws in a particular Jurisdiction.

<ex>She works for the [Oakland|Jurisdiction] [[police|Target]|Agency].</ex>

name: Leadership
description:
These are words referring to control by a #Leader over a particular entity  or group (the #Governed) or an #Activity. The frame contains both nouns referring to a title or position (e.g. <ment>director, king, president</ment>), and verbs describing the action of leadership (e.g. <ment>rule, reign</ment>). With verbs, it is possible to mention the #Role played by the #Leader (often a name of a leading position, e.g., <ment>king</ment>)

<ex>[Sebek em hat|lea] <m>was</m> a [Leader|Target] [of Priests|gov]. ca. 1780 BC</ex>
<ex>[In 1789|Time] [Fletcher Christian|Leader] [led|Target] [the mutiny on HMS Bounty|Activity]</ex>
<ex>[Louis XIV|Leader] [ruled|Target] [over his people|Governed] [as king|Role] [for the longest period of any European monarch|Duration].</ex>
Compare to: Appellations.

name: Leaving_traces
description:
A piece of #Evidence indicates that an #Event occured, or metonymically, #Entity had formerly existed, in a #Location.  The #Evidence consists of physical changes to the #Location that resulted from the #Event.  Some LUs of this frame are general (trace.n) while others specifically involve evidence of motion (trail.n, track.n, wake.n, contrail.n) or existence (vestige.n).

<ex>He was careful to make sure that there was no [[trace|Target]|Evidence] [of tampering|Event] [in the file|Location].</ex>
<ex>[The fugitives|Entity] left [[tracks|Target]|Evidence] [in their wake|Location] leading the authorities to their hiding spot.</ex>

name: Left_to_do
description:
A #Process of using or modifying is scheduled to be applied to a group or mass.  At a certain #Time, the #Remainder that is still left to be processed can be identified. The #Agent who is in line to work on the #Remainder is usually deprofiled but may sometimes be expressed.


<ex>[Three more cars|rem] [remain|Target] [to be fixed|Process].</ex>
<ex>We have done the first twenty so there are [only five more letters|rem] [remaining|Target] [DNI|pro]</ex>

name: Legality
description:
Words in this frame describe the status of an #Action with respect to a #Code of laws or rules. An #Object may also be in violation or compliance of the #Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.

<ex> [Illegal|Target] [drug use|Action] is on the rise. </ex>

<ex> Scores of [illegal|Target] [immigrants|Object] cross the border every year.</ex>

<ex> [Feeding the buffalo|Action] <m>is</m> [prohibited|Target] [according to Code 138|Code] . </ex>

name: Legal_rulings
description:
An #Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a #Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal #Case.

<ex>[The judge|Authority] [ruled|Target] [yesterday|Time] [that the revisions were not adequate|Finding]. [DNI|Case]</ex>

<ex>[A high court in London|Authority] [ruled|Target] [on the case|Case] [that a vulture fund can extract more than $20 million from Zambia for a debt|Finding].</ex>

<ex>[In the California case|Case], [a judge|Authority] [ruled|Target] [Oct. 12|Time] [that Tendler must pay the bloggers' legal fees|Finding].</ex>

name: Lending
description:
The #Lender gives the #Theme to the #Borrower with the expectation that the #Borrower will return the #Theme to the #Lender after a #Duration of time.  This frame differs from the Borrowing frame in that this frame profiles the Lender in active sentences, whereas the Borrowing frame profiles the Borrower.
<ex></ex>
For the time being, this frame includes both the transfer event itself and the end state of the event, as shown in the first two examples following:

<ex>[I|Lender] am [lending|Target] [a student of mine|Borrower] [my book on German modal particles|Theme].</ex>

<ex>The student has not yet given back [the book|Theme] [I|Lender] [lent|Target] [to him|Borrower].</ex>

<ex>Not only did I have to borrow a gown, but [I|Borrower] was also [lent|Target] [a jacket|Theme]! [CNI|Lender]</ex>

<ex>[I|Lender] [lent|Target] [my girlfriend|Borrower] [my car|Theme] [for the weekend|Duration].</ex>

<ex>[Jerry|Lender] [loaned|Target] [his skateboard|Theme] [to his little brother|Borrower].</ex>

name: Level_of_force_exertion
description:
An #Exerter, #Action, or #Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target. That physical force may cause deformation or breakage of, or simply motion in the receiving entity. The receiving entity is conceptually present (even if remotely), but is usually not lexically explicit. This frame covers both individual-level/static uses (""a STRONG person"") as well as stage-level/dynamic uses (""a STRONG push""). However, the durative, individual-level meaning appears more frequently in the data and seems more basic.

<ex>Eugenie loved the sea and was a [strong|Target] [swimmer|Exer].</ex>

<ex>Spartacus dealt the Roman soldier a [mighty|Target] [blow|Act].</ex>

<ex>A [powerful|Target] [force|For] tore off the tree's branches.</ex>

#Exerter, #Action, and #Force belong to a Core set.
<ex></ex>

There are several productive metaphors covered by this frame. The first and most common is one in which social influence or control is conceptualized as the physical exertion of force. The social influence/control is more specifically a propensity to cause change in social realms such as the economic, political, militaristic, cultural, or intimate:
<ex>There were theoretical limits to the [power|Target] [of the king|Exer].</ex>
<ex>Voters in the South have a [strong|Target] [incentive|Exer] to keep such Democrats in office.</ex>

Another similar metaphor is one in which psychological influence or control is understood as the physical exertion of force. The psychological influence/control includes the emotional as well:
<ex>[Poetic words in a text|Exer] can be <m>given</m> [more|Deg] [emotive|Dom] [power|Target] by using melisma.</ex>
<ex>He was a [forceful|Target] [speaker|Exer].</ex>

A third metaphor involves the amount of an entity construed as the physical force exertion of said entity. Depending on context, amount could be volume, etc. (“STRONGEST critics”; “MIGHTY uproar”).

<ex></ex>

Two related physical force dynamic frames are Level_of_force_resistance and Dynamism.
This frame is distinguished from the Level_of_force_resistance frame in that it describes the level of force <m>exertion</m> instead of the level of <m>resistance</m>, and also in that there are three categories of core FE available to the target (i.e #Exerter, #Action, or #Force), whereas in Level_of_force_resistance there are only two core FEs (i.e. Resisting_entity and Opposing_force). Of the latter frame's FEs, Opposing_force specifies the thing that the main entity resists to a level desginated by the target. Its parallel in Level_of_force_exertion is implied but backgrounded to the extent that it rarely appears as explicit lexical material; thus there is no corresponding core FE.

This frame differs from Dynamism with regard to individual-level cases; targets here express the FE's <m>capability</m>. In contrast, Dynamism targets express the FE's <m>tendency</m>. For example, ""a STRONG person"" is generally construed as a person who is <m>capable</m> of strength, while ""an ENERGETIC person"" (energetic.a from the Dynamism frame) is construed as a person who <m>tends</m> to be energetic.

However, there is overlap between the two frames in stage-level cases - ""a STRONG push"" and ""an ENERGETIC push"" seem rather comparable.

name: Level_of_force_resistance
description:
A #Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical #Opposing_force to a level specified by the target. With certain LUs (e.g. <m>impregnable.a</m>), the #Opposing_force FE is incorporated, and with many LUs, it is mostly null instantiated. This frame covers both individual-level/static uses (""the DURABILITY of jade"") as well as stage-level/dynamic uses (""the shoulder is PLIABLE after stretching""), although the individual-level meaning is the more basic and is much more prominent in the data.

<ex>The great and [impregnable|Target] [fortress|Ent] still stands today.</ex>

<ex>[His heart|Ent] is [by no means|Degree] [strong|Target], so he should ease into his exercise regime. [INI|Opp]</ex>

<ex>They were strapping athletic lads with fine belts and [sturdy|Target] [boots|Ent]. [INI|Opp]</ex>

<ex>[The staircase|Ent] <m>remained</m> [robust|Target] [under decades of heavy use|Opp].</ex>

Productive metaphors include cases where the social resistance of an entity to (an) opposing social force(s) is conceptualized as the physical resistance of an entity to an opposing physical force. More specifically, the ‘resistance’ is an entity’s propensity to resist change in social realms such as the economic, political, and cultural:
<ex>California has had (until now) a [robust|Target] [property market|Ent]. [INI|Opp]</ex>
<ex>The [durability|Target] [of the peace|Ent] will soon be tested. [INI|Opp]</ex>

Similarly, there are instances where the entity’s resistance is psychological instead of social, where ‘psychological’ subsumes emotional and other mental properties:
<ex>[The idea|Ent] <m>proved</m> [remarkably|Desc] [durable|Target].</ex>
<ex>We should remember the [fragility|Target] [of the human psyche|Ent]. [INI|Opp]</ex>
<ex>His [sturdy|Target] [resilience|Ent] to knocks and setbacks was impressive. [INI|Opp]</ex>

<ex></ex>

Compare to: Level_of_force_exertion.

name: Level_of_light
description:
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular #Location.  In some cases the #Source of light may be indicated instead of the #Location.
<ex></ex>
<ex>The small print was bearly readable by the light of the [very|Deg] [dim|Target] [torch|Source].</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>Tal flew over the barrier and into the [dark|Target] [tunnel|Loc].</ex>
<ex></ex>

The negetive LUs in this frame can be used metaphorically to describe time periods which can be characterized as bad or lacking in awareness, as shown in the following examples:
<ex></ex>
<ex>The custody of the era brought about a [dark|Target] [period during which the written word was forgotten and art had disappeared|Loc].</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>Clinton is shrewd to solidify political support during these [dark|Target] [days|Loc].</ex>

name: Light_movement
description:
