<ex>Knowing his likeness to the family of Lord Polperro [she|agt] [palmed|Target] [him|Item] [off|Target] [on them|Audience] [as a distant relative|Simulated_entity].</ex>

name: Path_shape
description:
The words in this frame describe the ""fictive"" motion of a stationary #Road.

Some of the targets cast the scene primarily in terms of the #Path_shape:
<ex>[The long mountain road|Road] [meandered|Target] [through the woods|Area].</ex>

Some of the words in this frame imply a #Source or #Goal which is expressed by a direct object:
<ex>[The path|Road] [entered|Target] [the garden|Goal] [on the west side|Place].</ex>

Other members of the frame refer to a #Direction:
<ex>Then [the path|Road] [bears|Target] [a little to the right|dir].</ex>

Yet others indicate a #Path which requires mention of a landmark:
<ex>[The otherwise arrow-straight highway|Road] veers north and [skirts|Target] [the lake|Path].</ex>

name: Path_traveled
description:
A #Path, a series of connected locations, is traversed by a #Theme, moving under its own power or under the influence of a physical force. The #Path may be described in various terms depending on whether it is bounded or not. If it is bounded, the #Path may be identified by its #Endpoints, which may be presented separately as #Source and #Goal.

<ex>For Earth, these perturbations slowly change the eccentricity of [the planet's|Theme]
[[orbit|Target]|Path] [around the Sun|Landmark].</ex>

<ex>From the eyewitness accounts, as well as satellite data, videos and photos, Brown and his team have worked out [the meteor's|Theme] [[path|Target]|pat] [through space|Ground].</ex>

<ex>Its period around Saturn is just under one Earth day, meaning that it really barrels along, to cover its [700,000 mile|Length] [[orbit|Target]|pat] in such a short time.</ex>

name: Patrolling
description:
An individual or group, the #Patrol moves through and examines a #Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally #Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous #Unwanted_entity. Rather than moving through the #Ground, the #Patrol may simply move such that all the (relevant portions of) #Ground can be observed and checked.

<ex>[Detective Jones|pat] [patrolled|Target] [the northern half of the building|gro].</ex>

<ex>[Security guards|pat] [patrolled|Target] [for intruders|unw] [while the game was in progress|tim].</ex>

name: Pattern
description:
This frame describes the interrelation of a collection of #Entities; they may be physical entities or shapes in a recognizable configuration, a pattern of events, or a relation among abstract entities.  The pattern is not the individual #Entities nor the set of #Entities, but an abstraction of their interrelations, as a gestalt.

<ex>The Cougers are playing in a [Wing-T|Name] [formation|Target] tonight.</ex>
<ex>The auditors noticed a [suspicious|Descriptor] [pattern|Target] [of withdrawals from the maintenance account|Entities] .</ex>
<ex>The digits of irrational numbers do not repeat in any kind of [pattern|Target]</ex>

name: Pay_collect_touristic_services
description: General frame in which the tourist pays the operator for a service.

name: People
description:
This frame contains general words for Individuals, i.e. humans. The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity.
<ex> A [man|Person] [from Phoenix|Origin] was shot yesterday.</ex>
<ex> She gave birth to a [screaming|Descriptor] [baby|Person]yesterday.</ex>
<ex> I study [16-year-old|Age] [female|Persistent_characteristic] [adolescents|Person].</ex>
<ex> I am dating an [African-American|Ethnicity] [man|Person].</ex>
<ex> She comforted the [terrified|Descriptor] [child|Person].</ex>
<ex> I always thought of him as a [stupid|Persistent_characteristic] [man|Person].</ex>

name: People_along_political_spectrum
description:
An #Individual belongs to a  group that is categorized in terms of the political views on particular issues that the members of the group  tend to share, in opposition to other groups that hold different beliefs on the issues. The views on particular issues that the #Individual shares with the other members are assumed to result from general principles or beliefs rather than being accidental or temporary.

<ex>[[Leftists|Target]|Individual] vow huge protests during inauguration</ex>

name: People_by_age
description:
This frame contains words for individuals as viewed in terms of their age. The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have a #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity. A specific #Age may sometimes be specified as well.

<ex>[He|Person] is a [12-year-old|Age] [kid|Target].</ex>

name: People_by_ethnicity
description: This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their #Ethnicity. The #Ethnicity is generally incorporated, but may occasionally be specified separately. The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Origin.

name: People_by_jurisdiction
description:
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, who are governed by virtue of being registered in a certain #Jurisdiction. Alternatively, they may be conceptualized with respect to their  governance by a political or religious #Authority  They may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity.

<ex>A [Somali|Ethnicity] [national|Target] entered our office.</ex>

name: People_by_leisure_activity
description: A #Person is considered in regards to some leisure activity in which she is engaged.

name: People_by_military_specialty
description:
The LUs in this frame refer to #Fighters in #Military_organizations according to their specialty in general or their function at a particular place and time. The #Fighter may be part of a nation-state's armed forces or may be a member of an irregular military organization.

<ex>The IED injured the left door [[gunner|Fighter]|Target].</ex>

name: People_by_morality
description:
This frame contains general words for Individuals, i.e. humans, whose specific acts or general behavior is evaluated against standards of morality or rightness. The #Person may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity.

<ex>Columbus: Was [he|per] a Hero or a [Villain|Target]?</ex>
<ex>There are endless disputes about this sort of thing, both in and out of the courts, because [wrongdoers|Target] will say and do anything to avoid getting punished.</ex>
<ex>There are endless disputes about this sort of thing, both in and out of the courts,
because [wrongdoers|per] will say and do anything to avoid getting punished.</ex>

name: People_by_origin
description:
This frame contains  words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their #Origin. The #Origin is generally incorporated, but may occasionally be specified separately.  The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity.

<ex>[I|Person]'m a [proud|Descriptor] [Brit|Target].</ex>

name: People_by_religion
description:
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their #Religion. The #Religion is generally incorporated, but with some lexical units it is specified separately.

<ex>The bells call the [[faithful|Person]|Target] to evensong [DNI|Religion]</ex>
<ex>A [90-year-old|Age] [[Baptist|Person]|Target] claims to have seen God personally in his backyard.</ex>

name: People_by_residence
description:
This frame contains  words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their  proximity of residence. This relationship may be defined either symmetrically (as #Residents) or asymmetrically (in terms of a #Known_resident and a #Indicated_resident).  The #Residents or the #Indicated_resident may have an #Age, #Descriptor, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity specified.


<ex>The dead included homeowner Todd Underfoot, 33, his wife Spring Back Underfoot, 32, [their|kno] [housemate|Target], [Luisa Life|ind], 46, and two of the Underfoot's three children. </ex>
<ex>[I|kno] <m>have</m> a [Swedish|eth] [[roommate|ind]|Target] that translated for me! </ex>

name: People_by_social_framing
description: This frame contains words for individuals as viewed in terms of their social conditions and their #Social_framing. The #Person is conceived of as a human being described. They may have a #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity. A specific #Age may sometimes be specified as well.

name: People_by_transitory_activity
description: This frame contains words for individuals as viewed in terms of the transitory activities they are performing. The #Person is conceived of as a human being performing a transitory #Activity. They may have a #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity. A specific #Age may sometimes be specified as well as the #Time and the #Place in which the #Person is performing the transitory #Activity.

name: frm_people_by_transit_mode
description: frm_people_by_transit_mode

name: People_by_vocation
description:
This frame contains  words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their vocation.

The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have a #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity. A specific #Age may sometimes be specified as well.

<ex>[Humphrey Bogart|Person] was a [great|Descriptor] [actor|Target].</ex>

name: Perception
description: A #Perceiver perceives a #Phenomenon. The general Perception frame is an inherited background to all frames that have to do with some sentient being responding to changes in the environment, independently of the sensory modalities.  The inheriting frames may specify the modalities (<ment>see, hear, taste, smell</ment>), or may emphasize the experiences or acts of the perceiver (<ment>peek, eavesdrop</ment>), or the properties of the perceived phenomena (<ment>clank, rattle, thump</ment>).

name: Perception_active
description:
This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.  For this reason we call the perceiver role in this frame #Perceiver_agentive.

<ex>[She|per] [gazed|Target] [upon him|Phenomenon] [fondly|Manner].</ex>

Comparing the Perception_active frame to the Perception_experience frame, we note that for some modalities there are different lexical items in each frame.  For instance, whereas Perception_active contains the verb phrase <ment>look at</ment>, Perception_experience contains <ment>see</ment>.   For other sense modalities, we find the same lexical item in both frames.  To illustrate, consider the verb <ment>smell</ment>.

This first sentence exemplifies the Perception_active use of the verb <ment>smell</ment>:<ex>[Smell|Target] [this|Phenomenon] [to see if it's fresh|Purpose].[CNI|Perceiver_agentive]</ex>
This second sentence exemplifies its Perception_experience sense:
<ex>I [smell|Target] something rotten.</ex>

name: Perception_body
description:
This frame contains words describing physical experiences that can affect virtually any part of the body. The body part affected is almost always mentioned with these words. It is typically expressed by the noun heading the external argument, and this noun is typically accompanied by a possessive determiner that refers to the possessor of the body part, as in the first example below:
<ex></ex>
<ex>[My head|Body_part] [hurts|Target]!</ex>

<ex>[Nuadu|Experiencer], [aching|Target] [in every bone|Body_part], had not made a sound.</ex>

name: Perception_experience
description:
This frame contains perception words whose Perceivers have perceptual experiences that they do not necessarily intend to. For this reason we call the Perceiver role #Perceiver_passive. Comparing the Perception_experience frame to the Perception_active frame, we note that for some modalities there are different lexical items in each frame.  For instance, whereas Perception_experience has <m>see</m>, Perception_active has <m>look at</m>. For other sense modalities, we find the same lexical items in both frames.  To illustrate, consider the verb <m>smell</m> where <m>I smell something rotten</m> exemplifies its Perception_experience use and <m>Smell this to see if it's fresh</m> exemplifies its Perception_active sense. This frame also includes words which are not specific to any sense modality, including <m>detect, perceive, perception, sense</m>.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Abashed, realising that [he|Perceiver_passive] had [overheard|Target] [her conversation with Victoria|Phenomenon], Sheeley didn't try to make excuses.</ex>

<ex>[She|Perceiver_passive] [smelled|Target] [the wine|Phenomenon] [on Paul's breath|State], and bade him to sit down.</ex>

name: Performers
description:
This frame contains words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their participation in artistic performances.

The #Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships. They may have a #Descriptor, #Origin, #Persistent_characteristic, or #Ethnicity. A specific #Age may sometimes be specified as well.

<ex>[Smithers|Person] is an [actor|Target].</ex>

name: Performers_and_roles
description:
A #Performer has a certain #Role in a #Performance and plays their part by following the directions in the #Script for that particular #Role.


<ex>[Margaret Thatcher|Performer] [played|Target] [Juliet|Role] [in a school play|Performance].</ex>
<ex>[""Pulp Fiction""|Performance] [starred|Target] [John Travolta and a lot of other big names|Performer].</ex>
<ex>[Mel Gibson|Performer] [starred|Target] [in ""Braveheart""|Performance] [as the leader of a Scottish rebellion|Role].</ex>
<ex>I play the [character|Target] [of Yusuf|Role] in this film.</ex>

name: Performing_arts
description:
The #Performers, together with behind the scenes #Personnel, execute a #Performance according to a #Script and/or #Score.  The purpose of the #Performance is to create an experience for an #Audience, who then judge its merits.  #Performances may be in many different #Mediums and be of various #Types.
This frame is very elaborate in modern society and there are a number of traditions and practices typically (but not necessarily) related to #Performances:
      The #Performance is preceded by many practice sessions in which the #Performers and other #Personnel attempt to improve the quality and/or fidelity of their individual and collective performances to the Script and/or Score.
      The #Audience members pay a fee to experience the #Performance.
      The #Performers (and #Personnel) receive payment for contributing to the #Performance.
      Often there are other individuals involved in the specifically financial aspects of the #Performance and #Performers.
      Critics act as part of the #Audience and then write reviews that evaluate the merits of the #Performance, describing the #Performance (and potentially the #Script and #Score and  contributions of other #Personnel) to other potential #Audience members.
      Due to the high quality of previous #Performances, #Performers can become famous, i.e. well known and liked.  Those who like them particularly well become fans of the #Performer.  (Shared with writers...)

name: Personality_traits
description: The words in this frame refer to attributes of people that can be treated as personality traits. They can be adjectives or abstract nouns, always related to traits inherent to the #Person.

name: Personal_relationship
description:
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal #Relationships they are or can be a part of.  Some of the words denote people engaged in a particular kind of #Relationship, others denote the #Relationship, yet others the events bringing about or ending the #Relationships. Many of the words presuppose an understanding of states and events that must have occurred before another event takes place or before a person can be classified in a certain way.
<ex></ex>
<ex>And of course that drippy [[boyfriend|Partner_1]|Target] [of hers|Partner_2] backed her up.</ex>

<ex>As the [happy|Depictive] [[couple|Partners]|Target] took their places there was a stir and a rising babble behind them.</ex>

<ex>Pattie is living proof that if you live with a man, you discover a lot you didn't know when [you|Partner_1] were just [dating|Target] [him|Partner_2].</ex>

name: Personal_success
description:
A #Person is in a state of prosperity and/or renown after some period of development or hardship in an #Endeavor.  LUs in this frame invoke a developmental path that is related to the goal one should have in a #Person, such that the #Person, after traversing a path of development (including hardship, effort, and time), completes or does not complete these goals. Note that this distinguishes an event's success in this frame from Successful_action.

<ex>[Framenet|Person] is enjoying [huge|Degree] [success|Target].</ex>
<ex>He had a long and [successful|Target] [career|Endeavor] in banking.</ex>

name: Person_deixis
description: Person deixis refers to an extratextual target (specifically a person), unlike anaphora, in which the target is found intratextually (Talmy, 2013). Each person deictic term refers to a participant in the communicative scene, and for the recognition of its target to occur, knowledge of the communicative context is necessary.

name: People_with_disabilities
description: A #Person with a #Disability who, depending on the circumstances, may need specific resources and/or legal rights capable of guaranteeing full and effective participation in society on an equal footing with other people.

name: Phenomenon
description: Phenomenon

name: Physical_artworks
description:
A physical object, the #Artifact, is produced by a #Creator to stimulate the perceptions, emotions, or cognition of an audience. Though it need not, in many cases, the created #Artifact is intended to represent an actual or imagined entity or event, the #Represented. The #Represented may be specifically shown in a particular state (#State_of_represented).



<ex>Sir Denis Mahon is the owner of the most important private collection of [Italian Baroque|Time_of_creation] [[paintings|Artifact]|Target].</ex>

<ex>He presented Eddie with a [watercolour|Type] [[painting|Artifact]|Target] and a bouquet of flowers to his wife Frances</ex>

<ex>I just took a [picture|Target] [of the screen|Represented] and plan to share it with 6.4 billion of my closest friends on the Internet tonight.</ex>

name: Physical_entity
description: An #Entity exists in some #Place at some time.

name: Piracy
description:
The words in this frame describe situations in which a #Perpetrator forcibly seizes control over a #Victim's #Vehicle to gain some end.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[French farmers|Perp] have [hijacked|Target] [a lorry|Vehicle] and destroyed its load of strawberries.</ex>

<ex>But [attackers|Perp] have [hijacked|Target] [cars waiting at traffic lights and road junctions|Vehicle] [by simply opening the passenger door, jumping in and forcing the driver to a more deserted area|Means].</ex>

name: Placing
description:
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an #Agent places a #Theme at a location, the #Goal, which is profiled.  In this frame, the #Theme is under the control of the #Agent/#Cause at the time of its arrival at the #Goal.
<ex>[David|Agent] [placed|Target] [his briefcase|Theme] [on the floor|Goal].</ex>

This frame differs from Filling in that it focuses on the #Theme rather than the effect on the #Goal entity.  It differs from Removing in focusing on the #Goal rather than the #Source of motion for the #Theme.

name: Placing_scenario
description:
This frame represents the abstract scene in which an #Agent manipulates a #Theme's location, thus affecting a #Goal which ends up co-located with the #Theme.

This frame is primarily for Inheritance.

name: Planned_trajectory
description:
A #Theme traverses a trajectory. This trajectory consists of a #Source, #Path, and #Goal. If the #Theme is sentient, the anticipated trajectory will usually be equivalent to the planned trajectory. If the the #Theme is non-sentient the anticipated trajectory will usually be the result of various forces acting upon the #Theme.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The dog|Theme] <m>went</m> that [way|Target][towards the ice cream factory|Goal].</ex>

name: Planning_by_tourist
description: The #Tourist does research about the #Place where the #Touristic_activity will take place.

name: Planting
description:
This frame describes a situation in which the #Agent puts the #Theme into the #Ground for the purpose of growing.
<ex>[He|Agent] [recently|Time] [planted|Target] [some old apple trees|Theme]. [INI|Ground] </ex>

name: Plants
description: The LUs in this frame refer to biological entities other than human beings and animals, which are labeled by the FE #Plant.

name: Point_of_dispute
description:
The answer to a #Question is under discussion in a #Group, which still  has a difference of opinion among its members. The prominence of the #Question relative to others can be indicated by a #Status expression.


<ex>Firstly, it is quite clear the [issue|Target] [in this context|con] <m>was</m> [not so much apostasy as much as it was treason|que].</ex>

<ex>The [question|Target] [in Finucane's case|con] <m>is</m> [this|que]: will an inquiry bring out the truth?</ex>

<ex>[It|Question] <m>remains</m> an [issue|Target] [of central importance to women|sta] .</ex>

<ex>Democracy in Serbia was blocked by the [unresolved|des] [national|que] [question|Target].</ex>

name: Police
description: Buildings and battalions of police forces are described in this scene. The police battalions and stations are often classified in reference to their jurisdiction.

name: Political_actions
description:
A less-powerful person or group of people (the #Activists) engages in an activity aimed to inconvenience or weaken a more powerful person or group (the #Institution) to seek redress, in the form of a series of #Demands, for the wrondgoings committed by the Instituion.
<ex>[ The workers|Activists] were [striking|Target] [for better wages and better benefits|Demands].</ex>
<ex>The [strike|Target] against [the corporation|Institution] [lasted for 6 weeks|Duration]. </ex>

name: Political_locales
description:
This frame covers words that name Locations as defined politically, or administratively.

<ex>[Berkeley|Name] is a [wonderful|Descriptor] [[city|Target]|Locale].</ex>

name: Popularity
description:
An #Evaluee, which can be a person or an object, has an amount of acceptability or utilization based on general (often non-aesthetic) desirability. The #Judge who determines the #Evaluee's desirability may be mentioned.

<ex>[Frank Sinatra|Evaluee] is [cool|Target] again.</ex>
<ex>[Web 2.0|Evaluee] is [so|Degree] [in|Target] [right now|Time].</ex>

name: Posing_as
description:
An #Agent behaves as if they were a particular individual or type of #Simulated_entity with the intent of misleading observers of their behavior.  This is generally accomplished by altering their normal appearance (especially dress), mannerisms, voice, and other observable characteristics.

<ex>[The belfast bank robbers|Agent] [posed|Target] [as police|Simulated_entity].</ex>

<ex>[These groups|Agent] are [masquerading|Target] [as mainstream groups|Simulated_entity], yet after taking a closer look you see they are the most extreme.</ex>

name: Position_on_a_scale
description:
This frame contains words that describe an #Item's static position on a scale with respect to some property #Variable.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Dried fruits|Item] <m>are</m> especially [high|Target] [in fibre|Variable], as are pulses.</ex>

<ex>Despite the fact that [the local land|Item] <m>was</m> [[rich|Value]|Target] [in silver|Variable], by 1865 most of the mining traffic through Las Vegas was of propectors headed to California or Northern Nevada in search of gold.</ex>

name: Possession
description:
An #Owner has (or lacks) a #Possession.
<ex></ex>
<ex>The river's part of my  manor, but of course [it|Possession] also [belongs|Target] [to the River Police|Owner].</ex>

<ex>It's a nuisance having to abandon [my|Owner] [[belongings|Possession]|Target], though.</ex>

name: Possibility
description:
A #Possible_event is deemed to have all pre-conditions satisfied; in other words, it has some probability of occurrence, if some (generally implicit) further #Condition pertains.  The #Condition, whether overt or implicit, often concerns the decision of an agent to attempt to bring the #Possible_event about. The primary implication is that certain other aspects of the situation that might have been expected to prevent the #Possible_event, usually lack of capability or permission, do not pertain.

<ex>[You|Possible_event] [ca|Target] n't [burn glass|Possible_event] . [INI|Condition]</ex>
<ex>[You|Possible_event] [can|Target] [have two more|Possible_event] [if you want|Condition] .</ex>
<ex>[This sense of lack|Possible_event] [can|Target] [never|Condition] [be satisfied|Possible_event] .</ex>
<ex>[We|Possible_event] just [ca|Target] n't [stand it|Possible_event] [anymore|Time] . [INI|Condition]</ex>

This frame is confusable with the Capability frame, which specifically involves an Agent who is presented as needing only the decision to perform an Action in order to successfully perform the Action.

name: Posture
description:
An #Agent supports their body in a particular #Location.  The LUs of the frame convey which body part is the #Point_of_contact where the #Agent is supported, what orientation the body is in, and some overall arrangement of the limbs (especially the legs) and the torso.

<ex>[He|Agent] [knelt|Target] [down|Location], [hand on heart|Depictive] .</ex>

name: Post_getting
description: The stage after which the #Recipient has acquired the #Theme.

name: Post_giving
description: The stage immediately after the #Donor gives the #Recipient the #Theme, i.e. when the #Recipient has possession of the #Theme and the #Donor no longer does.

name: Post_lose_possession
description: The subframe of Relinquish in which the #Owner (= Donor) no longer has the #Possession (=Theme).

name: Post_receiving
description: The state-of-affairs immediately after the #Recipient has come into possession of the #Theme offered by the #Donor.

name: Post_transfer
description: The stage after the #Theme is in the possession of the #Recipient.

name: Practice
description:
An #Agent enacts an #Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later #Occasions.  The goal of practicing is to ensure that the action at the later #Occasion(s) comes off flawlessly.

<ex>[I|Agent] [practiced|Target] [my song|Action] [for the play|Occasion].</ex>

name: Praiseworthiness
description:
The #Behavior of an #Evaluee is described in terms of the reaction it deserves from somebody, such as praise, blame or admiration.

<ex>It was [honorable|Target] [of you|Evaluee] [to help that person|Behavior].</ex>

name: Prank
description:
A #Joker, by means of a #Prank, arranges to deceive a #Victim, with the result that some harm or embarrassment comes to the #Victim.

<ex>[They|jok] always <m>play</m> [[pranks|Target]|pra] [on me|vic].</ex>

name: Precariousness
description:
A #Theme has the potential of falling from its current #Location, which would likely result in damage.

<ex>Now, [balanced|Target] [easily and firmly|Manner], [he|Theme] stood on the ledge outside in the slight, chill breeze.</ex>

<ex>[A ball|Theme] will sit there [perfectly|Degree] [balanced|Target] [on a jet of water (or air)|Location].</ex>

<ex> [Joey|Theme] [teetered|Target] [into him|Result] [sometimes|Time], losing his balance from extreme exhaustion. </ex>

name: Precipitation
description:
Water in some solid or liquid form (the #Precipitation) falls from the sky at a particular #Place and #Time, lasting for a particular #Duration.  The #Rate or #Quantity of precipitation may also be indicated.

<ex>It [rained|Target] [in Berkeley|Place] [yesterday|Time].</ex>

name: Predicament
description:
An #Experiencer is in an undesirable #Situation, whose #Explanation may also be expressed.

<ex>[The insurers|Exp] <m>ended up</m> <m>in</m> the [bind|Target] [of having to pay 15 years' taxes|Sit].</ex>

<ex>[He|Exp] <m>was</m> <m>in</m> a bit of a [[pickle|Target]|Situation] and make no mistake!</ex>

<ex>What a [[mess|Target]|Situation] [we|Exp] <m>'re</m> <m>in</m> [now|Time]!</ex>

name: Predicting
description:
A #Speaker states or makes known a future #Eventuality on the basis of some #Evidence. Instead of (or in addition to) a #Speaker, a #Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a more general #Topic may be stated instead of an #Eventuality.

<ex> [The Weather Centre|Speaker] [predicted|Target]  [that it would be warmer but wet for the weekend|Eventuality].</ex>
<ex>[Another seer who|Speaker] [forecast|Target] [a Tory majority|Eventuality] -- without compromising his impartiality -- was Sir Robin Day .</ex>
<ex>[Based on current calculations|Evidence], [the European market|Eventuality] is  [forecast|Target] [to grow 18.1% by the end of next fiscal year|Eventuality].</ex>
<ex>[The website|med] claimed to [prophesy|Target] [what the world would be like in the near-future|top].</ex>

name: Preference
description:
An #Experiencer has a greater desire to participate in some #Event, as against another (contextually recoverable) event which exhibits a specific #Contrast with the #Event. Alternatively, the #Experiencer may have a greater desire that some #Focal_participant participate in the #Event. The #Location_of_event may also be mentioned.

<ex>[Why|Explanation] do [women|Experiencer] [prefer|Target] [manly faces|Focal_participant]?</ex>
<ex>[I|Experiencer] [prefer|Target] [open source programs|Focal_participant] [over proprietary ones|Contrast].</ex>
<ex>[Other customers|Experiencer] [prefer|Target] [to send us an order together with a cheque|Event].</ex>
<ex>[I|Experiencer] [prefer|Target] [my tartar sauce|Focal_participant] [on fish|Location_of_event].</ex>

name: Preferred_alternative_scenario
description: In this scenario, there are two mutually incompatible scenes, the #Profiled_possibility and the #Opposite_possibility, leading respectively to a preferable #Positive_consequence and a dispreferable #Undesirable_consequence.

name: Preliminaries
description:
This frame describes means actions (#Preparatory_acts) that are taken by an #Agent for the purpose of preparing for a later act.

Contrast this frame with a scenario involving earlier versions of some entity being superseded by later versions (e.g., <ment>preliminary results, advance copy</ment>).

<ex>[This update|Preparatory_act] <m>lays</m> the [groundwork|Target] [for future improvements|Purpose].</ex>

name: Presence
description:
An #Entity exists at a particular #Location, at a particular #Time, as observed by an implicit observer. A #Depictive and/or #Duration phrase is often found.

This frame differs from Existence in that the #Location is profiled as a ground where an observer is conceived of as confirming the #Entity's existence.

<ex>[Liquid water|Entity] <m>was</m> [present|Target] [on the surface of Mars|Location] [billions of years ago|Time].</ex>

<ex>[Urate|Entity] <m>was</m> [present|Target] [in varying concentrations|Depictive] [in the bathing solution only|Location].</ex>

<ex>[No one|Entity] <m>was</m> [present|Target]. [DNI|Location]</ex>

<ex>[Your|Entity] [presence|Target] is appreciated. [DNI|Location]</ex>

In some cases, the #Location may be recoverable from phrases that primarily express peripheral information:

<ex><m>Was</m> [the senator|Entity] [present|Target] [for the committee vote|Duration]?</ex>
<ex>Was the senator [present|Target] [for the committee vote|Location]?</ex>

name: Presentation_of_mitigation
description:
A  #Mitigating_situation is presented as occurring against the backdrop of a more preferable situation and a less preferable situation that, while expected, feared, or hoped for, did not or will not occur; the #Mitigating_situation is thus, so to speak, sandwiched between a better and a worse situation, both of which are relevant in the discourse. Understanding the #Mitigating_situation is therefore dependent on understanding the better and the worse situations, one or the other or both of which normally have already been mentioned or strongly evoked in the discourse. The relation of the #Mitigating_situation to these situations may be filled in by discourse-level inference, as in the first example below, or implied by contrastive intonation, as in the second example.

<ex>[At least|Target] [I don’t have to go to school|MS].</ex>

<ex>[|MS]<m>Ava</m>, [anyway|Target], [knew who he was|MS].</ex>

When the [Mitigating_situation|MS] clause involves a negation, like in the first example above, the non-negated form is generally taken to be the worse situation - potentially also in combination with previous discourse context. (i.e. Perhaps there's been a blizzard.  The better situation is that a blizzard did not occur.  The mitigating situation is that a blizzard occurred, but I don't have to go to school.  The worse situation would be that a blizzard occurred, and I also have to go to school.)
<ex></ex>
Targets in this frame frequently occur in constructions that obscure the full <ex>#Mitigating_situation:</ex>

<ex>There will be no exceptions -- [not for you|Mitigating_situation], [at any rate|Target].</ex>
In this example, there is a fragment ellipsis construction that depends on the semantics of the immediately preceding context.
<ex></ex>
Lexical Units of this frame also frequently occur with the use of <m>or</m> that conveys a speaker self-correction or hedge. The function of this sort of <m>or</m> is to introduce contradictory possibilities without endorsing any of them.  In combination with targets of the Presentation_of_mitigation frame, <m>or</m> joins a clause that represents the better situation to a second clause (or fragment) marked with an LU of this frame, with the overall intent of saying that even the less preferable alternative is still suitable to carry forward the point that the speaker wishes to express:
<ex>She traveled, and [now she is back here to transform|MS] our drab little lives, <m>or</m> [at any rate|Target], [our drab furniture|MS].</ex>
<ex></ex>
The humorous point in this example is that, even if their drab lives are not transformed (the better situation), at least their drab furniture will be, while the worse situation is that everything simply remains drab.  Note that this example, and most examples involving <m>or</m>, occur with the Shared_completion construction, meaning that two parts of the sentence have to be annotated: the shared part of the first clause and a fragment directly marked with a Presentation_of_mitigation LU.
<ex></ex>
This frame is to be distinguished from two related frames, Concessive and Conditional_scenario. In Concessive and its daughter frames, either a Main_assertion or a Conceded_state_of_affairs FE (or both) are present, and both FEs, even though seemingly contradictory, are simulateously true. Here, however, only the #Mitigating_situation actually occurs. Targets in this frame may be embedded in larger Concessive constructions, such as the below with <m>although</m>, where the better situation is made explicit (in negated form):
<ex>[Although|Target] <m>she’s not my favorite</m>, a new actress has won this time [in any case|Target].</ex>

In Conditional_scenario, a Profiled_possibility and its Consequence, as well as an Opposite_possibility and its Anti_consequence, can be presented. Neither of the possibilities is asserted as true, nor is a desirability scale with better and worse ends evoked.

<ex>[If|Target] it rains, the ceremony will be under the tent.</ex>
<ex>[Unless|Target] you read carefully, you won't understand what I said.</ex>

name: Preserve
description: An #Agent or a #Cause causes a #Patrimony to remain in its original form or in a good state

name: Preserving_materials
description: In this frame an  #Agent preserves a #Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.   A #Medium may be used.   <ex>[Bill|Agent] [mummified|Target] [John|Patient].</ex>  <ex>[Tess|Agent] [pickled|Target] [the beets|Patient]  [in vinegar|Medium].</ex>  <ex>[The Smiths|Agent] [dried|Target] [the apples|Patient].</ex>

name: Prevarication
description:
A #Speaker communicates about a #Topic in such a way as to mislead an #Addressee, either by telling outright lies or by presenting a message in a misleading form.

<ex>[I|Speaker] [lied|Target] [to you|Addressee] [about your Christmas present|Topic].</ex>

name: Preventing_or_letting
description:
A #Potential_hindrance or an #Agent (via their actions) keeps an #Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the #Event, do not do so. Lexical units which indicate that the event is not prevented, e.g. allow.v, are marked with the semantic type ""Negative"".  Some lexical units, like [avert|Target] and [avoid|Target] indicate that the #Potential_hindrance or #Agent would have been affected if the #Event occurred.

<ex> [Rain|Potential_hindrance] [prevented|Target] [the ball game|Event] [from taking place|Event].</ex>

<ex> [He|Agent] could have [stopped|Target] [the riot|Event] .</ex>

<ex> [The government|Potential_hindrance] narrowly [averted|Target] [a coup|Event] . </ex>
<ex>[She|Potential_hindrance] [allowed|Target] [more than a few mistakes|Event] [to happen|Event] .</ex>
<ex>[Technology|Potential_hindrance] has [permitted|Target] [firms|Event] [to link together more closely|Event].</ex>
<ex>Unlike DOS , [Windows|Potential_hindrance] [lets|Target] [you|Event] [get on with something else|Event] [when sending a fax|Time].</ex>
<ex>[Liberalization|Potential_hindrance] [allows|Target] [easier entry into particular markets|Event] .</ex>
<ex>[Mesh|Potential_hindrance] [allows|Target] [the water|Event] [to circulate normally through the aquarium|Event].</ex>

<ex></ex>

Unlike in the Thwarting frame, the #Potential_hindrance or #Agent does not directly prevent the actions of an individual, but rather affects the world in such a way that an #Event cannot occur.

name: Prevent_or_allow_possession
description:
An #Agent or #Potential_hindrance keeps a #Protagonist from having a #State_of_affairs that they need or desire, or, despite the possibility of preventing the possession, they allow the #Protagonist to have the #State_of_affairs.

<ex>[His parents|Agent] [deprived|Target] [him|Protagonist] [of food|State_of_affairs] [for days on end|Duration].</ex>

<ex>[Our lonely city|Potential_hindrance] [starves|Target] [us|Protagonist] [of original live music|State_of_affairs].</ex>

<ex>[Employees|Protagonist] were [denied|Target] [overtime pay and meal breaks|State_of_affairs]. [CNI|Agent] </ex>
<ex>[Allow|Target] [me|Protagonist] [just one more cupcake|State_of_affairs] ! [CNI|Agent]</ex>

name: Pre_getting
description: The state of the #Recipient prior to the acquisition, i.e. before the #Recipient gains possession of the #Theme.

name: Pre_giving
description: The stage of giving just before the #Donor discontinues possession of the #Theme, yielding it to the #Recipient.

name: Pre_lose_possession
description: Subframe of Relinquish where the #Owner (=Donor) has the #Possession (=Theme).

name: Pre_receiving
description: The state-of-affairs immediately before the #Recipient gets the #Theme which describes the #Recipient's possession of the #Theme.

name: Pre_transfer
description: The stage before the transfer has taken place, with the #Theme in the possession of the #Donor.

name: Price_per_unit
description:
A #Product is offered by a #Seller at a particular #Price such that some total cost for the #Buyer in the transaction is a multiple of the #Price.

<ex>[Additional|Descriptor] [telephone|Product] [rates|Price] may apply.</ex>

name: Prison
description:
This Frame deals with #Penal_institutions. They are run by an #Operator and may be intended to hold certain kinds of #Inmates.  #Penal_institutions may have a special #Name and their #Location may also be indicated.

<ex>He's in [Pelican Bay|Name] [state|Operator] [penitentiary|Target].</ex>

name: Probability
description:
This frame characterizes the likelihood that a #Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable. The likelihood can expressed as numerical #Odds or a metaphorical representation of the #Position on a scale.

<ex>There's a [20 %|Position] [chance|Target] that you'll succeed.</ex>
<ex>The [odds|Target] that he'll actually do it are [one in a million|Odds].</ex>

name: Process
description:
This frame describes a complex event which lasts some amount of time, consisting of a beginning stage, a stage where the process is ongoing, and a finish or end.  In some cases the process may pause, and then possibly resume.

In this frame and its subframes, the distinguished argument is a #Process, and there is no reference to an Entity which undergoes this #Process or an Agent which initiates this #Process.

In formal terms, this frame refers to an overall controller x-schema (Narayanan 1997) with subframes corresponding to parts of the x-schema.

<ex>I'm in the [process|Target] [of writing it down|Process].</ex>

name: Processing_materials
description:
An #Agent alters some #Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical #Alterant.  Typically, this involves placing a reagent in contact with the #Material, or applying heat, pressure, etc.  Often a specific #Agent and/or #Result is mentioned. The #Alterant is often incorporated in the target, as in <ment>tin.v, galvanize</ment>.  (The Preserving frame is a special case of Processing_materials, in which the #Material is immersed in the #Alterant for the Purpose of preventing decay.)  Processing_materials is distinguished from Filling in that the #Material in Processing_materials is fundamentally altered (often chemically), rather than simply being covered with a different substance.
<ex>[Native Americans|Agent] [dyed|Target] [textiles|Material] [with dyes made from cedar strips|Alterant].</ex>
<ex>[Watering cans|Material] are often [[galvanized|Alterant]|Target] [to prevent rust|Purpose].</ex>

name: Process_completed_state
description:
A #Process is finished and can no longer proceed.

<ex>[The project|Process] is [complete|Target].</ex>

name: Process_continue
description:
An #Event continues at a certain #Place through #Time.  (Note that often when 'continue.v' occurs with definite time points, it denotes Resumption, which is out of frame here.)
NB:  Refer to Process frame.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Pyongyang agreed to suspend its withdrawal while [talks|Event] [continued|Target] [with Washington|Event].</ex>

<ex>[Missions and different plans|Event] [proceed|Target] [according to Islamic law provision|Manner].</ex>

name: Process_end
description:
A #Process comes to an end.

<ex>[The project|Process] [came|Target] [to|Target] [a|Target] [close|Target].</ex>

name: Process_initial_state
description:
The initial State of an Entity in an event; part of the Event X-schema.
NB:  Refer to Event frame.

name: Process_pause
description: The #Process stops making progress towards completion, but should resume and continue.

name: Process_resume
description:
An event resumes at a certain #Place and #Time.  NB:  Refer to Event frame.

<ex></ex>
<ex>[Both matches|Process] will [resume|Target] [tomorrow|Time], [after a day of rest|Time].</ex>

<ex>[Negotiations between Israel and the Palestinian authority|Process] have [resumed|Target].</ex>

name: Process_start
description:
An #Event begins at a certain #Time and #Place.  An #Explanation may also be indicated.  NB:  Refer to Event frame.

<ex>[The project|Event] [began|Target].</ex>

name: Process_stop
description:
A #Process stops at a certain #Time and #Place.  An #Explanation may also be specified.  A #Duration may be included in order to indicate the length of the persistence of a paused state before action resumes.  NB:  Refer to Process frame.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The strident, static-like hiss|Process] [ceased|Target] [abruptly|Manner].</ex>

<ex>[The use of railway-owned vehicles on aggregates traffic|Process] [ceased|Target] [altogether|Degree] [in 1989|Time].</ex>

name: Process_stopped_state
description:
The State of an Entity after an Event has stopped, i.e. part of an X-schema.
NB:  Refer to Event frame.

name: Process_uncompleted_state
description: A #Process is in a state where it can no longer be completed.

name: Procreative_sex
description: This frame exists to define a type of Sex where the intended result is procreation.

name: Product_delivery
description: In order to facilitate the purchase of #Goods which start off in a location distant from a #Purchaser, a #Deliverer transports and hands off the #Goods to a #Purchaser or (more indirectly) a #Goal location which is accessible to the #Purchaser.

name: Product_development
description:
An #Developer develops a #Product, in some cases for a #Company.
<ex></ex>
<ex>The [development|Target] [of a profitable product|Product] will be necessary for the company to stay afloat. [INI|Dev]</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Heinrich|Dev] will [develop|Target] [a great new product|Product] [for Apple|Company] [someday|Time]. </ex>

name: Product_development_scenario
description: An [Developer|Dev] works to create progress on an #Entity.  The #Entity typically goes through three stages of development: the conceptual process (Achieving_first); the development process (Product_development); and the manufactuing process (Manufacturing).  The Entity can also undergo additional processes such as designing, engineering, prototyping, and testing.

name: Product_line
description:
A specified #Designer or a #Brand creates and distributes a #Collection of related #Products. The individual #Products may all be part of a set or may just be related by season or other arbitrary reason.

<ex>The [new|Desc] [Gucci|Brand] [[line|Target]|Coll] is due out in early Spring.</ex>

<ex>He gave her the entire [Oscar de la Renta|Brand] [spring|Desc][[collection|Target]|Coll] for her birthday.</ex>

<ex>[Clorox|Brand] now <m>produces</m> a [[line|Target]|Coll] [of eco-friendly cleaning products|Products].</ex>

<ex>[Her|D] [new|Desc] [product|Products] [[line|Target]|Coll] turned out to be a wild success.</ex>

name: Progression
description:
An #Entity changes from a #Prior_state to a #Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.  The change is usually assumed to be an improvement for the #Entity. Because this frame is describing change according to some known model of the #Entity, the #Prior_state and #Post_state are backgrounded, and often implicit.

<ex>[Their offensive armament|ent] has [developed|Target] [from short range missiles|pri] [to long-range ballistic weaponry|pos] in a relatively short period .</ex>
<ex>The [maturation|Target] [of warhead technology|ent] is, perhaps, not far off .</ex>
<ex>[Recovery in our major overseas markets|ent] has [progressed|Target] [tentatively|man] and increased spending by consumers and government does not appear to be benefiting this</ex>
<ex>[Why|Explanation] have [we|ent] [developed|Target] [economically|dom] [as we have|man]?</ex>

This frame is not equivalent to the frame Improvement_or_decline for two reasons.  Firstly, Progression implies a smooth or multi-stage change involving several different states of the #Entity in an expected sequence, while Improvement_or_decline may be simple or complex, in accord with an expected sequence or not.  Secondly, progression along an expected sequence does not necessarily mean that things get better (or worse) for the #Entity.  This is clear in the case of progression of a disease, since different ailments have very different expected sequenes, with initial onset leading to expected disappearance (for cases like the cold), or to permanent impairment (in the case of Parkinsons), or to death (in many forms of cancer).  However, it is more confusing in the very common case of the progress of a biological #Entity from birth to death, where this frame often emphasizes the phases of the lifespan where the organism increases in ability, thus reaching a more desirable state.  Plans are also spoken of as progressions, and because the expected sequence is towards the goal of the agents that formed the plan, these uses of the progress frame also emphasize improvement.

name: Prohibiting_or_licensing
description:
In this frame a #State_of_affairs is prohibited (or allowed) by a #Principle. Raising constructions are common in this frame. Because laws and principles usually focus on what is not allowed, the words of this frame that are synonyms of prohibit.v are considered more basic, and the words that are synonyms of permit.v are marked with the semantic type ""Negative"".

<ex> [Guns|State_of_affairs] were [prohibited|Target] [in the airport|Place] .</ex>
<ex> [Code 1425|Principle] [bans|Target] [large trucks|State_of_affairs] [in the tunnel|Place].</ex>
<ex> [Children|State_of_affairs] were not [permitted|Target] [in the office|State_of_affairs]. [CNI|Prin]</ex>
<ex> [Code 1425|Principle] [allows|Target] [us|State_of_affairs] [to deduct interest payments|State_of_affairs].</ex>
<ex>[No religion|Principle] [accepts|Target] [discrimination against women|State_of_affairs].</ex>

In this frame the #Principle which prohibits the #State_of_affairs is not an agent who denies permission to a specific individual or group of individuals, and thus differs from the Authority in the Deny_or_grant_permission frame.

name: Project
description:
An #Agent, which may be an individual or group, is engaged in a complex #Activity.  A larger #Goal which motivates the #Agent carrying out the #Activity may be indicated. Instead of a particular  #Activity, a #Field of endeavor may be indicated. The project may also have a #Name and the #Time when as well as the #Place where it is ongoing may be specified.

<ex>The [New Car Assessment|act] [Program|Target] (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.</ex>

<ex>The school will continue with [its|age] [project|Target] [to end all violence related to racism, xenophobia and intolerance|goa].</ex>

name: Proliferating_in_number
description:
The number of entities that make up the #Set changes from an #Initial_number to a #Final_number. Alternatively, the situation can be described in terms of an #Initial_state and a #Final_state. In some cases the #Attribute (i.e., number) or #Difference in number may be mentioned.


<ex> How has the [proliferation|Target] [of cellular telephones|Set] affected your amateur mobile operation? [INI|inis] [INI|finis]</ex>

<ex>[The number of rural poor|Set] has [dwindled|Target] [from some 250 million|inis] [to 26 million|finis].</ex>

<ex>[Problems in the banking industry|Set] [proliferated|Target] [dramatically|Degree] [in the 1980s|Time].</ex>

name: Prominence
description:
An #Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.

<ex>[Pilot Mountain in NC|Entity] <m>is</m> [very|Degree] [prominent|Target].</ex>

<ex>First, from the Saturday images, the most [prominent|Target] [feature|Entity] is a
sharp spike emerging from the tailward side of the nucleus.</ex>

<ex>I was left with a deep and [conspicuous|Target] [scar|Entity] (about 10cm long) which felt uncomfortably tight and itchy.</ex>

name: Proper_reference
description:
A speaker marks explicitly that he intends to describe an #Entity in a more restricted sense than it was used in the immediately preceding discourse, and that therefore his #Intended_referent is different from the one that the hearer might have picked out based on the way the #Entity label was previously used.

<ex>Of these, nowadays there are 308 within the [city|Entity] [proper|Target], and 534 if suburbs are included.</ex>
<ex>Of these, nowadays there are 308 within [the city PROPER|Intended_referent], and 534 if suburbs are included.</ex>

<ex>The writing in the WSJ is always excellent, with the majority of its writing
staff located in [New York|Entity] [proper|Target].</ex>
<ex>The writing in the WSJ is always excellent, with the majority of its writing
staff located in [New York PROPER|Intended_referent].</ex>

<ex>Israel Radio said Israel would turn over the [town|Entity] [itself|Target], while agreeing to resume discussions over the surrounding villages in two weeks.</ex>
<ex>Israel Radio said Israel would turn over [the town ITSELF|Intended_referent], while agreeing to resume discussions over the surrounding villages in two weeks.</ex>

name: Proportion
description:
#Criteria exist that identify a particular #Subset of a #Group of things into members and non-members. In this frame, a comparative relationship is determined which indicates the size of the #Subset relative to the larger #Group, expressed as the #Ratio.

<ex> Urban areas have> a [higher|Descriptor] [teen|Subset] [suicide|Criteria] [[rate|Ratio]|Target] than rural areas. </ex>

name: Proportional_quantity
description:
The #Denoted_quantity is (generally) an imprecise characterization of the quantity of #Individuals or a #Mass, made with reference to a relatively easily and precisely imaginable #Reference_quantity.

<ex>It took [[about|Denoted_quantity]|Target] [three|Reference_quantity] [hours|Individuals], but we 're done now.</ex>
<ex>But there were [[barely|Denoted_quantity]|Target] [300|Reference_quantity] in the whole district. [DNI|Individuals]</ex>
<ex>Put in right [[around|Target]|Denoted_quantity] [a pinch and a half|Reference_quantity]. [DNI|Mass] </ex>
<ex>She waited [[a good|Denoted_quantity]|Target] [second|Individuals] before knocking.</ex>
<ex>She waited [a good|Target] [second|Reference_quantity] before knocking.</ex>

name: Protecting
description:
Some #Protection prevents a #Danger from harming an #Asset.

<ex>[The rubber on her sneakers|Protection] [protected|Target] [her|Asset] [from the mud|Danger].</ex>

<ex>[The coral reefs|Protection] [shielded|Target] [the coastline|Asset] [from the worst of the waves|Danger].</ex>

<ex>[A growing number of sustainable farmers|Protection] are preserving agricultural variety and [protecting|Target] [biodiversity|Asset] [by raising ?heritage? or ?heirloom? varieties|Means].</ex>

<ex>[The man responsible for this entire ordeal|Protection] [cowardly|Event_description] [shielded|Target] [himself|Asset] [from justice|Danger] [with the little boy's struggling body|Instrument].</ex>

name: Protest
description:
A #Protester (or #Protesters) expresses a strong opinion either in support of or against an #Issue, or the #Action(s) of a #Side which relate to the #Issue. The public expression of support or opposition often involves multiple #Protesters participating in an orginized assembly in a public area.

<ex>[Several hundred Tibetans|pro], already worried by inflation, took to the streets to [protest|Target] [at the new measures|Action].</ex>

<ex>Fourteen people were killed in the [demonstration|Target] [for the unemployed|Issue].</ex>

name: Provide_lodging
description:
A #Host provides a temporary #Residence for a #Lodger.

<ex>[We|Host] [housed|Target] [her|Lodger] [in our home|Residence] [for a while|Time].</ex>

name: Proximity_image_schema
description: A #Profiled_region is picked out which is near to the #Ground to a certain #Degree.  (For LUs marked with the semantic type Negative, the #Profiled_region is the region which is far from the #Ground.) The #Profiled_region cannot contact or overlap the location of the #Ground, as contact, in English, is a categorically different situation--see Contact_image_schema and Collocation_image_schema.

name: Public_services
description:
This frame concerns permanent organizations (the #Institutions) that are intended to help members of the #Target_group in a particular #Domain with a #Service_action.  Most or all relevant members of the #Target_group have a direct relationship with the #Institution.

<ex>[The Red Cross Tracing and Message Service|ins] <m>is</m> a [service|Target] [for finding and reuniting families separated by war and disaster|ser].</ex>

<ex>First and foremost, [Radio-Canada|Institution] <m>is</m> a [public|Target_group] [service|Target]. </ex>

<ex>The [California|tar] [Child Protective|ser] [[Service|ins]|Target] investigated the family based on a complaint filed by the son's former principal.</ex>

name: Publishing
description:
A #Publisher makes a #Work of an #Author (or authors) available to some public #Audience for general enjoyment, examination, and reference. The #Medium of a #Work can vary; examples include books, TV programs, movies, and radio shows. Publication normally involves a number of other events, such as editing and advertising of the #Work, and mass production and sales of a represenation of the #Work; thus in the most elaborated version of publication, there are a number of other potential roles, such as editor, publicist/advertizer, distributor, printer, etc., but none of these show up as separate, syntactically distinguished roles for the LUs in this frame.

<ex>[Doubleday|Publisher] is [publishing|Target] [my newest novel|Work] [next week|Time].</ex>
<ex>[I|Author] 'm [publishing|Target] [my next one|Work] [with Random House|Publisher] .</ex>

name: Punctual_perception
description:
A #Perceiver briefly perceives a #Phenomenon, often resulting in partial or uncertain perception.  A #Body_part that enables the perception may be mentioned, either metonymically replacing the #Perceiver or in addition to the #Perceiver.

<ex>[I|Perceiver] 've been waiting here to <m>catch</m> a [glimpse|Target] [of the snow leopard|Phenomenon] for seven hours.</ex>
<ex>If you go in there, [you|Perceiver] 'll [get|Target] an [eyeful|Target]. [INI|Phenomenon]</ex>

name: Purpose
description:
An #Agent wants to achieve a #Goal,  or an object.  A #Means  has been created or is used to allow the creator or a user to achieve a  #Goal. The #Goal is a state of the world that does not currently hold but which the #Agent wants to realize and is planning and/or working towards. In some cases, it is difficult to decide whether a noun phrase metonymically stands for the #Agent or the #Means (e.g. The goal [of this paper/seminar/project] is to determine ...). We mark these phrases as #Agent on the first layer but also annotate them as #Means on a second annotation layer.

In some cases a #Restrictor on the #Goal state of affairs can be given prominence as a separate constituent. Talking about #Goals frequently includes the mention of a #Domain to which the #Agent's #Goal is relevant.

<ex>The modest [American|Agent] [goal|Target] [of a threefold increase in capacity|Goal] recognises this fact .</ex>
<ex>The [object|Target] [of the tutorial|Means] <m>is</m> [to help a student concentrate on his writing skills|Goal] </ex>
<ex> The prime [goal|Target] [of the programme|Means] <m>was</m> [to help develop processes of scientific thinking in children|Goal] .</ex>
<ex>[My|Agent] [goal|Target] [in this book|Means] <m>is</m> [to introduce the reader to Web programming applications|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[The president's|Agent] [economic|Domain] [goal|Target] [for the country |Restrictor]<m>was</m> [to overcome the recession|Goal].</ex>

name: Putting_out_fire
description: An #Agent causes a #Fire to no longer burn.

name: Quantified_mass
description:
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a #Mass or of #Individuals. As opposed to aggregate words such as group, set, these #Quantity do not have a status as Wholes on their own.

<ex>He found them in the [[deluge|Target]|Quantity] [of papers|Individuals] on his desk.</ex>

Initially, at least, we have annotated both #Quantity of #Masses and of #Individuals in this frame, though we may split the frame along these lines later on.

name: Quantity
description:
This frame contains nouns denoting [Quantities|Quantity] of a specified #Entity and their numerical [Values|Value].  Note that the nouns in this frame DO NOT convey a gradable amount on thier own.
<ex>His heart attack was caused by a [high|Descriptor] [cholesterol|Entity] [[level|Target]|Quantity].</ex>
<ex>His [cholesterol|Entity] [level|Quantity] <m>was</m> [124 mg/dL|Value].</ex>

name: Quarreling
description:
A group of #Arguers (also expressible as #Arguer1 and #Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an #Issue.

<ex>[We|Arguers] [bickered|Target] [about semantics|Issue] [for an hour|Duration].</ex>

name: Questioning
description:
The words in this frame have to do with a #Speaker asking an #Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the #Addressee).
<ex></ex>
<ex>[We|Speaker] [asked|Target] [Ruby|Addressee] [what kind of food they ate|Message].</ex>

<ex>[Yeats|Speaker] was able to [interrogate|Target] [the spirit world|Addressee] [about his relationship with Maude|Topic].</ex>

name: Quitting
description:
An #Employee voluntarily leaves the service of an #Employer.

<ex>[Leah|Empee] [quit|Target] [her job|Position] [after one month|Time] [because of an evil force|Explanation].</ex>

<ex> It's Time for [Glenn Hubbard|Empee] to [Quit|Target] [as CEA Chair|Position]</ex>
<ex>[Its chief executive officer|Emper] has [resigned|Target] [amid a reorganization that will also eliminate about 20 percent of its work force|Explanation].</ex>
<ex>[Its chief executive officer|Position] has [resigned|Target] amid a reorganization that will also eliminate about 20 percent of its work force.</ex>
<ex>You should fill in your name, the defendant's name, and [the date and time|Time] [you|Emper] [gave|Target] [notice|Target]. [DNI|Position]</ex>

name: Quitting_a_place
description:
A #Self_mover leaves an initial #Source location.  The #Path by which the Self_mover departs, and the #Intended_goal of the #Direction may also be mentioned.  In many words which evoke this frame, there is an additional implication that the #Self_mover is discontented with the #Source location.

<ex>[I|Self_mover] [left|Target] [San Francisco|Source] [for Vancouver|Intended_goal].</ex>

name: Race_descriptor
description:
This frame covers LUs that describe the race of a #Person.

<ex>[Carlos|Person] is [hispanic|Target], or so he says.</ex>

name: Raising
description: Raising

name: Range
description:
There is a certain physical #Distance within which some other entity can participate in an #Event (typically perception or manipulation) with the #Participant.  Alternatively, the #Event may be indicated metonymically by a #Instrument .  [Note the connection with *Distance, Sufficiency, and Capability.  Words in this frame can generally be paraphrased ""close enough to be able to"".]

<ex>I'm sorry, but he was well within the [blast|eve] [[range|dis]|Target].</ex>
<ex>They are now within [our|par] [missile|ins] [[range|dis]|Target].</ex>
<ex>They are now within [our missile 's|par] [[range|dis]|Target].</ex>
<ex>They are now within [missile|ins] [[range|dis]|Target].</ex>
<ex>But then they passed out of [my|par] [[earshot|dis]|Target]. [INC|ins]</ex>
<ex>I would consider [striking|eve] [distance|Target] to <ment>be</ment> [about two meters|dis] for this weapon.</ex>
<ex>Jordanian troops came within easy [[strike|dis]|Target] of Israel.</ex>

name: Rank
description:
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.

<ex>[His|Item] [rank|Target] is [colonel|Rank].</ex>

name: Ranked_expectation
description:
An #Entity is rated as unexpected for its context in terms of its magnitude.  Either some different type of #Entity with a different scope would be expected, or a different amount of the #Entity.

<ex>The [entire|Target] [apple|ent] was riddled with worms .</ex>
<ex>The inevitable fate of the Warsaw Resistance fighters was not finally sealed until nine [whole|Target] [weeks|ent] of vicious fighting had taken a terrible toll on the people .</ex>

<ex>A [mere|Target] [two percent|ent] of Afghan women are registered to vote.</ex>
<ex>The crime scene doesn't wrap up in an hour, never mind an [entire|Target] [investigation|ent] . </ex>
<ex>It 's a huge engineering project when you 're building a [whole|Target] [car|ent] .</ex>
Although there are some words that overlap between this frame and Completeness, the words in this frame indicate specifically that the magnitude of the #Entity is different from what is expected, rather than grading an entity as to whether all its parts are present.  The Ranked_expectation uses must occur with an explicit or implicit quantification.  The Completeness uses can only occur with entities that have salient necessary parts and structure.

name: Rape
description:
The words in this frame describe situations in which the #Perpetrator has sexual intercourse with the #Victim forcibly (or by threatening the use of force) and without his or her consent.
<ex></ex>
<ex>Does the press make it more difficult for [raped|Target] [women|Victim] to obtain justice?</ex>

<ex>[On their third|Time] date [he|Perp] took her back to his surgery and [raped|Target] [her|Victim].</ex>

name: Rashness
description:
A #Protagonist performs some #Action without fully considering the circumstances under which he or she acts, or the possibly (negative) consequences of the #Action.  Alternatively, the #Action itself may be portrayed as having been performed under rushed circumstances.

<ex>Would it <m>be</m> a little [impatient|Target] [of me|pro] [to ask when an album might appear|act]?</ex>
<ex>He was quick to move, alert and forceful, as [he|pro] <m>was</m> [impetuous|Target] [in attacking an enemy|act]</ex>

name: Rate_description
description:
The LUs in this frame describe the level that a #Rate, or the variation in some quantity over a period of time, deviates from the norm. The focal #Event for which the #Rate is relevant may be profiled as metonymically referring to the #Rate of the #Event. This frame differs from Rate_quantification in that it does not describe the #Rate with a specific numerical designation.

<ex>The [rapid|Target] [increase in obesity|Event] is a major cause of concern.</ex>
<ex>Such systems have a [very|Degree] [rapid|Target] [rate|Event] of recovery.</ex>

name: Rate_quantification
description:
An #Event occurs that can be characterized by a given #Rate. The #Rate is a ratio of how much a particular quantity changes over time. #Degree compares the the given #Rate with a standard or expected rate for a similar #Event. The Agent is a participant in the event who is responsible for the #Rate.
<ex></ex>
<ex>We compared the [evolutionary|Event] [[rates|Rate]|Target] [of the two different species of monkey|Entity].</ex>
<ex>[Graduation|Event] [[rates|Rate]|Target] have not gone up in the last decade.</ex>

name: Ratification
description:
A #Ratifier responds to a #Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the #Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.

<ex>The [ratification|Target] [of the Kyoto protocol|Proposal] has been a long, hard slog.</ex>
<ex>[The US|rat] is considering [ratifying|Target] [the cybercrime treaty|pro]. </ex>
<ex>[The Malaysian government|rat] will [ratify|Target] [the UN's anti-smoking programme|pro] by the end of the year. </ex>

name: Reading_activity
description:
A #Reader visually examines a #Text, typically in a linear order, to understand its content.  In place of the #Text, a #Topic may be mentioned.

<ex>[She|Reader] ca n't [read|Target] . [INI|Text]</ex>
<ex>[They|Reader] [read|Target] [the bible|Text] [nightly|Frequency] .</ex>
<ex>[I|Reader] 've [read|Target] [about you|Topic] !</ex>

<ex></ex>
This frame differs from the Reading_perception frame, which obligatorily focuses on the perceptual and cognitive interpretive aspects of reading; unlike Reading_activity, targets in Reading_perception require explicit mention of the #Text being examined.  While Reading_activity is broad enough to cover the same circumstances as Reading_perception, it also covers situations where reading is contrasted merely with another task or leisure activity, when reading is considered generically, and when the #Topic unifying the reading activity replaces mention of a #Text.
<ex></ex>
Additionally, this frame differs from Hearsay in that Reading_activity is focused on what the #Reader is agentively doing, whereas in Hearsay, the focus is on what the Hearer knows and how they know it.  As a result, most valences are unambiguous: full clause complements for the Message point to the Hearsay frame, while #Text or lack of any complement indicates the Reading_activity frame.  The only overlap is in the case of #Topic, where the frames can be still distinguished by factivity of the #Topic.  In other words, read.v used in the Hearsay frame, just like hear.v in the Hearsay frame, when used with a #Topic, indicates clearly that there is some specific fact related to the #Topic that the reader or hearer now knows and understands. Thus the first and second of the following sentences belong to Hearsay, the last to Reading_activity:
<ex>Yes, I [read|Target] about how you won teacher of the year .</ex>
<ex>I just [read|Target] about the accident .</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>I was [reading|Target] about dinosaurs all day.</ex>

name: Reading_aloud
description:
A #Speaker interprets a written #Text and speaks the contents, usually to an #Addressee. The contents may be the #Text verbatim or a representation of the text.

<ex>I do think [they|Speaker] [read|Target] [to them|Addressee] [when they are little|Time]. [INI|Text]</ex>

<ex>[Inside the flat|Place] [a fruity voice|Speaker] was [reading|Target] [out|Target] [a list of figures which had something to do with the production of the pig-iron|Text]. [DNI|Addressee]</ex>

name: Reading_perception
description:
The #Reader attends to a #Text to process its information.  Sometimes a particular kind of #Sought_phenomenon is sought in the #Text.
<ex></ex>
The metaphor which allows motion verbs plus ""through"" to express reading (e.g. ""went through the text"", ""slogging through the phonebook"", ""sped through the dialogue passages"") is considered to be productive, and thus should be annotated in the Motion frames.  The metaphor applies most productively to motion verbs that do not specify motor program and either specify no manner information at all (e.g. ""go"") or only specify the manner of motion in terms of difficulty and/or speed (""slog"", ""speed""), although other verbs with specific information (""saunter"", ""swim"") may occur in more colorful usage.

<ex>[I|Reader] [read|Target] [A Tale of Two Cities|Text] [last night|Time].</ex>

name: Reason
description:
A volitional  #Agent is responding to a #State_of_affairs by performing some #Action.

<ex>And <m>was</m> [that|State_of_affairs] [your|Agent] [reason|Target] [for becoming an actor|Action] ?</ex>
<ex>But [Giles|State_of_affairs] <m>is</m> the [reason|Target] [that I am here|Action] .</ex>
<ex>Oh [my|Agent] [reason|Target] [for including it|Action] <m>was</m> [Section fifty four A|State_of_affairs].</ex>

name: Reasoning
description: An #Arguer presents a #Content, along with #Support, to an #Addressee.  The #Content may refer elliptically to a course of action or it may refer to a proposition that the #Addressee is to believe.  Some lexical units (e.g. ""prove"") indicate the speaker's belief about the #Content.<ex>Jan [argued|Target] [that the evidence was inadmissable|Content].</ex><ex>Jan [argued|Target] [against the admissability of the evidence|Content].</ex><ex>Jan [proved|Target] [ that the evidence was inadmissable|Content].</ex>

name: Reassuring
description:
A #Speaker conveys a #Message to an #Experiencer in order to reassure them about a #Situation; #Medium and the #Means of the communication also may be expressed.

<ex>[We|Speaker] [reassured|Target] [him|Experiencer] [that his decision was sound|Msg].</ex>

name: Rebellion
description:
An individual or group, the Rebel, rejects the authority of the Current_leadership, and attempts to bring them out of power. The rebellion may, but need not be violent. Rather than expressing rebellion against the Current_leadership, the lexical units in this frame may appear with expressions describing the Current_order, the system of rule which the Rebels reject.

<ex>In 1641 there was a [Catholic|reb] [rebellion|Target] [against the Protestants of Ulster|curl], and English authority over the island was shaken.</ex>

<ex>How do they justify [their|reb] [armed|mea] [insurgency|Target]?</ex>

name: Receive_visitor_scenario
description: A (potential) #Visitor arrives at a location associated with a (potential) #Host. The #Host permits the #Visitor to enter the location, and allows the #Visitor to avail him/herself of available resources, in order to pursue some goal. The visit is often for social or entertainment reasons. After a temporary stay at the #Host's location, the #Visitor departs.

name: Receiving
description:
A #Recipient comes into possession of the #Theme as a result of the joint action of the #Donor and the #Recipient.  The Receiving frame like the Giving frame requires that the #Donor first has possession of the #Theme and that following the transfer, the #Donorno longer has the #Theme and the #Recipient does.

<ex>[I|Recipient] [recieved|Target] [a box|Theme] [from him|Donor] [in the mail|Means].</ex>

name: Receiving_scenario
description: The sequence beginning with the #Recipient not having the #Theme and ending with the #Recipient in possession of the #Theme.

name: Reciprocality
description:
This frame characterizes states-of-affairs with #Protagonists in relations with each other that may be viewed symmetrically.  When the #Protagonists are equally prominent, each equally serving to identify the others, they are expressed together as #Protagonists.  When one of the #Protagonists serves to define the other (more or less as a Ground), it is called #Protagonist_2, and the other is called #Protagonist_1 (i.e. the Figure).
<ex></ex>
This frame exists as a background for a number of lexical frames, including Chatting, Similarity, Exchange, and Being_attached.  The most basic frames inheriting from this one are symmetrical states.  (For example, Being_attached is symmetrical, since if A is attached to B, B is attached to A.)
<ex></ex>
Other frames exhibiting reciprocality either have a causative/inchoative relation to such a stative frame (e.g. Becoming_attached), or are stative-like summarizations of multiple events of the same kind.  This second type, in which events are performed reciprocally, with two equal participants acting on each other, can be exemplified by the Chatting frame in which two people are effectively both speakers and addressees in a joint act of communication.
<ex></ex>
The basic characteristic of this frame, inherited in the daughters, is the equivalence of #Protagonist_1 + #Protagonist_2 to #Protagonists, and the further equivalence (modulo figure/ground profiling) of the following:
<ex></ex>
#Protagonist_1 <ment>Relation</ment> with #Protagonist_2.
<ex></ex>
#Protagonist_2 <ment>Relation</ment> with #Protagonist_1.
<ex></ex>
#Protagonists <ment>Relation</ment>.

name: Recording
description:
An #Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a #Phenomenon. Alternatively, the #Agent records that an #Entity had a particular #Value for one of its #Attributes.

<ex>[While visiting in Port Alberni, the day before he was diagnosed,|Time] [we|Agent] [recorded|Target] [him|Phenomenon] [to have 14 drinks and go to the bathroom 10 times|Phenomenon].</ex>

<ex>[William Hickey's death|Phenomenon] is not [recorded|Target]. [CNI|Agent]</ex>

<ex>[The voter turnout|Attribute] was [recorded|Target] [as over 90 percent|Value]. [CNI|age]</ex>
<ex>...... [voter|Entity]</ex>

<ex>[A number of US expressions of alarm presented during those weeks to the Israeli
government|Phen] were [registered|Target] [in the premier's diary|med]. [CNI|age]</ex>

name: Records
description:
A #Record that contains a permanent account of #Data.  This #Record may be maintained by a #Recorder for a certain #Entity.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The bank's|Entity] [[books|Record]|Target] were not accurate.</ex>

<ex>He made notes of the subject's responses in the [[journal|Record]|Target] by the desk.</ex>

<ex>[She|Recorder] <m>kept</m> a [[record|Target]|Record] [of how many times Steven had asked her for money|Data].</ex>

name: Recovery
description:
These words describe the recovery or healing of a #Patient from an #Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).
<ex></ex>
<ex>[My injuries|Affliction] had not yet [completely|Degree] [healed|Target].</ex>

<ex>[Henley MP Michael Heseltine|Patient], [recovering|Target] [from a heart attack|Affliction] got a very public get well card.</ex>

name: Redirecting
description:
An intentional #Agent or a causing event (#Cause) event causes a #Theme which is already in motion to take a different #Path or #Direction, or reach a different #Goal than the #Original_path.

<ex>The hotel business didn't last - especially after [the construction of a railroad|Cause]
[diverted|Target] [travelers|Theme] [a few miles west to what is now the village of Eagle|Goal]</ex>

<ex>[Pakistan government officials|Agent] helped and [diverted|Target] [the trucks|Theme] [to another camp in the no-man's land in Mach|Goal].</ex>

<ex>[Prior to the arrival of the president's motorcade|Time], [the police|Agent] [redirected|Target] [the protesters|Theme] [away from the main road|Direction]once more.</ex>

name: Referees
description: The referee and his assistants - or linesmen - are responsible for ensuring that the match happens according to the rules of the game.

name: Referee_actions
description: The actions taken by the #Referee during the match.

name: Reference_text
description:
In a text, a #Source_of_information is given that provides a reader of the text with further #Information relevant to the text. In this frame the author and reader are completely deprofiled, with the #Source_of_information made salient.

<ex>In Densmore's days it was sometimes made of an old-fashioned man's celluloid collar ([cf.|Target] [Densmore 1943: 116|soi]).</ex>

<ex>The 'foaming regions' play the role of 'internal shocks' ([cf.|Target] [Piran's recent publication|soi] [for a review|inf]) of GRB theory.</ex>

<ex>Use my() for local variables whenever you can get away with it (but [see|Target] [perlform|soi] [for where you can't|inf]).</ex>

name: Reference_universe
description: Reference_universe

name: Referring_by_name
description:
A #Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a #Name to refer to an #Entity.   The #Entity often is an interlocutor but may be somebody that the #Speaker is talking about, or even just a physical object. Note that we include titles such as ""Sir"" in the #Name category.
