<ex>They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which [he|spe] [addressed|Target] [her|ent] [as Windflower|nam]. </ex>

<ex>[We|spe] always [called|Target] [her|ent] [""my lady,""|nam] from the moment that she was put at the head of our section;</ex>

<ex>[Sharpton|spe] [called|Target] [him|ent] [Obama Baracka|nam] in HIS speech .... of all the people to screw his name up! </ex>

<ex> And then in private [he|spe] [called|Target] [me|ent] [""Sausage""|nam], which really pissed me off. </ex>

<ex>I found out that [her|Speaker] [name|Target] [for Barack|Entity] <m>was</m> [Obama|Name] .</ex>

<ex> [Advanced Micro Devices|spe] is going to [call|Target] [its next chip|ent] [the Athlon 4|nam]</ex>

name: Reforming_a_system
description:
Because it no longer functions adequately under the given circumstances, an #Agent (or non-Agentive #Cause) undertakes steps to change the structural makeup of a complex #Entity with interdependent parts, for instance an institution or a system of laws. The #Degree of change is typically gradual and partial rather than revolutionary and total. Note that with some LUs the #Entity can be unexpressed when it is identical to the #Agent.

<ex>[They|Agent] want to [reform|Target] [the law on Sunday trading|Entity].</ex>
<ex>At the same time , [the government|Agent] [reformed|Target] [the rating system as it applied to companies|Entity].</ex>

<ex>This study investigates [how|Manner] and [why|Explanation] [the majority of large Slovak companies|Agent] [restructured|Target] [without the help of foreign investors or a government|Means]. [DNI|Entity]</ex>

name: Regard
description:
A #Cognizer has a #Judgment of an #Evaluee, expressing how high or low their regard for the #Evaluee is.

<ex>[What|jud] do [you|cog] [think|Target] [of him|eva] [as a linguist|rol]?</ex>
<ex>[She|cog] [secretly|man] [thought|Target] [well|jud] [of him|eva] [for his role in defrocking Mr. Matthews|rea].</ex>
<ex>Please understand, [I|cog] <m>hold</m> [you|eva] <m>in</m> the [highest|jud] [regard|Target].</ex>
<ex>[My|cog] [low|jud] [opinion|Target] [of him|eva] was of long standing.</ex>

name: Region_with_portal
description: A Portal, #Exterior, #Surface, #Boundary, and #Interior are picked out relative to a #Ground.

name: Reject_leadership
description: An #Agent (usually a group) refuses to follow the orders and demands of the #Old_leader and attempts to bring about a situation where the #Old_leader no longer has their leadership #Role. In some cases, the #Agent has a specific #New_leader that they wish to fill the #Role, but sometimes there is no clear #New_leader.

name: Rejuvenation
description:
The action of an #Agent or the occurrence of a #Cause event returns an #Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.

<ex>[Falling prices and wireless connectivity|Cause] have [breathed new life|Target] [into the PDA market|Entity]. </ex>


<ex>While [Paul Reubens|Agent] [resuscitates|Target] [his career|Entity], Pee-wee fans use the Web to keep the 'adventure' alive.</ex>


<ex>[Athens' democracy|Entity] was [unexpectedly|eve] [reinvigorated|Target] [by its great defeat|Cause].</ex>

name: Relating_concepts
description:
A #Concept_1 is related to #Concept_2 by some #Evidence.

<ex>[The single remaining piece of evidence|Evidence] [linked|Target] [Kirov the tailor|Concept_1] [to Kirov the dissident activist|Concept_2].</ex>

<ex>There is [ample data|Evidence] [relating|Target] [earnings|Concept_1] [to years of schooling.|Concept_2]</ex>

name: Relation
description:
A relation holds between #Entity_1 and #Entity_2.

<ex>I see no [relation|Target] [between these animals|Entities].</ex>

name: Relational_location
description: This is a general frame that identifies a #Profiled_region whose configuration is specified by an image schema (specified in more specific child frames) and located relative to a #Ground.

name: Relational_natural_features
description:
The #Focal_feature is defined in relation to a #Landmark_feature, either as a particular part, or as an immediately bordering entity.

<ex>I'm on the [summit|Target] [of Mt. Shasta|Landmark_feature].</ex>

name: Relational_political_locales
description:
A #Locale is defined politically to be the head of state of another, larger political locale, the #Container_possessor.

<ex>She had repeatedly been to the [[capital|Locale]|Target] [of the nation|Container_possessor], and there had met with a reception none too cordial.</ex>

<ex>He decided to stay in the [[capital|Locale]|Target] [of Iraq|Container_possessor] for two months while he recuperated to fight another day.</ex>

<ex>The largest city in the area, [Oakland|Locale] <m>is</m> the [county seat|Target] [of Alameda county|Container_possessor].</ex>

name: Relational_quantity
description:
A quantity, the #Numerator, can be understood in terms of how it relates to another quantity, the #Denominator; the comparison of these two numbers is called the #Rate. The nouns in this frame may denote the #Rate unless the referent is specifically expressed. This frame is a general description of the relationship between any two dependent quantities; children of this frame may describe situations in which the scale of the #Numerator and/or the #Denominator is fixed.

<ex>I'm not paying the [high|Descriptor] [interest|Type] [[rates|Target]|Rate].</ex>

<ex>The nest egg is going to be taxed at a [federal|Type] [rate|Target] [of about 55 percent|Rate].</ex>

<ex>This assumption is commonly adopted in statistical models that are used to estimate the [transmission|Type] [[rate|Target]|Rate] [of HIV|Focal_entity].</ex>

name: Relation_between_individuals
description: Two sentient beings have a permanent or semi-permanent #Relation to each other.  This relation may be symmetrically construed as between the #Individuals or it may be construed assymetrically, such that #Individual_1 is identified by their relation to the (implicitly better-known) #Individual_2.

name: Relative_time
description:
These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.  There are two major types of relations evoked by the words of this frame.
<ex></ex>
Some of the words (e.g. <ment>follow.v, antecedent.a, previous.a</ment>) describe the (definitively) stative relationship between two events (the #Landmark_occasion and the #Focal_occasion).  This first type will be moved to the Time_vector frame.

<ex>[After|Target] [she arrived|Landmark_occasion] , [she laid out her papers on the desk|Focal_occasion].</ex>
<ex>The [following|Target] [morning|Focal_occasion], she tried to figure out what it meant . [DNI|Landmark_occasion]</ex>

<ex></ex>
Others (e.g. <ment>belated.a, early.a</ment>) refer to the change or deviation of an event from the #Landmark_occasion (which is expected or usual at a particular time) to the #Focal_occasion (which occurs at a different time).  Quite often, a #Focal_participant who is saliently involved in the #Focal_occasion stands in for the occasion.

<ex>[My flight|Focal_occasion] is [early|Target] [by 20 minutes|Interval].</ex>
<ex>[I|Focal_participant] 'm [late|Target] [for my departure|Landmark_occasion] !</ex>

name: Releasing
description:
A #Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a #Theme from the #Location_of_confinement. The release is in accord with the plans of the #Captor.

<ex>[They|Captor] [released|Target] [me|Theme] [from prison|Location_of_confinement] [on New Year's Day|Time].</ex>

name: Releasing_from_custody
description: The #Authorities release a #Suspect who has been held under suspicion of having committed a crime.

name: Reliance
description:
A #Protagonist needs a #Means action performed for their #Benefit.  The relevant #Means action is often evoked only by reference to  an #Intermediary who performs it. Also, if the #Protagonist performs the #Means action themselves, the #Instrument that they use may be referred to in place of the #Means Note that when one of the three interrelated FEs #Means, #Instrument and #Intermediary is realized overtly, the other two are blocked from overt realization as clause-level arguments of the target.<ex></ex>

When the #Protagonist is a sentient being, it is implied that they put their trust in the #Intermediary to help in the achievement of the #Benefit.

The extent to which the #Protagonist is dependent on an #Intermediary or #Instrument can be indicated in a #Degree phrase.<ex></ex>

A set of  #Circumstances in which the #Protagonist's need for the #Benefit arises, may also be specified. <ex></ex>


The difference between the #Benefit that the #Means action provides and the #Purpose that the #Protagonist has is very subtle. For our purposes we will assume that one can form a predication from #Benefit and #Means on the one hand, and #Protagonist and #Purpose on the other, but that they cannot be intermingled (cf. examples (7) and (8) below). With for-PPs such as in (6) it is not clear which FE they instantiate, #Benefit or #Purpose. We will arbitrarily call them #Benefit<ex></ex>


<ex>(1) [I|Protagonist] [rely|Target] [on you|Intermediary]  [to see that my name is not sullied|Benefit].</ex>

<ex>(2) [The system|Protagonist] can [rely|Target] [entirely|Degree]  [on coaxial cable|Instrument] or entirely on optical fibre, just as a tree and  branch network can be based on either technology .</ex>

<ex>(3) The Tories had got him into this and [he|Protagonist] [relied|Target]  [on them|Intermediary] [to get him out|Benefit].</ex>

<ex>(4) I knew [we|Protagonist] could [rely|Target] [on you|Intermediary].  [DNI|Benefit] </ex>

<ex>(5) [To get the economy moving|Benefit] [he|Protagonist] will [rely|Target] [on repairing the infrastructure of America|Means]</ex>

<ex>(6) Later , when the Northern Ireland Office was established , [it|Protagonist] [relied|Target] [heavily|Degree] [on it|Intermediary]  [for the information on which it based security and political activities|Benefit].</ex>

<ex>(7) [She|Protagonist] would have to [rely|Target] [on his help|Means] [to get through the fight in one piece|Purpose].  --  She got through the fight in one piece/*His help got through the fight in one piece</ex>

<ex>(8) [I|Protagonist] [rely|Target] [on his help|Means] [to get me through a long season|Benefit] -- His help got me through a long season/*I got me through a long season </ex>

<ex>(9) [We|Protagonist] [rely|Target] [on your helping us|Means] </ex>


<ex> (10) You can [rely|Target] on him [when the chips are down|Circumstances] to inspire the troops</ex>

name: Reliance_on_expectation
description:
A #Cognizer takes a certain #Expectation to be a reliable fact, such that their plans can be based on it.

<ex>[I|Cognizer] can always [count|Target] [on|Target] [him being late to work|Expectation] [when it's raining|Circumstances].</ex>

name: Religious_belief
description:
A #Believer has faith in a piece of #Content or an #Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith. The #Content is not necessarily tied to direct sensory experience. The system of beliefs may be enshrined by the members of a social group

<ex>Do [Muslims|Believer] [believe|Target] [in the virgin birth of Jesus?|el]</ex>
<ex>[Muslims|Believer] [believe|Target] [in only One God, the same God that Jews and Christians believe in|el], but some of the ideas about the nature of God are different</ex>
<ex>[Muslims|Believer] [believe|Target] [that the month of Ramadan is the holiest month of the year|Content]</ex>

name: Remainder
description:
A #Resource is depleted by some process, resulting in there being only a #Remainder in existence some time into or after the process. The original #Resource may be indicated metonymically via reference to an #Original_owner. The #Location where the #Resource is found may be expressed.

<ex>There are only [two poems|rem] [left|Target] [from Quayle|oo]</ex>
<ex>After the storm, [only two houses|Remainder] were [left|Target]
[DNI|res]</ex>
<ex>[Not much|rem] was [left|Target] [in the till|loc]</ex>
<ex>[Nothing|rem] [remained|Target] [for the youngest brother|ben] [from the inheritance|res]</ex>
<ex>[Only this school|rem] is [left|Target] [from the 1970|oc]s; all the other ones are newer.</ex>

name: Remembering_experience
description:
A #Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past #Experience or an #Impression of a #Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience. The #Cognizer may also remember  the #Salient_entity in a particular #State, which serves as a frame of reference in the #Cognizer's mind.   When attention is focused on a #Salient_entity, then mention of a global #Experience is excluded and typically, but not always, either a #State or #Impression of the #Salient_entity is presented.

<ex></ex>
Episodic memory is the  explicit memory of events. It includes time, place, and associated emotions (which affect the quality of the memorization). Episodic memory contrasts and interacts with semantic memory, the memory of facts and concepts. The Remembering_information frame is concerned with this latter type of memory.


<ex>[Kozmo|cog] could [remember|Target] [when his modem was the fastest he could buy|exp].</ex>

<ex>That's probably before my time, which was long time ago, [Fish|cog] may [remember|Target] [that time|exp].</ex>

<ex>[Who|cog] [remembers|Target] [me being a total dork and going up to everyone saying ""Hey, I'm Ashley Hunt from Chicago""|exp]!?!</ex>


<ex> I wanted to [remember|Target] [how good that felt|exp].</ex>

<ex>Hummel says [staff, both students and professional,|cog] [remember|Target]
 [her|sal] [as a ""very good friend, available for new staff and well-respected by everyone.""|imp]</ex>


<ex>Somehow [I|cog] [remember|Target] [him|sal] [as older, with long eyelashes, and doe eyes|imp].</ex>

<ex>When he died he was just a kid himself but for some reason at the age of 44 [I|cog] still [remember|Target] [him|sal] [as older than me|sta]. </ex>

<ex>Retro games are great, but a lot of the time [people|cog] get clouded by nostalgia and [remember|Target] [them|sal] [to be better than they really were|sta]</ex>

<ex>[He|cog] [remembered|Target] [him|sal] [as a kindly man but not a very lively one.|imp] </ex>

<ex>[The part|exp] [I|cog] [vividly|viv] [remember|Target] was about a South Seas tramp steamer captain . </ex>

name: Remembering_information
description:
A #Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.  The #Mental_content may be presented in clearly propositional form as a finite clause. It may also take the form of an embedded question or be a concealed question in the form of a simple NP.


<ex> I was impressed that [she|cog] 'd actually [remembered|Target] [Radish 's name|men] (= what Radish's name is) </ex>

<ex>Oh, and for those who like to continually whinge about how the French are 'surrender monkeys' - [remember|Target] [Napoleon|men] (= who Napoleon was)?</ex>

<ex> [I|cog] ca n't [remember|Target] [what  DSP stands for|men].</ex>

<ex>And [Bill|cog] can [still|tim] [remember|Target] [the pattern|men] (= what the pattern is). </ex>

<ex>[What|men] do [you|cog] [remember|Target] [about your grandma|top]?</ex>

<ex></ex>
Notice that this frame is very general. It can be used to talk about detailed reports of past experience.

<ex>I don't know if I lost consciousness for a while. But I [remember|Target] [that I was lying in the middle of the road with people trying to assist me|men].</ex>

<ex></ex>

Notice that #Mental_content reported within this frame is presented as factive, i.e. as reliable and accurate. Consider the following contrasts:

<ex>1a. I [remember|Target] her as selfish--but I might be wrong.</ex>
<ex>1b. ??I [remember|Target] that she was selfish--but I might be wrong.</ex>

<ex>2a. Bill [remembers|Target] her as smarter than she is.</ex>
<ex>2b.*Bill [remembers|Target] that she is smarter than she is.</ex>

The (b) sentences, which belong in this frame, are less acceptable than the (a)-sentences as they suggest  that the #Cognizer  takes their memory to be accurate while suggesting at the same time that the memory might be or is inaccurate. In the (a) sentences, which belong to the Remembering_experience frame, there is no contradiction as the remembering is taken to be subjective and not necessarily accurate.
<ex></ex>
The concealed question uses with personal names that occur in this frame are not always easy to distinguish from instances of the Remembering_experience frame where a Salient_entity alone is referred to in 3a and 3b, which belong to the Remembering_experience frame, there is no question of identity: remembering here means thinking of one's memories of the relevant person. 3c is different: the hearer is asked whether they know who the person is; it belongs in this frame.

<ex>3a. I [remember|Target] her fondly</ex>
<ex>3b. Please take a moment to [remember|Target] Caesar and his Family.</ex>
<ex>3c. Do you [remember|Target] [Alexander the Great|men]? He was one of history's most prolific conquerors, and he did it all in his twenties.</ex>

<ex></ex>
This frame differs from Remembering_to_do in that this frame is strictly talking about a fact, whereas the Remembering_to_do frame is strictly about tasks which the #Cognizer would be expected to do.  Remembering_to_do uses normally occur with infinitival complements.

name: Remembering_to_do
description:
A #Cognizer thinks of and performs an #Action that is a self- or other-imposed task or some other kind of desirable behavior. The #Action may involve a #Salient_entity in some way affected by the #Cognizer. If a #Salient_entity is mentioned, the #Action is left unexpressed.


<ex>You invited everybody but you [forgot|Target] [Harry|sal].</ex>

<ex>Thank God [Smithers|cog] [remembered|Target] [to return the video.|act].</ex>

<ex>If you [forget|Target] [your textbook|sal] and there is an assignment to be done, the highest grade you will receive on the work is aC (70%).</ex>

<ex>Did [you|cog] [remember|Target] [about the letter|sal]?</ex>

name: Removing
description:
An #Agent causes a #Theme to move away from a location, the #Source.  The #Sourceis profiled by the words in this frame, just as the #Goal is profiled in the Placing frame.

<ex>I saw that [several men in dark suits|Agent] had [removed|Target] [all of the evidence|Theme] [from the scene|Source].</ex>
<ex>[With your index finger|Means] [prise|Target] [the meat|Theme] [out of the shell|Source]</ex>
<ex>[The torrential winds|Cause] [dislodged|Target] [most of the roof tiles|Theme].</ex>

name: Removing_scenario
description: The abstract scene in which an #Agent affects a #Source and a #Theme so that the #Theme ends up not co-located with the #Source.

name: Render_nonfunctional
description:
An #Agent affects an #Artifact so that it is no longer capable of performing its inherent function.

<ex>[I|Agent] [broke|Target] [the TV|Artifact].</ex>

name: Renting
description:
A #Lessee gains the use of #Goods owned by a #Lessor by payment to the #Lessor.

<ex>[We|Lessee] are [renting|Target] [our apartment|Goods] [from a kind man named Tom|Lessor].</ex>

name: Renting_out
description:
A #Lessor who owns some #Goods allows a #Lessee to use the #Goods temporarily in exchange for #Money.

<ex>[I|Lessor] [rented|Target] [my cabin|Goods] [to him|Lessee].</ex>

name: Renunciation
description:
A #Speaker declares that they will no longer be involved with the #Content.  Such a declaration implies that the #Speaker has decided that association with the #Content is somehow undesirable.

<ex>That will only be possible if and when [the IRA|spe] [renounces|Target] [armed struggle|con].</ex>

name: Repairing
description: Repairing

name: Reparation
description:
The words in this frame describe the process of making amends for some (wrongful) action (the #Injury) committed by the #Wrongdoer.  In this process, in order to appease the #Injured_party or to follow laws or customs, the #Wrongdoer performs some #Benefiting_action for the #Injured_party or gives the #Injured_party some #Gift.

<ex>[I|Wrongdoer] will [make|Target] [it|Injury] [up|Target] [to you|Injured_party].</ex>
<ex>Sinn Fein said that [the marchers|Wrongdoer] had to <m>make</m> [restitution|Target] [to the Catholics|Injured_party] [for the disruption and violence|Injury].</ex>
<ex>[The tribesmen|Wrongdoer] tried to <m>make</m> [amends|Target] [to us|Injured_party] [with handfuls of their most precious seashells|Gift].</ex>

name: Repayment
description:
A #Debtor gives a #Loaner #Money in return for having borrowed #Money at an earlier time. Alternatively, the type of #Loan can be expressed as the object of repayment.

<ex>[I|Debtor] am [paying|Target] [back|Target] [$2,000|Money] [of my student loan|Loan] [to the government|Loaner].</ex>

name: Repel
description:
A #Defender successfully repels the aggressive attempt of takeover by an #Enemy.

<ex>[We|Defender] [repelled|Target] [the invaders|Enemy].</ex>

name: Replacing
description:
An #Agent changes the filler of a  #Role by placing a #New filler in the position after the #Old filler ceases to occupy the position.  Often this entails the #Agent removing the #Old filler.  In most cases the #Role is implicit.

<ex>If [you|Agent] [replace|Target] [me|Old] [with a robot|New], who's gonna make excuses to your wife for you?</ex>

<ex>[Following Keating 's resignation from the Cabinet|Time] [Hawke|Agent] [immediately|Time] [replaced|Target] [him|Old] [as Deputy Prime Minister|Role] [with Brian Howe , Minister for Community Services and Health|New].</ex>

This frame is used both for physically moving a #New thing to a particular location formerly occupied by the #Old thing, and for cases in which the change is accomplished by some non-motion means, e.g. Appointing.

name: Reporting
description: In this frame an #Informer informs the #Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper #Behavior of the #Wrongdoer. <ex> [Tony|Informer] [reported|Target] [Michael|Wrongdoer] [to the police|Authorities] [for breaking into his car|Behavior]. </ex> <ex> [The teacher|Informer] [reported|Target] [the bathroom vandalism|Behavior]. [DNI|Aut] </ex>

name: Representative
description:
A #Representative is authorized by a #Represented to communicate on behalf of the #Represented.

<ex>[She|Representative] is a [representative|Target] [for Pepsi|Representative].</ex>

name: Representing
description:
An #Entity represents some #Phenomenon through its existence and/or defining characteristics.  Sometimes a #Cognizer, a people or group of people who believe in the representation, is expressed.
<ex>[A bear|Entity] [symbolizes|Target] [strength|Phenomenon] [in some cultures|Cognizer].</ex>

name: Request
description:
In this frame a #Speaker asks an #Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.

<ex>[The customer|Speaker] [demanded|Target] [a refund|Msg].</ex>
<ex>[I|Speaker] [begged|Target] [my parents|Addressee] [to let me stay up late.|Message]</ex>

name: Request_entity
description:
A #Customer requests an #Entity from a #Supplier.  The #Customer can order the #Entity himself or via a #Medium.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[I|Cust] [ordered|Target] [a black scarf|Ent] [from J. Crew|S] [a week ago|Time].</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Mr. Strom's|Cust] [[order|Ent]|Target] has been cancelled.</ex>

name: Required_event
description:
Unless a particular #Required_situation obtains, #Negative_consequences will follow.  Alternatively, the #Required_situation is required to achieve a #Purpose (which avoids #Negative_consequences). A set of #Circumstances may be specified under which the requirement holds.

<ex>[You|req] [must|Target] [turn in your test by 5 p.m.|req]</ex>
<ex>[You|req] [better|Target] [have that fixed by tomorrow|req] [or else we'll fire you|neg].</ex>
<ex>[The book|req] [needs|Target] [to be shorter|req] [to sell to such a young audience.|pur]</ex>

Most, but not all, LUs of this frame are usable in a context that implies a duty or responsibility, concepts related to the Being_obligated frame. However, our analysis is that such interpretations are due to contextual pragmatic strengthening--in other words, a duty is a frequently salient type of purpose that has negative consequences if not achieved.

name: Requirement_scenario
description:
One  state of affairs, the #Dependent, cannot occur without another state of affairs, the #Requirement, also occurring.  This #Requirement is construed to be under the control of some implicit force or actor.  In an alternative construal, the #Dependent state of affairs may be presented as depending on the presence of a #Required_entity. Individuals that profit from the occurrence of the #Dependent state (#Dependent_individuals) are backgrounded. The same goes for individuals (#Required_individual) that are required to provide any #Required_entity or to see to the occurrence of the #Dependent state of affairs.

The connection between the #Requirement and the #Dependent can be qualified further in terms of the #Degree of strength of the link between the two eventualities, the #Place and #Time where this relationship obtains, the #Explanation for its existence, or a specification of #Condition when it applies.

name: Rescuing
description:
An #Agent saves a #Patient or an #Asset from a #Harmful_situation.

<ex>[Israeli commandos|Agent] [rescued|Target] [the hostages|Patient] and left.</ex>

<ex>[His German shepherd|Agent] [saved|Target] [him|Patient] [from drowing|Harm] once.</ex>

<ex>[She|Agent] [saved|Target] [my life|Asset] [on the bridge|Place] [yesterday|Time].</ex>

name: Research
description:
A #Researcher (an individual a group or institution) attempts to answer a #Question by means of consulting literature,  observation, or conducting experiments in a particular #Field pertinent to the #Question. The #Question may be underspecified in the form of a #Topic.


<ex> [Simmons and Nadel|res] did [research|Target] [pertaining to Ardea purpurea and Egretta garzetta|top] [in 1998|tim]</ex>

name: Reserving
description:
In this frame, a #Booker brings about a situation where an #Organization plans to provide #Services to a #Client at a particular #Scheduled_time.  The #Organization has authority over when #Services are provided to whom.  The #Booker usually has to communicate and negotiate with the #Organization to plan the #Services for a mutually agreeable #Scheduled_time.  Usually, there is a #Payment as well.

<ex>[We|Booker] can [book|Target] [you|Client] [a boatride on the Somme or a special tour of the Louvre|Services] .</ex>
<ex>[Now|Time] [booking|Target] [trips to Cancun|Services][for only $50|Payment] ! [CNI|Booker] [INI|Client]</ex>


In many cases, the #Booker may be the same as the #Client or the #Organization.
<ex></ex>
When the #Booker is also the #Organization providing the service, as in the first sentence below, we annotate #Booker on the first layer and #Organization on the second.  Realizing that the #Booker is also the #Organization providing the service is an inference, as we can see by comparing the following two examples.  In the first, it seems clear that the hotel is providing the service.  In the second, it is clear that the hotel is not providing the service.

<ex>[The hotel|Booker] gave [us|Client] a [reservation|Target] [for two nights|Services] .</ex>
<ex>[The hotel|Booker] <m>gave</m> [us|Client] a [reservation|Target] [for two nights|Services] [at the adjacent hotel|Organization] [to make up for screwing up our original booking|Purpose] .</ex>

<ex></ex>
In the frequent case where the #Booker is the same as the #Client, we annotate #Booker on the first layer and #Client on the second.  #Client is on the second layer since, in most cases, it is an inference that may be wrong.  For example, in the following sentence, the annotation indicates that Patrick is the #Client.  However, it is also possible that Patrick is reserving a table for a party that doesn't even include himself:

<ex>[Patrick|Booker] tried to [reserve|Target] [a table|Services] [at Dorsia|Organization] [ for 7:00|Scheduled_time] .</ex>
<ex>[Patrick|Client] tried to [reserve|Target] a table at Dorsia for 7:00 .</ex>

name: Reshaping
description:
In this frame a #Deformer deforms a #Patient possibly against a #Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the #Configuration, a new shape. Some of these words indicate that the #Configuration is an undesirable alteration of the norm, and in such cases the lexical unit is marked with the semantic type Negative_judgement.   This frame does not include senses that specifically indicate causing harm to a living being.

<ex>[Ellen|Def] [crumpled|Target] [the paper|Patient] [into a ball|Configuration].</ex>

<ex>[Michael|Def] [flattened|Target] [the can|Patient] [against his head|Resistant_surface].</ex>

<ex>Mix butter and sardines very thoroughly , [mashing|Target] [them|Patient] [with a fork|Ins] [until you have a smooth paste|Configuration]. [CNI|Def]</ex>

<ex>[A killer hurricane|Cause] [nearly|Mnr] [flattened|Target] [Sylvester Stallone's five luxury homes in Hawaii|Patient].</ex>

name: Residence
description:
This frame has to do with people (the #Residents) residing in #Locations, sometimes with a #Co-resident.

<ex>[Peter|Resident] [lives|Target] [in New York|Location].</ex>
<ex>[Sue|Resident] <m>is</m> an [inhabitant|Target] [of Los Angeles|Location].</ex>

name: Resolve_problem
description:
An #Agent resolves an outstanding #Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.  Alternatively, some non-agentive #Cause may resolve the #Problem.  The #Means, #Degree, #Time and #Place may also be expressed.

<ex>As it turns out, [putting all of my eggs in one basket|cau] [completely|deg] [solved|Target] [all of my problems|pro].</ex>
<ex>[Students|age] [finally|tim] [worked|Target] [through|Target] [all of the difficult problems|pro] [by working together|mea].</ex>

name: Respond_to_proposal
description:
A #Speaker addresses a #Proposal made by an #Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it. Agreeing entails a social responsibility on the #Speaker to bring about some state of affairs encoded in the #Proposal.

<ex>[They|Interlocutor] were [rebuffed|Target] [again|par] [in the larger city of Provo|pla]. [CNI|Speaker] </ex>

<ex>[Last month|Time] [Mr Duisenberg|Speaker] <m>delivered</m> a [sharp|Manner] [rebuff|Target] [to Mr Welteke|int]. </ex>

<ex>[He|Speaker] [rebuffed|Target] [Singh's every overture|Proposal],  [relentlessly pursuing a cap on India's nuclear capability|Depict].</ex>

name: Response
description:
An #Agent performs a #Response action in consequence of a #Trigger event. In many cases, a non-agentive #Responding_entity causes the #Response after the #Trigger occurs.

<ex>[I|Agent] [respond|Target] [to earthquakes|Trigger] [by hiding under my desk|Response].</ex>

name: Response_scenario
description: A #Trigger elicits a #Response by some #Responding_entity or an #Agent.

name: Responsibility
description:
An #Agent is responsible for having intentionally performed an #Act or for being the or a primary instigator behind the #Act. There is often a sense of negative evaluation of the #Agent for having done so.

<ex>It has been determined that [a relatively unknown terrorist group|Agent] <m>is</m> [responsible|Target] [for the recent attacks|Act].</ex>

Note: the noun <m>responsibility</m> in this frame frequently occurs with <m>take</m> and <m>claim</m>. These words are considered controllers (rather than supports), as they express events of communication rather than the static relationship of responsibility.

name: Rest
description:
One #Part of a larger #Whole has been mentioned, is inferrable, or is available in the discourse setting and the previously unmentioned part, the #Rest, is now mentioned.

<ex>The lenses , like the [[rest|Rest]|Target] [of the exoskeleton|Whole], are made of calcite.</ex>
<ex>They see social policy work as a natural [complement|Target] [to bureau work|Part].</ex>

name: Result_of_attempt_scenario
description: An #Agent and their #Action succeed or fail inasmuch as the result of an #Action matches the #Goal that they hope to bring about by the #Action.

name: Resurrection
description:
A #Protagonist which had been dead returns to life.

<ex>[He|pro]'ll [come|Target] [back|Target] [from the dead|pri] [at 11:03PM exactly|tim], [since that's what his suicide note indicated|rea].</ex>

name: Retaining
description:
In this frame an #Agent continues to possess a #Theme for a #Duration of time.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[In her heart|Place] [she|Agent] must [retain|Target] [bitterness against those who had killed him|Theme].</ex>

<ex>[I|Agent] [kept|Target] [the iPhone Sally gave me|Theme].</ex>

name: Reveal_secret
description:
A #Speaker reveals #Information that was previously secret to an #Addressee. In some cases, the #Addressee is expected to keep the #Information from other parties. The #Information may be damaging to the reputation of the #Speaker. Instead of (or in addition to) a #Speaker, a #Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a #Topic may be stated instead of #Information. Some lexical units in this frame imply that the #Addressee has already been confronted with the #Information.


<ex>Could it be true that Martin himself was [the one who|spe] [spilled|Target] the [beans|Target] [on Pops and Brad's planned wedding|top]? </ex>

name: Revenge
description:
This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An #Avenger performs a #Punishment on a #Offender as a consequence of an earlier action by the #Offender, the #Injury. The #Avenger inflicting the#Punishment need not be the same as the #Injured_party who suffered the #Injury,  but the #Avenger does have to share the judgment that the #Offender's action was wrong. The judgment that the #Offender had inflicted an #Injury  is made without regard to the law.

<ex>(1) [They|Avenger] took [revenge|Target] [for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners|Injury].</ex>
<ex>(2) [Lachlan|Avenger] went out to [avenge|Target] [them|Injured_party].</ex>
<ex>(3) The next day, the Roman forces took [revenge|Target] [on their enemies.|Offender].</ex>

name: Revolution
description:
An #Agent brings about a radical change in leadership by removing the #Current_leadership and potentially dismantling the #Current_order, outside recognized means of doing so (e.g., elections).

<ex>Recent reports indicate that [the local troops|age] have [mutinied|Target] [against their superiors|curl].</ex>

name: Rewards_and_punishments
description:
An #Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a #Response_action on an #Evaluee for a #Reason, the #Evaluee's actions or beliefs.   #Means and #Instrument may also be indicated.
The goal of the punishment/reward is  to discourage/encourage the actions or beliefs.  Words in this frame presuppose that a judgment of the #Evaluee has occurred and that the #Evaluee is (or becomes) aware of the judgment.  This judgment was performed by a cognizer which is either the same as the #Agent, or, minimally, a representative of the same institution.

<ex>[His|Agt] [punishment|Target] [of the prisoners|Eval] was too harsh.</ex>
<ex>[Her|Eval] [punishment|Target]  was too harsh.</ex>
<ex>The [penalty|Target] [for this crime|Reas] <m>is</m> [death|Action]. </ex>
<ex>I believe that this behaviour should be subject to [disciplinary|Target] [action|Action].</ex>

name: Ride_vehicle
description:
In this frame a #Theme is moved by a #Vehicle which is not directly under their power. The #Source, #Path, #Goal, or #Area of the motion may be indicated. The #Distance traveled or the #Speed of motion may also be indicated. A #Route or #Roadmay be present and the #Manner in which the #Theme moves may be given.
<ex>[Mrs. Smith|Theme] [rode|Target] [on the train|Vehicle].</ex>
<ex>[Sally|Theme] [flew|Target] [3000 miles|Distance] [from San Francisco|Source] [to New York|Goal].</ex>
<ex>Every day, [Martin|Theme] [rode|Target] [the bus|Vehicle] [on highway 880|Road].</ex>
<ex>[Mr. Bigglesworth|Theme] [rides|Target] [route 51|Route].</ex>

There is shared vocabulary between this frame and Carrying and Operate_vehicle. It is differentiated from Operate_vehicle in that the vehicle is not under the subject's control. It is differentiated from Carrying because the vehicle is not being used to transport goods.

name: Rising_to_a_challenge
description:
A #Protagonist, by exerting great effort, comes to meet the pre-conditions for participating in an #Activity that is judged to be difficult for them to participate in, either due to their inherent properties or due to temporary #Circumstances.

<ex>In conclusion, [our staff|pro] [rose|Target] [to the challenge|act] [in developing the necessary training programs and delivery methods|mea].</ex>

<ex>[Dr Runcie|pro] [rose|Target] [to|Target] [the|Target] [occasion|Target] [with a simple address|mea]. [DNI|act]</ex>

<ex>There was still clearly much to do, but [the governor and his staff|pro] had begun to [rise|Target] [to the task|act].</ex>

<ex>Pacers say [they|pro]'ll [rise|Target] [to the pressure|act].</ex>

name: Risky_situation
description:
A particular #Situation is likely (or unlikely) to result in a harmful event befalling an #Asset. The #Situation may be a state, an activity, or some focal entity that must be inferred to be part of some larger Situation involving both it and the #Asset. Although the idea of a harmful event is crucial to the understanding of this frame, it is not expressible as an argument of the LUs in this frame.

<ex><m>Is</m> [climate change|Situation] [dangerous|Target] [for mankind|Asset]?</ex>
<ex>Customers can make complaints about [unsafe|Target] [products|dan_ent].</ex>
<ex>The primary [risk|Target] <m>is</m> [to our infrastructure|Asset].</ex>


See the Run_risk frame for discussion on differentiation regarding the noun <ment>risk</ment>.

name: Risk_scenario
description: An Asset is in a particular Situation, which has a likelihood of leading to or inviting a Harmful_event which will negatively affect the Asset.

name: Rite
description:
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.

<ex>In certain [fertility|Desired_state_of_affairs] [rites|Target] [in Burma|Place] , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .</ex>

<ex>[He|Member] was [ordered|Target] [a priest|New_status] [in 1944|Time]. [CNI|Leader] </ex>

name: Roadways
description:
This frame involves stable #Roadways which connect two stable #Endpoints, the #Source and the #Goal.  Being physical objects, these #Roadways may have #Names and #Characteristics; they are also made of a #Material.  They also cover ground, so they may have a #Path or a #Relative_location that the travel occurs in.

<ex> We crossed the [brick|Material] [[road|Target]|Roadway].</ex>
<ex> I prefer to travel on [[highway|Target]|Roadway] [I-80|Name].</ex>
<ex>This is the only [[highway|Target]|Roadway] [between Lodi and Sonoma|Endpoints].</ex>
<ex> She dreaded turning onto the [busy|Frequency_of_use] [[street|Target]|Roadway].</ex>

name: Robbery
description:
These are words describing situations in which a #Perpetrator wrongs a #Victim by taking something (#Goods) from them.  In some cases, the #Source location from which the #Goods were taken is used to metonymically refer to the #Victim.  The robbery can be done in a particular #Manner (for example, forcefully) and via a specific #Means (for example, by threatening the #Victim).

<ex>[Half of the team|Perpetrator] [held|Target] [up|Target] [the tellers|Victim] while the others were stationed to report the arrival of police.</ex>

As opposed to Theft, Robbery focuses on the harm to the #Victim and on the #Source location from which the #Goods have been removed, rather than the #Goods themselves.

name: Rope_manipulation
description:
An #Agent manipulates a linear entity (the #Rope) to form a #Knot.

<ex>[Harry|Agent] [tied|Target] [the rope|Rope] [into a slipknot|Knot].</ex> <ex>[Patty and Selma|Agent] [knotted|Target] [the ties of their aprons|Rope].</ex>

name: Rotting
description: In this frame a #Patient, which is  an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decaying from an #Initial_state to a #Result.  <ex>[The leaves|Patient] [rotted|Target] [into a mass of slime|Result].</ex> <ex>[The dresses|Patient] [decayed|Target] [from their former beauty|I_state].</ex>

name: Run_risk
description: A #Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a #Bad_outcome for him- or herself. An #Asset which is in danger of loss may stand in for the #Bad_outcome. There is no implication that the #Protagonist intentionally exposes themself to the risky situation. The #Protagonist may be attempting to achieve some #Purpose, which involves being in a dangerous situation. The #Severity of risk involved may also be expressed. There was a [risk|Target] [of fire|Bad_outcome]. [Original thinkers|Protagonist] incur [greater|Severity] [risks|Target] [to their careers|Asset] [than their pedestrian colleagues|Severity]. NOTE: This Frame is currently in the process of being changed so that some instances of at risk.n will be moved to the Being_at_risk frame, and some will be moved to the Risky_situation frame. In the Being_at_risk frame, risk is almost always supported with at, and its external argument is the Asset. Risky_situation uses of risk include the following: Smoking poses a [risk|Target] to your health. Smoking is a health [risk|Target]. The most imminent [risk|Target] is to our infrastructure. but (possibly ; still under discussion) not: The most imminent RISK is that our infrastructure may not be able to handle the load. In the Risky_situation frame, the external argument is the Situation, and the Bad_outcome in not expressible. The verb risk.v will remain in the Run_risk frame, in the sense of he risked his life for his country. The construction run risk also will remain in the Run_risk frame.

name: Sacrificing_for
description:
An #Agent sacrifices an (often abstract) #Asset in exchange for a #Benefit which is deemed better or more worth having.

<ex>[We|age] never [sacrifice|Target] [quality|ass] [for price|ben].</ex>

<ex>[What|ass] are [you|age] willing to [sacrifice|Target] [to get a chance at winning|ben]?</ex>

<ex>[Most people in that position|age] probably would have [compromised|Target] [their principles|ass]. [INI|ben].</ex>

name: Sanctions
description: A #Sanction is characterized as the punishment or penalty applied to an athlete or team, the #Punished_athlete, or in favor of the opponent, the #Beneficiary_athlete. The #Sanction is given due to the violation of a rule in a #Sport. It is generally applied by the #Referee, but it can also come from a federation or committee decision.

name: Satisfying
description:
This frame describes an #Agent or an #Entity meeting or not meeting a #Standard.  Alternatively, an action or occurrence may be construed as an #Event that meets or fails to meet the #Standard.
<ex>Will [my coursework|Event] [satisfy|Target] [the requirements for admission|Standard]?</ex>
<ex>[He|Agent] [satisfied|Target] [his son's wish|Standard] [by buying him a Wii|Means].</ex>

name: Scarcity
description:
The #Quantity of a #Collection occurring in a #Place has a particular #Measure, which is related to the amount generally needed.

<ex>There is evidence that [volatile materials|Collection] have [always|Time] been [scarce|Target] [on the Moon|Place] .</ex>

<ex>A global effort to tackle [water|Collection] [scarcity|Target] is getting underway. [INI|pla]</ex>

<ex>It is the [scarceness|Target] [of these precious metals|Collection] that adds to their luster. [INI|pla]</ex>

name: Scenario
description: Abstract frame to group scenarios frames.

name: Scheduling
description:
An #Agent schedules an #Event to take place at a specified #Scheduled_time and #Place.

<ex>[Gina|Agent] [scheduled|Target] [a dentist appointment|Event] [for Monday|Scheduled_time] [in Berkeley|Place].</ex>

<ex>[Christa|Agent] [set|Target] [up|Target] [an afternoon meeting|Event] [to discuss the new prototype|Purpose].</ex>

name: Scope
description:
An #Event is described in terms of the diversity of entities that are affected or considered in the #Event. Alternatively a #Salient_entity which enables or brings about the #Event can be similarly described.
<ex>The U.S. government believes that China has not revealed the full [scope|Target] [of its program|Salient_entity].</ex>
<ex>A key question is how U.S. deployment of ballistic missile defense will affect the pace and [scope|Target] [of Chinese strategic modernization|Event].</ex>

name: Scouring
description:
A #Searcher looks all over a #Ground in order to find a #Sought_entity. The #Sought_entity is not presupposed to exist. The search activity is not concerned with the state of the #Ground, which is the case in the Inspecting frame, but only with the finding of the #Sought_entity, which is desirable.


<ex>[The newcomers|sea] [combed|Target] [the area|gro] looking for minerals</ex>
<ex>[Scientists|sea] [scoured|Target] [the ice samples|gro]  [for signs of life|sou]. </ex>
<ex>[Mulder|sea] [rummaged|Target] [through his toilet kit|gro] [for a plastic razor|sou].</ex>

name: Scrutinizing_for
description: A #Cognizer examines a #Ground closely, alert to the presence of a #Phenomenon.

name: Scrutiny
description:
This frame concerns a #Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the #Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.  The #Cognizer may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the #Phenomenon, that belongs to the #Ground or is contained in the #Ground (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present).
Some words in this frame allow alternate expressions of the #Groundand the #Phenomenon:
<ex>We [searched|Target] [the yard|Ground] [ for my contact lens|Phen].</ex>

name: Searching_scenario
description: A #Cognizer seeks a #Phenomenon within the #Ground.

name: Secrecy_status
description:
A #Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential #Cognizer. The person responsible for the hiding of the #Phenomenon is not part of this frame and cannot be syntactically realized. The potential #Cognizer may be realized, but is in fact rarely expressed. A period of #Time during which the #Phenomenon is secret may be indicated.


<ex>Few people would use ATMs if [the content of their transaction|phe] <m>was</m> [secret|Target] [from their bank|cog] and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .</ex>

<ex>The protesters were not on her list, and weren't allowed in, despite the fact that [the meeting|phe] <m>was</m> [public|Target].</ex>

<ex>[Student disciplinary matters|phe] are [confidential|Target] and should only be discussed with appropriate university officials</ex>

name: Seeking
description:
A #Cognizer_agent attempts to find some #Sought_entity by examining some #Ground.  The success or failure of this activity (the #Outcome) may be indicated.

NB:  This frame should be compared to the Scrutiny frame, in which the primary focus is on the #Ground.

<ex>[John|Cognizer_agent] [looked|Target] [for his pencil|Sought_entity].</ex>

name: Seeking_to_achieve
description:
An #Agent intends and takes steps towards bringing about a #State_of_affairs or, metonymically, towards acquiring a #Sought_entity .

<ex>[Libya|age] [sought|Target] [nuclear weapons|sou] [in the 1960s|Time].</ex>

<ex>[North Korea|age] [sought|Target] [several billion dollars in cash from the US|sou] [during bilateral missile talks|Time].</ex>

<ex>The talks in Berlin ended without agreement after [Bora Bora|age] [sought|Target] [to link large-scale economic assistance to joint recovery operations|soa].</ex>

<ex>[India|Agent] had [sought|Target] [her extradition|soa] [for forging documents to procure a passport|exp].</ex>

name: See_through
description: A #Cognizer realizes that a #State_of_affairs (or Focal_entity within the #State_of_affairs) is meant to deceive (the #Cognizer is not necessarily the intended victim of the deception). The #Cognizer comes to this belief by perception and reasoning, and not, for instance, by being informed of the true state of affairs.

name: Self_control
description:
An #Agent actively (yet not always with success) attempts to keep themselves from participating in an #Event. The #Agent is usually pushed to the #Event because of an internal urge.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[He|Agent] couldn't [help|Target] [but peek|Event].</ex>

name: Self_motion
description:
The #Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a #Path. Alternatively or in addition to #Path, an #Area, #Direction, #Source, or #Goal for the movement may be mentioned.

<ex>[She|Self_mover] [walked|Target] [along the road|Path] [for a while|Duration].</ex>

Many of the lexical units in this frame can also describe the motion of vehicles (e.g., as external arguments). We treat these as belonging in this frame.

<ex>[The cars|Self_mover] [scooted|Target] [slowly|Speed] [towards the intersection|Direction].</ex>

Self_motion most prototypically involves individuals moving under their own power by means of their bodies. Many words also specify the manner of motion (<m>swim</m>, <m>walk</m>). This frame contains mostly words that fit this prototypical scenario, but the frame itself does not specify whether a separate vehicle is impossible, necessary, or unspecified. Lexical units that involve separate vehicles are associated with FEs that are not appropriate for the more general case of motion, so they are placed in the Operate_vehicle or Ride_vehicle frames (e.g., <m>He drove across the country</m>, <m>She flew to Europe</m>).

name: Sending
description:
A #Sender plans the #Path (along with #Source and #Goal) of a #Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this #Path under the power of some entity other than the #Sender.  This frame also has a #Recipient distinct from the #Goal, as both can be present:
<ex>I [sent|Target] the manuscript [to England|Goal] [to Bill|Recipient].</ex>
<ex>I [forwarded|Target] the grain [to a dealer|Recipient] [in Frankfurt|Goal].</ex>

This frame contains verbs that participate in the ditransitive construction, with a recipient as the direct object, as in the following: <ex>I [sent|Target] [Bill|Recipient] the manuscript.</ex>
Certain Verbs in this Frame focus on the initial sending act, while others do not.  For example, <ment>I sent it rapidly</ment> can either mean the act of sending was initiated quickly or that it moved quickly.
However, the in following sentence: <ment>I exported/dispatched it rapidly</ment>, meaning that the act was begun quickly, both types of verbs are included.

name: Sensation
description:
This frame contains nouns that refer to sensations in different modalities. The FE #Source is used for the phenomenon that gives rise to the sensation in question. The FE #Percept is used for the characteristic quality of the sensation. In cases of veridical perception these are not typically distinguished from one another; we use the FE #Percept as the default in these cases. With some nouns in this frame it is possible to express the being who experiences the sensation, or the part of the body of such a being. We mark such expressions with the FEs #Perceiver_passive and #Body_part, respectively. (The <ment>-passive</ment> part of this label serves to distinguish this FE from the Perceiver_agentive FE used in the Perception_active frame.)
<ex></ex>
<ex>[The huge sand dunes, perpetually changing|Percept], <m>make</m> for a [surreal|Descriptor] [sight|Target].</ex>

<ex>[Endill|Perceiver_passive] <m>heard</m> the [noise|Target] [of glass smashing, plaster crumbling and furniture being broken|Percept].</ex>

<ex>The [feel|Target] [of his strong fingers enclosing her small palm|Percept] came as something of a shock to her system.</ex>

name: Sentencing
description:
During a court appearance, a #Sentence, generally a punishment, is imposed on the #Convict by a #Court, usually represented by a judge.

<ex>[The judge|Court] [sentenced|Target] [Martha Stewart|Convict] [to 2 years in prison|Sentence] [for insider trading|Offense].</ex>

name: Sent_items
description:
A #Sent_item is prepared for, received after, or involved in a process of Sending, which may involve a particular kind of #Transport_means. The #Sent_item has an (intended or actual) #Sender and #Recipient (or a #Source and #Goal). As a physical object, the #Sent_item can be located in a #Place.

<ex>The [[shipment|Target]|sen] [from Romania|Source] is destined for the Iraqi Police Forces.</ex>

<ex>Postage became more affordable and [[mail|Target]|Sent_item] [to the President|Recipient] gradually increased.</ex>

<ex>I 'll arrange for her to collect [Bertha 's|Recipient] [[mail|Target]|sen].</ex>

<ex>i am looking for a penpal for email or [snail|tra] [[mail|Target]|Sent_item].</ex>

<ex>He had plenty of time to read all [his|Recipient] [fan|Sender] [[mail|Target]|Sent_item] [from Australia|Source] while there.</ex>

name: Separating
description:
These words refer to separating a #Whole into #Parts, or separating one part from another.  The separation is made by an #Agent or #Cause and may be made on the basis of some #Criterion.

<ex>[I|Agent] [divided|Target] [the class|Whole] [into groups|Parts] [in alphabetical order|Criterion] .</ex>

name: Sequence
description:
The words in this frame describe entities that occur in some temporally-ordered sequence.  The entities thus have some sort of relation between them that might be described by the Relative_time frame.  However, at this time, this frame has no Frame Relation with that frame (though this is still under discussion).  Additionally, it should be noted that the words in this frame have a metaphorical link to the words in Shape.

<ex>Describe in detail the [sequence|Target] [of steps taken during an emergency|Entities].</ex>

name: Serving_in_capacity
description:
An #Agent occupies a #Role in some institution. This #Roleis (usually) temporary and can be occupied by other entities at different periods of time. It is common for a #Duration of the #Role to be mentionned.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Chris|Agent] [served|Target] [as chairman of the board|Role][for one year|Duration].</ex>

name: Setting_back_burn
description: A #Firefighter sets a controlled fire to remove fuel from a currently incompletely controlled fire.

name: Setting_fire
description:
This frame describes either the creation of a #Flame by a #Kindler or non-sentient #Cause, or the igniting of #Flammables by a #Kindler or a #Cause.

<ex>[Taliban militants|Kindler] recently [set fire|Target] [to several schools|Flammables].</ex>

<ex>[The fire|Flame] [ignited|Target]. [CNI|Cause]</ex>

name: Setting_out
description:
A #Self_mover begins a journey at a #Source location, in a particular #Directiongenerally setting out with an #Intended_goal in mind.

<ex>[At about 1:00 in the morning|Time], [climbers|Self_mover] [set out|Target] [for the summit|Intended_goal].</ex>
<ex>[The expedition|Self_mover] [set out|Target] [from Granada|Source] [early in March|Time], leaving only one hundred men to garrison the fort which overlooks the city.</ex>
<ex>[After that|Time] [the earl|Self_mover] [set out|Target] [south|Direction] [with his host|Cotheme], and Kari went with him, and Njal's sons too.</ex>

name: Set_of_interrelated_entities
description:
A group of #Component_entities along with their interrelations is viewed as a #Complex.


<ex>By definition, no external forces act upon an [isolated|des] [[system|Target]|plx] [of particles|com].</ex>

<ex>[Earth|plx] <m>is</m> a [contained|des] [system|Target] [which receives energy from the sun|des].</ex>

name: Set_relation
description: A #Superset has several members, a part of which is the #Subset. This frame exists largely for the purposes of inheritance.

name: Severity_of_offense
description: In this frame an #Offense is described in terms of the legal or other punishing action that can be taken in response to the offense. <ex> He committed an [indictable|Target] [crime|Offense] . </ex>

name: Sex
description: #Participants in a Sex act engage in or are subjected to sexual contact. Often the LUs in this frame are suggestive euphemisms which refer to non-sexual physical contact, Giving/Receiving scenarios, frames related to travel, physical orientation, body metonymy, biological necessity, or a simple completion of Activity.

name: Sexual_reproduction_scenario
description: This frame embodies the process of procreation.

name: Shaped_part
description:
An entity is a shaped #Part of a larger #Whole. The #Part may correspond in form and  function  to a part of another entity. For instance, the leg of a table supports the weight of a table like the leg of an animal or person supports their weight. The #Orientation of the #Part relative to the #Whole may be expressed.

<ex>I removed the [[brim|Target]|Part] [of the hat|Whole]</ex>

<ex>Bill likes to chew the [waxy|Part_prop] [[rind|Target]|Part] [of the cheese|Whole]</ex>

name: Shapes
description:
This frame contains words which describe the dimensional extent and #Shape of a #Substance.  These words do not make reference to a Part-whole relationship. There can also be a descriptor of the #Shape, #Shape_prop.

<ex>She held a [[square|Shape]|Target] [of cloth |Substance].</ex>

name: Sharing
description:
In this frame #Protagonist_1 and #Protagonist_2, collectively #Protagonists, allow one another to partake jointly the use of an #Entity .

<ex>[More than half of the group|Pros] [shared|Target] [needles|Ent].</ex>

<ex>[I|Pro1] [shared|Target] [the cake|Ent] [with the ladies at the DAR meeting|Pro2].</ex>

name: Sharpness
description:
An #Entity has a #Sharpness characterized by its capability to cut.  The #Sharpness is a value of the Attribute of sharpness.

<ex>[That axe|Entity] seems [dangerously|Degree] [sharp|Target].</ex>

name: Shooting_scenario
description: A firearm is discharged, causing the motion of a projectile.  This frame exists primarily to relate frames.

name: Shoot_projectiles
description:
An #Agent causes a #Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the #Projectile.

<ex>[The bank robber|Agent] [shot|Target] [at the clerks|Goal] [with an AK-47|Firearm].</ex>
<ex>[Shooting|Target] [a cannonball|Projectile] isn't as easy as it looks.  [CNI|Agent]</ex>

Note that usages with the #Firearm as object are out of frame, belonging to Use_firearm.

name: Shopping
description:
A #Shopper looks for #Goods in order to purchase them.

<ex>[She|Shopper] [shopped|Target] [for a new hat|Goods].</ex>

name: Short_selling
description:
Short selling, a common financial market concept, involves an #Intermediary selling #Assets to the #Market, having borrowed these #Assets from a (generally implicit) #Lender. The #Intermediary is obligated to rebuy the #Assets later, so that they may be returned to the #Lender. The #Intermediary's intent is to repurchase the #Assets from the #Market at a lower price than when he sold them, and so return them to the #Lender for a profit.
<ex></ex>
Because this strategy only makes sense when the #Intermediary believes that the value of the #Assets is lower than the valuation assigned by other members of the market, words of this frame may be used metaphorically to refer to an Agent (usually wrongly) believing some Entity is worth less than other people do.

<ex>[He|Intermediary] was [selling|Target] [short|Target] [shares|Assets] [from his brother's company|Lender] [on the NASDAQ|Market] and he made a fortune.</ex>

name: Sidereal_appearance
description:
An #Astronomical_entity comes into view above the horizon as part of a regular, periodic process of (apparent) motion of the #Astronomical_entity across the sky. In the case of the sun, the appearance begins the day.

<ex>[Venus|ast] [rose|Target] [at 5:23 AM|tim], twenty minutes before the sun which reached the horizon at 5:43 AM.</ex>

<ex>At the time of the new moon, [the moon|ast] [rises|Target] [at about the same time the sun rises|tim], and it sets at about the same time the sun sets.</ex>

<ex>And, as [the sun|ast] [came|Target] [up|Target] [over the trees|goa], it became golden, and then turned again into a silvery path; and the water came alive</ex>

<ex>Each day [the sun's|ast] [rise|Target] offers us a new day.</ex>

name: Sign
description:
A phenomenon, the #Indicator, exists as an indication of another phenomenon, the #Indicated. The relationship is asymmetric: the #Indicated is not necessarily a sign for the existence or presence of an #Indicator. The #Indicated can be a past, present, or future entity or eventuality. The relationship between #Indicator and #Indicated is not one of symbolization or iconicity. Rather the #Indicator is an index of the #Indicated.

<ex>[This|Indicator] is a [sign|Target] [of things to come|Indicated].</ex>

name: Sign_agreement
description:
A #Signatory signs an #Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the #Agreement.

<ex>. [During this time|Time], [84 countries (including the United States)|sig1] [signed|Target] [the Protocol|agr].</ex>

name: Silencing
description:
An #Agent causes a #Speaker to become silent, sometimes about a particular #Topic.

<ex>[The teacher|Agent] [quieted|Target] [the children's laughter|Expressor].</ex>

name: Similarity
description:
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.  Depending on figure/ground relations, the entities may be expressed in two distinct frame elements and constituents , #Entity_1 and #Entity_2, or jointly as a single frame element and constituent, #Entities.  The similarity may be based on appearance, physical properties, or other characteristics of the two entities. However, no such #Dimension has to  be specified explicitly.  The #Entities may be like each other to a greater or lesser #Degree. Rather than specifying the #Dimension of difference, a #Differentiating_fact may be mentioned.
<ex></ex>
Notice that, although similarity presupposes the notion of a judge who assesses similarity, that judge is not part of the frame of similarity.

<ex>[A mulberry|Entity_1] <m>is</m> [very|Degree] [similar|Target] [in shape|Dimension]
[to a loganberry|Entity_2]</ex>
<ex>[Recovering it afterwards|Entity_1] can also <m>be</m> [similar|Target] [to collecting an unsecured loan|Entity_2] </ex>
<ex>[Great Britain and Germany|Entities] <m>were</m> only [alike|Target] [in one respect|Dimension].</ex>
<ex>[Lothlorien|Entity_1] <m>is</m> [quite|Degree] [like|Target] [most of their other war games|Entity_2] really.</ex>

name: Simple_name
description:
A #Term is the linguistic sign conventionally used by a #Speaker to refer to a type of #Entity.

<ex> [Perianth|Term] <m>is</m> a collective [term|Target] [for the outer whorls of the flower, which protect the reproductive parts during development|ent].</ex>

<ex>The [Polish|Speaker] [word|Target] [for it|ent] <m>is</m> [czarnuszka|Term]</ex>

name: Simple_naming
description:
A #Speaker conventionally uses a particular #Term to refer to an #Entity.

<ex>The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore [we|spe] have [termed|Target] [this domain|ent] [DC1|Term] for divergent C1 domain.</ex>

name: Simultaneity
description:
Two #Events happen at the same time.  This may either be construed symmetrically as a relation holding between the #Events, or asymmetrically as holding between a #Landmark_event whose known occurrence is used to describe when a #Profiled_event took place.

<ex>[These events|Events] [coincided|Target].</ex>

name: Size
description:
The size of an #Entity is assessed in terms of the #Degree by which it deviates from the norm. The size generally refers to the amount of three-dimensional space that is occupied by the #Entity, not primarily to its weight, density, or length, which is why it is peculiar to refer to a bullet as ""large"", even if it is heavy, unless it actually has larger dimensions than usual, or to a rope as ""big"", even if it is long, unless its other, cross-sectional dimensions are also significant.

<ex>I own a [very|Degree] [small|Target] [home|Entity].</ex>
<ex>Where is my [little|Target] [notebook|Entity]?</ex>
<ex>[That dog|Entity] is [huge|Target]!</ex>
<ex></ex>

There are an enormous number of productive metaphors that involve this frame as the source domain; two of the most frequent metaphors come from the target domains of quantity/amount and importance.

<ex>He gave me a [small|Target] [sum of money|Entity].</ex>
<ex>The novel was a [substantial|Target] [achievement|Entity].</ex>
<ex></ex>

Subcases of the quantity/amount and importance metaphors are also prominent. These involve cases describing the extent of an action's, event's, or person's effect (""his influence on her work was massive""), as well as those related to events (""big party""), similarity (""gigantic difference""), communication (""giant misunderstanding""), and emotions (""great joy"", ""little joys"").

Other productive metaphors include those dealing with groups (in terms of their number of members, net worth, importance to the economy, i.e. ""giant electronics company"") and those describing sound volume (""in a tiny voice"", ""the enormous thundering of her heart"").
<ex></ex>

The target domain of fame, by contrast, occurs in a non-productive metaphor, found especially with big.a and huge.a. Maturity and age also occur in non-productive metaphors (""big boy"", ""little baby"").

name: Sleep
description:
The #Sleeper stays in an altered state of consciousness with greatly reduced external awareness.

<ex>[We|Sleeper] [slept|Target].</ex>

name: Sleep_wake_cycle
description: A #Sleeper enters a state of consciousness of reduced external awareness, remains in this state for some amount of time, and (normally) returns to full wakeful consciousness.

name: Smuggling
description:
The words in this frame describe situations in which the #Perpetrator secretly takes #Goods into or out of a country or other area which are prohibited by law or on which one has not paid the required duty.

<ex>[He|Perpetrator] [smuggled|Target] [the bottle|Goods] [through customs|Path].</ex>

name: Soaking
description:
In this frame, an #Agent places the #Theme in the #Medium for an extended period of time, with the intent that the #Theme will be affected by and absorb some of the #Medium.
<ex> [Ellen|Agent] [soaked|Target] [the beans|Theme] [in the water|Medium] [for 30 seconds|Duration].</ex>

name: Soaking_up
description:
An #Item becomes filled with a #Substance as a result of movement of liquid into visible or invisible interstices in the #Item.

<ex>[Paper and board|Item] [absorb|Target] [moisture|Substance] [in the winter|Time].</ex>

<ex>[A stable soil|Item] [soaks up|Target] [water|Substance].</ex>

name: Sociability
description:
These words describe how outgoing or sociable a #Protagonist is judged to be by a (usually implicit) #Judge, often in a particular context, either with certain people (the #Company), or about a particular situation, topic or event (the #Content).

As opposed to the Social_interaction_evaluation frame, this frame talks about <ment>how much</ment> someone interacts, not <ment>how well</ment>.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[He|Protagonist] <m>was</m> [shy|Target] [with strangers|Company] and afraid of showing his feelings.</ex>

<ex>Unfortunately [he|Protagonist]'<m>s</m> [very|Degree] [gregarious|Target].</ex>

name: Socially_significant_history_scenario
description: A series of #Events are important to humankind and its culture.

name: Social_behavior_evaluation
description: In this frame the #Behavior is judged by the speaker (or, in some cases, a separate #Judge) against pre-existing social standards for that type of behavior.  An #Individual who is involved in the #Behavior is assigned the same evaluation as the #Behavior.  This is an abstract frame that encodes the relationship between such frames as Mental_property, Sociability, Social_interaction_evaluation, Stinginess, and Volubility.

name: Social_connection
description:
A mutual social and personal relationship that keeps people involved in each other's lives comprises a #Connection of #Individual_1 to #Individual_2 or between #Individuals.

<ex>They wanted to strengthen [their|Individuals] [family|Typ] [[ties|Target]|Connection].</ex>

name: Social_desirability
description:
This frame contains LUs which are like those of the Desirability frame except the Evaluee incorporates the Parameter as ""associated with a percieved place in a social heirarchy"" for all LUs. LUs are not restricted to positive or negative implications.

<ex>[His manner of dress|Evaluee] was [pedestrian|Target] but tidy.</ex>

name: Social_entity
description: Social_entity

name: Social_event
description:
A #Social_event occurs at which #Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity.  The #Social_event is often a party or celebration, in which case it is possible to express someone who is being honored (the #Beneficiary) or its function may be to celebrate an #Occasion at which #Attendees are present. Often, a specific #Attendee, the #Host, provides a venue for people to gather.

<ex>[Sue|Host] <m>threw</m> a [[party|Target]|Soc] [for Bob's birthday|Occasion].</ex>

<ex>[Who|Host] will [host|Target] [the Olympic games|Soc] [in eight years|Time]?</ex>

name: Social_event_collective
description:
This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed in one representative FE, #Attendees.  Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_individuals, where participants are grammatically separated.

<ex>[Our|att] [date|Target] [yesterday|ti] was interrupted by my ex-boyfriend!</ex>

name: Social_event_individuals
description:
This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed separately, as #Party_1 and #Party_2.  Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_collective, where participants are grouped into one collective grammatical constituent and FE.

<ex>[I|Party_1] [went out with|Target] [him|Party_2] [on Friday|ti].</ex>

name: Social_interaction_evaluation
description:
In this frame an #Evaluee is judged by a (usually implicit) #Judge to be of a certain character based on her or his #Behavior towards other human beings; a specific #Affected_party may be overtly mentioned along with the #Degree to which the #Evaluee behaves appropriately towards others. The#Behavior alone may be mentioned with the understanding that these behaviors characterize a property of the unmentioned #Evaluee. The #Evaluee's #Behavior may be in the context of a #Topic.

<ex> It was [nice|Target] [of you|Evaluee] [to send a card|Behavior]. </ex>

<ex> [Jim|Evaluee] was [thoughtful|Target] [to email the directions|Behavior].</ex>

<ex> [For Martha to smoke in the car|Behavior] was [extremely|Degree] [inconsiderate|Target].</ex>

<ex> It was [cruel|Target] [that he continued to call her|Behavior].</ex>

<ex> [Mary|Evaluee] was [cruel|Target] [to her friends|Affected_party].</ex>

<ex> Samson was a [thoughtless|Target] [person|Evaluee].</ex>

<ex>[Mrs. Robinson|Evaluee] was always [considerate|Target] [of her students|Affected_party].</ex>

<ex> [The press|Evaluee] was always [kind|Target] [about Madonna|Topic].</ex>

<ex> [Lee|Evaluee] was [nice|Target] [about my car accident|Topic].</ex>

<ex> I appreciated his [kind|Target] [offer of the car|Behavior].</ex>

name: Sole_instance
description:
An #Item is the only instance of its #Type.
<ex>[Steven|Item] is the [sole|Target] [survivor|Type] in his family.</ex>

name: Sounds
description:
This frame is  concerned with the percepts that vibrations which travel through the air or another medium produce in hearing organs. Sounds are a subtype of sensation. In talking about sounds, speakers often provide information about how the sound was produced. A #Noisy_event may be mentioned which gives rise to the sound. Alternatively, the sound may be attributed to a #Sound_source, which is construed as a point source emitting the sound. A further possible specification of what gives rise to the sound is for speakers to talk about two physical entities coming into contact by motion, resulting in either friction or impact.

Although this frame is defined in terms of a phenomenon of objective reality, many instances of the LUs in this frame are metonymic references to purely psychological phenomena due to a strong metaphorical relationship between external and internal reality. Furthermore, many of the LUs in this frame such as chuckle.n or whimper.n require a perceiver's analysis of a sound rather than being purely descriptive.

<ex>I awoke to the [clash|Target] [of a jackhammer on concrete|Sound_source].</ex>

name: Sound_level
description:
An #Entity is judged by a sound #Attribute of some perceived level of #Volume intensity.
<ex>[The radio|Entity] is [very|Degree] [loud|Target].</ex>

name: Sound_movement
description:
A #Sound emitted by a  #Sound_source, which construed as a single point, moves along a #Path. Rather than the #Sound_source itself, the #Location_of_sound_source may be mentioned. Essentially, this frame denotes the (semi-)fictive motion of the the #Sound. Given the spreading nature of sound vibrations, it is not surprising that there usually is no expression of any particular #Goal.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Her shouts|Sound] [echoed|Target] [around the cylinder formed by the walls|Path].</ex>

<ex>She heard her name called from below, the sound distorted as [it|Sound] [echoed|Target] [from the depths|Sound_source].</ex>

<ex>[Her voice|Sound] [echoed|Target] [flatly|Manner] [from hollow walls|Location_of_sound_source].</ex>

name: Source_of_getting
description: A #Goal has a #Source from which it has gotten a #Theme. The #Goal may be a sentient recipient who has actively obtained the #Theme but it may also be a non-sentient entity that gets the #Theme as a result of natural or other processes that it does not control. [she|sou] is my friend...not to mention [my|goa] [source|Target] [for French madeleines|thm]! Pakistan informed IAEA and US officials investigating the network that [North Korea|sou] was the [source|Target] [of the uranium shipment|thm] [DNI|goa]. [The state|sou] remains the dominant [source|Target] [of research funding|thm]. [INI|goa] This is not true according to [our|goa] [[source|Target]|sou]. [DNI|thm] Note that we also take this frame to cover as metaphorical uses those cases where a person has obtained information from another person or a textual source, which they typically intend to disseminate further. Crews was held in contempt and ordered to jail after refusing to reveal [his|goa] [[source|Target]|sou] [for the claim that Big Basket Weaving is circumventing import tariffs on reed.|thm]

name: Source_path_goal
description: Basic Image Schema: the #Trajector moves (or is conceived as moving) from the #Source along the #Path to the #Goal using the #Means.

name: Spatial_co-location
description:
A #Figure is located essentially at the same location as a #Ground, which is viewed as point-like, or having no important internal or external structure.  Typically, the #Ground is viewed as point-like due to its small size with respect to a conversationally relevant spatial scale; this scale may be provided by reference to other, distant entities or full paths of travel that make the size of the #Ground seem relatively small.  Another use of this frame is to specify a location via a #Ground that is primarily considered for its function, rather than its shape; this second use explains why ""at the store"" is typically used even when a #Figure is inside the #Ground, but only in cases where the store is considered, according to its prototype, as a place to buy and sell, rather than an architectural entity (in which case ""in the store"" would be more usual).

<ex>[We|Figure] <m>are</m> [now|Time] [at|Target] [the cathedral|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>They claim that [many Christians were martyred|Figure] [at|Target] [the Collosseum|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>[I|Figure] <m>'m</m> [at|Target] [my mother 's|Ground] .</ex>

This frame has a very large family of productive metaphors associated with it, the foremost of which maps from the target meaning of values on a quantitive scale (e.g. price, temperature, speed) onto the source domain of vertically-arranged positions in space.  Because this metaphor does not normally serve to locate a cognitive agent, it is only rarely and exceptionally usable with the LU here.adv, which implies being at the same location as the speaker. A separate metaphor maps the target meaning of quantified progress (measured by a quantity associated with a processed entity vs. a quantity associated with what is left to be done) onto the source domain of forward-backward-arranged positions in space.

<ex> [Tesla stock|Figure] <m>is</m> [at|Target] [a three-month low|Ground] [today|Time] .</ex>
<ex>[She put the biscuits in the oven|Figure] [at|Target] [only 400 degrees|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>[At|Target] [fifty dollars|Ground] , [everyone 's gonna buy one|Figure] !</ex>
<ex>If [you|Figure] <m>'re</m> only [at|Target] [page 20|Ground] , just start over .</ex>

name: Spatial_contact
description:
A #Figure is located in contact with a #Ground.  With some words that evoke this frame, the #Figure is also asserted to be fully or partially supported by the #Ground (e.g. <m>on</m>), while in others a support relation is either denied (e.g. <m>to</m>, as in ""she put her hand <m>to</m> the wall"") or unspecified (e.g. <m>against</m>).  In addition, some LUs assert a direction in which to find the #Figure from the #Ground (e.g. <m>atop</m>).

<ex>There <ment>was</ment> [a tight-fitting lid|Figure] [on|Target] [the bottle|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>[Against|Target] [the back wall|Ground] <m>stood</m> [a young black man|Figure] staring at his shoes .</ex>
<ex>[Against|Target] [the back wall|Ground] [three students were reading|Figure] .</ex>
<ex>Clean if [the jewelery|Figure] <m>is</m> ever <m>in</m> [contact|Target] [with water or chlorine|Ground] .</ex>

This frame participates in productive metaphor cases, like ""shining a light on corruption"", ""Stalin's hand lay heavy on the presses"", ""it touched her heart"" in each of which an abstract entity affects another entity as if they were in physical contact.
<ex></ex>

This frame is intended to cover the description of writing, images, or situations being depicted on a document, canvas, screen, or other flat surface, including metaphorical cases where there is no literal document, like ""on record"" or ""pretty low on my list"".
<ex>[They were arguing|Figure] [on|Target] [screen|Ground] .</ex>
<ex>[Watching chess|Figure] is pretty low [on|Target] [my list|Ground] .</ex>

The use of on.prep to describe use of a vehicle is not included in this frame even though it does involve contact and support. The sense distinction is proven by the omissability of the Ground only in the vehicle cases:
<ex>She is already on (the bus/the ship...) .</ex>
<ex>My paper is on *(the desk) .</ex>
This use is related to Ride_vehicle.  A similar argument holds for uses of on.prep with a clothing Figure, which virtually always omits the Ground; see Wearing.
<ex></ex>
