The use of on.prep and upon.prep for Topics is considered a non-productive metaphor (see Topic).  No other target in the frame allows the use, nor is is correlated with other language of the source domain of contact (e.g. stand, sit, lie, put, rest).

name: Speak_on_topic
description:
A #Speaker addresses an #Audience on a particular #Topic.  The #Audience is generally passive, although for many types of address (including academic talks and press conferences), a discussion or question-answer period is virtually always required.

<ex>[McNamara|Speaker] [addressed|Target] [congress|Audience] [on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense|Topic].</ex>

name: Specific_individual
description:
LUs in this frame denote that the #Instance of a #Type is contextually notable.  This frame typically requires dual FE layer annotation; see below.

<ex>I contrived to acquire a [particular|Target] [vintage of Merlot|Type]</ex>

<ex>I contrived to acquire a [[particular|Target] vintage of Merlot|Instance]</ex>

name: Speed_description
description:
An #Entity is in motion  at a particular #Speed, a momentaneous description of distance traveled per time.


<ex>[The car|Entity] went by [real|Degree]  [fast|Target].</ex>

<ex>[The car|Entity] <m>is</m> [really|Degree] [fast|Target].</ex>

<ex>Oh yeah, [Maseratis|Entity] <m>are</m> [fast|Target]! [INI|Degree]</ex>

<ex>The [speed|Target] [of the car|Entity] was [25 mph|Speed] [when it ran into the obstacle|Time].</ex>

LUs of this frame are commonly involved in a semantic construction in which, instead of describing the current #Speed, they rather describe some other #Speed saliently associated with the #Entity, such as maximum possible #Speed of the #Entity or (for an #Entity used as an implement) #Speed when in operation.

This construction can be defined as follows:

A phrase describing a temporary (stage-level) property (A) of an entity (B) is pumped to a phrase describing an individual-level property predicating or attributing the entity's (B's) salient association with such a property (A) under some salient conditions, especially the conditions of use of the entity.  E.g., in the Temperature or Location_of_light frames:

<ex>I can never bake anything in my oven because it 's too hot.</ex>
<ex>She gave him a really bright flashlight for Christmas.</ex>

name: Spelling_and_pronouncing
description:
A #Speaker realizes a #Sign, usually a linguistic one, in some #Formal_realization. The #Formal_realization may be described as correct or incorrect in a #Judgment expression, or it may be partially indicated as a #Part_of_form.  #Manner may be used as a more general indication of the #Formal_realization

<ex>[A person|spe] doesn't always [pronounce|Target] [a word|sig] [the way they say  it in context|man]</ex>

<ex>[I|spe] can't [spell|Target]. [INI|sig] [INI|jud]</ex>

<ex>[Stephanopolous|spe] [spells|Target] [his name|sig] [with a ""ph""|pof].</ex>

<ex>[On page 87465|cxt], [you|spe] [spelled|Target] [the name of my dog|sig] [incorrectly|jud] [as ""Checquers""|for].</ex>

<ex>[In German|cxt], [the word for 'peace'|sig] is [written|Target] [""Friede""|for] [CNI|spe]</ex>

name: Sports
description: Ways to practice physical activities that, through occasional or organized participation, aims to balance health or improve physical or mental fitness, provide entertainment or generate competition among participants.

name: Sports_disciplines
description: This frame brings together the set of sports subcategories or types of #Sports_discipline.

name: Sports_equipment
description: This frame includes the objects and apparatus used directly by the athletes or referees as sports #Equipment in a sports competition.

name: Sports_temporal_subdivision
description: This frame refers to the periods of #Time in which the sports are organized and subdivided.

name: Sports_venues_subparts
description: This frame refers to the #Parts of a #Venue.

name: Sports_scenario
description: Human activity whose the main actor is an #Athlete that practices some #Sport, aiming the welfare or to win some rules based competition, using kinds of #Equipment and #Venue.

name: Sports_venues
description: A #Venue is a building, structure, or place where a competition of a particular #Sport takes place.

name: Stage_of_progress
description:
An #Entity is at a particular stage of its development.

<ex> The [Next Generation|Target] [Internet|ent] (NGI) Program has been successfully completed.</ex>

<ex>Osama bin Laden, prime suspect in the US terror attacks, is outfoxing intelligence agencies with his [low-tech|Target] [communication methods|ent].</ex>
<ex>[Kids|ent] <m>are</m> [much more|deg] [advanced|Target] [today|tim] [than they were in our era|deg] that is for sure.</ex>

name: Standing_by
description:
A #Protagonist waits for an #Expected_request, and is prepared to respond to the request when it comes by engaging in an #Activity. Alternatively, the #Protagonist waits for a #Salient_entity involved in the request, most often realized as the person making the request.

<ex>[Police|pro] have been [standing by|Target] [for further orders regarding the protesters|exp] [for over two hours|Duration].</ex>

<ex>[Our staff|pro] are [on call|Target] [24 hours a day|Time].</ex>

name: State
description: An #Entity persists in a stable situation called a #State

name: Statement
description:
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a #Speaker to address a #Message to some #Addressee using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a #Speaker, a #Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a #Topic may be stated instead of a #Message. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as <m>declare</m> and <m>insist</m>.

<ex>[I|Speaker] now [declare|Target] [you|Message] [members of this Society|Message].</ex>

<ex>[She|Speaker] [said|Target] [that I would be late|Message] .</ex>

<ex>The [announcement|Target] [about raffle winners|Top] came [across the loudspeaker|Medium].</ex>

name: State_continue
description:
Despite some implication that a #State would be interrupted, the #Entity remains in the specified #State. Note that #State includes locative relations.

<ex>[Online security|ent] remains [elusive|sta].</ex>
<ex></ex>

name: State_of_entity
description:
An #Entity is in a specified #State. When not explicitly specified, the #State usually concerns the #Entity's health, repair, or functioning. The #State is also often assessed with an #Evaluation and it may be specified to apply only to a particular  #Parameter of the #Entity.

<ex>[Some of the classics|Entity]  <m>were</m> <m>in</m> [excellent|Evaluation] [[condition|Target]|State].</ex>

<ex>She was taken home , where [her|Entity] [[condition|Target]|State] worsened.</ex>

<ex>They soon reduced [the Indians|Entity] <m>to</m> a [CONDITION|Target] [of abject slavery|State] .</ex>

<ex>They had regressed beyond any help and could never be cured of [their|Entity] [""bestial""|Evaluation] [STATE|Target] [of utter dependency on poor relief|State].</ex>

<ex>Evil is the outer result of a [mental|Parameter] [condition|Target] [of fear, ignorance, doubt, unbelief|State].</ex>

name: State_of_process
description: State_of_process

name: Stative_configuration
description: Stative_configuration

name: Stative_location
description: Stative_location

name: Stimulate_emotion
description:
Some phenomenon (the #Stimulus) provokes a particular emotion in an #Experiencer.

<ex>[Nightmare on Elm Street|Stimulus] [scared|Target] [me|Experiencer] [silly|Result].</ex>

name: Stimulus_focus
description:
In this frame either a #Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the #Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience. Some words indicate that the #Stimulus is characterized by the experience it is likely to evoke in an #Experiencer and for these, the #Experiencer may rarely be present. There may also be a #Degree to which the #Stimulus affects the #Experiencer and #Circumstances under which the experience occurs. There may also be a #Comparison_set to which the #Stimulus is compared and a #Parameter that indicates the area in which the #Stimulus has its effect.
<ex> [The view|Stimulus] is [breathtaking|Target] [in January|Circumstances]. </ex>
<ex> [That movie|Stimulus] was [quite|Degree] [fascinating|Target]. </ex>
<ex> That was certainly a [gratifying|Target] [experience|Stimulus].</ex>
<ex> [The report|Stimulus] was [very|Degree] [alarming|Target] [to me|Experiencer]. </ex>

name: Stinginess
description:
In this frame, a #Resource_controller is judged by a #Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the #Recipient access to their #Resource. The #Resource_controller may exhibit this attitude with an #Expressor.

<ex>[John|Resource_controller] is [mean|Target] [with money|Resource].</ex>
<ex>[Sally|Resource_controller] has always been [generous|Target] [to her children|Recipient].</ex>

name: Store
description:
A #Supply of a #Resource is kept safe and available for a future #Use.  The #Supply may be under the control of a #Possessor.

<ex>[Our|Possessor] [supply|Target] [of food|Resource] is running low.</ex>

name: Storing
description: An #Agent has placed a #Theme in an accessible but somewhat out of the way #Location for the purposes of maintaining it free from harm and illegitimate use while it is not being used.

name: Strictness
description:
These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an #Agent, usually with regard to another person (the #Controlled_entity) and often with regard to a particular #Issue.

The strictness/lenience with respect to the #Issue may be manifested in (expressed by) an #Agent or by some #Medium (e.g., laws), or by some behavior of the #Agent, i.e., the #Controlling_act.

<ex>Court says [judge|Agent] [too|Degree] [lenient|Target] [in rape case|Area].[INI|Issue]</ex>
<ex>[Sonny|Agent] <m>was</m> [indulgent|Target] [of her admirers|Controlled_entity] and allowed their attention for a time before she disappeared into the small back room.</ex>
<ex>[Some laws|Medium] <m>are</m> just [too|Degree] [strict|Target].</ex>
<ex>Don't <m>be</m> [strict|Target] [about cross-posting|Issue].[CNI|Agent]</ex>

name: Studying
description:
A #Student enrolls and then remains at an #Institution for the purposes of education within a #Subject.  They may receive instruction from a particular #Teacher at the #Institution.  The #Place, #Time, and #Duration of the study may also be specified.

<ex>[He|Student] spent ten years [studying|Target] [physics|Subject] [at the lycee|Institution] before he flunked out.</ex>

name: Suasion
description:
A #Speaker succeeds in getting an #Addressee to believe or plan to execute the #Content the #Speaker has in mind. In most cases, the information is related to some course of action for the #Addressee, and the words of this frame imply that the #Addressee has formed an intention to act consistently with the #Content. There is no implication that the #Addressee actually acts upon the intention formed. In the case of <ment>convince</ment> and <ment>persuade</ment>, the act that the #Speaker wishes the #Addressee to perform can be the adoption of a belief, which may be expressed as a that-clause or as an of-PP complement.

This frame differs from Attempt_suasion in that in Suasion, the #Addressee has changed their mind in accord with the #Speaker's wishes, whereas in Attempt_suasion, the only implication is that the #Speaker communicates with the intent of changing the mind of the #Addressee.


This Frame has unique Frame-to-Frame Relations: it inherits from and uses the Eventive_cognizer_affecting frame. This is atypical of FrameNet's frame relations.

<ex></ex>
<ex>At one point, [Walter|Speaker] tries to [convince|Target] [his wife|Addressee] [that he has had a story accepted by BBC Radio|Content].</ex>

<ex>[They|Addressee] invaded the bridge, but were [dissuaded|Target] [from further action|Content] [by the captain|Speaker].</ex>

name: Subjective_experience
description: Subjective_experience

name: Subjective_influence
description:
An #Agent, #Situation or #Entity has an influence on a #Cognizer. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the #Cognizer's engaging in an #Action as a consequence of the influence; or the #Cognizer may be influenced in how they carry out a #Behavior that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a #Product may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the #Cognizer's experience of the  #Situation or #Entity.
<ex></ex>

The  mediation of the #Cognizer's psyche distinguishes this frame from the Objective_influence frame, where dependent events occur automatically given the appropriate kind of influencing force. In this frame, by contrast, a #Cognizer may perceive an influence yet not respond to it in any way.

<ex> [These works|ent] had a profound effect and [influenced|Target] [her|cog] [in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region|beh].</ex>
<ex>I'm sure if I asked Mattel [what|sit] [inspired|Target] [this car|pro] I would be told it's an original design, and not supposed to represent any actual car.</ex>

name: Subjective_state
description: Subjective_state

name: Subjective_temperature
description:
An #Experiencer senses different degrees of warmth that may or may not be related to the ambient temperature. The level of warmth is usually compared against the #Experiencer's subjective standard of comfort.

<ex>[My feet|Body_part] are [cold|Target].</ex>
<ex>The fire will <m>keep</m> [you|Experiencer] [warm|Target].</ex>
<ex>[I|Experiencer]'<m>m</m> [too|Degree] [hot|Target] with this sweater on.</ex>

name: Submitting_documents
description:
A #Submittor gives #Documents to an #Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.


<ex>I  was sure I had passed as soon as [I|Submittor] [handed|Target] [in|Target] [the test|Documents]. [DNI|Authority]</ex>

<ex>She stated that [she|Submittor] [turned|Target] [in|Target] [the paperwork|Documents] [yesterday|Time].</ex>

<ex>After [the applicant's|Submittor] [submission|Target] [to the department|Authority], the department chairperson must evaluate.</ex>

<ex>I acknowledge [my|Submittor] [submission|Target] [of the Material|Documents] [to you|Authority] shall not lead to a concurrent review by any of your affiliate and subsidiary channels.</ex>

name: Subordinates_and_superiors
description:
Two individuals, the #Subordinate and the #Superior have a relationship such that the #Subordinate generally follows orders given by the #Superior and has the best interests of the #Superior in mind.

<ex>The archduke and several of [his|Superior] [[henchmen|Subordinate]|Target] got out of the carriage, looking around nervously.</ex>

name: Subsisting
description:
An #Entity survives a situation with some #Support, which tends to be far below the accustomed or standard level expected. The #Degree to which the #Support is responsible for the #Entity's survival may be mentioned, as well as the #Duration for which the situation lasts.

<ex>[Harry|Entity] [subsisted|Target] [on ramen and cheap beer|Support] through college.</ex>

name: Substance
description:
This frame concerns internally undifferentiated #Substances.


<ex>As their gut bacteria ferment cellulose , they generate [methane|con] [gas|Target] , which escapes from the rear ends of the insects.</ex>

<ex> The pipes are leaking [noxious|des] [gas|Target].</ex>

<ex>Some CH-47 ""Bombers"" were equipped to roll-out [riot control|use] [gas|Target] or napalm onto Viet Cong bunker complexes from the rear cargo ramp.</ex>

name: Substance_by_phase
description:
In this frame a #Substance is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.  This can be its inherent phase or indicate that it is returned to its inherent state.

<ex>Collect up the  [thawed|Target] [water|Substance] from the freezer section.</ex> <ex>Put under the broiler until [the cheese|Substance] becomes [melted|Target].</ex>
<ex>Major companies are switching to [liquefied|Target] [natural gas|Substance].</ex>

name: Subversion
description:
A  #Counter_actor or #Cause  impedes an #Agent in an #Activity or impedes the unfolding or continuation of a #State_of_affairs. The opposing force applies without first being noticed, often in a secret or an underhanded fashion.

<ex>However, as this story goes on the Queen of Sodom has [a brother who|cou]
plans to [undermine|Target] [his sister|age] and take the throne of Sodom.</ex>

<ex> Diotrephes withstood John's words, and would not submit to his authority; in fact, [he|cou] [undermined|Target] [John's authority|soa].</ex>

<ex> I don't want to get a reputation for punishing disagreement. On the other
hand, [he|cou] [undercut|Target] [me|age] [pretty badly|deg] and I can't just let it slide.</ex>

name: Successfully_communicate_message
description:
A #Communicator speaks to an #Addressee in such a way that the #Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the #Message.


<ex> Marred by overblown writing , [this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife|Medium] effectively [conveys|Target] [some of South Africa 's problems|Message] .[INI|Add]</ex>

<ex>[He|Communicator] [conveys|Target] vividly the absurdity of a situation , but he is incurious about the underlying processes which shape it. [INI|Add]</ex>

<ex>[We|Communicator]'ve got to [get|Target] [the message|Message] [through|Target] [to them|Add] [before they become sexually active|Time].</ex>

<ex>Have you been using PowerPoint (PPT) for years and feel [you|Communicator] don't [always|Time] [get|Target] [your point|Message] [across|Target] [to the audience|Addressee]?</ex>

<ex>It 's impossible to [convey|Target] [how lost I felt|Message]. [CNI|Communicator]  [INI|Add]</ex>

<ex>But , alas , [the printed word|Medium] can not [adequately|Adequacy] [convey|Target] [the panting , gasping misery of this particular torment|Message]. [INI|Add]</ex>

name: Successful_action
description:
The #Means action by which a deprofiled agent (the #Protagonist) has attempted to achieve a #Goal, is finished and the actual outcome of the #Means action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the #Protagonist's intent (e.g. <ment>success</ment>) or does not match it (e.g. <ment>failure</ment>). In an alternative construal, an #Instrument stands for the #Means action that the deprofiled agent undertakes in order to achieve the #Goal.


<ex>[Why|cau] [our bid|mea] <m>was</m> [successful|Target]. [DNI|goa]</ex>
<ex>[Your attempt to unsubscribe|mea] <m>was</m> [unsuccessful|Target], please try again later. [DNI|goa]</ex>
<ex> Well I did end up replacing the old co axial cables with new monster ones and
[it|mea] [did|Target] [the|Target] [trick|Target]. [DNI|goa]</ex>
<ex>[The hammer|ins] [did|Target] [it|Target], not a scratch or dent in the parts as they came apart [DNI|goa].</ex>
<ex>[What|Means] has [failed|Target] [in Palestine|Place], will fail in Iraq. [DNI|Goal]</ex>

name: Success_or_failure
description:
An #Agent has attempted to achieve a #Goal, and the actual outcome of the #Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the #Agent's intent (e.g. <m>success</m>) or does not match it (e.g. <m>failure</m>).

<ex>[He|age] [pulled|Target] [off|Target] [his April Fool's Day prank|goa] [by the barest of margins|deg] .</ex>
<ex>Unfortunately, [we|age] <m>were</m> n't [successful|Target]. [DNI|goa]</ex>
<ex>[We|age] [failed|Target] [miserably|deg] [at getting the gay rights bill passed|goa] .</ex>

name: Sufficiency
description:
An #Item is located on a #Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some #Enabled_situation. Generally, when the #Enabled_situation is left unexpressed the #Enabled_situation is interpreted to be the desirability of the #Item being located within a particular range on the #Scale. With many of the adjectives of this frame, the #Scale is not explicitly mentioned; in such cases, the #Scale is usually the quantity, incorporated in the meaning of the targets themselves, though in the case of [adequacy|Target], etc. the #Scale referred to is quality.

<ex>I probably have [enough|Target]. [DNI|Item] [DNI|Enabled_situation]</ex>

<ex>[I|Item] was [mad|Scale] [enough|Target] [to scream|Enabled_situation].</ex>

<ex>[I|Item] was [too|Target] [mad|Scale] [to keep myself from screaming|Enabled_situation].</ex>

<ex>[I|Item] was [way|Degree] [too|Target] [hot|Scale]. [DNI|Enabled_situation]</ex>

<ex>[The particles|Item] are [sufficiently|Target] [small|Scale] in diameter [that they may be considered points|Enabled_situation].</ex>

name: Suicide_attack
description:
An #Assailant attacks a #Victim, intending to die in the process. In the prototypical case, the attack is designed to kill the #Assailant, as when a pilot deliberately crashes a plane into the target.

<ex>The [terrorist|Assailant] [suicide attack|Target] [on U.S. troops|Victim] [early last week|Time] caused more damage than initially reported.</ex>

<ex>[They|Assailant] [kamikazed|Target] [the base|Victim] [in the middle of the night|Time]!</ex>

name: Suitability
description:
This Frame is concerned with evaluating an #Evaluee as being suitable for a #Purpose or a #User, presupposing some choice that is being made about which #Evaluee to use for the #Purpose or #User.  An LU like suitable.a thus implies that, given a particular #Purpose or #User, the #Evaluee is one which could be or ought to be chosen.  The #Evaluee may be deemed suitable to a greater or lesser #Degree. This frame has some similarity to the compatibility frame where two Items are evaluated with respect to their compatibility with each other against some background.

<ex>(1) We need to build [more houses|Evaluee] [suitable|Target] [for local residents|User].</ex>
<ex>(2) [These chips|Evaluee] are not [very|Degree][suitable|Target] [for parallel processing|Purpose]. </ex>
<ex>(3) We are not sure about [the Cathedral's|Evaluee] [suitability|Target] [for Philharmonic concerts|Purpose].</ex>

name: Summarizing
description:
A #Communicator processes some information (either from textual or real-world/perceptual sources) regarding a #State_of_affairs into a concise form (a summary) that contains the essential content in briefer form, and communicates this summary to an #Addressee, or records it in a #Medium. The #State_of_affairs may be represented directly (e.g., outline <ment>what happened</ment>, <ment>the situation abroad</ment>), or as a textual source (summarizing <ment>the documents</ment>), or metonymically as some focal entity (a synopsis <ment>of the candidates</ment>).

<ex>[Frank|Communicator] has already [summarized|Target] [some of the reactions|State_of_affairs] [on his weblog|med].</ex>
<ex>[Director Van Auken|com] <ment>gave</ment> a brief informational [synopsis|Target] [of each applicant|sta]. </ex>
<ex>[He|Communicator] [boiled|Target] [down|Target] [the argument for domestic wiretapping|State_of_affairs] in one plainspoken and effective, if also deceptive, line...</ex>
<ex>[You|Communicator] should be able to [summarize|Target] [your findings|State_of_affairs] [to a lay audience|Addressee].</ex>
<ex>[In her materials|Medium], [she|Communicator] also [outlined|Target] [the situation and major problems facing the company|State_of_affairs].</ex>

Some LUs, such as <ment>summarize</ment> and <ment>synopsis</ment> entail a preexisting body of information that has been processed into a briefer form by the #Communicator. Others, such as <ment>outline</ment> and <ment>blueprint</ment> are compatible with, but do not entail, a preexisting, fully fleshed-out concept. E.g.,

<ex>[Her book|Medium] [outlines|Target] [a new proposal for handling grammaticalization|State_of_affairs], though she doesn't flesh it out entirely.</ex>

name: Supply
description:
A #Supplier gives a #Theme to a #Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (#Imposed_purpose) of the #Recipient.

<ex>Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by [provisioning|Target] [them|Recipient] [with sugar cane|Theme]. [CNI|Supplier] [INI|Imposed_purpose]</ex>

<ex>[I|Supplier] have [equipped|Target] [my leech troopers|Recipient] [with tiny subspace displacement thingummies|Theme]. [INI|Imposed_purpose]</ex>


<ex> She sat down on her bed, carefully folding her clothing and packing it into
[the small carryall|Theme] [Starfleet|Supplier] had [provided|Target] [her|Recipient] [for the journey|Imposed_purpose].</ex>

name: Supporting
description:
A #Supporter assists to strengthen the #Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).

<ex>[The bottom of the wall|Supported] is [supported|Target] [by the foundation|Supporter].</ex>

<ex>[Many legislators|Supporter] have [supported|Target] [the industry|Supported] [in the past|Time].</ex>

<ex>[The revetment layers|Supporter] [buttressed|Target] [the mud-mortared cobblestone core wall|Supported].</ex>

<ex>[Online gambling|Supporter] can [bolster|Target] [the US economy|Supported].</ex>

name: Surpassing
description:
In this frame a #Profiled_item is higher that its #Standard_item on a scale with respect to some #Attribute. The #Extent of the difference between the #Standard_item and the #Profiled_item may also be mentioned. Furthermore, the particular value of the standard or profiled item on a certain scale may be given by the #Standard_attribute of the #Profiled_attribute respectively.

<ex> [Notices for the Shield Theater's production of Macbeth|Profiled_item] [surpassed|Target] [all previous reviews|Standard_item] . </ex>

<ex> [ Radio WKRR|Profiled_item] [far|Extent] [surpasses|Target] [all radio stations|Standard_item] [among rural radio stations|Comparison_set] [ as the leading source of regional news |Attribute] . </ex>

<ex> [We|Profiled_item] [surpassed|Target] [father's skills|Standard_attribute] [ before we were 12 |Time] . </ex>

<ex> [The current price|Profiled_attribute] [surpasses|Target] [the price this time last year|Standard_attribute].</ex>

name: Surrendering
description: In this frame a #Fugitive presents himself or herself to the #Authorities to be subject to the criminal process. <ex> [The bank robber|Fugitive] [surrendered|Target] [to Berkeley police|Authorities]. </ex> <ex> [Norte|Fugitive] is expected to [surrender|Target] [to police|Authorities] [tomorrow|Time] [on tax fraud charges|Charges] . </ex>

name: Surrendering_possession
description:
A #Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a #Theme to a #Recipient.

<ex>Shortly after [the boy|Surrenderer] [surrendered|Target] [the gun|Theme], the three remaining warriors made a rush for liberty.</ex>

<ex>[He|Surrenderer] [finally|Time] [surrendered|Target] [the item|Theme] [after cops and Secret Service agents showed up at his home Saturday|Time].</ex>

<ex>[D?Augustino|Surrenderer] [yielded|Target] [the weapon|Theme] [to Herrick|Recipient].</ex>

name: Surrounding
description:
A #Figure surrounds a #Ground.  The #Ground location is presented as more likely to be a known location than the location of the #Figure. Some lexical units entail more-or-less complete surrounding in two or three dimensions (e.g. surround.v), while others entail surrounding on only two sides (e.g. astride.prep, straddle.v).  Like other locative relations, the #Figure may be any of a movable entity, an immovable entity, or an event.

<ex>[The hand|Figure] [around|Target] [the sword-hilt|Ground] was no less impressive than the sword .</ex>
<ex>[The drug war|Figure] [straddles|Target] [the border of the US and Mexico|Ground] .</ex>

This frame resembles the Abounding_with frame, in that both involve a #Figure ""covering"" some #Ground, but the Surrounding frame differs in that the #Profiled_region is not coextensive with the #Ground, as it is in the Adorning frame, and, in fact, unusually for a locative relation, the #Ground entity is normally smaller than the #Figure.  For this reason, the verbs of this frame are often used in the passive (restoring the normal relationship of stative subjects to oblique elements).
<ex></ex>
In addition to several lexical units of this frame originating as metaphorical extentions of much more specific posture descriptions (straddle.v, astride.prep), this frame is itself used in a productive metaphor, involving abstract entities metaphorically ""impinging"" on other entities (in terms of derivative similarity, control, etc.), as in the following:
<ex>that led to Dolce and Gabbana to [base their autumn/winter D and G collection|Figure] [around|Target] [her style|Ground] in 2008</ex>
<ex>But he discovered that [the literary world|Ground] was a battlefield— mined with hatred, [rimmed|Target] [with snipers|Figure]. </ex>
<ex>[Countless legends|Figure] sprung up [around|Target] [the knight|Ground].</ex>

Common abstract entities that serve as #Figure include emotions ('the hopelessness [surrounding|Target] them'), as well as theories, arguments, and collective philosophies ('Ageism [surrounds|Target] us, but passes largely unnoticed').
This metaphor arises from the normal invited implicature of this frame that the #Figure may physically impinge on the #Ground, either protecting it, or limiting its motion, or even supporting it.

name: Surviving
description:
A #Survivor manages to avoid being negatively affected, despite encountering a #Dangerous_situation. The negative effect is most often death, destruction, or a metaphorical construal of one of these.

<ex>Wilderness Survival: Could [You|sur] [Survive|Target] [the Wild|dan]?</ex>

<ex>[More than 400 of the 600 residents|sur] [rode|Target] [out|Target] [the hurricane|dan] [in Gulfport's 11-story high-rise beachfront facility|Place].</ex>

name: Suspicion
description:
A person or group, the #Authority, believes that another person, the #Suspect is a participant in a criminal #Incident.

<ex>[The police|Authority] [suspect|Target] [Noah Rogers|Suspect] [of aiding the robbery last night at Shop-n-drive|Incident].</ex>

name: Symmetrical_collective_reciprocality
description: Perspective of Reciprocality in which the #Protagonists are viewed as essentially identically participating in the Reciprocal event, relation, or situation, not differing in agency, affectedness, or presumed cognitive or conversational accessibility.

name: System
description:
A #Complex with a particular #Function is formed out of #Component_entities. The function may be expressed by reference to a #Salient_entity involved in the working of the #Complex.

<ex>[The body's|pos] [immune|fun] [[system|Target]|plx] can be mobilized against cancer. </ex>

<ex>The [sewer|com] [[system|Target]|plx] carries wastewater from homes and businesses to the Water Pollution Control Plant for treatment. </ex>

name: System_complexity
description:
A #System is perceived as complex depending on the intricacy of the interconnectivty of its parts or components. These individual parts or components do not function as frame elements in this frame, even though they are implied by its definition. A #Dimension may also be defined which situates the System within a certain domain.
<ex></ex>
<ex>San Diego freeways are a [complex|Target] [array of poorly maintained roads|System].</ex>
<ex> [Childrens' toys|System] <ment>are</ment> [simple|Target] to assemble.</ex>
<ex>[The hierarchy|System] <ment>is</ment> [complex|Target][in structure|Dimension].</ex>
<ex>The newly-discovered humanoid spoke a [syntactically|Dimension] [complex|Target] [language|System].</ex>

name: Take_place_of
description:
A #New filler occupies a #Role or serves a #Function after the #Old filler ceases to occupy the position.  In many cases, the #Role or #Function is implicit.


<ex>[Gas|new] can [substitute|Target] [entirely|deg] [for petrol|old].</ex>
<ex>Sometime in the 1880s [gas|new] [replaced|Target] [oil|old] [for manufacturing fuel|fun].</ex>
<ex>[Twelve years later|tim], [oil|new] [replaced|Target] [coal|old] [as the energy of choice|rol].</ex>
<ex>[Honey|New] can [replace|Target] [sugar|Old] [in this recipe|Textual_location].</ex>

name: Taking
description:
An #Agent removes a #Theme from a #Source so that the it is in the #Agent's possession.

<ex>[Milton|Agent] [took|Target] [the can of beer|Theme] [out of the refrigerator|Source].</ex>

name: Taking_captive
description:
An #Agent begins preventing a #Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the #Captive to do so.

<ex>[Authorities|Agt] [recently|Time] [captured|Target] [several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area|Captive].</ex>

<ex>[High value target|Captive] has been [quietly and safely|Manner] [secured|Target].</ex>

name: Taking_sides
description:
A #Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an #Issue.  A #Side in a debate concerning an #Issue or an #Action of a #Side may stand in for the #Issue.  The #Cognizer's #Degree of alignment may also be specified.

<ex>In interviews , it seems like [everyone|cog] <m>is</m> [completely|deg] [against|Target] [this expenditure|iss] .</ex>

name: Taking_time
description:
An #Activity takes some #Time_length to complete.  If an #Agent is involved they may stand in metonymically for the #Activity. For some LUs (e.g., <ment>fast</ment>, <ment>speedy</ment>) the #Degree to which the #Activity is conceived of as taking less time than usual can be expressed.

<ex>[How long|Time_length] will [this|Activity] [take|Target]?</ex>

<ex>[The ride|Activity] <m>was</m> [speedy|Target] and often bumpy.</ex>

<ex>Under high-pressure situations, [police officers|Agent] <m>are</m> [very|Degree] [fast|Target] [at reacting to danger|Activity].</ex>

name: Talking_into
description:
A #Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the #Addressee to act.  The #Addressee forms an intention to act and does so.
<ex></ex>
<ex>You think [I|Speaker] [talked|Target] [Peter|Addressee] [into giving me those earrings|Content], don't you?</ex>

<ex>Don't let [a shop assistant|Speaker] [talk|Target] [you|Addressee] [into buying a so-called ""orthopaedic"" bed|Content] -- there's no such thing.</ex>

name: Tasting
description:
An Agent ingests or begins to ingest a Food item that they have not had before with the intention of determining its quality on some scale. A Purpose for trying the Food may be explicitly mentioned.

<ex>[Most people|Agent] will never [try|Target] [dog|Food].</ex>
<ex>[I|Agent] [tasted|Target] [the soup|Food] [to see if it had enough salt|Purpose].</ex>

name: Tax
description: Tax

name: Team
description: A #Team is a group with shared goals and works toward them together in a coordinated fashion.

name: Moves
description: Actions performed by the athletes according to the rules for the sport.

name: Telling
description:
A #Speaker addresses an #Addressee with a #Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a #Topic. Instead of (or in addition to) a #Speaker, a #Medium may also be mentioned.

<ex>[I|Speaker] [told|Target] [him|Addressee] [about the party|Topic].</ex>

name: Temperature
description:
An #Entity has a #Temperature characterized by the target.  The #Temperature is a value of the temperature #Attribute.
<ex>[The pan|Entity] is already [too|Degree] [hot|Target] [to touch|Degree].</ex>

<ex>[The walk-in|Entity] was [freezing|Target], but it was better than hanging out in the kitchen.</ex>
<ex></ex>
Note that in this  frame, the #Entity does not experience the temperature, but is merely described as being in a certain externally verifiable state.
Thus <ex>Open a window; I'm too [hot|Target].</ex> is not in frame but rather in Subjective_temperature.

name: Temporal_collocation
description:
A Trajector is identified as occurring at the same time as some better-known Landmark.  We consider sequenced calendric units (e.g. Tuesday, 1987, January) as periods for the purposes of this frame.  Some lexical items allow certain types of frame elements while disallowing others (e.g. *[During|Target] Tuesday...).

Several words of this frame (e.g. <ment>now.adv</ment>) have deictic incorporation of the #Landmark_period.

<ex>[He tried to take care of that|Trajector_event] [on|Target] [his last visit|Landmark_event] .</ex>
<ex>I especially like [brunch|Trajector_entity] [on|Target] [Sunday|Landmark_period].</ex>
<ex>Dinosaurs lived in [prehistoric|Target] [eras|Trajector_period].</ex>

<ex>[He did it|Trajector_event] [[then|Landmark_period]|Target].</ex>

name: Temporal_deixis
description: Temporal_deixis

name: Temporal_pattern
description:
A salient #Subevent has a #Pattern of recurrence within a larger #Process.


<ex>Tony's fingers tapped [rhythmically|Target] on the keyboard</ex>

name: Temporal_subregion
description:
A #Subpart of a #Time_period is picked out.  In some cases, the part (as opposed to the entire #Time_period) may be described by a #Subpart_property.  The #Time_period may be indicated by an event which takes place during the #Time_period.

<ex>I nearly kicked my TV this afternoon after watching the [shambolic|subpp] [[end|subpar]|Target] [of the Austrian Grand-Prix|tim] .</ex>
<ex>Jack Yan looks at how the branding profession will be affected in the [[early|Target]|subpar] [2000s|tim] by globalization .</ex>
<ex>The [late|Target] [part|Subpart] of the afternoon is the worst time to get things done .</ex>

name: Temporary_group
description:
A #Temporary_group is formed from members of a #Parent_organization for a particular #Purpose. The #Temporary_group does not exist independently within the #Parent_organization. It is under the control of a #Container_possessor, which also controls the #Parent_organization.

<ex>They came upon another of Whipple's scouting parties, Under Lieutenant S.M. Rains, and wiped out the entire [twelve-man|mem] [[detachment|tem]|Target].</ex>

<ex>A [guard|pur] [[detachment|tem]|Target] [from the Royal regiment|par] was traveling with the main force to secure high-value prisoners.</ex>

name: Temporary_leave
description:
A #Person takes leave from his or her routine #Activity (such as work or school) for a #Duration of time.  The #Duration can be any length of time, as long as the absence is temporary.

<ex></ex>
<ex>The claimant should then submit medical certificates for the duration of [their|Person] [absence|Target] [from work|Act].[INI|Dur]</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>[He|Person] <m>took</m> [three month's|Dur] [leave|Target] and went to our world assembly at Caux. [DNI|Act]</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Negroponte|Person], [who|Person] is <m>on</m> a [two-year|Dur] [leave|Target] [of|Target] [absence|Target] [from MIT|Act], decided to stay on to the end of the present academic year.</ex>

name: Temporary_stay
description:
A #Guest stays for a time at a #Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some #Duration. The #Location is often the permanent residence of a #Host.

<ex>[I|pro] usually [stay|Target] [with my aunt|Host] [at her summer house|loc] [when I go to Seville|Time].</ex>

<ex>[For a few days|dur] [my father|pro] [lodged|Target] [at a hotel|loc] [with a buddy who was a biology student|cor].</ex>

name: Temporary_transfer_scenario
description: In this scenario, the #Theme begins in possession of the #Lender and ends up in the possession of the #Borrower, with the expectation that the #Borrower will return the #Theme after a #Duration of time.

name: Terms_of_agreement
description:
A condition that is set out in an #Agreement imposes #Requirements on a #Party or parties, with respect to some #Regulated_entity. If the conditions are not met, the #Agreement as a whole ceases to be valid or, more specifically, a #Desired_state_of_affairs cannot occur. (The #Desired_state_of_affairs typically is an interaction between the parties that benefits one or both sides.)


<ex>Breach of contract occurs where one of the parties fails to perform any one of the [contract|Agreement] [terms|Target] .</ex>
<ex>Breach of contract occurs where one of the parties fails to perform any one of the contract [[terms|Target]|req] .</ex>

<ex>[What|req] <m>are</m> [your|par] [conditions|Target] [for a peaceful settlement?|Desired_state_of_affairs]</ex>

<ex>Please read [our|par] [Conditions|Target] [of Sale|des] carefully</ex>
<ex>Please read our [[Conditions|Target]|req] of Sale carefully</ex>

<ex>We will verify compliance with the [financial|reg] [terms|Target] [of the contract|Agreement].</ex>
<ex>We will verify compliance with the financial [[terms|req]|Target] of the contract.</ex>

<ex>The Engineering Division has violated the [seniority|reg] [provision|Target] [of the collective bargaining agreement.|Agreement]</ex>
<ex>The Engineering Division has violated the seniority[ [provision|req]|Target] of the collective bargaining agreement.</ex>

name: Terrorism
description:
A #Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful #Act upon a #Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace. The #Act may be committed in particular for political or ideological reasons, and is often directed at civilians, as opposed to government or military officials. It is most often in violation of one or many laws.

<ex>[Their|Terrorist] [[terrorism|Target]|Act] [against civilians|Victim] will not be tolerated.</ex>

name: Text
description:
A #Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a #Topic, created by an #Author at the #Time_of_creation.  It may be a physical entity that is made of a certain #Material etc.  It may be constructed for a #Beneficiary.

<ex>[It|Text] was a good [book|Target].</ex>

name: Text_creation
description:
An #Author creates a #Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular #Addressee in mind.  The #Text may include information about its topic, although the latter is not an FE in this frame.

<ex>[I|Author] [penned|Target] [a letter concerning racism|Text]  [to Congress|Addressee].</ex>
<ex>[The brothers|Author] [said|Target] [not two words|Text] [to each other|Addressee].</ex>
<ex>[Jot|Target] [any notes you need|Text] [below the line|Place] [in red pen only|Manner].</ex>

name: Theft
description:
These are words describing situations in which a #Perpetrator takes #Goods from a  #Victim or a #Source. The #Means by which this is accomplished may also be expressed.

<ex>I can't believe [he|Perpetrator] [pickpocketed|Target] [my gold watch|Goods] !</ex>
<ex>[I|Perpetrator] had to [pilfer|Target] [from the office|Victim] [just to get by|Purpose] . [INI|Goods]</ex>
<ex>[Snatching|Target] [purses|Goods] [from little old ladies|Source] is not a living . [CNI|Perpetrator]</ex>

name: Thermodynamic_phase
description:
This frame describes the attributes of a thermodynamic #Phase of #Matter.
<ex></ex>
<ex>The [molten|Phase] [state|Target][of the lava|Matter].</ex>

name: Hospital
description: This frame depicts establishments that offer health services to tourists. The establishments are usually classified according to their type.

name: Threatening
description: Threatening

name: Thriving
description:
An #Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it. For living entities, this may entail a proliferation of instances of the entity, or of desirable properties associated with the (single) entity. For non-living entities (economies, political locales, academic topics, etc.), this entails a proliferation of instances, or of activities that lead to instances, or any attribute that would prevent the entity from disappearing. This state is conceived of as temporary, or at least contingent on a number of changeable factors. Words expressing the opposite state, i.e., a lack of such positive activity, are also in this frame.

<ex>[In the 1920s|tim] [the peach industry|ent] [flourished|Target] [in Upson County|pla].</ex>

<ex>[Construction companies|ent] [thrive|Target] [on public projects|cir].</ex>

name: Thwarting
description:
In this frame a #Preventing_cause interferes with the ability of a #Protagonist to complete an intended #Action. The #Protagonist may not be mentioned in the sentence, in which case the #Action is an endeavor that an individual or group of individuals hopes to accomplish. In this frame it is necessary that the #Protagonist is unable to successfully complete the #Action.

<ex> [Noriega's troops|Preventing_cause] [foiled|Target] [a coup attempt|Action]. </ex>
<ex> [He|Preventing_cause] [prevented|Target] [her|Protagonist] [from running away|Action]. </ex>
<ex> [He|Protagonist] was [foiled|Target] [in his attempt to overthrow the government|Action]. </ex>

name: Timespan
description:
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.

<ex>The [best|Descriptor] [time|Target] [of year|Whole] [for planting|State] tends to be fairly regular.</ex>

name: Timetable
description:
A #Timetable of #Events is a mental object deliberately created, modified or kept by a #Cognizer. The #Timetable is often modified by an adjective depicting a #Period_of_iterations or a dependent noun expressing the #Events of the #Timetable.

Note that this frame does not include the physical representation of a timetable.

<ex></ex>
As of now this frame does not have an inheritance relationship, but in the future a *Mental_object frame will be developed from which Timetable will inherit.
<ex></ex>

<ex>Changes to [an employee's|Cog] [work|Events] [[schedule|tt]|Target] should generally be approved prior to the change actually occuring.</ex>

<ex>[The science students|Cog] <m>had</m> [very full|Descriptor] [[timetables|tt]|Target]; these consisted mainly of lectures, with some lab sessions and problem classes or tutorials.</ex>

name: Time_period_of_action
description:
LUs in this frame denote a period of time in which an #Action is possible or required.  The #Duration of this time period can be either exact or inexact.  An #Agent who performs the #Action may also be mentioned.
<ex>Allow a [three-day|Duration] [window|Target] [for delivery|Action].  [DNI|Agent]</ex>

name: Time_relation
description: Time_relation

name: Time_vector
description:
An #Event is identified as occurring at a particular #Distance and in a particular #Direction from a #Landmark_event.   The lexical units incorporate the #Direction and, in some cases, the #Landmark_event.
This frame builds on the Direction frame, further specifying the Domain as Time.
This frame will receive some of the lexical units currently found in Relative_time.

<ex> [Tell me that|Event] [a week|Distance] [[from|Target]|Direction] [now|Landmark_event]. </ex>
<ex> [Some twelve months|Distance] [[after|Target]|Direction] [I had graduated|Landmark_event], [I had my first job interview|Event]</ex>

name: Tolerating
description:
The words in this frame describe an #Experiencer's feelings of tolerating with respect to some #Content. An #Explanation for the toleration may also be expressed.  Although the #Content may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.

<ex> [He|Experiencer] could not [tolerate|Target] [the smell of coconut|Content] . </ex>

name: Tool_purpose
description:
A living entity intends a #Tool to be able to fulfill a generic #Purpose.  The material from which the tool is created can be something natural or something manmade, including another tool.

<ex>The [use|Target] [of a saw|Tool] <m>is</m> [to cut down trees|Purpose].</ex>

name: Topic
description:
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a #Text that a #Communicator produces has a #Topic that it is about.

<ex>[Chapter 5|Text] [discusses|Target] [the issue of transubstantiation|Topic].</ex>
<ex>[Smither's essay|Text] is [about|Target] [plane spotting|Topic].</ex>
<ex> [Ostrovsky|Communicator] [addresses|Target] [monetary policy|Topic] [in Chapter 5|Text].</ex>
<ex>[This book|Text] is [mostly|Degree] [about|Target] [particle physics|Topic].</ex>

name: Touring
description:
A #Tourist experiences an #Attraction, a location with a unique history or other societally recognized individual character, with the goal of seeing and learning about it. Typically, the #Attraction has a source of information about the #Attraction--a guide, pamphlets, or displays.

<ex>[We|Tourist] [toured|Target] [the Grand Canyon|Attraction].</ex>

name: Tourism_scenario
description: It represents in a general way the essential human activity in which the main actor is a #Tourist who is interested in visiting or enjoying either an #Attraction or a #Place. Different reasons may lead to tourism such as entertainment, business, events and education.

name: Arrival
description: A #Tourist arrives at the #Destination and, later, to the housing option of her choice. The means of transportation can be various, such as automobiles, planes or ships. The trip can happen with the #Co-participant and involve the carrying of #Luggage.

name: Tourism_scenario_departure
description: The #Tourist leaves an #Origin with the aim of arriving at her #Destination, that is, generally, the place where she resides. To make it happen, it is necessary that the #Tourist ends her stay at the #Origin.

name: Tourism_scenario_preparation
description: The #Tourist wants to know more about the region where the touring will happen. Different information is searched, as the local attractions, cuisine, health insurance, documentation need, weather forecasts, transit and security. Besides, ticket purchases, hotel booking or even travel packages can be chosen, including both the traveling and lodging options. These issues can be regarded as the planning of the #Touristic_Activity.

name: Tourism_scenario_stay
description: Many reasons make the #Tourist have a touristic experience during the stay at a #Place: attractions, events, religion, business, studying, adventure, etc. During the period of stay, these motivations are achieved. The #Tourist has interests in other activities, besides the ones which motivated the trip. These activities, generally, are projected in attraction and/or places that are recognized by humanity to have historical or cultural importance, natural and/or artificial resources.

name: Tourist_activities
description: While visiting attractions or touristic places, the #Tourist may engage in leisure #Activitys, such as going out to eat, dance or buy souvenirs.

name: Arrival_at_lodge
description: The #Tourist arrives at the #Lodge, where s/he will stay for some time.

name: Arrival_at_destination
description: The #Tourist arrives at the #Destination where s/he will engage in some touristic activity.

name: Attracting_tourists
description: Either a #Place or an #Attraction has culturally and/or historically recognized natural or artificial recources, which attract tourists from different places.

name: Tourist_departure_locality
description: Having completed the period of stay at a touristic place, the #Tourist travels to another #Destination, which may be her home.

name: Tourist_departure_lodging
description: The #Tourist terminates the contract or agreement established with the#Lodging before departing from the locality using a #Means_of_transportation.

name: Touristic_service
description: An #Operator provides #Services, such as accommodation and meals, to the tourist.

name: Tourist_service_buy
description: This scene describes, from the perspective of the tourist, a basic commercial transaction involving a tourist and an operator exchanging money and services.

name: Tourist_service_collect
description: Scene in which the operator comes to have the money.

name: Tourist_service_pay
description: Scene in which the tourist pays the operator for the services.

name: Tourist_service_reserve
description: The #Tourist makes the reservations necessary for planning the touristic activities.

name: Tourist_service_sell
description: This scene describes, from the perspective of the operator, a basic commercial transaction involving a tourist and an operator exchanging money and services.

name: Tourist_service_transaction
description: This scene organizes the knowledge about the acquisition and offer of touristic services.

name: Toxic_substance
description:
A #Toxic_substance causes death or harm when introduced into or absorbed by a living organism, the #Victim. The #Toxic_substance may be specified to be produced by or contained in a #Toxin_source. The #Toxic_substance may affect the #Victim as a whole or a particular #Body_part (understood here to include organs and other sub-systems). A #Degree of harmfulness  can be specified  and the #Toxic_substance  may develop  its effect only under particular #Circumstances.

<ex>[The  main product , sulphide ,|Toxic_substance] <m>is</m> [toxic|Target] [to cells|Body_part] </ex>

<ex>[They|Toxic_substance] are better tolerated and  <m>are</m> [less|Degree] [toxic|Target] [in overdose|con]</ex>

<ex>The reason he was close to danger was because an extremely [poisonous|Target] [beetle|toxs] was crawling down his shoulder.</ex>

<ex>[Ingested gliadin and PT-gliadin|tox] <m>are</m> [toxic|Target] [to coeliac patients|vic].</ex>

name: Toys
description: A #Toy is made or modified by a human being or a company to entertain children or make them develop new skills. A #Toy has a certain kind of #Use.  Various properties of the #Toy may be specified, such as its #Creator, #Time_of_creation, #Name, #Type, #Origin, #Description and the #Material of which it is composed.

name: Transfer
description:
This frame involves a #Donor transferring a #Theme to a #Recipient.

<ex>[I|Donor] [transferred|Target] [$20|Theme] [to his account|Recipient].</ex>

name: Transfer_scenario
description: In this scenario, the #Theme begins in the possession of the #Donor and ends up in the possession of the #Recipient.  Alternatively, these two participants may be jointly construed as #Transferors.

name: Transition_to_a_quality
description:
An #Entity ends up with a particular new #Final_quality.

<ex>[The milk|Entity] has [gone|Target] [sour|Final_quality] [already|Time] .</ex>

There is only one lexical unit, go.v, that evokes this frame directly in English, and it combines only with a limited set of #Final_quality types, such as undesirability (bad, sour), insanity (crazy), inability (limp), or posture (prone).  However, the frame itself is intended to cover situations with arbitrary #Final_quality types.  As such, frames describing simple state change should inherit from this frame, incorporating the #Final_quality FE as part of the background meaning of the frame.

name: Transition_to_a_situation
description:
An #Entity ends up in a #Final_situation.

<ex>[I|Entity] have [come|Target] [to appreciate good coffee|Final_situation] .</ex>
<ex>[We|Entity] have [come|Target] [to expect three meals a day|Final_situation] .</ex>
<ex>When [the history of our times|Entity] [comes|Target] [to be written|Final_situation] , They Organized Themselves to Death will be the only possible epitaph . </ex>
<ex></ex>
This frame should be compared to the more general Transition_to_a_state, which also includes changes to a Final_category and a Final_quality.
<ex></ex>
This frame should be compared to Process_start and Activity_start.  Unlike Process_start's Process FE and Activity_start's Activity FE, the #Final_situation need not be conceived of as an ongoing event.  Also, there is no emphasis on the temporal profiling in Transition_to_a_situation other than the before (where the #Final_situation is not true) to the after (where the #Final_situation is true).

name: Transition_to_a_state
description:
An #Entity ends up in a #Final_category, #Final_situation, or #Final_quality which it was not in before.  Some members of the frame (e.g. <m>grow.v</m>) tend to emphasize a gradual change, while most members of the frame do not indicate whether a change is gradual or not.

<ex>[Why|Explanation] [I|Entity] [became|Target] [an Emacs user|Final_category]</ex>

<ex>[I|ent] left the ministry and [became|Target] [an atheist|Final_category].</ex>

<ex>Surprisingly, [various veteran organizations|Entity] also [turned|Target] [vehemently antiwar|Final_quality].</ex>

<ex> [Over the years|Transitional_period] [she|ent] [grew|Target] [to hate him|Final_situation].</ex>

This frame should be compared to Undergo_change.  Undergo_change is different in that it much more emphasizes the difference between the pre- and post-states of the #Entity.  This shows up both in Undergo_change's increased occurrence with #Initial_category and #Initial_state (<m>change from red to blue</m>) and in its increased occurrence with #Final_category (<m>changed into a toad</m>) rather than #Final_situation or #Final_quality (<m>?changed to red</m> vs. <m>got/turned red</m>).  In addition, when Undergo_change occurs with the #Final_category frame element, it presents a deep difference between the #Initial_category and the #Final_category, so that it is humorous to say 'she turned into a Republican', because it presents this as a fundamental change of identity.

Compare the previous sentence to 'she became a Republican', which is quite normal (albeit in a different frame).  In a less humorous example, someone can 'turn into a Mac user', strongly implying that they no longer use their former operating system, while if they 'become a Mac user', the meaning is either as a replacement of other OS-s or potentially as an addition to the use of other OS-s.

name: Transitive_action
description: This frame characterizes, at a very abstract level, an #Agent or #Cause affecting a #Patient. This frame is inherited by many lower-level frames.

name: Translating
description:
A #Cognizer produces a #Target_symbol which represents, in the #Target_representation format, a #Content that pre-exists in the form of a #Source_symbol in a #Source_representation format.
<ex></ex>

<ex>[This word|Source_symbol] is [sometimes|Time]  [translated|Target] [as ` girl '|Target_symbol]. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

<ex>They all wore symbolic black clothes over bright yellow T-shirts and all spoke in Welsh, [their statements|Content] being [translated|Target] [into English|Target_representation] [afterwards|Time]. [CNI|Cognizer]</ex>

<ex>[His texts|Source_symbol] were [translated|Target] [from French|Source_representation] [into Scots|Target_representation] [by Carl Gronau|Cognizer].</ex>

<ex>Perhaps when Irish monks spoke in Latin about lionn, meaning ale, [they|Cognizer] [translated|Target] [the word|Source_symbol] [literally|Equivalence] [from Irish|Source_representation] [into Latin|Target_representation] [as biber, 'drink'|Target_symbol].</ex>

<ex>[Each of the ten Greek nouns below|Source_symbol] can be [accurately|Equivalence] [translated|Target] [by using just one English word|Mns]. [CNI|Cog].</ex>

name: Transportation
description: This scene refers to #Transit services and buildings a given #Place provides to #Tourists.

name: Transportation_status
description:
A #Rider is being transported in a #Vehicle, or is moving on foot.

<ex>[Mounted|Target] [police officers|rid] are a common sight in this village.</ex>

<ex>You mean to say [they|rid] <m>are</m> [on foot|Target]?</ex>

name: Trap
description:
A #Deceiver sets up a #Trap in order to cause a #Victim to have an incorrect understanding about a situation. The #Deceiver anticipates that this will lead the #Victim to take a course of action (including doing nothing) which causes the #Victim harm.

<ex>Setting a [[trap|Target]|tra] [for your opponents|vic] is usually a good strategy.</ex>

<ex>[It|tra]'s a trap!</ex>

name: Travel
description:
In this frame a #Traveler goes on a journey, an activity, generally planned in advance, in which the #Traveler moves from a #Source location to a #Goal along a #Path or within an #Area.  The journey can be accompanied by #Co-participants and #Baggage.  The #Duration or #Distance of the journey, both generally long, may also be described as may be the #Mode_of_transportation.  Words in this frame emphasize the whole process of getting from one place to another, rather than profiling merely the beginning or the end of the journey.
<ex>[Ellen|Traveler] [journeyed|Target] [to Europe|Goal] [with five suitcases|Baggage].</ex>
<ex>[Samantha|Traveler] [journeyed|Target] [2500 miles|Distance] [with her family|Co-participant] [by sea|Path] [to China|Goal].</ex><ex>[The Osbournes|Traveler] <m>took</m> a [trip|Target] [from Beverly Hills|Source] [to London|Goal] [on the Concorde|Mode_of_transportation].</ex>

name: Traversing
description:
A #Theme changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a #Source, #Path, #Goal, #Area, #Direction, #Path_shape, or #Distance, as shown in the examples below:
<ex></ex>

<ex>Start [your|Theme] [ascent|Target] [from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis|Source].</ex>

<ex>[We|Theme] [crossed|Target] [the desert|Area].</ex>

<ex>[She|Theme] [jumped|Target] [across the ditch that marked the entrance to the woods|Path].</ex>

<ex>[The children|Theme] [hopped|Target] [into the neighbor's yard|Goal].</ex>

<ex>[I|Theme] [leaped|Target] [twenty feet|Distance] before slipping and falling.</ex>

<ex>As they did so, [the plane|Theme] [circled|Target] [lower|Direction].</ex>

<ex>[Boyner|Theme] has been [[crisscrossing|Path_shape]|Target] [the country|Area] [since May|dur].</ex>

name: Treating_and_mistreating
description:
In this frame an #Agent is evaluated as behaving toward an #Affected_party in some #Manner, which may or may not be incorporated into the target LU.

<ex>[Douglas|Agent] always [treated|Target] [Mary|Affected_party] [well|Manner].</ex>

name: Trendiness
description:
A #Behavior, attributed to an #Evaluee, conforms with or is heavily influenced by a popular trend or practice, often in the realm of fashion, design, though extending social and interactional behavior in general. Trendiness differs from Popularity in adding a factor of aesthetic or other judgment to behaviors and individuals, and judging these with respect to social behavior; Popularity is about amount of acceptability or utilization based on general (often non-aesthetic) desirability.

<ex>[Wearing flowered brocaded silks|Behavior] <m>was</m> [fashionable|Target] [in the first few years of the decade|Time].</ex>

name: Trial
description:
A trial is a process conducted in a #Court before a #Judge and (usually) a #Jury in which the participants meet in order to decide a #Case.  The #Prosecution attempts to prove that the #Defendant is guilty of the #Charges and the #Defense tries to prove that the #Defendant is innocent.
Trials have a rich schematic structure which is only partially represented here.  The Trial frame is the part of the Criminal Process frame that occurs after a crime, Arrest of a suspect, Arraignment, jury selection, etc. and before Sentencing and punishment or release.  The Trial is made up of court appearances.  The beginning of the Trial generally involves opening arguments, in which the #Prosecution and the #Defense present their respective points of view.  Then during the course of the Trial, both sides present evidence, some of which is provided by witnesses with testimony, and this is then drawn upon as support for their arguments.  Following the presentation of evidence, testimony, and arguments, generally culminating in closing arguments for each side, the #Jury (if present) deliberates and either comes to no sufficient consensus or produces a Verdict.

name: Triggering
description:
A #Cause triggers a #System to operate in accordance with its intended purpose. Alternatively, an #Actor (acting volitionally or not) which participates in the #Cause, stands in for the #Cause. The #System often has the capability to detect and signal the presence of an object or the occurence of an event (metal, an earthquake). It may also be or contain an explosive device. The Means by which the Cause activates the System may also be specified.

<ex>[Smoking a cigarette|Cause] will normally not [set off|Target] [a smoke alarm|System].</ex>

<ex>[Suspected drug traffickers|Actor] [set off|Target] [12 bombs|System], injuring 35 people.</ex>

<ex>[Joseph|Actor] wriggled out of the ropes and inadvertantly [triggered|Target] [the burglar alarm|System].</ex>

name: Trust
description:
A #Cognizer thinks that the #Information given by a particular #Information_source is correct.  The specific #Content or #Topic of the #Information may also be described.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[I|Cognizer] don't [trust|Target] [this information|Information].</ex>

<ex>[Nobody|Cognizer] will [believe|Target] [you|Information_source], and people will think you're scum.</ex>

name: Trying_out
description:
An #Evaluator participates in an #Experience (or metonymically, a salient #Entity of the #Experience), often for the first time, in order to form an opinion about its quality. The aspect of quality that is being judged is often implicit but may be expressed as the #Purpose of the #Evaluator's participation.

<ex>Have you [tried|Target] my latest get-rich-quick scheme? [INI|Purpose]</ex>
<ex>Don [tried out|Target] the bike [to see if it was the right size|Purpose].</ex>

name: Try_defendant
description:
A #Defendant is tried by a #Jury or #Judge in a #Court for #Charges.  This frame perspectivalizes the general Trial frame.

<ex>[The state|Governing_authority] will [try|Target] [him|Defendant] [for fraud|Charges].</ex>

name: Turn passing
description: The #Utterer passes the communicative turn to a #Comprehender who participates in the conversation. When the conversation involves more than two participants, the Turn passing may involve the current #Utterer choosing the participant who will be the next #Utterer.

name: Turning_out
description:
A #State_of_affairs turns out to be true in someone's knowledge of the world. This may be recognized with evidence or in certain circumstances. The cognizer whose beliefs are affected is not expressed.

<ex>[Hybrid grass|State_of_affairs] may [prove|Target] [to be a valuable fuel source|State_of_affairs].</ex>

name: Turn_confirmation
description: The #Comprehender does not take the conversational turn, when a moment of possible turn change occurs, signaling to the present #Utterer to continue with the communicative act.

name: Turn_keeping
description: During a conversation, the present #Utterer does not give up the communicative turn to a #Comprehender, and continues the communicative act.

name: Turn_taking
description: One of the #Communicators participating in a conversation requests or takes the communicative turn.

name: Type
description:
This frame has to do with nouns denoting types of entities. The #Subtype refers to a collection of members of a more general #Category which have certain defining characteristics; alternatively, the #Subtype refers only to the type itself, i.e. a more restrictive set of characteristics than those of the more general #Category.  The properties of the items that are included in the collection may be specified by the #Item_property.  Sometimes the #Subtypes themselves are described by some #Type_property.

<ex>I don't like this [newfangled|Type_property] [[kind|Subtype]|Target] [of  fish|Category].</ex>
<ex>Kleo isn't [our|Item_property] [[sort|Subtype]|Target] [of people|Category].</ex> <ex>He argued against the [formalist|Item_property] [[type|Subtype]|Target] [of analysis of art|Category].</ex>
<ex>I think that she was referring to the other [[type|Subtype]|Target]. [DNI|Category]</ex>

name: Typicality
description:
A #State_of_affairs is generally, or with regard to a particular #Feature, representative of its class, which may be narrowed to a specific #Comparison_set.

<ex>The Elan truly is an [unusual|Target] [car|soa]; the first and only Lotus with a front engined/front wheel drive layout, and the first new Lotus to be introduced since 1975.</ex>

<ex> I need a plain, [vanilla|Target] [example|soa] that doesn't use PRINT! </ex>

<ex>How smart is the [average|Target] [drug user/experimenter|soa]? </ex>

<ex>It's not [unusual|Target] [to be loved by anyone|soa], It's not unusual to have fun with anyone,</ex>

<ex>Is [lying|soa] [normal|Target] [for a child this age|com], and how can I best handle this situation?</ex>

name: Unattributed_information
description:
A #Reported_fact is presented by the speaker as deriving from statements (made directly to them or to others) of third parties.

<ex>Four [purported|Target] [gang members|rep] could face death penalty in Virginia slaying of federal informant.</ex>

name: Undergoing
description:
An #Entity is affected by an #Event.

<ex>[The hotel|Entity] is [undergoing|Target] [renovations|Event] [at this time|Time].</ex>

name: Undergoing_scenario
description: In this scene, an #Event occurs, and an #Entity is affected by it.

name: Undergo_change
description:
An #Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an #Attribute. In the first case, where category membership is changing, an #Initial_category and a  #Final_category may be expressed. In the second case, where a situation as a whole is changing, an #Initial_situation and a #Final_situation can be present. And in the last case, where some characterization of the #Entity is changing, an #Initial_quality and a #Final_quality can be specified.


<ex>As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, [Tiffany|ent] [turned|Target] [into a frog|finc]. </ex>

<ex>He chanted and [the rock|ent] [changed|Target] [shape|att], becoming a great double bitted axe.</ex>

<ex>The College has [changed|Target] [markedly|deg] over the century since it first opened its doors.</ex>

<ex>If I'm understanding you correctly, you want the switchbar color to [change|Target] [whenever the bot says something|Circumstances]?</ex>

<ex>[My life|ent] instantly [changed|Target] [from an empty life|inic], [to a life full of joy and purpose|finc].</ex>

<ex>As you can see, [the word WALK|ent] [changed|Target] [from red|iniq] [to green|finq] rather than have a separate lens for each colour.</ex>

<ex>[My feet|ent] [turned|Target] [to stone|finc].</ex>

<ex>[The promise|ent] will [turn|Target] [to ashes|finc] [if progress is not made|Circumstances].</ex>

<ex>[The price|att]  [changed|Target] [from $1.26|iniq] [to $1.27 per pint|finq]. [DNI|ent]</ex>

<ex>[At least one relative instruction|ent] has [changed|Target] [in size|att] [from short|iniq] [to long|finq].</ex>

In some cases, the types of perspective are mixed, so that, e.g., an #Initial_quality is mixed with a #Final_situation; this is usually considered poor style.

<ex>[She|Entity] [went|Target] [from confused|Initial_quality] [to acting completely confident|Final_situation] .</ex>

This frame is often the target domain of motion metaphors, in which the moving Theme corresponds to the  changing #Entity, the Source of motion corresponds to the #Initial_category, #Initial_quality, or #Initial_situation and the Goal of motion corresponds to the #Final_category, #Final_quality, or #Final_situation of the #Entity.  By correspondence with the complex domain of motion, this metaphor introduces several FEs to the target domain of change, such as an Intermediate_state (etc.) from Path, and Tendency_of_change from Direction.

<ex>The nation was [crawling|Target] towards oblivion.</ex>
<ex>We were [walking|Target] past almost reasonable and heading right for what-the-bleep.</ex>

name: Undergo_transformation
description:
An #Entity changes from one kind of thing (#Initial_category) to another kind of thing (#Final_category).  Whether the #Initial_category is mentioned or not, the change is viewed as negating some #Initial_category, and not simply adding an additional #Final_category to the #Entity.

<ex>[She|Entity] [metamorphosed|Target] [from a mere coworker|Initial_category] [into a friend|Final_category] .</ex>
<ex>[His mother|Entity] had [transformed|Target] [into a rock star|Final_category] . [INI|Initial_category] </ex>
<ex>The [metamorphosis|Target] [of his attitude|Entity] [from benign neglect|Initial_category] [to active hatred|Final_category] was so slow he never noticed .</ex>
<ex>The [transformation|Target] [from Ms. Nobody|Initial_category] had taken her years . [DNI|Entity] [INI|Final_category] </ex>

name: Undressing
description:
A #Wearer removes an item of #Clothing from a #Body_location (the part of the body that the #Clothing is prototypically worn on.)

<ex>Walking on sand is better if [you|wea] [take|Target] [off|Target] [your shoes|clo]. [INI|bod]</ex>

name: Unemployment_rate
description:
Based on how many #Individuals are employed, the #Individuals as a whole are described with a #Value (either a percentage or absolute number) representing the #Employment of the #Individuals.

<ex>[[Unemployment|Target]|Employment] is down, salaries are up for US chemists.</ex>

<ex>As a result, the [[unemployment|Target]|Employment] [of Roma|Individuals] is very high.</ex>

<ex>Today's report finds that [[unemployment|Target]|Employment] [among single mothers|Group] rose for the first time in six years in 2002. [DNI|Individuals]</ex>

<ex>In the 1950s and '60s, [[joblessness|Target]|Employment] [of 6 to 7 percent|Value] was intense, but now an
unemployment rate of below 6 percent could be inflationary. [DNI|Individuals]. </ex>

<ex>The economy was operating at full capacity, traditionally defined as [[employment|Target]|Employment] [of 96 percent of the civilian labor force|Value]. [DNI|Individuals]</ex>

name: Used_up
description:
Through use, a #Resource is diminished in quality or quantity (up to complete attrition) such that it becomes less capable of sustaining future use.

<ex>[My entire life savings|res] <m>is</m> [depleted|Target] [due to university and medical bills|exp].</ex>

<ex>[All significant oil and gas reserves|res] <m>are</m> [exhausted|Target] or have dwindled to an uneconomical level except for those of the Middle East.</ex>

<ex>Use shampoo and conditioner every day until [the shampoo and conditioner|res] <m>are</m> [completely|deg] [used up|Target].</ex>

name: Usefulness
description:
An #Entity aids in the successful completion of a #Purpose.  Its #Degree of utility may also be expressed. Some of the lexical units  in this frame (e.g. <ment>great, good</ment>) can only express permanent, generic states of the #Entity.

<ex>[A box|Entity] is an [ideal|Target] [storage device|Purpose].</ex>

name: Use_firearm
description:
An #Agent causes a #Firearm to discharge, usually directing the projectile from the barrel of the #Firearm (the #Source), along a #Path, and to a #Goal.
<ex>[The Germans|Agent] wouldn't stop [shooting|Target] [cannons|Firearm] [at them|Goal].</ex>
<ex>[Oswald|Agent] [fired|Target] [twice|Iterations] [through the window|Path].</ex>

name: Use_vehicle
description: A #Driver transports themselves and possibly other passengers (the #Theme) to another location.

name: Using
description:
An #Agent manipulates an #Instrument in order to achieve a #Purpose.

<ex>For cold conditions, we recommend that [you|Agent] [use|Target] [a heat gun or a hair dryer|ins] [to make the adhesive work better|Purpose]. </ex>

name: Using_resource
description:
An #Agent has access to a finite amount of some #Resource and uses it in some way to complete a #Purpose. The specific #Portion of the #Resource may be stated, and after the #Resource is spent, it is no longer available to the #Agent. The #Means by which the #Resource is used may be mentioned, but it is often implied by the stated Purpose or understood based on what the #Resource is.

<ex>[I|Agent] [used|Target] [half|Portion] [of the bag of dirt|Resource] [to plant the roses|Purpose].</ex>
<ex>[She|Agent] just [spends|Target] [all her time|Resource] [sitting in front of the television|Purpose].</ex>

name: Utensils
description: A #Utensil is a container, a tool or something that is especially for household use. It is created for a specific #Use. Several properties of the #Utensil can be specified, such as its #Creator, #Time_of_creation, #Name, #Type, #Origin, #Constituent_parts, #Description, #Material of which it is composed, #Quantity and the #Place where it is.

name: Vehicle
description:
The frame concerns the vehicles that human beings use for the purpose of transportation.

<ex>I drove a [limo|Target] to the school dance.</ex>

name: Vehicle_departure_initial_stage
description:
A #Vehicle moves into position or otherwise changes configuration or state as preparation for normal operation. The focus of the event is on the state of the #Vehicle rather than any agent which is manipulating the #Vehicle.

<ex>[The flight for New York|Vehicle] [finally|Time] [lifted off|Target] [from Oakland International|Source] [with one hundred passengers aboard|Depictive].</ex>

name: Vehicle_landing
description:
A flying #Vehicle comes to the ground at a #Goal in a controlled fashion, typically (but not necessarily) operated by an operator.

<ex>[A police helicopter|veh] [landed|Target] [just outside my neighborhood|goa] [at around midnight last night|Time].</ex>

<ex>[The UFO|veh] [touched down|Target] [here|goa], you say?</ex>

name: Vehicle_subpart
description:
An entity is integrated into a vehicle as a #Part of a (possibly unexpressed) #Whole which may refer to the whole vehicle or merely to a sub-part of the vehicle.
<ex></ex>
<ex>The [car's|Whole] [[engine|Target]|Part] started smoking so we pulled over.</ex>
<ex>Put the bags in the [[trunk|Target]|Part].</ex>
<ex>One should always wear a [[seatbelt|Target]|Part] while driving.</ex>

name: Verdict
description:
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a #Judge gives a #Finding with respect to the #Charges against the #Defendant in a particular #Case.

<ex>[He|Defendant] was [convicted|Target] [of fraud|Charges] [by Judge Judy|Judge].</ex>

name: Verification
description:
An #Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the #Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.

<ex>[This note|Medium] [confirms|Target] [my suspicions|Unconfirmed_content].</ex>

name: Version_sequence
description:
An entity goes through several versions, from initial to final.

<ex>This is my [first|Target] [draft|Item].</ex>

name: Victim_operated_IED
description:
An improvised explosive device, the #Bomb, is placed so as to be hidden from view or disguised as something not harmful. It is rigged to detonate when triggered by actions of an intended Victim. Possible triggering actions include stepping on a pressure-sensitive plate, activating a trip-wire, or moving an object which activates a spring-loaded device.

<ex>We hit a [VOIED|Target] and the lead truck was destroyed.</ex>

name: frm_vinculação
description: frm_vinculação

name: Violence
description:
The words in this frame describe acts (or situations characterized by acts) that cause injury or harm. The acts may involve an #Aggressor or #Cause injuring a #Victim, or [Aggressors|ags] causing each other harm.

<ex>Research on whether concealed carry laws increase [gun|Instrument] [violence|Target] [among gang members|ags] has been inconclusive.</ex>

<ex>[They|agr] <m>committed</m> [brutality|Target] [against innocent civilians|vic].</ex>

<ex>[The storm's|Cause] [violence|Target] [last week|Time] came without warning and caused unprecedented damage to costal regions.</ex>

name: Visiting
description:
An #Agent matches location with an #Entity in order to fulfill some  #Purpose.

Quite often, the #Purpose is social- or entertainment-oriented.

<ex>I ca n't remember how many times [he|Agent] [visited|Target] ! [DNI|Entity]</ex>
<ex>[Now|Time] [she|Agent] <ment>was</ment> <ment>on</ment> an [inspection|Purpose] [visit|Target] .</ex>
